WF_yJ4BxJqVO8f_lJg_HTw.text: They use curry like chili, topping it on everything. The consistency is the same. The heat is mean. Now I know the difference between Thai and Japanese curry. Both are good. I like how Japanese curry is thick.   Place is clean, food was fast and fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry - Spicy!

S42lp0GKQ3vBYa3GIG1HXQ.text: This place is sooooo yummy! Was introduced by a friend and I won't go anywhere else for curry! The food is served hot and fresh every time and we never have to wait long to dine. I'd give this place 10 stars if I could!

NwQk9Z5ByLbCHCS2XMKhtA.text: I've been here multiple times and it's no wonder why this place gets such good reviews.  I've came here for lunch and dinner at different times and both times I didn't have to wait to be seated. The staff is friendly and definitely acknowledges the presence of their customers. Not many places do that nowadays.  The place is a bit small but it still feels very spacious. They have tables, booths, and a bar. The place also looks clean.  Their menu is pretty simple to follow if you haven't had Japanese curry before, they offer a lot of pictures of each dish. You choose the level of spiciness on your curry.  I've has the tofu katsu, pork katsu, and chicken katsu here. My favorite out of the 3 is the tofu katsu!. The curry is very flavorful. It's savory and packs a lot of heat! You can also get a non spicy curry.  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QlcjyggFQVa686XQutzGEg.text: Zen Curry is one of my favorite places to go if I'm feeling like treating myself to a hearty meal. It averages out to about $10-$14 a plate for a person depending on what they customize your plate with. What I really like about the menu is customizing the spicy levels of your meal, rating from 1 (mild) to 10 (burning your butthole.)   If it is your first time trying Japanese curry, you can never go wrong with the chicken katsu curry plate. But if you're feeling adventurous, I suggest you try my plate: scrambled eggs with spinach, tomato, cheese and sausage curry with 16 grains rice--best hangover cure ever!   Only downside, parking lot is ALWAYS full. :( but don't let that stop you from getting the best Japanese curry you'll get in Vegas!

OPZZIQpvU1aNasi5NOC6rw.text: I love to come here, because they make the best curry to be honest. I will definitely come back for it in the next few days. The waiters are very nice and also it is clean and neat.

uB_BEQbatsaZVDm1gll_1A.text: This is really such a shame, since this place came so close to a 5 star curry perfection, marred from numerous small missteps, missing lunch menu items, and minor details.  First of all, the chicken katsu is the dish to get, hands down. I tried both pork and chicken, and the chicken was breaded and fried to such a perfection that I almost had misty eyes. The chicken is perfectly seasoned and fried with such an amazing crispy layer without requiring extra calories just to bite through the protein. The pork, unfortunately, did not get the memo, as the meat was much tougher and less flavored than its other white meat cousin. Since this was my first and possibly the last visit, I had tried a series of appetizers. However, the takoyaki was gone and we showed up literally 15 minutes after the store opened. The fried oyster exceeded my expectation as it was juicy and marinating in its own sauces when I bit through the crispy exterior. The tofu salad was good (although I've never been a fan of iceberg lettuce) and we also tried the edamame (overly salted and many were shriveled), the chicken skewers (protein on a stick, forgettable). As for the main course, my friend and I got he brown rice with curry and the respective meats. I tried a spicy level 8 and it was sizzling, but not cathostrophic. The curry, in my opinion was just a little bit too salty for my taste, but made more bearable when eaten with the curry. Oh yeah, we also ordered the peach jelly champagne, which was an interesting experience, but not sure if it was worth $7.5.  Overall, this is definitely a popular spot amongst the locals, as the place filled up pretty quickly by 12:30pm, so I recommend coming early and preparing your dining experiences.  Food: 4 stars Price: 3-4 stars Service: 3 stars Ambiance: 3 stars

dKs5LmQMbHo4qiulYo96LA.text: Richard Pro here with another review.  I was skeptical of all the positive reviews--after all, curry is curry, and I've had my fair share of it. However, I'm pleased to say this place really hits the spot. Small, cramped, cozy, and warm, Japanese Curry Zen instantly impresses with soft sticky rice, a generous portion of addicting curry sauce, and a huge selection of meats.  First off, the curry is spicy! Level 3 was already more than I could handle, and it goes up to level 10. I tried pork katsu, pork tenderloin, grilled chicken, and kurobata sausage.   The pork katsu and tenderloin taste the same yet one costs more than the other. So if I were you, I'd choose the cheaper one. You really can't tell the difference once they cut it up and fry it.   The grilled chicken was disappointing. Dry and unmarinated. Yes, you're supposed to lather it with sauce but it doesn't change the fact that it comes dry and unmarinated.  The kurobata sausage impressed me the most. Perhaps because I've never had it before, but I was honestly expecting some kind of hot dog and ended up being pleasantly surprised. It has a nice flavor to it.  Portion size is quite generous and service is great.

JX9rJNa_wFt5-yzWHV9XIQ.text: Curry perfect.  This curry fanatic gives Zen a solid 5 stars. More if I could. Since it was my first visit I went simple, pork katsu curry Level 9 heat.  Zen nailed it. Perfect heat, a deep depth of character in their curry that keeps you longing for another bite and second guessing whether you should have ordered more rice and curry. After leaving Zen, my mouth was still watering thinking about the curry. I will be back.  Best curry in Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu curry - perfect!

EG41DaX2Nlfr1HnK2OLtgQ.text: Going by what was on Yelp we came here at 11:00AM but were disappointed to find out that they actually open at 11:30.. hmm I think pretty much everything in this plaza opens at 11:30 so we went to McDonald's to get some free coffee and to kill some time. hehe Anyways we went in at exactly 11:30 and were warmly greeted by the small staff of 3..  As other Yelpers have mentioned it is a cute little restaurant with less than 4 tables in addition to their solo diner's bar.. They have an open kitchen so you can see the chef making your food.   I had the chicken katsu curry with brown rice, corn and cheese. The portion size was good.. The curry didn't have any crazy strong tastes but the flavor was all there! I love the little add ons.. especially the pickled onions.. The waitress was very nice and kept our water glasses full. The chef even touched tables and made sure everything was delicious. Amazing service from such a little place.. Love it! The bill for 2 came up to a little over $20..! cheap & tasty = perfect!   This will definitely be my go to spot when I'm craving curry although like Monta, I would probably stay away during peak times.   RANDOM: are you the type of curry eater who eats it very clean or do you like to mix everything around on your plate and get a little messy? haha  TIP: don't forget to look at the Specials board.. I definitely want to go back to try the tofu katsu and curry udon ;]]]

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenderloin tastes just like chicken cutlet to me ~ save a couple $$$
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pX5kxKf1z7WYnunHB7ngag.text: What a gem, this place is truly authentic Japanese curry deliciousness.  Started with the gyozas, which were okay not fab.  For the main dish, I had a chicken katsu curry with fried egg and corn, with a spice level of 3. The curry plate was off the charts good.  Be careful with the spice level though, i am a spicy aficionado and a level 3 was mild for my taste buds.  Service waa phenomenal.

roN2TSVHmZIKCX2r2C20CA.text: We decided to try this place on one of those rare rainy days in Las Vegas. My boyfriend and I both had the chicken katsu with curry. One curry at #4 spice and the other at #5. The chicken is nicely breaded and fried fresh and slightly crispy. The curry tastes just like the authentic Japanese curry we've had several times in Japan. Probably because it is! The shumai was also a tasty appetizer. The mustard flavor with the shoyu is a nice combination with the pork. Nice, hot, spicy, and just all-around good food! We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry and a shumai appetizer

0hGI_tmJGCeYvNnUTnQTIw.text: I agree with David V.'s Tip, this is strictly a Japanese Curry house (not Katsu house) and they do it right!!  I've been a handful of times and the curry is always consistent and has great flavor.  In addition, I like/enjoy: -You basically build y our own curry plate. You can either start with a plain plate and add on items, or just order one of their set plates. -You can change the spicy level, but you pay for anything above spice level 5 -They have Curry Udon now!!!   -Chicken Katsu is a thick cut,  not dry and fried well. -Jasmine Tea is good -Spinach Curry is a good way to get the greens in without taking away from the curry.   I would definitely come back, and grab take out from time to time.

9u2BjyEWMHCxSBwKK5jWpg.text: This place is awesome. Great food, fast service. It's a bit tiny, but usually authentic Japanese restaurants tend to be smaller. Sometimes I see a wait, but most times I don't really wait too long. I usually stick with the curry with pork tonkatsu. It hasn't ever disappointed me. If you're hungry and want something quick and filling, curry zen will definitely hit the spot

bKULOovq-xnpIJD9WzucEA.text: My bf and I decided to check this place out because one of my friends recommended   this place has great curry. We were skeptic at first because we never heard of Japanese curry. Let me tell you, we are hooked! The curry was soo yummy and you can choose whatever spice level you want. I eat a lot of spicy food but I can only go to  a spice level 1 haha I'm a huge fan of the vegetable curry with Tofu cutlets!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VRUb13h-p41pZE25JrFL6g.text: the service is really sucks,the waitress let us waiting there for more than 20 mins and they have tables for us. I ask her why u have tables for two and u don't let us to sit .. she said because there are a group of 6 people they r before us.. so they have 3 tables for 2 .. just empty, and she said if u r important u can sit ...I don't know why this kind of people can be a waitress ?

8fq53k3kFlV04j_4ew9aDA.text: I love curry zen! So simple, yet so good. I come to dine in a few times but I order out quite a bit. When my siblings and I are trying to decide what to eat that day,  at least one of any of the four of us will suggest curry zen!   The dining space is small and casual but you'll see groups of friends hanging out, couples on a small date,  or business men having dinner with their colleagues. Both tourists and locals. Maybe all at the same time! The servers will work hard for you regardless of how busy it will get. Nice and polite wait staff!   The food overall is amazing. Each time I dine in, I might get a different side.  My usual plate consists is chicken katsu choosing spice level 1-4,  depending on what I feel like having. The sides I have tried so far are takoyaki, curry pan, and spinach. All delicious,  but I gotta say my fave is the spinach.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My take out order!  (alongside with boba from right next to curry zen)

T-BzfSD4zRoctGw9Upp9tQ.text: This place is amazing. The curry isn't traditional Japanese style. They use garam masala, which is Indian. You can even get naan, but all the other ingredients are Japanese. I got curry udon, which already has scallions and pork. Then you can pick from quite a few different additions, so I went with corn, breaded pork katsu, and kurobuta sausage. Went with spice level 10, which had decent kick, but I also added some of what was in the shaker on the table, pretty sure it was cayenne. There's a sweet and salty Japanese sauce as well. Throw in some gyoza, which were as good as any I've had anywhere, and takoyaki (fried octopus balls, and it was a great meal for a great price.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ALZBMi7ypKO6R1Zr5oRenA.text: Made my own curry and it was delicious, chose a spicy of 7.5 and had to eat my food slowly lol

S4TJoPUgVnNSeKhEwGMRQg.text: I skipped lunch so by the time I got to JCZ, I was famished.  At 5pm, the place was empty but I can imagine it can get easily packed at normal dining hours since it only has a few tables and a bar.  This is located in the same complex as Monta, Raku, Trattoria Nakamura-ya and Kabuto.  I was fiddling around with the condiments, raisins and almonds that were on the table.  I ordered a pork cutlet with brown rice, corn and croquette - and no, I didn't have to use any of the condiments.  It tasted great on its own and it was filling.  My bro-in-law got the chicken cutlet with white rice, cheese and corn which he annihilated in a few minutes!  The curry was spicier than what I'm used to (I'm a wimp when it comes to spicy food) but I didn't mind.  On the back of the menu is a list of spices they use for their curry and what health benefits you could get from each spice which I thought was pretty interesting.  I thought my Chinese grandmother was just making stuff up when I was little!  Our server, Jason, was great and easy on the eyes.  The chef came out of the kitchen to personally thank us for coming.  More people started coming in as we were getting ready to leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cutlet with Japanese sausage, corn, croquette and brown rice
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork tenderloin, Japanese sausage, corn, croquette and white rice
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting facts on spices

Cokh-4RPTE2LKSPoxkgsGA.text: Best Japanese curry in Vegas. They specialize in the stuff so you could only expect as such. The appetizers are fun and delicious. The staff always greets you with great attitude and this is a great place to meet with friends for lunch or dinner. Great location too but parking could be tough at times.

Fjad7VBz3SjZp760Vwl0vQ.text: Probably the best curry restaurant in town, but curry are actually cold/warm, I expected that should be hot.  Poke is very good, the Squid and the Oyster, you can skip.

FfWHbJiss3ZPoR8jNv_j3w.text: I love the curry here! It has a homemade taste - you can taste the vegetables melted into the curry broth, so subtle. I love the simplicity of the menu too. The curry broth is the main ingredient of course, and then you can add a topping. Genuine service too :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Items Menu~ They also have Curry Udon!

EIkpn3hfUqBZCOzWp3UZRA.text: My first Japanese curry and my favorite place so far.   Everyone here is always so polite. When you come here, you aren't a customer. You are a guest. Because of their outstanding service, it's hard not to come back.   As far as the food goes, the curry is thick and full of flavor. There are many additional toppings to add and specials are always changing, so you won't get bored! Food always comes out hot and fast.  Also, Curry Zen is open late, so it's a great place to hit up after a late shift or an evening class.   I go at least once a week and so should you!

M0uMHTDY15d8QW5tPK6FrA.text: I wish I could rate higher! Some of the best food I've ever had, all with polite staff and speedy service. Would recommend to anyone!

l6N3pa8N1TTSo242jZBR4w.text: You have to love Japanese curry.   That deep spicy flavor   Crispy katsu.   Yum.   Level 3 was good and spicy.   Could go to 5.  Hard to believe I would enjoy 6 and above.   Good service.   Very typical of what you would find in Japan.   Not expensive and next to a great little massage place.

Z_7pYYaAhJM_ij497ra_gQ.text: This is my one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas! Probably the best plate of curry I've ever consumed. The service is fast, staff is friendly, and the food comes out quick and delicious! If you're over in Chinatown give this place a try!

G-ge2lmLQlgTHha_D54eNw.text: This venue is a definite must for those wishing to indulge in Asian-Style Curry! The shop is quaint and service is detail oriented. Our server was accurate at taking our order as well as informed us of how the Spice Scale works. If you are looking for a filling and delectable dish to try I suggest: Starter: Takoyaki Entree: Spam/Tofu/Vegetable Curry*^** * I get a #2 because I like to savor the curry taste with just a little kick ** I also get a lot of food because when you try it you WILL want to take some home

cWKgccGW2gQM5lL5QMSAqA.text: Came here for the first time on a busy Saturday afternoon and had a satisfying lunch! I think the reviews speak for themselves :) This place is good !

FUFrNbwGQHFAW23xFw7Eig.text: I've been a fan of Curry Zen since they've opened.   Food: A fine example of how keeping things simple and focusing on a specialty delivers a reliable, quality experience. I think they've recently expanded their menu a bit but I have always been thoroughly impressed with their Japanese curry. The curry itself is standard for their dishes. You pick your meat or veggie option, pick your level of spice and they add rice and voila...you have an awesome dish. They also have a list of add-ons that you would typical see at other places like ramen spots.  Facilities: They've recently expanded (that's a good sign). And now they're double the size that they were when they opened. There might be a wait....but given how fast they get their food ready...wait times shouldn't be a problem. but as a guest, please keep to the same manners as you would with Monta next door...don't hand around...get in...eat your food...and dip.   Staff: This is more of a food-service spot so, by design, the staff won't chat it up too much. But they are friendly, quick with service and check back frequently.   Now I am getting hungry.

INPfOgLeh7LJL4RPNA-mTw.text: We fell in curry love when we were brought here when we relocated to Las Vegas. At that time the had not expanded the resturant so seating was hard to find. When you have people waiting in line for food, you know it's good and they have not disappointed us with the food here. Its small, homey and did I mention that the food is oh sooo good?

2b4bgk6uoHksMLcYgIfyxA.text: We were there at 10pm on a saturday and waited for about 15 mins to get a table for a party of 6.  Including ordering and eating it took us about an hour.  The stupid waiter named Yuta went to our table and gave us our bill.   We paid right away and he asked us if we need anything else - we said no thats all but he still kept on looking at us.  We were still talking while waiting for my husband who went to the restroom and the stupid waiter came back again at our table saying since we didnt need anything if we can leave  coz theres a big party waiting outside.  Really?  Who cares if there's a big parttly outside?   Is it right to ask customers to leave right away after they ate and they got the money already?  That was freakin rude and very disrespectful.   I asked to speak with the owber and he said the waiter did the right thing coz they do have a small place.  And that gave them the right to disrespect customers by asking to leave after eating?   Stupid and uneducated people!!!!!   Will never go.back there again.  I'll give my business elsewhere who's deserving and have  intelligent owners and workers.  Never will I go to this stupid place again!!!

nc3MN_V8BiPqDFizKO0CWw.text: One of my favorite restaurants for Asian cuisine in Las Vegas. Don't let the the unassuming/insipid sight of their plates fool you. The dishes here pack a host of flavors. My favorites are: Pork Katsu Curry with Meatloaf (spice level: 3), Takoyaki, Gyoza. My wife loves the Curry Udon.

8g1BapwyOJPVULSOlZwwEQ.text: I've never had curry much up until now but everything is perfect here from the food to the service. Got the chicken curry with a 3pc kushi and I've eaten at this place 2 times within the last week love the consistency of the flavors.

6bs42hrrV_VSVh3TfaSOQQ.text: Amazing place to get authentic Japanese Curry. The employees are always so sweet and quick to serve you. The bathrooms are spotless and smells good for a restroom haha! Good place, you definitely should try it if you're on the fence about curry!

4yY8oQhElunq0oYJKHcLBQ.text: Yum! You can never go wrong with this place! Being from Cali and growing up with Japanese curry restaurants like curry house, this place definitely satisfies that curry craving! I first tried this place when it first opened. And I fell in love. Just as awesome as other curry places in California. Service is great as well as the food. I love spicy food so it's great that they make your curry as spicy as you want it. When you choose a spicy level 6 it's like a 10. They have various toppings you can add on as you wish which is great also.

XphiZQrk67t4t5EB-8vAFw.text: The food!   They custom created one of the appetizer specials (deep fried oysters) as a curry for me [Chef behind the counter heard me ordering, and said "no problem, we can do that"].   It is so delicious!  Service was lightning fast, foods were served in under 5 minutes.  Seems a little small for how busy it is, feels crowded, they could have easily filled 3 or 4 more tables if they expanded into bigger space.  The serving sizes were just right, I cleared my plate, but wasn't hungry afterwards.  I really like that they offer a wide range of curry spiciness, on a scale of like 1 to 10 I believe. Perfectly accommodating everyone in a family or a group. They also have genuine vegetarian options, again accommodating everyone in the family.  This is my first time at a fusion Japanese curry restaurant. I will definitely be bringing my family here.

iBciRKyKIooDVrMW78ib_g.text: I Have moved from Hawaii where I have eaten Curry House almost every single day and had been looking for a replacement for the longest time. I finally found the most delicious curry from Japanese Curry Zen. My first sitting here was with my husband and my friend Jahi. It was his birthday and we wanted to try a new place in town. The service was amazing and the waiters were very nice. We ordered our food and it came out pretty fast. The waiters are always asking if we need anything or how they can help.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love my Gyoza curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza curry is best curry

Bg5UetoN3uU4VoYK_ItOiA.text: Came to try out this spot after a friend recommended it to me and yeah...glad I did! Cute little spot with delicious curry (you can choose your spice level..yes!) and combinations making you come back for more.   I got the small curry with tofu, veggies, and sausage spice level 5 and my bf got the regular pork cutlet with veggies and fried shrimp spice level 3. They were both really good and filling!! I'm going to try a spicier level next time. We ordered a couple desserts (coffee jello and something with pineapples on it) and it was a good way to end our meal.  Overall, the waitresses were nice and food was delish! We'll be coming back this week... :)

RMHZCfvdBAWCcNIUb5DZCA.text: World's best curry place ... We love this place ... Amazing staff .. Specially Mr. Zen ... If we ever had to go away from Vegas we will miss this place more than anything else.  God bless them !!!!

msW1aE2UgKN3U9OazoDX3Q.text: Love this place. Good Japanese curry.  Not CoCos but it will do :)  (At least till I go back to LA)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh sweet awesome curry how I&#39;ve missed you! Been far too long...
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bikes at Curry Zen!

wBJzRxtv2_mV440Y0c3vCA.text: One of my most favorite restaurants in Vegas. A winning combination of great food, quick service and attentive servers at a great price. I have visited the restaurant more than 10 times with different groups. Vegetable zen curry is a winner and appeals to all vegetarian and meat lovers alike! You can actually experience the burst of unique flavors melting in your mouth. Seriously! :) If you are do not mind fried food (although it's not dripping oil), you can try one of katsu items. Tofu katsu is average and chicken katsu is not very different from chicken wings at KFC. I usually pair the entree with a side of tasty Tofu salad. Thai Ice tea is housemade and is refreshing! I tried Oolong tea for a change last time, but wasn't too happy with my choice, as it was bottled and unsweetened. I guess I will stick with my Thai tea from next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable Zen curry and Oolong tea

dpkDESdxBdL9c6Guk-wQ8w.text: I always go to Curry Zen whenever I visit. It has multiple options of toppings with the curry. I always get the chicken katsu curry with scrambled eggs. It's a small-ish restaurant, so the wait might be long. They also serve bottles of beer for a cheap price.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

Ks880jvzmiLUFMPOZ7_ikA.text: The vegetable curry / i added katsu chicken on top & the udon curry were both excellent ... Also the Mango Cheesecake was sooooo goooood . the nan bread was kind of tough but overall everything was great .. its a small place so it can get pretty crowded id go in early on a weekday ...

vKJMUUbBF9rE8Qemll6R4g.text: By far one of my favorite curry restaurants when visiting LV and one of my favorites curry spots overall. I love spicy foods and the level 10 hits the spot. Service was excellent and the servers checked on us frequently

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k5c0ZcmZNNB0J5hRMDaVGw.text: Haven't been this satisfied with Japanese food since Japan (still a far reach though). I got the vegetable curry, which the waitress assured me was Vegan. It was delicious, and I got a spice level 4. The spice level was perfect for me, and I'm a spice lover. It was amazing comfort food, and I was super full by the end. I can't wait to hit this spot again, the service was stellar.

lKhtUCvtJ1eIwHMNnxADRg.text: Pretty good curry! We arrived starving so that probably helped the case too. Food comes out very quickly - great b/c we were starving, caveat - the rice tasted cool. Rice needs to be hot! We ordered tako yaki, and fried shumai as apps - both delish! Everyone ordered port katsu curry of varying spicyness levels. Very nifty you can choose your own level of spice (1-10). We ordered between 5-8, and it was a good amount of spice. Some ordered with white rice, some ordered with the 16 grain. Both good. The katsu was well fried and crispy, but again - not hot. So thank for getting our orders out so quickly, but food wasn't as hot as it should be.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tako yaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pork katsu with 16 grain rice
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried shumai

tJRuiJN5oP1-mylfeKtsaw.text: I have a favorite curry house back in Honolulu called CoCo Curry House, which has imho really great curry and is modeled just like this place with the base curry dish and add on selections. I think it has the exact same feel but slightly different curry taste. The curry here has more of an earthy taste and more powdery texture, which i kinda like, not more just different. the curry here is definitely alot more spicy even at its mildest. I cant take too much heat, as I sweat profusely. I could enjoy the spice at home fine but id need a towel at the restaurant. So if you like spicy this place is probably going to satisfy you. I ate the Japanese Meatloaf with Chicken Katsu and they were both very tasty. I particularly liked the Japanese Meatloaf which was almost a hamburger patty save the spice mixture in it. It was very soft inside with that great flat top crisp on the outside. The servers were very fast and polite. They have really good rice, something i always look for in a curry house. Definitely going back to check out the other things on the menu.

ZISeoVTG1Mdut5udTWvC1Q.text: Their portions are huge!  Our waitress (who said she is vegan) said their curry is vegan, but the Tofu batter is not. For health benefits she recommended the 16 grain rice with the spinach curry mixed with the vegetable curry.  It was soul warming, hearty, and yummy.   Hubby got the chicken katsu curry and liked it a lot.   This place is tiny and super popular. Perfect for small groups, but plan ahead. At 4:30 PM on a Saturday we waited about 20 min for a table for two.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How to order the vegan curry with 16 grain rice, vegetables, and spinach
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 grains rice with Vegetable curry and added spinach (vegan)

81t0ptjKUyuUVRkGUHs9Fw.text: PROS: -This is the only place in Vegas where I get Japanese curry -Great food & service :)  FOOD 5/5: -Chicken Katsu Curry ($8.95 // cheese $0.50): I'm in love with their curry sauce. It compliments well with the fried chicken. At first glance it may not look super appetizing but it is! And it's not oily. I add cheese and raisins for extra flavor~ -Katsu spiciness is from 1-10. I usually have mine at 3, because 4 and up is too spicy! haha -Takoyaki ($4.50): This is a deep fried ball filled with octopus. Super delicious!  CONS: -I've been going to Curry Zen for a couple years now, and very recently they started to make their portions smaller :(  -Also you have to ask for raisins and all the extra-free toppings.

ne8IPWfg-kG7v5rlhcAw6g.text: Japanese Curry Zen is one of those types of restaurants that you are willing to go to if you want to eat rice because you do not want to be home.  It is also one of those restaurants that you would probably want to go to every day if only it was right by your house.  I always go for the Katsu curry and it does come on a large plate. It is definitely more than filling and sometimes kills me inside because there is more rice than I can handle.  The service is constantly good and I am so lucky that this restaurant is in the same plaza as Kung Fu Tea. I mean I feel like I am always in a win win situation whenever I do eat here because of all these other places in the same plaza!  This restaurant beats Tokyo Kitchen any day.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9D2X00KfWNF7uVzng6-OBA.text: Super busy restaurant. The staffs are so friendly. I ordered to go, and it's ready on time. Can't wait for eating my lunch. I will be back for sure.

3zPp7aRcYswf_ia5I43pSg.text: We came here pretty late. Originally we were going to go to Montas be the wait was ridiculous & that night we just didn't feel like waiting that long. There was a little wait for curry Zen, as there was one fairly large party ahead of us. It wouldn't have been too bad but we had to wait outside in the cold . My mom tried it before and was saying how good it was so we decided to just take our chances at Curry Zen and it was soooo good. We a loved our food. I got a spice level 2 with the pork Katsu curry and it was plenty of spice for me. I could see the portion sizes being kind of small for some but it filled me up. I definitely plan on going back.

qasW7eG2zmpDj3LuAIC7jw.text: BLUF: Try it. The curry is delicious and reasonably priced.  This was my first experience with Japanese curry and it didn't disappoint.  Parking in this area isn't the greatest. There's a large quantity of restaurants in the area and we had to search out a spot. Once inside, it took maybe five minutes for a table to open up, which was better than expected. It's a smaller restaurant so I could see them being pretty busy at times.   The food was great. I got the curry udon and tried some of my friends katsudon. The curry udon had a great flavor. I would definitely get that again but I'd probably get a side of rice to go with it to mix up the flavors and textures a little next time. The Katsudon was delicious. It was cooked perfectly and had this kind of sweet but not normal sweet taste to it that I loved. Also something I would definitely get again.  I wanted to try some of the appetizers as well, but figured the portions would be a good size. One appetizer to 3-4 people would probably make more sense unless you are local or are in a hotel where you can take leftovers with you.

MAK-tHs47ITE5e8QYbBshQ.text: I am often on the hunt for non-traditional food options in Las Vegas and was fortunate to find Japanese Curry Zen. I have eaten here, with my wife several times and overall have been impressed with the food and service. However, be warned it is a popular establishment so wait times can be excessive. Also, the restaurant has a great deal on beer, it is only $5 for a large bottle of Kirin and nicely takes the edge off the spiciness. The menu is decent with solid appetizer selections and is a great spot to go for lunch. Be forewarned the parking can be tight because there are several popular dining establishments in the small plaza. If you find yourself on the west side of town, on the edge of Chinatown and you are looking for a great spot to grab a meal stop in and try curry zen.

6TL3HDuIBfDc2-Kh_uj4LQ.text: Food tasted okay, but the presentation wasn't very nice. Prices are reasonable. Not sure we'd go back again.

YCwNG6piGcDYV8xV1_Hj_Q.text: Best Japanese curry spot in Vegas. I crave it all the time! I'm addicted to the spam and chicken katsu. Their curry is the perfect flavor.

6AFIUG3TSvecagzv7DVHgw.text: THE BEST! Probably my favorite spot right now. Reminds me of when I lived in Okinawa, Japan, and went to Cocos Curry and man this brings back memories! Always fast and delicious! I recommend the croquette curry and don't forget to start off with the naan bread. Thank me later!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croquette curry and already digged into naan bread #fire

Nh8CWVgpW7DYfJ4uw-rNsA.text: This place is great very fast service the food is delicious the service is outstanding, if you have never tried japanese curry this the place to go too!

Nmb8ElBumIr92YRFGME21A.text: This place is one of the best places for Japanese Curry...  I ordered the vegetables curry it was amazing... the staff was great and the place was clean.

u4YLXGsp_he7VpemDmJS3g.text: This location of Curry Zen is located on an overcrowded along with few other popular restaurants in the same strip mall, parking can be very limited during peak hours.  They do have a fast turnover rate at this place, and table free up rather quick for the times we visited them.  First time I was there was in a hurry, the curry was rather plain here, and their explanation was because their curry is so good that they do not need anything else beside the sauce... a bit too proud?  The flavor was just ok from all the curry I had eaten around the world.  Another time I avoid the curry, and got Katsudon instead, and it was actually much better choice, and they made the right way too.  Other starters we tried were Deep Fried Shumai and Takoyaki.  Shumai was just "meh", a bit too dried, and bland.  The takoyaki was just ok as well, a bit too floury on the inside.  I guess my expectation was a bit high being in Vegas and all, but Curry Zen would not be a first choice for me if I had a craving for Japanese cooked dish.  The staffs seemed like they have an attitude problem too.

RpCMGWDicb0ktNSqhrujGg.text: This place was packed. No where to park but people still waited outside in line ready to eat. Curry was wonderful. I was amazed by how many people love curry. Friendly staff and quick service.

BtnlAGDLzxvak854URa2_w.text: Had the pork katsu curry (spice level 3) and fried shumai     Delicious and affordable!

A9YCM3g-HTN5NbBVY9vhvA.text: Went with a group for a birthday and we got chicken katsu curry, 5 piece kushi curry, katsu don, croquette, sausages, tofu katsu, spinach curry x2 (all spice level 4).   The flavor was rich and everything delicious! The katsu breading were perfectly crispy. They are salted just right and portion sizes are not too large nor too small. Prices are reasonable.   Food coma is kicking in... zzz

DtCgK1kxFpGqj59TggePRA.text: Been obsessed with this place since I found out about it. I usually get the takoyaki here along with the tofu katsu curry. The tofu katsu is so delicious and always hits the spot and it's what got me coming back time and time again. They're very friendly here and I never get tired of the food. Definitely a great place to try, and it's so convenient because there' a couple dessert places you can go to after eating here. The only downside to this place is parking; because the center is so busy, there's usually never any parking nearby and I always find myself having to park on the side street.

Wr3nI3IkAbv4OOXou3Zk4Q.text: The best curry I've ever tasted!   1) The rice to protein ratio was perfect. We had just enough curry for every bite.    2) Spicy levels have a meaning here! I love spicy and even with level 5 every bite had a nice kick to it.   3) A little on the pricey side. Especially if you do add-ons, which we definitely did.   4) Wait staff is attentive and food comes out in a timely manner.    5) I can't wait to back to vegas and try it again.

HiPY6bJfkJZd58kU6qCmsQ.text: We started with the Fried Gyoza ($4.50); it's standard Japanese-style dumplings. It was fine, but I probably wouldn't order it again.  Japanese curry with Chicken Katsu is one of my all-time favorite dishes. This one was a little disappointing. I had the Chicken Katsu Curry w/ Brown Rice ($8.95). I was really pleased that brown rice was an option with no additional cost. The katsu was decent. The curry itself is what I wasn't really feeling.  The consistency and everything else about this dish was great, but the flavor wasn't what I like (or expect) in Japanese curry. It wasn't bad, but not what I want.  Also, I was really peeved that Fukujinzuke or any type of Japanese pickled vegetables were NOT set on the table or offered with your meal. I had to ask two servers because the first one seemed to have forgotten and we waited for some time. When we finally received it, they had only brought one dish for two of us. Although rather stingy, I thought one was standard for the table until I saw the party across from us had THREE things of pickled vegetables (and two types) for three people. Totally lame. What's Japanese curry without Fukujinzuke?!  Everything about this place made me feel like I wasn't in a Japanese curry house. Besides the menu. The menu looks great and the options are fun and vast. The curry flavor, missing or shortage of wonderful pickled vegetables, and lackluster service made me leave feeling sad and disappointed.

McccrkxxLR2XowoZFNMuyg.text: I. love. this. place. Curry got me like zayyumm.  just kidding, kind of. Seriously though whenever I eat here and take the first bite you can always count on me looking at you from across the table with the words "oh my god I've just eaten something so beautiful" in my eyes.  when you're here get the spinach curry with a croquette or chicken katsu! I usually get spicy level 9 because I like to live on the edge, but that's just me.  Their chicken katsu is bomb, but order their croquette to have your life changed forever.   hope this was helpful.  PEACE

yQbnf88Qg7gksdlHHLuZhQ.text: The workers at this place are good about greeting customers as they walk in & saying bye when they walk out.   I've been to this location a couple of times & there's never been a wait. I usually order the chicken katsu curry with brown rice, spicy level 3. I don't like my food too spicy to the point that I have to constantly drink water. I find that level 3 has just the right amount of spice. I don't like the fact that you have to pay for every little thing, i.e. Spice. The breading for their katsu is just right & isn't too heavy. Their water is also good (lol). I'm usually really picky with water & I won't drink tap water.  Their service is also not bad. Overall, this place is good & I'll definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu with white rice

X8PVhIZsLx-sWZ-V6UhgwA.text: Japanese Curry is one of the only  curries I like.  I don't like thai curry or indian curry, so i had to try this place.   If you notice my other reviews it's like i never left this mall. And yes, I almost ate at every location in this mall.   I came here right when they opened for and early lunch.  I got the  Veggie curry with the croquette and i added corn and had it with brown rice. My friend had the chicken katsu curry with a croquette.  You can choose your spice level.   They said that 5 is pretty spicy so keep that in mind.   The dish was really good, and because i had a sore throat i wasn't able to finish it.  The brown rice actually went pretty good with the curry and they didn't charge us extra for the brown rice.   It's a great place to come on a cold day.  The service was great and the place was clean. I would return there the next time i'm back.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken  Katsu curry with croquette
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie curry with corn and croquette

2fxSle_Zmv-6Hwaic1KRiQ.text: Love, love, love. This is my favorite place to eat at in Las Vegas, not only because of my almost unhealthy obsession with Japanese curry and the conveniently central location in Chinatown, but also because of the people who work here. The servers are unbelievably courteous, efficient, and always have a smile on their face. Every customer is greeted with an enthusiastic "Welcome!" and is seated almost immediately. The servers are also quick to let customers know if the wait time for a specific dish is projected to be longer than usual, so there are never any unpleasant surprises regarding that.   Although the menu isn't extensive, people who'd rather not have curry do have some other options, such as Takoyaki, Gyoza, and rice bowls, which are all pretty good. The food is prepared fast and timed just right, so orders for the same table come out at around the same time. It's definitely a perk when I go out with friends to eat and talk.  The portions are big considering the low price - just perfect for hungry broke college students. There is not all that much meat on the Beef Curry, but I usually get the Grilled Chicken Curry, which has a good meat-to-rice ratio and tastes fabulous. I come here at least once every month, and I have never had a bad experience. A day that involves Curry Zen is always a good day.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZOjo4L4Ejhz6tWQVVYfvBg.text: I love the curry here!! Very popular place in Chinatown. My favorite thing to order is the chicken chasu curry. Customer service is good!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TWdokmkdeEFgJz3xxHoODw.text: I usually don't go and eat in sit-down restaurants by myself, to avoid looking like a complete loser, but for here I make the exception! Everything on the menu is Japanese curry, coming with a choice of pork, chicken, vegetable, and whole bunch of other selections. The spicy scale is from 1-10, but it doesn't come that spicy, I'd say the 7 is their 'medium'. The chicken katsu curry is on point, that is the one I always get and it's a good dish for first-timers to try. The service is fast and friendly, it's a small establishment so it's almost always crowded, expect a wait.

ZYvk4bKc9C6qOEdGkhVDTg.text: ...for those who dont know curry and pork are HUGE in Japan...that said the food is decent...reminds me of one of the restaurants I have seen in many Japanese films where the working class guy just sits down to have a brief respite from the world and enjoy a meal...delightful

LMiAp_xWOmXiHneXYv8WHQ.text: If you love curry, you need to go here! I love Japanese curry. This place makes the best curry in my opinion! You can also range your spicy level from mild to hot or hotter! The curry is offered with rice and Katsu. I always get the chicken Katsu and spam katsu. -try it when you go there. They also serve alcohol. But it's pretty pricey just for a small bottle. The wait time to be seated is always immediate or a little while because it's popular. Even the time for your food to come out is generally quick. This place also does take out if you!just want to eat it somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner during study break.. Gotta feed our stomachs to learn
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7HUskSkpHHn1o7DFHv7ckQ.text: I recently went on a trip to Japan where I got stuck up about Japanese food.  Sorry 'merica, but even the best Japanese food here is just average food there, lol!   Anyway, my favorite curry spot when we were in Tokyo was CoCo Curry.  It's a chain there, but the curry is SO good.  The Tonkatsu is SO good - juicy, crispy.  Everything SO good.  So when I got home to Vegas, I was on the hunt for comparable curry.  After trying curry at maybe 2 or 3 spots, I decided to check out Zen Curry.  Not gonna lie, I was slightly disappointed.  The curry didn't have the UMPH I remembered from Japan and the tonkatsu wasn't nearly the same.  HOWEVER, it is good!  Don't get me wrong, its probably the best Japanese curry that Vegas has to offer.  The curry had good flavor and a really nice smooth texture.  The service was aiight... the prices were decent.  I would recommend this place!  My fav thing that we tried was the takoyaki... YUM!  Crispy, creamy inside, bursting with flavor.  Try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki... YES!

knNLtcetxQBIEajJYfdHww.text: The curry here is very very good. It is flavorful, rich and probably the best I've had outside of Japan.  I just wish the portions were a little bigger. Tip: don't get the beef (literally 3 pieces of small beef cubes). Don't get any spice level above a 6. It's way too spicy to the point of unenjoyable. Also, adding veggies to the curry makes all the difference.

PjBH28lype0MEy4XFaN8QA.text: Waiting for a spot at either Hwaro or Monta at peak lunch time on a weekend wasn't going to happen, so we found ourselves here, which we have also been meaning to check out. There was also a waiting list, but it was much more manageable and they seated us under 15 or so minutes. All of us got curry udon as it was highly recommended on their blackboard. It came out piping hot, and we could immediately tell the focus was on the curry broth, which was thick and full of flavor. The noodle also had the perfect texture and was able to absorb the aromas of the broth. The toppings of scallion and meat pieces were rather minimal, but that was understandable as the curry itself was already rich enough. While the bowl looked small, it actually had more depth than it appeared, and the broth helped fill us up on a surprisingly small budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry udon

zetqH5Q8lZYAoE-6BbdOCA.text: I enjoy the Japanese curry here - I really do. There's a lot of homemade and wholesome qualities about the place and food, and it doesn't taste like the curry is oversaturated with monosodium glutamate, which is great! In fact, the curry is quite smooth - not as thick of a consistency as I am used to, but also does not have chunks of anything included. The rice is very fluffy and sticky. Their main downfall is that portion sizes are unimpressive - I can find a similar sized katsu curry dish in an Asian supermarket food court for a few dollars cheaper. Eating a full dish did satisfy me, however, but I got hungry a few hours later, and it seems like you need to include add-ons or appetizers to really complete the meal. Looking through the pricing, I did not find any add-ons or appetizers worth it.  I've tried the chicken katsu and pork katsu - chicken seemed to taste just a little better in some way - maybe it was the more varied texture and grooves of the breading. I've tried having the cheese for a topping, and it was pretty cool - it did partially melt and provided melty goodness, but it also would have more or less tasted the same without. I've tasted the curry with no spice added, and with a spice level of 4 ("blaZEN" levels range from 1-10 and cost between 20 to 45 cents extra). Level 4 adds a good kick to it, but nothing really spicy on the tongue.  I also did not like that you have to ask for fukujinzuke for it to be included. The menu pictures show them included, and I wouldn't have even known that they had to be requested, had I not overheard someone. I must be spoiled from curry places around my area and from overseas.

2geQlugP312YaEAGsWnfMQ.text: Tucked away in little China Town is this gem! I don't normally do curry, or at least I though I didn't until I tried this place. It's ridiculously fresh and delicious. Plus their open late so that is a plus for most. Potato croquettes are the best. I literally have to have 2 every time I come! Staff is cool. Sometimes there is a wait but it's never more than 8-10 minutes. Place is small, but you have enough room to be comfortable and enjoy such a good meal.

j9lP9ENOFbp1ALREkUoGhg.text: Just let me say bunch of idiots here I order to go ordered a chicken Katsu curry open getting home and ready to eat I got my curry but no chicken bunch of idiots but other then that the food is good

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aYMNI3-NxGvUkRsLVWDWkg.text: Great place!  Curry was just right amount of spice. And it went perfect with rice and the chicken.  As simple as it is, it just taste great. And the price of the place is very affordable.

CTNom7WxK2BKjqob26Vzsg.text: I am definitely a fan, my friend from the Bay Area yelped this spot so he wanted to have dinner here. Immediately as we walk in we notice how small the dinning area is, probably only capable of seating 15 dinners or less. I swear I think the it was the size of my bedroom, haha! However, there were only a few other patrons since it was a Monday night. I wasn't too hungry so I ordered the croquet with corn while my friend had the chicken katsu, corn with cheese. We both enjoyed our meals very much so and particularly liked that there was a slight hint of spice in the curry. The croquet was pretty standard so I couldn't complain there. The prices are pretty cheap too, most menu meals were under $10. So if you are on a budget I definitely recommend this place. I liked my first visit so much I had been craving this place days after so I came back a week later with a different friend. We came in on a Sunday night and since this place is so small, it was packed! There was a "waiting list," but I guess those people didn't like standing outside so I think they just left. Initially she was kind of iffy about trying another Curry place since she's had the legit ones in Hawaii and she recently tried Kaba Curry's original location on Charleston and wasn't a fan. I glad she was pleasantly surprised! We had both ordered the chicken katsu with corn. Yum I must say and I also like the fact you can order brown rice which makes it feel a bit healthier. A major downer is that everything is FRIED, except the beef curry stew. The menu is definitely minimal and they should consider expanding and adding options like omelet or loco moco.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu with corn and brown rice..
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croquette $7.95

9VRCL6EhXEHAXF2E8O0Jzg.text: For my experience, I ordered the chicken katsu curry. The curry was overly sweet in my opinion, which I couldn't get over with. Also, the katsu wasn't crispy, and the meat is dry. In my opinion, Oh! Curry has better curry. I want to give this place five stars so badly, but maybe that will happen in my next visit once the food improves.

nKbJ6FHm38ZIvFwE-9BUYQ.text: UPDATED - they have expanded since I wrote this review (reason why I rated it a 4 versus 5). Plus!  I came across this place when the wait next door at Monta was too long and I must say I am glad I decided to eat here. The curry is amazing and I like that they give you the option to get brown rice. Spice level is 1-10 but don't be fooled. I usually love spicy food  and even when I get food with a spice level from 1-10 (for instance thai) I get a 7. But here, I get 3. I knocked off a star because the seating in this place is minimal. I usually go here for lunch as it's right across from work but I try to arrive a little early. Also, the portion size is great and the price is affordable for lunch!

yhiW_cr2ueQONHicRtWEIg.text: There are basically two dishes: rice and curry with your choice of meat and a pork rice bowl. Also, there are only a handful of tables and some counter space at a no-frills location in a strip mall. And yet look at all of those five-star ratings... I suppose when you do both of those items perfectly at bargain prices, you have earned your five stars. I am a huge curry fan. And with that said, Japanese Curry Zen knocks it out of the park. Hell, I do not even care for breaded meat most of the time, yet both the chicken we got in the curry and the pork in the rice bowl were superb. Both dishes are incredible. My only concern is that the place is too small for all of the curry lovers in this valley.  Pro Tip: The spice levels here are no joke. They range 1-10. I love spice, but am usually a little hesitent when trying a new joint. I went with a conservative 4 and it knocked me on my toosh!

gCNtBBoJXiUitndrUS4sjw.text: Had a Katsudon, and it was really good. probably the best in town. curry was real good. yet, there was a long hair in my rice. And I showed to a server then she replaced it. They still cha4ged for it. it is only a dollar, but I think they should not charged that dollar. well, shouldn't  be a hair in the rice in  the first place, of course. someone fromthe kitchen really should came to apologize. it can happen, but the way they reacted was not very appropriate. other than the incident, everything was good. I will come back though.

t31SyXa25m0amTwClwnstg.text: Sadly, I have to update my Curry Zen review. On our last visit, we were treated really poorly by the staff and it really soured me on the restaurant overall.  We arrived in the evening when they were pretty busy but there were two empty seats at the counter. The waiter who sat us asked US if anyone was before us in line for a table- um, how should we know? There were two guys hanging around outside but they could have been waiting for take-out or something else, and it's not my job to keep track of your customers for you. Also I just got here?  So anyway, he sat us and took our drink order... and then suddenly remembered that there WERE other customers in line for a table and made us get up and leave. I was completely appalled at how unprofessional and absurd this behavior was. We were seated and had our order taken! He kind of acted like we did this on purpose, too, like we were trying to sneak ahead of the other customers. It was just gross.  Even if I still lived in the area, I would never eat at Curry Zen again. One bonus star for being yummy and introducing me to Japanese curry, which I've since enjoyed at several other restaurants.

9xjRw0wuIyXkzbRbueT1zw.text: Decided to try this place out with some friends and the food was delicious and service was great! Definitely coming back. Had the vegetable curry with chicken katsu level 3. It was a little hotter than I thought, but still was yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry with chicken katsu and brown rice!

i5aHhxcBMBKhVcURfEBoRg.text: I do not understand the ratings on this place. I went there due to a really great rave I heard from my best-friend she loved it! I So I went and got the chicken Katsu with no extra additions on my curry, but I did ask for a level 3 spicy. Sadly the one I got was more of a level 7 spicy compared to what I am used to. I thought the chicken was good nothing different than the rest of the chicken Katsu I've had before the curry spicy level may have killed it for me though, yet I still cant see myself going crazy for this place even if the curry was not spicy. The food is not bad.... but nothing to go crazy for.  The service was great and the staff was friendly, and the place was cute and simple, but the food is meh in my opinion though.

lbxfrzMPkTYkvHfYteSUMg.text: I've been going to Curry Zen so much for over a year now. They really have progressed a lot in the past year.   Before, their restaurant was very small but ever since they expanded, it has been very spacious and there is always a seat for you right away unless you are a very large party.  Their service is still amazing as always and nothing says the best customer service than the owner coming out to check on his own customers and asking how everything is. The servers themselves are always very kind and attentive.  They recently also expanded their menu and have more appetizers and desserts now. They also got new toppings to go with their curry. For all you spicy lovers out there, there is a higher level than spicy 10. Me and my friends all tried spicy 100 and it is the spiciest curry you will ever taste. It costs $5 more for spicy 100, however, if you cannot handle it and am unable to finish your food, the owner is nice enough to replace the curry for you for something that you can handle :p Therefore, only try spicy 100 if you're prepared to die!  My favorite toppings to get are sausage, tofu katsu, or vegetables. They also have spam katsu which my boyfriend loves! They also have the best thai tea you will ever taste :D

r4dwdreeY-WbB-Apb4GpOQ.text: I had never tasted the curry, but is rich i love this place, the guys are so friendly

y1Ygodwgs1BiYrIER8Q2Lg.text: I'm picking up vegetable curry with chicken tenderloin and chicken tenderloin with curry. I love the curry here. The Katsu is delicious too.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry with tenderloin
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry with chicken tenderloin
