QLUF2uDJTgVtIX1MhDCV9A.text: We had fried oysters and Shumai as a appetizer. I ordered the Original Curry #2 with Pork Katsu and Croquette. It was a little too spicy for me, but still good. Next time I'll just order it without increasing the spice level. The Fried oysters we very good and the Shumai was really small, but still good. All in all, VERY yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Curry #2 spicy with Pork Tonakatsu and Croquette

Es68BZMGoTDyESKyXICtUQ.text: My new favorite curry house! Definitely coming back. Chicken katsu and takoyaki is soooo goood! Cant wait to try the pork katsu.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki

HvbHe2RvUKk_dpYy974-HA.text: I love this place! This was my second go at Japanese curry (the first being at CoCo Ichibanya in CA) and it was delicious. I came right around when 11am their opening time. It was a small restaurant so as usual I ordered carry out. I had the chicken cutlet with a potato croquet, vegetable curry, and cheese. When reading the menu I forgot to add in the level of hotness that I wanted but I think I was given #1 since I didn't mention it. When I got it home I was pleasantly surprised at the nice amount of vegetable curry I was given. Everything was so good that I regret not taking a photo of it before I dug in. After finishing I had a good amount of curry left that I ate it the next day on some homemade rice. Can't wait to visit here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry with chicken cutlet and 3 piece Kushi. Delicious!

yw4hzRFUR70CQmMzw98UYQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. Not only is the curry awesome, but the owner personally greets every customer as they come and go. Very welcoming, great service and food!!

ZKBD3OrYyWR4Giw8YkhGcw.text: Service is really great here! We were seated right away and the food didn't take that long to make. Our waitress refilled our drinks when needed and she asked if everything was good. I had chicken katsu curry along with vegetables & cheese. I chose level 2 which had a little bit of a kick to it. Zen curry is yumtastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original chicken katsu curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry with vegetables and cheese.

XDcm9VfD-vnQMem7zZyv3g.text: Undeniably the best curry dish I've ever had. Food is cooked to perfection. Chef and wait staff are pleasant.  This is a must try even for a newbie.

muhy3PApxFzvrD2UWpOciA.text: This place was so amazing! I had the chicken Katsu curry and my boyfriend had the vegetable curry. He's a vegan but luckily the curry is vegan friendly. He also got the tofu salad, which was surprisingly amazing! The dressing on it should be bottled and sod! It's like a miso Dijon. Yum! I got the shumi and the gyoza as well. I was pretty happy! So delicious!

TJdtKlWj-NDBW61b5TvfBQ.text: I am a very critical when it comes to Japanese curry. I love Japanese curry, but I feel very loyal to Curry house so I compare everything to Curry house.  I came here with my friends for a late lunch while we were in Vegas. I got the spiciest level of curry here. I love spicy food. It was a good spice level.   I got the standard chicken katsu curry. Portions are pretty big here.  it was pretty good, but the flavor of the curry was okay.

_YOXia43UAnjHC0dIJaoHA.text: Great place for Japanese Curry! Been coming here for over a year now and they have never disappoint me so far. The food is great and the service is always nice. But I do have to warn you about their spice level, it gets pretty spicy above lvl4. I'll be coming back in the future for sure.

X_kv4iCtudM4bEWuxkm3iw.text: this place is so good if ur craving curry it's a small joint so ur wait will be kinda long we came in as a party of 16 and got us on right away before it came visit the workers here are kinda slow

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lep7D2JjOcPkYlmWITNnzw.text: Food 5/5  Their curry is well flavored, I typically get a level 3 or spice and am satisfied with just the right amount of heat every time. They offer grilled chicken as a protein which is a healthy alternative compared to the Katsu which is my typical go to. I also love their potato croquettes and vegetables as options. You can Order a regular or small size portion but I don't think they are very different in portion size. They are a favorite when the craving hits.   Mom Rating 4/5   While they do offer high chairs many of the restaurants on Spring mountain are smaller and not as equipped for young children. Curry Zen is no different they also do not have a changing table in their bathroom which is a bit of an inconvenience.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VuHr2ncuGQAcq95AXN0Ffg.text: Whenever I'm hungry...and craving some rice...and craving some spice...and craving some curry, you know I'm here! Curry Zen is always so delicious and I like to come here often with some friends after a long day of classes.  I have tried most of the main entrees but my favorites are Tofu Katsu with vegetables or Chicken Katsu with spinach. I always get a spicy level 4, but sometimes they are a little inconsistent with their spicy levels. Some days level 4 is perfect and sometimes it's barely even spicy. So beware!   Lastly, if you ever get the chance before it sells out...buy a curry pan! It's so delicious and a perfect little snack.

idbiJQmoYKpeVWasgqFcLA.text: Thanks to this restaurant, I now know the wonders of Japanese curry! How have I never tried this dish before?!  Zen Japanese Curry was the perfect lunch spot during my trip to Las Vegas. It's located in a strip mall and has a casual vibe. They serve up lunch quickly, so it's the perfect place to grab a quick bite during the work day.   My dining companion and I started off by sharing an appetizer of fried oysters. Even though I'm not a huge oyster fan, these were wonderful! We then shared the pork tonkatsu curry at level 2 spiciness. The curry reminded me of a gravy-like sauce and was bursting with umami flavor. Level 2 spiciness was still quite spicy (which I enjoyed!). Portions aren't huge, so I definitely could have ordered my own dish.  Such a satisfying, comforting meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork tonkatsu curry! Yum!

TMHwW2deBmVX9h_4aecesw.text: Always come here without a fail when I come to Vegas. The curry ordering concept is pretty simple - you pick your curry base, rice, toppings, and spiciness level. There are other options on the menu - of which I've only tried the katsudon (pretty good).   It gets pretty busy around lunch time so it's best to come earlier if you're in a rush and/or want to find a good parking spot. The complex it's in is not exactly the best, but the food here makes it worth while.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aHukIX0-yFjW3e8sKQT7qg.text: Zen was one of the places I had bookmarked on Yelp because I had been craving Japanese curry ever since coming back from Japan. It's just not the same when you make it at home from a box, ok? Even late on a Sunday lunch, the restaurant was crowded and people were waiting outside.  My boyfriend and I both ordered the pork katsu curry. He got level 7 spicy while I got level 3. Level 3 was a good "medium" level spicy - towards the end, my nose was a little runny, but the spice definitely makes it better tasting. Curry was rich and smooth though there was too much rice for how much curry sauce was actually on the plate. The pork was piping hot and I love that they don't just dump curry sauce all over the freshly fried cutlet so that it stays crispy. We got a side of the fukujinzuke which has a sweetness that provides the perfect balance to spicy curry. My only gripe is that I've never gone to a restaurant that charges you for it by 3 oz. portions. Most places just have a container of it at the table. I do wish they had some more topping options like some other chain curry restaurants.  Overall, very tasty experience with great service and we'll definitely be back.

WE9DUqKZtquI-suDddexGQ.text: When I lived in Vegas this was THE spot. This was where I would bring friends who had never tried Japanese curry before and this is where they would come for years after. Their quality has only improved from the time they inhabited half the space they have now before they tore down a wall from an old nail salon. Mr. Zenbayashi can often be seen in the kitchen cooking and making making sure the curry is up to his high standards. If you ever needed an introduction to Japanese curry then this is the pace!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-zN9wUMQLwvvR4USdxhufQ.text: First... Let me start off with parking. Parking is just horrible. However, I was one of the lucky ones. I managed to find a hidden spot. I see cars circling around and around. The food here is just awesome. I had their curry and some added sides.   Service- Their service is great! Very attentive and friendly.   Their restroom is a different topic. I had to use their restroom... and upon washing my hands... I got scraped by the sink... a tiny scratch like that caused me to bleed. The green algae on the faucet caused me to have a cut. I highly suggest anyone who use the restroom to be careful and the restaurant to clean the sink better.

aTyItvFtDRewtEIvdeKJLA.text: I've been going to this special little place since 2012. A few things have changed, but the things that haven't are the friendliness of the servers and the quality of the curry.   Tucked within a crowded and small plaza, Japanese Curry Zen is pretty much THE place to go in town for, well, good Japanese curry. They make their flavorful curry with a vegetable broth and a blend of a whole bunch of spices that together make a comforting and unforgettable taste.   Accompanied by the curry is a wide selection of meats and vegetables including tonkatsu, kurobuta sausage, deep fried shrimp, and fried tofu. I personally order the curry with either chicken katsu or grilled chicken, occasionally with spinach. You can't go wrong with any combination, really. And if I could suggest to ask for the fukujinzuke (hard to pronounce, but easy on the tastebuds), it'll give a nice sweetness to the savory plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Chicken Katsu Curry on a cold, cloudy day.

Ix4OnsHVSKiryGVpdSDACg.text: I go here allot like allot.... (inserts ashamed face) lol. One word... amazing! Amazing service amazing food amazing location!! I love how simple it is yet soooo delicious! I usually get the katsu chicken curry with a 2-4 spice level and it's just so good the sauce is always boiling hot so it stays hot threw-out the whole time it takes you to finish your food. This dish gets me full they offer different types of currys and high spice levels. If you love spice then go high but even a 2 will have your nose running! Lol  So yes I do recommend coming here if you're from here or visiting it's not too far off the strip in a little location. Parking can suck around there if you're going around dinner time so Uber it if anything. But I always am lucky enough to come when parking spaces are available.  Prices vary for Curry's around $8 and up!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ROA_HbSduIxFzZnmGUz9Bg.text: I love this spot!! The parking is always full because there's different businesses around this curry spot.. legit Japanese curry spot!!   Must try!!

SwTv5e08RhfOC6t2Horl-g.text: This is a japan curry restaurant in Las Vegas. I think it's ok for me so many choice in the menu and you can design for how spicy you need 1-10. But Really need more curry because it's so dry for me.

FAB20WdzGk2rxr4O1yO-0A.text: I've been coming here for lunch and dinner for a while now. At night, it's usually busy which is to be expected, so I prefer to come earlier in the day for lunch since there isn't much of a wait. The service here is always spot on, and the servers are very polite. I usually order a half size brown rice curry with either a meat loaf, spam, or tofu katsu accompanied with scrambled eggs. The half size is a reasonable portion for me which gets me full every time. The prices here are extremely fair, so my orders never exceed $10. There have been a few times where there were hiccups. For one, my chicken katsu was undercooked so I notified a server, and they only took the price of that off of my bill. Another time, I ordered a fried egg instead of my usual scrambled egg which was a mistake. The egg was very undercooked and the whites were running through. Other than that, I have always had great experiences here the many times I've gone.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jh8mljmuVYqWN9KNAU-yQQ.text: So good! So many options & flavors! The prices are very affordable and the portions are generous. It is a small space so there may be a wait but it's worth it.

aLSBZ5IXWIyW3L4ggGc1fg.text: One who seeks curry enlightenment needs not to look further. A sanctum of devoted curry worship, this establishment is focused on calming hunger and appeasing all anxiousness. The few who choose to not pursue the quiet lifestyle may also challenge themselves on their patience with spice tolerance.  Setting: Located in the busy monta ramen/hwaro plaza, good luck finding a parking spot in here during dinner and especially weekend times. Many flock to park in the Chinese church parking lot on the east side of the plaza but you have been warned, people's car's have been broken into in the past in this area.  Food: The fried food comes out crispy and delicious with the curry always on point. Spice level on the menu runs 1-10 but you can test your limits up to 100 (15 made my face numb and sweaty). 11-15 (same price) 16-20 (same price) on the spice price and so on.   Overall: This is the go-to for Japanese style curry with usually a 0 to 5 minute wait

LGvyvLoO2DhyLWPDuGSBSA.text: First time ordering from here(takeout) was super excited because it was recommended by a lot of my friends. Came home to find only 3 pieces of chicken katsu. Like I literally paid 10.99 for 3 pieces of chicken and rice. I Called and asked how many pieces it usually has and was told about 7 and was also told there was nothing they could do about what they've given me. It's just disappointing and I'm upset that I spent 11$ on this. If you ever order takeout from here, check your food. Smh

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu

0A9o8SN_MR4SBMek3QpI9w.text: Tried their chicken katsu curry - delish - the takoyaki was well executed - it is a great feature that you can customize the heat level of the curry - also going to borrow their idea of tofu katsu next time I am in vegetarian mood at home

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki

tOTSAlth-VHdEd4Atrc97Q.text: I do love a good curry. And that is what I got from Japanese Curry Zen today at lunch.  I was seated right away in one of the few open tables. Its a small restaurant and it was pretty crowded. Not as bad as Monta Ramen across the parking lot but still a busy place.  I ordered the chicken katsu curry which is apparently their best seller. I can understand why. Tender, crispy fried chicken, a big scoop of rice and a plate full of Japanese curry. Its hard to beat.  I ordered my curry with a spice level of 3. It was perfect for me. I could maybe go as high as 4 but more spice than that might be too much. This was just right. It made my sinuses open up just enough. And it wasnt so spicy that I lost the taste of the actual curry. Japanese curry, to me, has a certain nuttiness that cuts through the pungent spice. Its not as sweet as say Thai red curry or panang curry. This is more savory. The thickness and color is reminiscent of Grandma's gravy on Thankgiving. It warms the soul.  I would give Japanese Curry Zen another go in the future. I like curries of all varieties but Japanese curry stands out in my mind. When I am in the mood for a good curry away from an Indian or Thai restaurant, Curry Zen has my vote. Good food. Fast service.  Ok pricing.

DE3EmvVLiJfI4FXQpLESTw.text: Curry is their thing. We come here often and order the Udon curry, Takoyaki, Oysters, and basic Curry rice with pickled vegetables. The service has extremely improved with their tech support. If it's Japanese curry you want, this is it!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu is lean and basic.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki is delicious.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Udon curry, yummy.

hkbNKVN1CbzPlJoH2MitBQ.text: Can't say that I am the biggest fan of this location. Slightly disappointed in the fact that this location has so many positive reviews.   Traveled down to Las Vegas for a quick trip with friends and decided on eating curry before the trek back to LA. Searched curry and this placed popped up with 4.5 stars. We arrived, wait was no more than 5-10 minutes and sat down.  We were all in the mood to eat some curry as it was freezing cold at night and some warm curry would do the trick. Between the table, we ordered a curry chicken katsu and I ordered the pork katsu. I added level 2 spicy to my order for a little extra kick. Also order a plate of takoyaki for the table.  The first plate arrive, the chicken katsu. Portions were nice and food looks delicious. When my plate arrive, I noticed i received significantly less curry. Was it because they added a level 2 spicy so they didn't portion it correctly? The pork katsu looks crispy on the outside but after taking the first bite, the meat was dry as jerky and none to pleasant. I powered through the katsu to get to the delicious part, the curry, The spice level was just right with the right amount of kick up sadly, I had to portion control my curry to rice ration to make sure I had enough curry. The takoyaki was a little disappointing as well. Mostly all dough with very little filling.  Will all these positive reviews, maybe we just had a bad set. Was really looking forward to that meal but who knows, very hesitant to try it again,

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu -Level 2 spice. So little curry :(
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu

IIL_7d3W4jDdNxoiEmvrZg.text: Came with friends on a weekend for dinner. Place is pretty small so if you're a big party you might have to wait a lot. Optimal is parties of 4 or less. The parking lot is crazy too because that complex has so many good things in it. This is my first Japanese curry place in vegas and it didn't disappoint. I just wish that they have more creative combinations like curry house in la. This is very traditional, with chicken Katsu, pork Katsu, hamburger steak, and of course the add ons you want like spinach, corn, egg (not soft boiled. Hard boiled) etc. I got the chicken Katsu and it was very moist and flavorful.  My friends got the pork Katsu and hamburger steak and they both enjoyed it. Personally I think the chicken is juicer than the pork. I also had the Takoyaki balls and they were really good. It's like a friend mash potato balls with pieces of octopus in it. Sounds really weird I know but give it a try.   If you cant eat spicy beware of even ordering a 2. It definitely has a kick to it. The scale is 1 through 10 but a 5 is super super spicy according to the waiter. The one thing I don't like about this place is that they don't automatically give you the pickled radish. If you ask they gave you a small portion of it. I had to ask 3 times cause I love that stuff. They weren't giving me attitude about it but I wish it was just out on the table like kept curry restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf curry with fried egg

NtS3YoOTo0q_YfiqgBTBHA.text: Always order the pork katsu and chicken katsu. The food is amazing. This has become just about a weekly dinner spot.

7KA11lzO6jAUWpSdKBWhsw.text: One of my go to places in Vegas. Disappointed in the service this last time around hence only 4 stars, servers were very inattentive.

E8orhsEeV8QARbV9up8Bhw.text: Food: excellent, SUPER AUTHENTIC japanese chicken katsu curry, original spice level, with croquette added. Hubby likes spice level 5. If you want the red pickled radish and pickled onions, you need to ask for it (complimentary), otherwise it does not come on the plate even though it is pictured on the menu. I don't know why they don't just put it on the plate, maybe people don't eat it and food is wasted? The chicken is fried perfectly, super moist on the outside and panko crispy on the outside. Yum - I want to eat here every week!  Authenticity: Japanese run. Feels liked I've stepped into a restaurant in Tokyo.   Parking: small lot competing with other popular restaurants, so go at off times!  Service: Attentive and friendly.

uaODc1Ijtkf1w-oxt4qRbQ.text: We ordered the Kushi Curry (deep fried quail eggs, mushrooms, eggplant, chicken, and shrimp) and two Katsu Dons. The rice is delicious and fresh, and the entrees are impeccable.  Beware of two mistakes we made: - do not order takeout from here on a Friday evening. It is a nightmare to find somewhere to park without a hike from where you stopped just to pick up your food. - don't mix this place up with their also great but very far rainbow location... a mistake I deeply regret smh  It all comes in healthy portions that leave almost enough for leftovers.  However, for take out, I far prefer the Rainbow location in portion size and for the sake that it's not as insanely busy there as it is here.

qCfUdzJTL_GrmGdhLwyYqg.text: The Skinny: the curry is okay but nothing special(3) service is slow during their busy hours and the seating area is small although better than when they first opened (3), value: given the prices they charge, they should give you more curry (3).  My husband likes this place but quite frankly I could take it or leave it. In terms of flavor, the curry is not bad... but it doesn't taste like anything that special either. (Kinda like the Japanese curry you can make with House brand instant roux)  My beef is the portion size of curry relative to the amount of rice and toppings. When we first started coming, there as barely enough curry for the rice. Now, the amount of curry provided is even less than before.  So I end up leaving half of the rice behind because eating white rice at a curry joint is no fun . And I refuse to pay more for extra curry. I am not a big eater by any means but I normally need to hit Snowflake shavery next door to feel satisfied.  I normally get the spinach curry and I must say...it would be nice to get a bit more spinach in a dish that costs $9. The vegetable curry is also super skimpy on the veggies.  The katsu is okay - the coating is a bit too heavy for my taste.  Even worse, you have to ask for fukujinzuke or rakko. (Normally there is a little canister of these pickles that you can help yourself with or they put it a little on your plate when it is served.) And when they do get some for you, it's a tiny little dish of it. That is if they remember to get it for you.  Overall, this place is okay but provides Jenny Craig portion control. Service is easily overwhelmed and the seating areas are minimal (this place does a lot of takeout... which really is no fun if you order katsu).3 star review

ckFk_sNOzkj-SVmVxMgg0g.text: Located OFF the strip in Chinatown, this place is definitely worth the drive for some authentic Japanese Curry!!!  (It's not that far off the strip)  The restaurant itself is very small, but the workers willingly accommodated our group of 9, by pushing tables together.   Lots of different curries to choose from with many levels of spiciness. You can also customize your curry and add additional toppings. I ordered the vegetable curry and added chicken katsu with a spiciness level of ZERO! I also ordered a side of curry pan.  Everything was yummysss. Curry pan was big. Enough to share with someone else. The curry was perfect, not to thin and not to thick either. The portion size was huge too. I couldn't finish it...  One thing I would comment on is that the curry was a little bit on the saltier side. Maybe it's just me since I'm more sensitive to salt. If it was just a bit less salty, then it would have been perfect.  So sad there's no Curry Zen in LA... Curry House just can't compare..

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry with chicken katsu and brown rice!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry pan (this is amazing)

_IXQjk-zH_Fsg2EvNLmm3g.text: A thwarted attempt to get Korean BBQ landed our group of three at this tiny Curry house.  The tako taking was amazing!   And my number 5 curry with chicken katsu, spinach and 16 grain rude was very good. I also order the half portion Beavis the probs are very big her and each item is stacked.. As in you get the full size piece of chicken and the full-size order of spinach when you order both.  My table mates had pork katsu and more vegetables. The curry is the real star with a ton of flavor. And so far it's one of my cheapest meals in Vegas clocking in at $16 with tip :).

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tako yaki,. Octopus fried and sauced...sooooo good.perfect texture.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu, spinach and 16 grain rice.

4BbUf3qbVSX0TmFmOAmeVw.text: Such a nice restaurant with really great food with great staff showing great customer service.  This place specializes in curry which is very similar to CoCo Ichibanya. Their whole menu and ordering system is also very similar. You get to choose the spicy level with extra charge and you can also add toppings as you like such as pork katsu, croquette, corn and etc.  I really enjoyed my Chicken Katsu Curry with spicy level 2 since I cant really eat spicy food. Anyway, it was perfect to my liking and the katsu was large and the meat was very tender. Curry was very simple but had the taste of curry and it wasnt missing anything though it just looks BROWN.  The guy server who was shorter than the other guy (there were two), was super super nice and kind. I enjoyed my dinner a lot more because of his attentive service and his kindness. He filled up my water cup even before I asked. I drink lots of water so thats always a plus!  I will come back here and tell my friends to visit when they come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry with Corn
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry with Corn

Kp_gX_qZU09FcUq8Q6eY3A.text: Good food, poor service. Had to get our own menus, tables were rarely touched, staff was generally unattentive. Drink glass was left empty with no offer of a refill. Staff needs to be retrained.

XOwEg6i5bNEFMr3coqG0cg.text: We lived I Okinawa, Japan for three years with the military and had the pleasure of trying CoCo Ichibanya there. I've craved it almost every day since we left and I came across this place!!! It's curbs my craving every time and the spicy levels do no disappoint! I love this curry but the price for a beer isn't the best  sooo order it to go and buy some beer from Lees haha I can't stop eating curry

0Tdw7pRSsXthzAiyssYy2A.text: My husband and I came here to get away from the strip we wanted to go to Raku Grill which is just next door but you need a reservation. This place is Japanese curry and is so very yummy and affordable. They have meat curry and veggie curry and offer brown rice instead of white rice if you want which is super nice if your health conscious.   Raku Grill won't answer the phone. So don't try calling to make a reservation. Just walk-in make the reservation for the following night and head next door to have curry for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specials Bored Curry Udon sounds good but I went with a classic veggie curry

evGRtlTazICveBWT-riziQ.text: Zen curry you have the most amazing flavor to a simple meal. Each bite reminds me of a home cooked meal. Your prices are reasonable and your customer service is exceptional. I just wish you had more locations.

-S3Nb81iKxmqE-dXTPGM0g.text: I ordered pork katsu curry. The pork chop was very juicy even though it was deep fried. The rice was very soft! The spicy levels are from mild, 0-10, where mild has no spice in it and zero has a kick in the spiciness. An order of curry is around $10, and the portion is small. I agreed with a lot of yelper that the curry tastes good; however, is it really worth the money you spend?! I will leave it up to you to decide.  Point is taking away because the portion is small.   *line could be long during lunch or dinner time!

9DAP4_S1UIkkrJJMf3-pgw.text: I had the chicken curry here, while my friend had the katsu curry. I'm a huuuuuuuuuuuuuge curry fan, deeming it one of my last meals on this planet if the world were to end tomorrow.   I wasn't too fond of the curry flavor. It was OK. The BEST thing that ever came out of this restaurant was the FRIED SPAM. My friend wanted to order this, and I thought he was crazy, thinking, "Do you wanna stroke or shoot up your cholesterol by double in 5 minutes?"  Sometimes the baddest things in life are oh-so-good. Fried spam was the highlight of my night. The curry was a 2 star, and the fried spam brings this place up to a 3 star. I don't know if they still have it on the menu since I had it about a year ago. Perhaps this place has improved itself since then, as I am seeing higher reviews. I shall find out again later if I visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry- good but not exceptional. Portion is small IMHO

ZdX3IbK-MdfWGQI-NACHZQ.text: This tiny spot was packed when I stopped in for lunch one Friday afternoon. There were a few people waiting, but since I was a party of 1, I was seated right away. There is no host stand, but they do have a piece of paper and a pen for you to write your name down. I ordered the pork katsu curry, level 2, and added corn and cheese. I also got a sprite and an order of gyoza.  The food came out quickly. The gyoza were just placed on the table and a moment later my entree was being delivered. Gyoza were crispy and hot, and I enjoyed the dipping sauce. The curry was just okay, but mind you I have never had Japanese curry before. I thought the corn and cheese were yummy additions though. The spice level 2 was just perfect for me. The pork katsu was crispy and delicious and I found myself eating that by itself because I realized I am not really a fan of Japanese curry. But certainly that is no fault of Zen's. I may not be back, but I would definitely say check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu curry level 2 with corn and cheese
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sprite

Ewf_y8h9JSnhL4Aj66cuMw.text: We came here pretty late at night and was not in the mood to wait for food which was perfect because there wasn't a line out the door. The restaurant was small but accommodated around 25-30 people. The service was quick and we got our food pretty quickly.   We ordered curry with chicken, chicken katsu don, fried oysters, and takoyaki. For the curry with chicken, I thought the plate was large in my opinion and surely should be enough to satisfy your hunger. I thought the curry was flavoured well and the chicken was tender. The chicken katsu don was also a big portion with plenty of egg and rice. I felt so bad I couldn't finish it but there was a good amount of food in that bowl. The katsu don tasted great and reminded me of homestyle cooking.   The fried oysters came in 3 pieces and was decently priced. I absolutely love takoyaki! It was not too sweet or salty and that dish alone had a good amount of it. Takoyaki is a fun plate to share with a group of friends.   Overall, cheap place with good food. I recommend coming here especially if you want to take a break from seeing your savings disappear at the casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried oysters
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki

XRkGGV8MUekPP0nHwIq_jQ.text: Amazing, delicious, the best. I Go here all the time. Level Five spice if you can handle the black Hot Cheetos.

8k38ILVo6c5LhPkvUegReg.text: Love this place! My first time having Japanese curry and it was phenomenal, I am definitely recommending this place to all my friends and coworkers. Can't wait For my next visit.

wsJ8Pnd2tag__eIAWTUaYA.text: Great meal! We would go back again! Chicken Katsu was outstanding! I got the level 6 spiceyness as it was perfect'

TPiglu8uJnbmNt26KHLsMw.text: Love me some Japanese style Curry! Bring on the spice!   what they lack in variety they more than make up with in quality. The food is great and the price is right on!

VnsKMhZeE2GebC8hwYmu8A.text: We ordered the chicken katsu with tofu katsu added, spicy #4. Just the right amount of spice and the curry was great. Tofu and chicken were both fried right. We will be back to try some other dishes on the menu :-)!!!

CDFau9CxwTf_NCV2_briaQ.text: Croquette/vegetable curry and coffee jello is so good! A little busy at lunchtime but I'm glad to see them get business.

nnUwcyKy4iQ6rwinv25WUQ.text: I have no idea what i can say about this place that would do it any justice. The only way one could ever truly understand how amazing Curry Zen is would be to eat there themselves. The food is absolutely astounding. It's high quality, consistent, clean, and most importantly DELICIOUS!! It's also affordable, but not by any means of cheap quality. The service is absolutely amazing, and if you are a repeat customer (like myself and my boyfriend) the employees actually take the time to remember you. We get an extremely warm welcome every time we come in! The food always comes out quickly and it's always fresh and hot. I LOVE drinking the J Pop alcoholic beverages they have available here too. Try the white peach flavor and thank me later.  Pretty much this place is fantastic, and if you are on the fence about coming here, DO IT!!!! I love bringing friends here and watching as it becomes their new favorite place to eat. I've never heard anyone say they DON'T like it.  It's pretty much the best place to eat in Vegas.

ZF5sPl2mHNZC8y55bIwuMQ.text: This place is so cute inside, it almost made me sad that we were only picking up instead of staying. The beef curry is amazing, full of flavor even with the spicy level added! The beef pieces are large and soft like pot roast without all the fatty parts (it's basically perfect). I tried the spice level "Blazer level 2" and it kicked my ass all up and down ass-kicking street. So hot. So good. So worth it. Definitely going here again whenever the curry cravings come back.

15iNAimcRduFS0nnobHLOA.text: Small mom and pop joint in Chinatown LV.  Clean, newly remodeled and very popular among the locals so we gave it a whirl. We got the chicken and pork curry katsu. Deep fried fried flattened choice of pork and chicken that is smothered in their curry sauce (yum). You can choose either white or brown rice to accompany the dish, our fav is the brown. This is not your ordinary Indian or Chinese curry. It's a secret Japanese style that is usually cooked hours on end. I don't know how this recipe is prepared or how long it's cooked but it tasted really good. You can get it in a range of how spicy you like the dish from 1-10. The server didn't ask us and I totally forgot so I was a tad bit disappointed that the dish was not as spicy as I would like. Otherwise great find and a must if your in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Cury over brown rice.

v2nk2H7az7w7UFWNcEXhuw.text: The curry was very good and portions were reasonable. Highlight for me were unlimited pickles at the table. Perfect complement to curry.   Don't underestimate the spiciness level. This was my first time, and to be safe, I chose spice level 3. It still had a kick!  Minus one star. They are understaffed. Service was slow.

_umV6owDa8YyIFHhVywtYw.text: I love this place, I told my friend I had an urge for Curry and she suggested this place.  This was her go to place and I can see why.  Its only sad because Seattle doesn't have an establishment like this.  Anyways, during my trip, I came here twice and was blown away by the curry.  The heat rating system was new to me since it went it to 10.  I had 7 twice and might actually bump up to 10 next time!  Both times, I got vegetable curry with some sort of protein.  My favorite would have to be the beef since I like stewed meats.  This with the sides of almond slivers, pickles veg.  I feel refuel and  ready to tackle the Sin City again.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu, vegetable, beef curry 7 stars
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple menu

B4BRbQ9mmGM1-Rx7_207nA.text: My husband and I were famished after our unintentional fast during the day, and on a recommendation from a friend we came down here, and we are sure glad we did!   Curry Zen is a very small space, but very clean and cute, and I couldn't have felt more welcome. The staff there seemed genuinely happy to serve us and make sure we were okay during our short visit, which cinched me wanting to come back here (if the food didn't already!).   Both of us ordered the same meal - Tofu Cutlet Curry with brown rice, and added corn and added vegetables.   The presentation of this is quite nice (although it's hard to make curry look appealing) and the taste was out of this world! Just the right amount of spice and it seems so rich but still with a light feel. The tofu cutlets were definitely the stars of the show and I hope they keep it on the menu because they were fabulous - lightly breaded and fried and just crazy delicious. The amount of corn (add on 50 cents for about 1/3 cup) was decent, however for a $2 add on of vegetables there was maybe half a cup in there and it was drowned in the curry sauce. I wish there was a bit more for the price offered. If you looked at the plate, you wouldn't have seen the $2 veggies except for a couple potatoes popping up from it.   All in all though, both of us practically licked our plates clean and also were out of there in less than a half hour - it hit all the right spots! I will definitely be back although the price was a little up there for a vegan curry plate. However I will be adding it to my favorite vegan-friendly destinations and will think of this plate of deliciousness often!

Y2XO5IT_ovli_HFgm_v8Bw.text: Went here on a Sunday night for dinner. Upon arrival the inside is reminiscent of Monta. Small not many tables and a counter you can sit at. The menu contains sausage, pork, chicken, shrimp. Most of it is breaded and fried but they also have just grilled chicken and pork. Also the plates come with curry, obviously and rice.  The food tastes amazing the curry flavor is really strong and tasteful. The sausages were my favorite and the fried shrimp.  The price is also a good plus for 2 people it only cost us $25. I would definitely return here.

_9MTg9I7CT8iaCEIOWuETQ.text: I would consider myself a regular here, coming here mostly during lunch breaks. My usual go-to order is a chicken katsu curry with spinach. The spinach adds an additional different flavor to the curry itself, and with its texture mixed with that of the chicken and rice together makes a great combo. The food usually comes out pretty quick, and the services is often very good. I've only had one bad experience with the service recently. I had ordered my usual, chicken katsu with spinach. However, the order that came out was only a plate of rice with spinach, no chicken. So I had let them know, and they apologized and brought out a separate plate of chicken katsu. But that process even took much longer than it should have. It might have been the service herself who made the mistake, because at times I would see new faces taking orders. This experience doesn't hinder me from going back, because it's a great place for Japanese curry, probably the best in town. Love it here, would go back for more lunches to come.

nbhtI5cn4-kzzCrr2q-56Q.text: Like the ancient Chinese proverb says "it has grown on me like a colony of E. Coli".  After 3-4 visits I'm seriously digging this place. It's is relatively "healthy", delicious, fast and affordable. Not to mention that is one of the cleanest Japanese spots In the area.   Menu is very limited with few protein variations of the same rice and curry plate. There are few toppings or add ons. I have tried chicken katsu and pork cutlet with croquette toppings. I really like the condiments: almonds, sweet onions and radish. You can also request brown rice as a side.   I've tried the tofu dessert, also very tasty.   Seoul Plaza has to be the one of the foodiest spots in the city. Add JCZ to the list.

n7B4H_oKHYRpFWvt9XwgjA.text: By far my favorite curry house in Vegas I even bring my friends from Japan here and they love it!  Service is great and Mr zen often visit with the guest to make sure his food is of the best quality, that shows how much he cares about the people  and his food.

QJQ8BVSpQAqytOrLZXkunQ.text: HATE  Nothing.  DISLIKE  Nothing.  LIKE  The spinach curry. The chicken cutlet. The sides offered. The pleasant service. The close proximity to other local favorite spots.  LOVE  Nothing.

mG5GVoXmKgbCFV8z53KaMw.text: I remember coming in the first time, the place was so small but oh boy did the food live up to the expectations . Now they have expanded I love coming through to get my curry fix . My boyfriend is fan and always enjoy good meal here. Definitely recommend to anyone who's looking for some Japanese curry for an actual decent price ! Also the proportions are pretty amazing if you're down to eat a whole plate (:

srGUnDm2OjEEP24FeJ-Mqg.text: Had the pork cutlet curry. Overall, better than average. Not the greatest but still better than normal.   What sets them apart is the service. They're really accommodating, especially since we had a baby with us. Great service. The waiter, which we found out was the chef's son, got his friendliness from his dad.

wcQ-8b_3FUyd_tUVO1KBJg.text: Service was excellent and attentive.  I would rate them 5 stars if we could separate it out.  Unfortunately,  I cannot say the same for the pork katsu curry.   The Pork Katsu was slightly dry though the actually breading was light and crispy.  The curry was actually good but I was missing the traditional potato and carrots.   Instead I had a half a plate of curry sauce that drowned the rice and pork katsu.  The best thing was that they gave me an endless supply of pickled radish which is the perfect condiment to this dish.  Even though it was not the best for me as I have high standards,  I would still recommend trying them out.

QEDUgc0W9cBYfN0EkXbIFQ.text: With Rice Trax closed indefinitely, my wife and I needed a place to get our curry fix. When we found Yelpers raving about this place, we thought we'd give it a shot - and we're glad we did!  The menu is very simple, because it doesn't have to be complicated. Pick a protein, pick white or brown rice, and enjoy the curry. My wife was pleased that they have tofu katsu, and I enjoyed the chicken. We both tried croquettes on the side, which were fine but ultimately took a backseat the curry awesomeness on the main plate. The proprietary spice blend is so delicious that they prepared a special card on the table explaining everything in it. I'm craving it now just thinking about it.  The place was deserted when we arrived, which meant that the waiter stood at attention for the duration of our meal. It was a little weird, but at least it meant that it was never hard to get a drink refill. (Unfortunately, speaking of drinks, pop is served only in cans - no fountain.)  Oh! And the price! This place is super-economical. I can't remember the last time I had a sit-down dinner for two under $30.  Delicious, attentive and cheap. This place hits the trifecta and I can't wait to go back!

PRoKEF0g6Kb49GDZD-4VSA.text: Love this place! Hands down best curry place. I love the food and the service! I usually get the chicken katsu and shrimp, but lately I've gotten the five piece kushi which is so yummy and has a bit more variety with quail eggs and zucchini. Highly recommend. 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cutlet with shrimp and three piece kushi

BPHtMpNJ9S76lkqcCxXMug.text: This place is FANTASTIC if you're looking for Japanese curry.  I've been coming here for the last few months at least once a week.  The place is a little small, but intimate... i personally like that.  The Chicken Katsu or SPAM katsu with spinach curry is amazing!  chicken is moist and tender and the aromas from the spices they use are to die for.  If you like SPICY  this is the place (Ranging from 1-10).  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

DKLxWtK2UL8VVS3jIYNpyg.text: the plaza it is located at is small and parking is limited, so that's one annoying point about going to japanese curry zen. the restaurant itself is quite small, too, so space is very limited. the service can be a bit slow and the waiters or waitress might have trouble understanding, but overall it isn't that bad. the food, though, makes up for all of this. it is simply the best curry i've ever had. i've gotten the chicken katsu curry, the beef curry, and the tonkatsu curry, and they all tasted great. i also like their croquette and curry pan, and usually order them when i go there.

vUKa2VK3nkCEUJ84EBl7Ig.text: Best Japanesse curry in las vegas. I am no expert. I have had Japanesse curry about a dozen times. This place is the best one in Vegas. Great staff to boot!

JsTxnEPTTqh2M5xDuIxtgg.text: I had the pork tenderloin. Just breaded and fried. The curry was good. Nothing to rave about but good enough to take me back to it. For the price you pay for each dish, defiantly worth it.

D16IX5vNCO5Rh49gx5zoiA.text: good customer service. I should have bought their chicken katsu curry..but well next time. I'll definitely come back. :)

UNlhW7IkYNvQ-AhoGOmFxA.text: I went here for the first time back in November.  It was very good.  The service was friendly and quick.

twcBy5hoKs8Q2jS-4Njs6A.text: I love this place. You'll definitely feel the zen when you eat here! I lived in Japan & always wished there was a place in Las Vegas that was similar to taste & atmosphere to that of a Japanese Curry Shop & this is the place! The female waitress has top notch customer service & is very genuine and helpful! The curry menu has expanded & you can basically get traditional japanese curry to create your own type of curry! I would definitely recommend this place to any one looking for Japanese styled curry or is willing to try something new!

_KwQ398MFDdmlwk3rCR-YA.text: After 3 years in Vegas this is my favorite restaurant, I love the spinach curry, tofu salad and curry pan. The prices are incredibly affordable, every time we come we are shocked to see how low the bill is. My kids love that they can pick a la carte.

7IEpVnz1P62dP4LFcQ-Gzw.text: I love this place!!  I've only visited this place once, but my first experience was a pleasure!  Tiny restaurant, but clean and cute.  We were automatically greeted upon arrival by the cook and the server.  I tried the chicken tenderloin with extra sides (veggies, corn, cheese).  It was so damn good!!  I was so pleased by both the presentation of the dish and the taste.  I wish they had served more rice on my plate though.  On my next visit, I'd have to order an extra side of rice.  This place is a must see and must try!  Good food for such a good price!  Yummy!!

Cq2OYXoMTzkC4fNMNs71zA.text: Love the curry, every time I visited there the taste is always consistent, I love beef, Sasami, and steam tofu curry the best.  Most importantly, everyone who works there always so polite and filled with positive energy

n3vgtYAK52OeJT5Gs693FQ.text: simple, and always perfectly made! if you like japanese curry, this place does it the best

mGo0XbIpxWod77xwBIYjAw.text: I have to say this place has the best home-made curry in town. I am here at least once a week and now the staff recognized me and will automatically put in the order for me once I walk in the door. All staff are very friendly and of course, the curry was delicious. Highly recommend!!

txUfHIwGZSIVZpO22RWX8A.text: Omg!!  This is what REAL Japanese curry tastes like?!?!  Not the yellow pasty, grainy, raw curry in other Japanese restaurants. Almost like my Mom's!!!

MD7mOsFT7hTyTahwHaKMnA.text: Folks, this is the closest you can get to Coco's curry house. I had the chicken cutlet and it was on point! The curry tastes just like it does at Cocos! The service was excellent, I almost felt like I was back in Japan! The only negative thing i have to say is that its a small area to dine in and theres only 3 people preparing the food so it takes a while, but so worth the wait. Oh and they don't have Naan Bread, i know, big disappointment, but you can go to the Indian store and grab some and bring it with you, im sure the people at Zen will throw some cheese on it and heat it up for you with your meal.

TIiG6FVYIYXgq2gxJr_BSA.text: The staff here is great.  5 stars, no doubt.  But the selection on the menu is too limited, and the spice level does not correlate with other Japanese Curry places.  It's too spicy.  I orderred a level 5 and it definitely was closer to a lever 8.  So one less star for that.  And one star off because the steamed rice tased off.  It tasted like cheap rice.  Not sure how to describe it better, but I just recall thinking the rice tasted to ricey.  Like it wasn't washed? Or too much starch?  I would love this place if it added a few things to the menu.  Like fried rice wrapped in omlette for starters.  Then menschi katsu would be great (planko breaded hamburger patty).  And a few extra add-ons to the curry dishes.

r60uO4YOLw1-6CvA6l_TXQ.text: My family and I stumbled upon Japanese Curry Zen after 5 days of mediocre, overpriced food on the Strip. It was by far the most memorable meal of our Vegas adventure. I lived in Japan for three years and make curry rice at home quite often.  This was the real deal; spicy, flavorful Japanese-style curry with several interesting additions.  I tried the tacoyaki appetizer and it was great. Highly recommended, especially if you've never had Japanese curry before.

2O4JdDH2FqmLNIpHxfEj6Q.text: What a great little place! The food is exploding with flavor.....   be warned on the level of spicy heat you ask for! They offer 1-10, and charge for over 5.  For one who typically orders Thai Spice 7-9, I was shocked when it ordered a 3 here and broke a sweat!   The dining room is very small with only 4 tables and a small eating bar. It reminds me of curry house in Honolulu.  This is a must go!!!

AkFxftERcfs52fV7GRulQg.text: I have wanted to come to Japanese Curry Zen for some time now and finally went for lunch with a friend. I had never had Japanese curry so I didn't really know what to expect although I had seen some photos and honestly the dishes did not seem to aesthetically pleasing. But I had heard great things and my friend was always raving how good it is so I went with an open mind.  I went with the chicken cutlet and the croquette. The taste was ok, but it definitely could've used some vegetables. Yes, they have corn, but something green would've been nice. It would've lent the dish some freshness too, I think. What with the rice, the croquette, the breaded chicken and the brown sauce, it just seemed kind of monotonous to me.   The price is very reasonable, lunch was under ten dollars WITH TIP and the waitress was super friendly.

r5kK9Z654wTIwBq9t6ulrA.text: I accidentally ate here. Not a huge Japanese curry fan. But my sister insisted we dine here. They have a delicious pork tenderloin. It's perfectly Crispy and tender. All in all they have comforting food and pleasant customer service. My sister mentioned that it felt like she was being hugged from the inside with every bite.

8CasmKB_POO23Yq19QOQYQ.text: Spinach curry resemble saag paneer, tofu Katsu was average. The curry is just one note- spicy, can't distinguish any other flavors in it. The spice level is very deceiving, their 4 is extremely spicy. My nostrils are running, my tongue and lips are on fire- to the point where you can't taste anything anymore. I would recommend getting spice level of 1 and adding to it. If not, you will regret it.

HI6dTnWQ_Hn3CRoqYkeFYA.text: Best curry in town, hands down! No other curry restaurant can compare! The chicken Katsu curry is my favorite! Come here almost every week because the food is addicting! I love it here! Service is great! I recommend everyone to try this place!

VnowizFMMqDQNjO4piYiHA.text: I absolutely recommend this restaurant!!! The food is amazing and the service is fantastic!!! I always get the spinach curry spice level 7 it's not just spicy but very flavorful. Definitely try this  place out.

5YNnpSoOlcLoC0s9hgi34w.text: I believe you need a lot of sophistication to enjoy Japanese Curry. It's just these small little differences with the spices that separates  a J-Curry place from being "good" and "great". And, I believe that JAPANESE CURRY ZENBAYASHI has achieved Greatness.   This is a rare Japanese restaurant where they pay attention to the smallest details. For example, today the Rakkyo was perfectly cut in a distinct geometric style, which made every single piece look identical in size and shape. At first, I thought I was seeing things but eventually after watching Mr. Zenbayashi working so carefully in the kitchen, I came the conclusion that they spend hours before the store opens preparing everything to look beautiful and artistic.  Unlike similar restaurants, JCZ will refrigerate the condiments such as Tonkatsu Sauce, Rakkyo, and Fukujinzuke. They wait till a customer arrives and then they bring them out with new clean serving spoons. Other places around town will merely keep the condiments sitting out on the table all day long with the same serving spoons which had been touched by many dirty hands. But, you won't find that problem here. This is the most spotless and clean restaurant I have seen in Las Vegas.  Even the bathroom looked like no one had ever used it.   Just like INABA, this place prides itself on having a dish that not only tastes great, but has tons of health benefits. They have a homemade Gram Masala which is a combination of about 15 spices such as Turmeric, Coriander, Black Pepper, Cumin, Cardamom, Fennel, Japanese Chili Pepper, Ginger, Garlic, Paprika, and many more. Unlike Indian Curry, J-Curry is lower in calories and fat content. It also has anti-oxidents, digestive benefits, blood cleansing, and even anti-aging benefits.   I actually came here by accident today, I spent most of the day loitering at Jen G's place of work.  After about 3 hours of bugging her, she told me to "BUY SOMETHING OR GET OUT!", so I went straight to JCZ! ...Just kidding. Actually, the True story does involve me loitering at Jen G's place of employment, but we had a conversation about Kabuto, and both of us agreed we should go there and give it another try. I actually didn't like my last visit to Kabuto on account of being spoiled by Urusawa in LA. But, I ended up going over there anyway  to make a reservation. While I was in the parking lot, I noticed the JCZ sign.  David Y had recommended the place to me earlier, and he told me that it was exactly what he used to get in Japan, so I gave it a try. And Dave was right, it was the best. I don't know why people would rather eat at overrated Monta when JAPANESE CURRY ZEN is only a 15 second walk. And the best part of JCZ is that it doesn't have a 2 hour waiting list, uncomfortable seating, overflowing toilet, hipsters and emos reciting poetry, and non-japanese cooks who cook the eggs in the back alley(read my review on Monta to understand that better). And that's another thing that makes JCZ great, it's 100% Japanese staffed. Sure, I actually know Chinese and Filipino Sushi Chefs who make some Japanese ones look like amateurs, but the point is that it's always so unique to find a J-restaurant that is 100% Japanese staffed.  The best thing on the menu is the Pork Tenderloin Curry. Do not confuse this with the normal Pork Cutlet. The Pork Tenderloin Curry will not be on the main menu. You have to ask for it specifically. Today, the cook put so much attention into making sure the cutlet was fried perfectly. The color was beautifully golden brown, and the texture of the meat was so juicy and soft that I ended up eating it all in less than 5 minutes.   This was the best service I have ever had as a 1st timer. Sure, there are some Japanese owned restaurants that treat me better, but that's because I've spent a lot of money there. For example, when I walk into "Sushi on Rainbow", it's like that scene in "Goodfellas" when Robert De Niro walks into the club and everyone knows his name, they open the door for him, save him  his usual seat, and everyone gets whatever he wants before he even has to ask. That's how good some places treat me because I show up regularly, I treat older Japanese workers with a lot of respect,  and because I'm f*cking rich I tend to leave giant tips. But, even though this was my first time at JAPANESE CURRY ZEN, they already were treating me like I had spent over $1000 here. And of course, even though I only spent like $10.00 on curry I left a $20 tip. And the server earned every penny of that because it really was the best service I've had in years.   JAPANESE ZEN CURRY is a small independent business, not a million dollar bankrolled J-restaurant. Even though there is a rumor that this place is owned by the Mon-group, the server told me that it's just not True. This is a small business that needs the support of the Japanese-American community here in Las Vegas. So, I encourage all LV Japanese residents to come try this place out and support them.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu with Mr. Zenbayashi&#39;s secret spice recipe.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr. Zenbayashi&#39;s secret curry recipe!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu, Korokke, Cheese, Corn, Raisins, Almonds, Fukujinzuke, Rakkyo, and Mr. Zenbayashi&#39;s secret recipe curry

MMAvJi1DttePy-VK6U_qtg.text: Love this place!   I am a huge fan of hole in the wall specialty Japanese restaurants (Monta, Ichiza, etc) so I decided to try this place out.  Prices are super cheap, the dish is very filling, and extremely good! They even have a brown rice option if you are looking to avoid white rice. (Huge plus in my opinion.)  Staff was super nice, and the owner (possibly also the chef?) even checked up on us to see if we were enjoying the food. I know sometimes people do not like Asian restaurants because of the service, but this is one of the only ones with great service.   I would like to see some more items added to the menu sometime in the future so that when I get tired of gorging myself on curry I can still come and enjoy a meal. (Or even more options for dessert.)  If you like curry, this place is a must go!

2wLRmWncS6J15ujIvBSXiw.text: I have been looking for some good brown curry for like 8 years in the Vegas area. Based on reviews, I made sure that during some business one day in vegas I made the time to stop in for lunch. No disappointments here. This place is awesome. The only complaint is it is tiny! So you gotta eat and run so the folks hanging outside the front door can get some great food also! I am a fan of the beef curry and potato croquets. I ordered a side of curry cause I like the rice and beef swimming in it!  They keep it simple and I think this has helped them become successful. Not all curry is created equal.....

UZRBI0jnT0MW-B_rqZICDg.text: So delicious! We ordered chicken katsu curry, tofu katsu curry, curry pan, and iced green tea. The green tea was from a can but still tasty. My husband loved it and it reminded him of his favorite curry place when he was stationed in Okinawa. The tofu was silky inside and crunchy on the outside. Condiments like pickled vegetables and sliced almonds were available on the table. I suggest trying them all. The curry pan was toasty, crunchy but still light and fluffy. We will visited again before we go back home! Tons of options to add to your curry to make it special.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced green tea

MU_RI0Wgb75fil-KH3uJ4A.text: Best curry flavors I've tasted. They recommend 3 if you're not into spicy. I like heat in my food, a 7 is good.

NZrIb50nWKv3QN4Q-2U3dw.text: Curry!  OMG do I love Curry... Indian Curry, Thai Curry, Japanese Curry-it's all good.. The amalgamation of spices, creating that distinct, deep, rich, umber slurry, with heavenly wafts filling my nostrils; you literally taste it through your olfactory senses like an emotion or a memory (Curry is my Pavlov's dog)..  Curry is a favorite from my childhood; just before spending the Summer vacation in Japan, My Mom would make batches of Curry and hundreds of Fried Dumplings for my Dad to eat while we were gone.  I loved hanging out in the kitchen, helping her cook these dishes, and it is distinctly home cooking.  Curry Zen is located in the same Commercial Center as Monta, Raku and Trattoria Nakamuraya, making it's own 'Little Tokyo' deep in the heart of Chinatown.  It's a small venue with only a couple of tables and a counter, so you can imagine there's a prime, rush hour wait - makes sense to time carefully with this restaurant.  But it's clearly a family run business with Husband and Wife manning the kitchen, which is endearing.    The Curry is a simple gravy, made entirely from Spices and Vegetables.  It has the consistency somewhere between a sauce and stew, with deep but clean flavors that highlight each Spice in a way I've never tasted.  Almost a science, a brief explanation is on a placard on each table (in Japanese) describing the ingredients and methodology- one thing that I find about Japanese culture is the cult like devotion to the culinary process.  On the table, you find various condiments that I find unusual, but welcoming: Almond and Raisins for one, then as the Curry is spicy but not hot, there's a bevy of dry spices to ramp up the heat.  I enjoyed working with a sprinkling of Mild, then incrementally moving towards Hot Chili Peppers.  Along with the Curry, there's a selection of toppings and fried accompaniments: such a Chicken or Pork Tonkatsu, Croquettes, Fried Shrimp and Vegetables. I really enjoy the fact that I can customize my Curry, and I immediately wanted to 'load up' on the fried goodies:  I ordered the Pork Tonkatsu and Fried Shrimp.  Now given the price point, the Tonkatsu was amazing; not your tough, thin piece of stringy meat, Curry Zen presented a really good piece of Pork that was fried perfectly and for an extra $3.50, it's a steal!  The breaded Shrimp was properly cooked and a great mini addition to counter the Tonkastu, you can never have enough fried meat on your plate is my philosophy!  I enjoyed the service, both the Husband and Wife repeatedly asked me how my dish tasted and I appreciated their attentiveness.  And I know I will be coming back, not only for the food, but I want to support the smaller businesses in Vegas and these are good people!  Ratings (Out of Five Stars) Food:            5 Ambience:    3 Service:        5

yIzNDxNecvcS6OvcuxwUQA.text: Good curry but watch out for the spice level. Also superb service and katsudon. A entree will fill you up.

tCHdC8yDZbbqfw-pVX3ApA.text: The restaurant is near the Kongfu tea. If you go at the dinner time, it may take you some time to wait but it worths it. You can choose how spicy you want for the curry. I have chose 5 and it's kind of spicy!

BxLKA-zOMhzQNImLN8HSNQ.text: Loved this place. Great staff and cute restaurant. Great food. I ordered out for my family and they put it separately so nothing would get soggy. Super thoughtful and delicious! Will go to Vegas to eat there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

daOkjFY4813Hrksm5xHf3A.text: Great authentic curry joint. Oishi! Reminds me of Coco's curry in Japan, with it's yellow and brown color scheme. The Pork Katsu was a little tuff, could have been tenderized a little more but the flavor of the curry was spot on and spice level 5 was just right not to hot not to mild.   The restaurant is fairly small though so don't plan on bringing a big group here. Perfect if you're by yourself cause you can pull up to the bar and put down some rice and curry.   Parking is ruff in this little shopping center, I think there are more restaurants than parking spots, so you may have to loop around a couple times or take a chance parking on the street or better yet just get it to go...

xxKonzjNIH4fjscM0F4WMg.text: What a unique, simple, yet elegant place this is!  While the space of the restaurant is about half the size of it's famous neighbor, Monta Ramen, the flavor is not.  You can get a nicely crafted plate of Japanese curry for a quick and budget lunch at this new spot!    They serve both brown and white rice with the one thing they make here: curry.  The menu is extremely simple... what kind of meat do you want on your curry?  Condiments include raisins, ginger, some sort of pickled beat type of thing that is amazingly good, almonds, and three different heat levels of spice.  I suggest you add everything to your curry!  Yum!  Even for a Thai curry snob, the curry here is spiced extremely well.  The flavors are balanced with herbs and a slight sweetness.  I have had the fried shrimp and fried pork on my curry so far, and both have been done very well, not too greasy or too breaded and with quality ingredients.    The price for a plate of curry here ranges from $4.50 (no meat) to around $8.50.  You really can't beat that price for a quick meal out.  The curry here is better than the one served at Shuseki and Ichiza, so give this little spot a try!

mkMKUVAUHSuzMTmSSl22kQ.text: Curry Zen is a very small restaurant that offers a small menu and will cost you a small amount of money.   The curry is very tasty. I like all the spices and condiments at the table.   The owner/chef(?) is very friendly and always asks us if we enjoyed it. :)

N1tUTU7ZSi8wGqnwG5GgkA.text: We originally came to the area to try Monta Ramen, but they were pretty busy and we didn't want to wait. I yelped this place and saw good reviews- decided to give it a try. It was pretty empty at that time so we were seated right away. We ordered 2 chicken & 1 pork katsu curry. They are so good! It's very comforting especially when the weather is so cold. I finished the whole thing- we were done in 10-15 mins. We also ordered the takoyaki which was good also. The food came really quick, so that was our best decision to give this place a try!

yzi9t21Cm7q9hQFo1qy_2A.text: Went Sunday 7-19-15 around 12:30 PM.  Waited outside for almost an hour.  Not an easy thing to do when you have a 1-year-old when it's 95 degrees outside.  But that's not their fault.  The place is kinda small and the "waiting list" is just a sheet of paper you have to write your own name on and they'll call you when there's a table ready.   It's just west of Decatur on Spring Mountain. It's in the same shopping center as Monta Ramen, Kung Fu Tea, and Raku.   I'd never had japanese curry before.  I got the chicken katsu+curry spicy level 2+corn+cheese. I left a $4 tip and the total was $15.52.  I can see why this is crave-worthy.  The only thing I can compare it to is curry-wurst in Germany.  It's like a thick brown gravy with curry in it.  The chicken was fried perfectly in a panko coating but was incredibly bland.  Maybe it's supposed to be like that to balance the strong curry.  The rice was wonderfully sticky and the cheese made the whole dish feel comforting.    Level 2 spicy was just enough...my white girl palette can only handle so much.  It would be really good with french fries I bet.  I liked it and I'd eat it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and croquette +corn + cheese. 12-26-15
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu. 12-26-15

01xyR_cDrqfVwWs6nzdTSw.text: From what I've heard, Zen is owned by the same people who run Curry House in Hawaii. If that's True, I wouldn't be surprised because the food here is great. I normally get the chicken katsu curry, but this last visit I got plain curry with a side of gyoza to make gyoza curry! (P.S. you guys should put that on your menu.) Both really yummy. The restaurant itself is on the small side so if you have a big party or are concerned about waiting, they also take to-go orders. My to-go's have always been hot and fresh. The place to visit if you are craving simple but authentically done Japanese curry.

HrVtMzb-QcrWaxegEcyCjQ.text: Loved loved this place!  I had the donkatsu (pork cutlet) curry at level 5 spicyness. It was heavenly. Ate the entire dish!  Fried to perfection and the spice was perfect for a spice lover like me. I will be coming back with my family. Love discovering new gems!

ltZcjXX1LBlQhVs2ddiuHg.text: When we are in Vegas we make sure to visit. They are also open late till 0100 am so when hungry a definite place to visit. Very casual.

qoAzFBdzkzHGA3kMhyadxg.text: I always get the chicken Katsu with cheese spicy lvl 7 just enough spice to give it a kick and make you nose run slightly but not enough to hurt your stomach they're servers are always friendly and know when to refill your water cup

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I always get the chicken Katsu lvl 7 no matter the spice lvl the curry is always delicious

hpKjT-kUUuDKpeJaBfS1-A.text: We stopped by Zen's around 8 on a saturday night. There was a waitlist, but after standing around for a few minutes, we were seated early since we only had a party of 2.  I got the vegetable curry with tofu katsu, and my boyfriend got the pork katsu curry with a spice level of 8. He loved his dish, and the spiciness was intense, but delicious - aka not just spicy for the sake of spice. My curry was amazing, and the tofu katsu was deliciously crunchy. I was so happy they had a vegetarian curry on the menu! I assume it was vegan, but I didn't think to verify.  We had only ever had japanese curry made from store-bought blocks, and this knocked it out of the park. When we're in Vegas again, we'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry with tofu katsu!

v-3xGGTVJlThMPjRigM5Qw.text: Having had curry in Japan, we we're craving it ( can't find it in Texas), found this place in Yelp and decided to give it a try.  It's a nice little place with resly nice service. The food was good. My only complaint is that l ordered a spice level 6 expecting it to be fairly spicy and there was absolutely no spice( my kids thought so also)

2jIaxhPGcVpNO1uGJyZbfg.text: I love going to Chinatown when I'm in Vegas. Better food than on the strip and for a better price.  I had the fried tofu and vegetables with curry, spice level 5. I love spicy food, and that was spicy but not too bad. They also let you choose between white and brown rice. It was so good, I scarfed down my whole plate, and I was stuffed :) Could've easily made it two meals.

Qfsd2TgAnqdYngq2y0hogw.text: I've been dining here for quite some time now and Curry Zen has sustained their quality, service and efforts! From the moment I stepped into this establishment, I felt authenticity. Some may say that there's simply nothing too special about it but hey, that's your opinion. For the rest of us who do enjoy the simplicity of this place, we think of something more. To me, personally, I find comfort here.   With excellent food comes an excellent workforce. These two elements come hand in hand to produce the overall business and Curry Zen, I would like to give you guys a round of applause. You guys are the bridge to the production of these beautifully crafted dishes.  One more thing to add on to that, the prices are affordable! So technically, not only do you get good food, you don't break the bank either!   Overall, I encourage you first timers to have a go at this place, it definitely will not disappoint and is worth trying out. And to the rest of us who's been dining here for some time now, we all know why we keep coming back.  Nice touch on the new updated menu by the way.

uaprRicA_VV5gUkX9T-ytA.text: Always packed and although parking can be a challenge it's definitely worth it. I recommend the chicken katsu with cheese and added potatoes, spicy level for me a 10 was hot but not inedible.

uO9bZuKm9aLgKOLMWsow4w.text: For one, the space is so tiny and uncomfortable. If there is a wait you have no choice but to wait outside because there is literally no space to wait inside. The curry is just OK. I love curry, I make curry and I order it all the time. I was really expecting alot I guess after reading the reviews. I got katsu curry which was good but with barely any chicken. The curry sauce is pretty spicy and I only got a level 3 so be careful if you're sensitive to heat. The service was great and I have no complaints there. They also do not have fountain drinks, so if you want soda you are limited to whatever cans they have available. Over all, I don't think I will be back.

xp0Jv1KAATPd6ncaPcwvlQ.text: The taste was good but the amount of meat was so little. I literally counted 6 small pieces.

txO-dSBaW-IR43ArMBwJ0g.text: If you have visited or lived in Japan, like me, you fall in love with Japanese curry.  Similar to CoCos, you can select your spice level, toppings, rice amount, etc., but this restaurant's quality far exceeds that of the "fast food" curry of CoCos.  Their sides like takoyaki are also amazing.  Be sure to add the radish and scallion pickles to your meal.  The scallions reminded me of my mother in-law's huge jar that I could never get enough of.  Best of all, the service here is family like and will keep you coming back.

0B00hZ70npoU_uyn5ryFYA.text: One of the best curry place i have ever eaten, my family came here pretty much every week, sometimes twice a week, the side dish like tofu salad and tako yaki are bomb, toping with corn and chesse make the curry taste more ever better. The only thing I am dislike is that they took off one of the dish call curry puff cake, i believe, and it was so good but some how they took it off the menu. Their customer service is great every-time we visit. We will be back for sure again this week

After paying our check, the male waiter (only one male) suggested for us to vacate as people are waiting outside. We just got done eating, was still drinking my tea. That was very rude. KfQF7u-GAc6KjmE2nhll_g.text: This is really authentic Japanese curry. I got the spinach curry with chicken katsu and it was incredible. Definitely the place to try if you're craving some curry!

P_p1FmCg68r2gCZ0FVrm8g.text: Overall: Japanese Curry Zen cooks up good curry, but it's lacking in terms of toppings.  Food: 3  Pork Katsu Curry: The curry had good flavors. The katsu was juicy, but it was a little too oily. My biggest gripe is that the curry doesn't come with pickles, which is a necessity for Japanese curry. I think they charge extra for it, but that just seems stingy.  Service: 4  Our waitress was nice and patient with such a large group. She did a great job taking everyone's order, especially when there are so many specifications in a single dish with Japanese curry.  Note that the bill can only be split 4 ways, so plan accordingly if you have a large group!  Ambiance: 4  The restaurant seems fairly small, but it has a decent amount of seating. And, unlike many other Japanese restaurants, can seat a larger group easily. Parking is a little difficult because the plaza has several busy shops, but it shouldn't take too long to find a spot.

PClR_pEPC4d4T6jTnePEgQ.text: Sooo good! There's so many choices you can choose from. If you don't see any of the preselected menu, you can just build your own plate. It's also vegetarian friendly! Can't wait to come back to Vegas and visit this place Again!
