a9Qu5kqv9DZwS9Gz2AP-rQ.text: Our favorite Ramen joint (montas) was closed so we ventured into JCZ...  good call fellas!!!  Had the pork katsu curry @ level 3... added a fried egg and a croquet... da Bomb!!!  P2P was - On Point  Left there not stuffed but perfectly satisfied.  Now we know if the line is too long at Monta's we'll drop right in on the Zen.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almost forgot to take a pic before I devoured my plate...
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ssp2wfqia-tYBoUwrQLhJg.text: I've passed by this place several times but finally was able to try this place out after being recommended by my cousin. We all went for a late dinner around 9:30pm on a Saturday and luckily the place had several open tables for our group of 8.  Service is outstanding, the waitresses were very friendly and quick. So we got the Pork Katsu Curry, Chicken Katsu Curry, some takoyaki, and kaarage chicken. So for the curry, our cousins usually got spicy level 5, so I went along with that and my brother, guess he felt a little spice challenge so he got level 7.  The takoyaki was so-so but the kaarage chicken was pretty good. I believe they were both around $4.50. The portions for the chicken were slightly disappointing though. So first of all, the katsu was on point, loved both the chicken and pork, but recommend pork more. The curry though lacked a bit of flavor, just mediocre. It could be because of the spice but anyways it wasn't the best of curries I've tried. So for spiciness for the curry, level 5 spiciness was ok I guess but may be a bit too spicy for most people. I felt a little burn in my chest after my meal, but it wasn't too bad. I would recommend level 3 or maybe even 4 for new people. And as you can guess my brother did not expect that level of spice, but he said he still enjoyed it. Although he also did say his curry tasted like Taco Bell's hot sauce haha. So basically once spice level goes over 5, it'll probably taste more like hot sauce than curry sauce.  Portions were reasonable for the price and taste I think. Overall, not sure if I'll be back but it was an ok meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry

iB-3sUfquNC31cWAc372zA.text: This place can do no wrong   Been here a couple times and despite the small setup, never really had to wait unlike the surround choices.  The service is always quick and the food of course is what keeps me & my boyfriend coming back.   Always order the chicken katsu with cheese (you have to ask for chopsticks) but they are good with making sure you have water in case you're still trying to determine which spice level is best for you.   The menu indicates a 1-10 based spice level, but trust me, you can go beyond that. They charge extra on 5 range increment. So if you're thinking of going for an 11, it'll cost you the same to get a 15.   I'll try it next time I'm here, but they have Kirin beer!  The food honestly doesn't look like much when the bring it out to you, but it's the perfect amount. The chicken is always fresh and nothing ever tastes old :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9hT7Ps8OeykR2ZNCoMcYzw.text: If my mom were to make curry very often when I was little, this beef curry, I'd imagine, would be my 'comfort' food LOL.  Hubby loves curry so we thought, hey, there is a curry joint, let's try it... spur of the moment thing and it was surprisingly yummy.  We ordered a beef curry, added an egg and corn and we also ordered katsu don.  Ok, curry is not my go-to food.  I ordered the katsu don because of that.  One taste of the curry, I immediately regretted my decision.  Not that their katsu don was bad, but it's because their curry is that good.  We even only ordered a level "3" spice.  And that was perfect for us.  A small kick but not stealing the flavor.  It packed so much flavor and the beef was so tender, I wish we could stay in Vegas longer so I can have another meal here.  I also love how cute the place was.  The servers were all very friendly and it has that 'home' feel.  Parking is a bit nasty though....

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Don.  Delicious but I&#39;d rather have the curry...
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum yum yum!  Beef curry with egg and corn.

CEOJs_euw7Rj1dN6FI4QYA.text: I haven't had a bad plate from them ever and I always get the same dish so i am able to comment on how consistent they are at putting out the same quality of food, every time. The staff are always friendly and this goes for every location that I have visited. Give this place a try.. it's a perfect balance of food for price with everything tasting good at the same time-

Yy9cEEcyxfIBZWHl4wxs8g.text: Japanese curry is one of my favorite comfort foods, perfect for rain or shine and any time of the day. I haven't been here in so long yet the curry here still tastes the same. My face lit up with the first bite. It's hard not to smile when the curry is so rich and thick and flavorful.   I like my curry simple with just a chicken or pork cutlet. I prefer the pork to the chicken although both are really good. The panko crust is my favorite part and I love how it stands up to the curry even until the last bite. Perfect curry to rice ratio. Great prices but sizes are just a tad small. I scraped the plate clean and left wishing I had more!

sQEku6Ok2WOFm9UjplIlRg.text: Craving satisfied. I ordered: fried gyoza, Takoyaki, and Karaage. While my companions ordered 3 different curry: beef curry, pork tender curry (both were level 1 ) and then a level 8 of spiciness on curry udon. We were all satisfied with the food. Not 5 stars because the restaurant is a little but small, it would be nice if it was a little bit spacious or Japanese like theme.

X8iDlXmMHqeKZ3YiJVL6Ew.text: THE BEST I'VE HAD!! Takiyaki balls and curry katsu with cheese and sausages. 'Nuff said! Vegas isn't all about the buffets anymore. The best restaurants are off strip, and this one is a must eat! I hate to see the line gets longer, but I have say this is one of the best foods I've had. My friends and I went there years ago. I took my parents there. I took my fiancee there. Then I returned with my fiancee and my friends. Would I go again? Yes, I'll make sure to go here whenever I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-ryCTJ8Qw6cHwmx8giYU0A.text: Very delicious place even the curry zen express! I always go for curry vegetable, maybe medium spice level, and curry udon!! Best curry udon ever!!! Tried so many other curry udon and it always fails! But not this place! Price is pretty decent as well! :)

crbeWydpBvjX6NfP0Y1Zeg.text: So I'm here once a week. The curry is a velvety delicious love letter to Japan. I love the food here but honestly there is some slipping that occurs. The meatloaf is delicious but it's never consistent. Spicy levels have the same issue. One day a six will make you cry and others a ten taste like it's a two. It drives me bonkers but at the end of the day it's just too good. If you haven't had Japanese curry you won't be disappointed. I'll leave this one short and sweet. As always happy hunting.

zTrpbe2qd0lWeWDSM8MIeg.text: The name says it all... It is Japanese curry at it's finest hence the zen as the ingredients are perfectly cooked and it will put you in a peaceful state of awwwww!    For staters we like their fried gyoza (5 pieces $4.50). Tako yaki (5 pieces $4.50).   My favorite curry is the chicken katsu curry level 3 ($9.95). Nice juicy tender chicken katsu and their famous curry is the winner. Do you want beef?  Then try the beef curry which also nice and tender beef chunks ($11.20).   Only thing I have to warn you about is that you ask who is the cook. I say this as you can choose your spice level from level one to ten. But if it's a Thai cook, it will be really hot. Yes people that I know who really do like hot said oh my. So you might want to ask who the cook is and choose your level of spice from there. My friend got a negative two. I had to laugh but he can't handle spicy at all but he loves the taste as everyone that i brought here does.   Winding down from a hard day at work or just want an adult beverage?  They have Japanese beer and sake.  Yes they also have a variety of soft drinks too.   Another reason we like coming here is a awesome waitress named Tavia. We are bummed that she will be leaving here for another job. Very sad we won't be able to see her the next time we come.  Thank you Tavia for always taking care of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tavia and me.

U7O5qZ22IYxKJy2M3zUNcA.text: One of my friend and I came to Japanese curry Zen for the first time last night. Parking is a little hard and is located in the same shopping plaza as Raku, Big Wong etc. They offer a variety of curry dishes, with spice level. The restaurant is small and the place was busy. I felt the tables were too close, my only pet peeve.  I went with the Japanese Meat loaf curry. The portion was bigger than I thought and the meatloaf was done perfectly and well-seasoned. I ordered Medium spice level 3 and was glad I could feel the heat. Many curry places don't give enough rice, but the rice on my plate was definitely enough to soak up the curry. I ate about half and was able to save the rest for the next day! Also the service was friendly.  Overall, we had a solid meal here and would come back whenever I'm craving curry.

ubQV2w5gpKawqvNs6nqH7A.text: Curry has 1-10 level of spicy. I think it is a great place to eat traditional Japanese curry. The service here is nice. You have many different choice of curry:beef,chicken,or vegetable. You can also combine with something else on the menu. It provide a small size and regular size of curry!Recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rsh-oWCkrCRGmFq8Kr_y-A.text: First time having Japanese curry and I was impressed. Ordered the pork katsu curry with a level 4 spice and it was delicious. Level 4 wasn't that spicy IMO and the pork was cooked to perfection. Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. Curry had a nice complex flavor from the various spices used in it. Service here was also good.   A great, cheap place for some authentic Japanese curry in Vegas! I'll definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu curry.

leK3brrjJUoQ3xlcbbqvNA.text: My office loves Curry Zen, so we're always ordering to go. It's fast, affordable, and filling. Service is always excellent whenever I walk in. Although my coworkers love their curry, I love their Katsu-Don and takoyaki. It's the perfect amount of rice and pork ratio. It's also not drenched in sauce and comes with pickled veggies. Perfect combination bowl that hits the spot. The takoyaki has good chunks of octopus, not like some places where you're searching for those little tentacles.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite Katsu-Don

gVMfTrBZcEKG5dZq5MhhDQ.text: Atmosphere: 4.5/5 A casual social ambience that is perfect for a late night munchies run if you want to catch up with an old friend. Zen Curry has a smaller interior compared to other restaurants. Because of its small interior, it can be hard to hear people when it gets busy. You can smell curry throughout the whole restaurant.   Quality/Quantity: 5/5 I always love going to Zen Curry for their chicken katsu curry with cheese and spice level 3/4. The quality of the food has exceptional flavor. The curry and chicken go hand in hand. When you combine it with rice, it's a perfect trio. The quantity of the food is reasonable for the size that is given. Bare in mind that you can also get the curry in a half size if you have a hard time finishing the original size.   Experience: 5/5 Hands down, my favorite Japanese curry spot in the city and my favorite quick stop to grab food. Servers are more attentive and respectful. They are willing to help you if you are not quite sure what to order. The food comes out quickly and the smell of the curry is just heavenly.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZV0zSPSNFTYeu-8ucR05ug.text: Japanese Curry Zen - Average check ~$13 - Japanese Curry is mainly served. Service is nice and the place looks ok in general. Food is good I guess cos I don't know how Japanese curry suppose to taste like. The portion is big so the price worth the dish (~$10 a dish). Overall experience 4 stars, recommend for who like Japanese Curry and katsu

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ruqnTU45nWinuPjpUfw33w.text: So, came here today in craving for curry pan.  I have looked high and low for great Japanese curry pan and I think I found it here.  The pan was almost as good as the one I get in Little Tokyo in LA.  I also like their croquette too, not greasy at all... delicious.  I also tried their pork katsu curry and the curry was excellent.  They have great customer service and now I have a place to get curry pan when I have the craving.  Come check this place out if you love curry.    Happy yelping xoxoxoxox

WAicE3U-kQBOj_1tkzyt1w.text: Currently obsessed with this place. So so so good. I get the chicken katsu curry and a level 2 spice (I'm weak). One thing I love is the chicken katsu tastes fresh. Unfortunately a lot of places will have chicken katsu and the pieces are hard or stiff. Zen's is very fresh. Their curry has great taste! Small place, but seating is available in a good time.

b2v2apO_DbVSxxRu3wIXxA.text: The food is absolutely amazing! Chicken katsu curry is simple, but so goooood. However, the service is a little cringing. The people themselves are nice, but the actual service time itself is just so long. The longest I've probably waited for a check was 10-15 minutes. I keep coming back for the food, but I'd usually prepare ahead of time if I have some other place to be after.

ywW4rMAJTkYwC-l2vbNFZQ.text: The curry was so good I got the vegetables curry. Yummy. Satified my craving and made me full too. The server was nice as well. I would so recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry

DFXxAh7X2JZAsIIz4Z9cGA.text: Great atmosphere and the food is good for anybody who is willing to try curry. The service is great. The curry isn't watered down like many places who serve curry. This place is just up the alley if you want a thick curry curry plate :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh yea

tRnuk0vIC_RZcNLJ_3YKZw.text: I have come here a few times now and I really like this place. The owner has always been here working the line and the staff is really nice. I have only done take out from here so far, but even as a take out customer, the staff still treats me like I am dining at there. They have me take a seat and ask me if I would like a glass of water while I wait.   The first couple of times I've been here I got the same thing. Original curry with pork katsu and kurobota sausage with corn. Recently I tried the 5 piece kushi and it was delicious. I also asked if I could get a couple of extra skewers of quail eggs and I could and I did!   I would like to try some of the other choices so I will definitely be back.

EpoLPHeToevDqXGNfJ7Qgw.text: Unbelievably simple, simply amazing. Don't let the simplicity fool you! I could not believe how moist the chicken katsu curry and how there was a good kick with spicy level 3.   Wine and beer available.

qI-ph4zEYpT1-Ru1cMmVMQ.text: Bomb. Good is always served timely, even for take out. Chicken and cheese is the way to go. In my opinion best Japanese Curry in Las Vegas. One week I had it 5 days in a row for Lunch at Planet Mazda.

e1KMJq0oHJLJtLf4-1kyJQ.text: I come to Curry Zen as often as possible - it is my go-to restaurant any time someone is visiting from out of town! I always get the chicken katsu with the normally-spiced curry, and it is positively blissful.   Though I am so in love with the chicken katsu that I have no desire to branch out, friends and family have gotten a variety of items from the menu, and always devour whatever they choose (with the solitary exception of the takoyaki, which, I think, was not quite what my friend thought it was).   I almost always get a Thai iced tea (delicious!), and have, on many occasions, barely been able to resist the temptation to order multiple servings of the chicken katsu, and eat nothing else for days! Like I said - bliss!

7uw_LKI02_reV_gl-aeRvA.text: Japanese Curry Zen. I've never eaten Japanese curry before, so I decided to try it for the first time at this highly-rated establishment. The photos of white rice and brown curry on plain white plates did not stimulate my appetite (slightly unappetizing looking), however, those 150 Yelpers before me could not all be wrong. For our late lunch, we shared a regular-size order of rice and curry (spice level 0) with the 5 piece Kushi Curry option. I'm not sure of the "right" way to eat curry, so I mixed together the rice and curry slurry and dug in. Mmm. Wow, it's really very yummy, a fantastic combination of spices. The skewers of fried goodies were all pretty good too. I really liked the potato croquette. It was something like mashed potatoes rolled in an egg mixture and coated with panko, then lovingly lowered it into the deep fryer. The panko-coated fried quail eggs were slightly rubbery and had a green-grey tinge around the yolk, but no biggie. Most people boil the heck out of eggs.   Yelp did me right. Thank you!  *Low prices  *Filling, low-brow tasty Asian fare *Nice service *Tiny hole in the wall with a few bar stools and (three?) small tables, so try to come at off-peak meal times. The tables seat four, so when a group of six came in, they stood in the middle of the restaurant and watched the two parties of two eat their food. Awkward! I wouldn't mind some breathing room to scarf down my lunch... :P

r6Yp4TXCgO_RHoJIThmN-A.text: Wow.  Just tried this place, very glad I did.  Great quality curry.  This is the closest I have found to the Coco Ichibanya Curry House in Hawaii since I left home.  Amazing.  At first we got there & it was nearly packed (lunch time).  Our waitress seemed rushed and didn't let me finish ordering my food, still polite though.  This didn't matter once the food came.  My husband and I were VERY impressed at the quality of Zen's curry.  Best in town. Hands down, no argument.    Unlike other curry places in town, like Kaba Curry:  They serve my favorite, deep fried oysters.  The tables have condiments for you to personalize your curry with, like raisins, almonds, katsu sauce, hot spice shaker, rakkyo, and especially fukujinsuke (pickled radish).  The way a Japanese curry restaurant should be.  The menu is simple, but you can play it up however you like.  Zen doesn't need a fancy menu to have superior food or fancy decor, unlike other curry places.  The owner himself is very nice and seems to always be hard at work in the back.  We plan on coming here from now on for our curry craving & plan on bringing more friends along on too!  Love it!

ivgsmC6fgLMW7vZnZU4awQ.text: Never mind the small location (which has since been renovated from the size of a broom closet to the size of the coat closet... Lol). It's all about that dreamy sauce. Put it on a shoe, I'd be tempted (only briefly), but ladle it on a piece of perfectly crisp and succulent chicken or pork and it's curry nirvana for me (Japanese kind, not any other kind). If I could I would eat here twice a week but I have to settle with once a week (when I can). Everyone who I've brought here (I myself was brought too) has since returned in the same week they went the first time. IT'S THAT GOOD

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I have to have this at least once a week. And I drive close to 30 miles for it too.

4_r1YvORtVqwgKHzapz6gg.text: Finding a decent Japanese curry restaurant is like finding a four-leaf clover.   It's like picking the winning numbers for the Powerball lottery. Playing the perfect hand of poker. Or finding jeans that don't ride up your crotch...  Japanese Curry Zen is good curry. All the more surprising cause it's in Las Vegas.  Run by real Japanese!  Eat their curry.  I recommend slathering it on their 16 grain rice.  Then let the waistband of your crotchless jeans loose.  Did I say that in public?

4USxnaBW_acSsPEo1HDSew.text: Basic, nothing special.  If you want more bang for your buck, just mosey on over to Greenland and pick up a pork cutlet and package of curry mix.  Make yourself the same thing -- either 4 days of food for yourself, or a curry party for your friends.  I'm not saying curry zen was bad...but seriously something easy to DIY.  But if you don't have the time, then Curry Zen is your spot.

1EkmjI4OWnEnHsPp8pby9Q.text: I love curry - Thai curry, Indian curry, Steph Curry (see? I don't discriminate), and in this case, Japanese curry.  Japanese Curry Zen's namesake is made with 15 different spices.  Little containers of almonds and raisins are also at every table to sprinkle into your curry for even more enhanced flavor (I gave both the almonds and raisins a whirl.  While I preferred my curry sans these additions, I did appreciate the new flavor profiles - crunchy texture from the almonds and a subtle sweetness from the raisins).  My katsu was perfectly crisp on the outside and moist on the inside. I also went for level 6 (out of 10) on spicy, but the heat wasn't very strong.  Definitely a Vegas must worth venturing off the strip for.

7S7JLNObeo1KZoXGIx0wrQ.text: I am not much of a curry person, but my friend wanted to go here so I agreed. It was pretty good. The small size was still pretty good sized hehe. I came like a couple years ago when it was just this tiny little place, but they have extended it and the decoration is awesome. The service was great! Rui was so nice and helped me pick a dish because I was so unsure. I will come back to try the tako yaki :)

pIE8X5iRdjyhoeM7n9gsFw.text: This is the best place to get Japanese curry, the few times I have eaten here it was outstanding I have only tried the chicken Katsu Curry. The restaurant is small and drafty but who cares when you have curry this good. the plaza is cramped and hard to find parking on weekends and evenings so go early to find a spot.

WDumKoItyxMP_O77KJLXWA.text: Japanese Curry Zen was a pleasant surprise for my group and I on our last trip to Vegas.  My group has come to the conclusion that they add crack to their curry sauce.  The first bite is nice and flavorful; however, as you continue downing your meal, you find yourself becoming more and more addicted with each bite!  It doesn't really matter what meat/vegetables you order; it is definitely the curry sauce that makes the meal here.  Thinking about the curry right now while writing this review is making me want to go back to Vegas just to have some more of it. Yum!  Note: Their curry spice levels are pretty spicy in general; two people in our party ordered level 3 (out of 10), and they already thought that was pretty spicy.  I ordered a 5 and was sweating quite a bit by the end of my meal as well.  Another note:  The place is pretty darn small, so don't be surprised if you end up needing to wait a little bit to get a seat!

3gyLmAV2QIZBpkZBX6w0yQ.text: God damn, this Chef makes a mean curry! and I mean, MEAN. Now I've had my fair share of Japanese curry and as a lover of True spicy food, I know that even a level 10 at your average Japanese curry house is not going to get the job done, but not at Curry Zen, no no my friend. This Chef is serious, if you order a 10, you're gonna feel it, and it's gonna feel good :)  Since I'm not a big rice eater, I loved that I could add veggies and spinach to my curry. I didn't have to waste precious stomach space on starches, woohoo. The pork katsu was cooked to perfection, not too chewy and krispy just right. Prices were reasonable and the service was lovely. No line for a late lunch on a hot Sunday. 5-stars all around!

PYjJ9Ip7R5UF2HVpXluq-g.text: Delicious Japanese curry that definitely hits the spot. You really can't go wrong no matter what kind of curry you choose and the great thing is its so customizable!   They have different spice levels for the curry as well. I got level 5 spice and it was a bearable medium spiciness. If you like eating flaming hot cheetos (my reference for tolerable spiciness level lol), you could probably go a little spicier.  Get cheese in your curry and you won't regret it! They even have some tsukemono, all you have to do is ask for some!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie curry with tonkatsu, cheese, and corn
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu curry with sausage and cheese
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef curry with chicken katsu, cheese, and croquette

RjHvFgwbbjrGoww--P5Vrg.text: The best curry in Vegas. Their food is always delicious and fresh and it's at a great price.

5E3oU78c0Ot_K91LVHGgcQ.text: Cute small Japanese restaurant that's tucked away from the Las Vegas strip.  My friend and I came by one evening to have some curry.  My friend pointed out that the plaza had a few good restaurants and limited parking so there weren't any parking available when we arrived.  We ended parking on the street.    Service was rather quick.  I had the chicken curry with cheese and she had the pork curry with cheese.  Our food arrived within 10 minutes.    Food was delicious.  I have never had Japanese curry before so I can't compare it.  They provide a good portion of rice, lightly breaded and fried chicken with curry and cheese.  I thought it would be weird to have the cheese with the curry but it was actually tasty and all the ingredients meshed well together.  A great combination.    Service was awesome.  I'd return to this establishment to try more dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry with cheese.

DWEBS4vdoi6cP5C5Z8F7mg.text: Solid curry rice plate and very satisfying when hungry lol. Very customizable and I love that they offer brown and multi grain rice options! Half sizes also available which was perfect for me (half the amount of rice but same amount of protein!).   They have a 1-10 spicy level scale, a 1-2 is considered mild/medium. I assumed that 5 was going to be a typical "medium" spicy (where it has a lil kick...) until the server warned me that anything above 3 gets quite spicy. I went for the 4 and boy am I glad I did. It was a real kicker that got me sweaty. Lol I don't think I would have been able to handle it at 5-10. So you have been warned!  Overall, a great place for lunch and I'm glad I dropped by.

gOkxHPnEUTiSUMx09w1rDg.text: Super authentic Japanese curry, rivals Coco curry in Japan which is a chain store but they have the best curry. Pork katsu isn't as juicy as those ones in Japan but the curry itself is unbeatable.

MXdlK0ERq0E_Q7xVmAJICA.text: My boyfriend and I loved this place. So many of our friends have posted it on instagram and Snapchat, and we finally decided to give it a try. Usually when we go to places that are over-hyped we get disappointed, but this place exceeded expectations and lived up to its hype! The food was so good, we both loved it. Definitely a MUST TRY!  FYI, parking is a little tough in this complex!

3s4gML2ZfLkt7I-laOESQA.text: Woo-hoo! Best curry in Vegas! Me and my coworkers came here late one night after work and got seated right away. Got the chicken katsu curry spicy level 5 and it was perfection! It was just enough spicy for me to still enjoy the crunchy goodness of the katsu with my curry. Plus the portions were pretty hearty and all for a very affordable price. Service here was fast and attentive, even though it got busy. This place is definitely my go-to whenever I need to satisfy my curry fix.

MlSXyr5nzzUoJixLYhjwTQ.text: ***Yelp Challenge 2016 4/100***  No time to cook, look no further my Southwest folks! The chicken katsu is good and love the portions! I always get the spinach curry. The curry is EXCELLENTE'! I always call ahead before picking up the food. The curry pan is also awesome. Its a fried bread stuffed with curry. If you are looking for good fast Japanese curry in the SW side of Vegas, this is the spot.

JiR-1Loruuy5c3wbUwKSZA.text: There's a couple of new Japanese curry cafes that have opened up in the Chinatown area of Vegas.  I was bummed that Cafe de Japon had closed down a year ago, the curry experience was one of the best I'd ever had.  This small restaurant, located in the same shopping cul-de-sac as Kung Fu Tea and a questionable Massage parlor in Chinatown is very nice and the food is very good. They have daily specials which is on the board, today's listed special curry udon, pan fried or deep fried gyoza or shumai, and a fried oysters appetizer which looked tempting.    They had the standard Japanese curry menu with a decent amount of curry selections. I ordered the pork katsu curry, which was fairly priced at around $10, although I was tempted to order the tenderloin pork katsu. The pork katsu was really good, though nothing that exceptional and well breaded.  The curry was flavorful and sweet, though not overly.  You are able to order various levels of curry which range from .20+ depending on the level of spiciness on a scale of 1-10.  I ordered 5, which is actually pretty spicy and cost 40cents more.  If you're looking for a well rounded med spicy level, go with 3 or 4 instead.  Decent parking, good service.  Will get full especially during lunch as it's kind of small.  Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry

fh7TnC8hS6y3AdjAPWs0Mg.text: I go here pretty often. I always get the Tofu Katsu with brown rice, corn and cheese. The staffs are always very welcoming and patient with me. However the only problem is that I feel that the spice levels are not consistent. There is definitely a difference in spice levels every time I come here. Some days, a spice level 8 can be a baby spice to me while other days it can be a medium spice. The portioning however is definitely more than enough for me. I can never finish my curry!

K2DkAyDMXZjTpbdqvxURmQ.text: Japanese Cutlet Curry is one of my favorite foods on this entire planet earth ever since I could even utter the words !! (I want Curry!) out of my mouth. I require this stuff just to survive. When I first moved to Vegas a few years ago, I was going through some serious withdrawals, and then I found this place. I was relieved to find that this place does the job.  There are basically two types of curry that are standard in Japanese cooking. First, there is the roux (or however you spell that) over rice with some meat bits in it. Then there is the cutlet curry which is a big slice of whatever protein you chose on top of rice, covered with the roux. I always get some sort of cutlet curry because I don't see the point otherwise.  Now if you have one of those big "American" appetites, the standard serving isn't going to cut it for you. But fear not! There are plenty of add-ons you can choose as well as some good appetizers. Also, like any good curry place, there is a scale of spiciness from 0-10 I believe. 0 is pretty much non-existent. I usually go with 3 or 4 and my Korean friends think I'm weak. You start paying extra after 6. I think 10 would be suitable for someone like my mom who likes to take a big chunk of wasabi and eat it straight up before her meal just to cleanse her palate. If this is your first time, take it easy with the spice. There are also two rice types you can choose. The standard white rice, and the purple rice with beans. The purple rice is very healthy for you and it doesn't taste like shit so give it a try. Another cool trend that has been going on in Japan that this place also does is that they provide Tonkatsu sauce at your table for you to add on to your roux. It adds a very good flavor. I don't know why I always see people getting scared to try this. It's good. Just try it. Don't be vanilla.  Finally, the service is very good. Most of the workers actually speak Japanese and they know how to treat the customers well. That always makes me want to leave my money there. This joint isn't huge, and as everyone knows, this plaza can get mad crowded so do expect a wait during peak hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try adding the tonkatsu sauce on top of your dish. Very tasty!

PkDrDUcJfo-bMZ8DGQlC7w.text: I LOVED this place when I was living in Vegas! It was a relatively new find for me when I was in Vegas a couple of months ago. I've had the chicken katsu which was DELICIOUS. The katsu was breaded very lightly and it didn't feel too heavy. The rice was perfectly steamed. The curry was rich and creamy. The rice to curry ratio is perfection. I always finished my dish without any rice or curry to spare.  Spicy level 3 was already a good kick for me -- my spice tolerance is pretty low.   I also tried the veggie curry which was perfect for me that day. I was feeling sick that time and the veggie dish was so hearty.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu. Soooo good!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie curry dish. I loved it!

01IXr_yF9ESKgzCh6DQVuA.text: We came here as we wanted a change of atmosphere from all the restaurants on The Strip. I had two other people in my group and between us we tried the chicken katsu curry, pork katsu curry, Japanese meatloaf curry, and the curry udon. The curry was basic, but cooked well. The sauce was flavorful and the katsu was piping hot!   As good as the curry rice dishes were, the curry udon unanimously was our favorite. Broth and noodles were on point!   You can pick the spicy level on all of the curry dishes. I don't normally do too spicy, just a mild kick and level 3 was perfect for me. The waitress said most people go with a 5 or 6, but it goes all the way to 10!

-r4EG8JQAYKfcvHZDdPYAA.text: I love the food here BUT the manager named Uta was EXTREMELY RUDE. I complained that my chicken was undercooked and was extremely hard to cut and he came over and ate a piece of chicken out of my plate and said "it's fine to me" and didn't want to help me out. What manager eats out of a customers plate to prove them wrong?! That was disgusting and so disrespectful. I've been coming here for three years, once a week so I know how my order should be and taste like. I never thought I would have to write a bad review about this place.

8uPKim897SNWanF0XKFYdQ.text: The curry is always on point when I come here! The service is a little slow but they staff is always nice .. The Curry Zen on rainbow is literally down the street from my house but I drive all the way to China Town just for this location.  I've gotten the chicken curry & pork curry which were both good. I also add cheese & corn to my curry. The gyoza & shumai are my favorite sides as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jnz5BjJZSUs9s_IogSr3wg.text: Was looking forward to eating here. We placed our name down and went to get something in the car. This waitress (nonasian) crossed our name out and refused to seat us. She told us we had to wait at the end again when we waited for over 30 minutes. Decided to just leave and eat somewhere else. Worse experience ever.

lSTUrdh8g4RKrGoHT8grhw.text: Curry Zen has become one of my comfort foods.  Some people crave soup on a cold, rainy day; I crave Curry Zen.   The depth of flavor the curry base has is phenomenal! It has the perfect consistency, it's not too thick or runny.  I asked for a spice level of 2 and I could feel the spice in the back of my throat, but it did not overpower the taste of the curry. I've been cutting carbs out lately so I avoid rice when I can, but this is one of the places that is the exception. I can't stop eating, it's just too good!   Ordering is simple. You get to pick your rice/size, choice of meat, and toppings (I like to add cheese).  They also offer additional spices, pickled onions, radish, almonds, and raisins. I add in the hot powder, pickled onions, and radish to give it that extra kick. It sends my taste buds over the top!  The service is great here! I was driving around the area with my dog and decided to get some to go. It was 11:15 AM and I didn't realize they open at 11:30, but they happily took my order and said that it would be ready by 11:30 since they're just waiting for the rice to cook. I sat in my car and at 11:30 sharp, the server came out to give me the food. I couldn't wait to eat it, so I had a go at it in my car. To my surprise, the owner came out and said hi to me & my dog and asked how I liked it.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small curry + croquette, cheese, and corn

46SYw49ifSjx7lst1hAfmg.text: Pretty good, we ordered chicken katsu curry with potato croquette (they say "cro-que" but that sounds like the lawn game), takoyaki, and iced Thai teas and added a level 8  extra curry sauce.    Tako Yaki - fried octopus & seaweed, mayo and tonkatsu sauce - not for typical Western palates nor those who don't like squishy hot fishy seaweed taste.   The curry is good. There are extra powdered spices at the table, cayenne and masala curry.   Service is excellent the 2 times we went there. We were seated immediately. Drink orders we taken and filled fast.   My Japanese college roommates loved coming to Las Vegas because there was real and typical Japanese food made by Japanese chefs. This is one of those places.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Price was ok
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tako Yaki - fried octopus &amp; seaweed, mayo and tonkatsu sauce - not for typical Western palates squishy hot fishy octopus

V2PCWJKnyFaV0T9GmFqGhQ.text: This place is decently sized and clean. The couple of times I went, it was busy, but we didn't have to wait that long to be seated (a party of 4). Customer service was friendly, quick, and accommodating.  The setting is casual, nice to hang out and chat with friends.   There's a good selection of starters and sides. The fried shumai was tasty,  served with a little shredded cabbage and spicy mustard, if a bit on the pricy side (6 for about $4). I guess the main attraction would be the curry itself. I liked the sauce overall.  It was flavorful with a good consistency, not to runny or thick.  I thought the spice was a little lacking, though.  I'm someone who usually orders the spiciest I can,  and the 10/10 (which they charge extra for) had just a little kick for me. Lots of variety in the accompaniments.  I recommend the kushi 5pc and pork cutlet mmmm fried foods!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kushi curry. Delicious! I loved the quail egg kushi.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried shumai, kurobuta curry with meatloaf.  Yummy,  but 10/10 spiciness felt more like a 7/10 haha.

ReqihqMHG2kFkSXcA9xwiQ.text: Time and time again, Curry Zen delivers the best tasting curry and perfectly prepared and cooked pork and croquette.  The tofu salad has amazing tasting dressing (sesame) and the lettuce and ingredients come out ice cold and crispy.  Absolutely love the sound of the crunch of fresh, cold iceberg lettuce.  Easing over to Kung Fu Tea, in the same center for boba to fight the heat and spice.

KA728BCwNlMQOwpHifJC5A.text: Funny thing about this place is that I didn't even mean to come here! It's location is in Chinatown and it's surrounded by a few other restaurants. My boyfriend and I came into this area for some ramen, and saw a big sign for this curry spot.  What'daya know...we came to check it out. I do not lie when I say I'm curry-obsessed!!!! Lately I haven't been able to eat it because of personal reasons. BUT...I do not regret coming in Japanese Curry Zen not one bit!  I ordered the katsu curry with brown rice and veggies on the side. My boyfriend ordered the Katsu curry with a spice level 7. The cool thing about this place is that you can customize the spice level, and add on extra spices (such as turmeric, cumin, oregano, etc) depending on your liking. Cool right?! I've never even heard of such a thing!!   Service- it was fast and convenient. They were pretty busy when we came to eat, so I say come around the afternoon. Probably after lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Katsu curry with no spice, mixed with veggies
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu curry with white rice; spice level 7

weeaadDklFNua66ImffvRQ.text: You can't go wrong with a build your own curry with toppings, rice, and spice level.   FOOD The dish consists of rice, curry sauce, and options for different spice levels, proteins, and toppings. Super simple yet so delicious! I always order chicken katsu, croquette, and deep fried shrimps with a level 3 sauce. They also have side dishes, including my favorites: takoyaki, karaage, fried oysters, fried gyoza, and curry udon.   OVERALL The price to portion size is fair, the service is quick (even though there's usually a 10-15 minute wait to be seated), and the Japanese curry sauce is very flavorful.

iME_ZWFsbjcQC3C_X_cqlg.text: Delicious! We usually call and do a take out order and wait time is no more than 15-20 mins every time. Staff is amazing. The food is delicious & such a great price.

9znxW7zyzn2Y-hedSFZ9nw.text: I feel that I will always be a frequent visitor for Curry Zen, even if they raise their prices on their menu. You can't really go wrong with any of the items. I normally go with either chicken katsu or beef with spinach and croquette. You can't really go wrong with any of the proteins, they're all so good! Croquette is very tasty, it is pretty much a fried, breadcrumbed mashed potato with some vegetables. Make sure to also ask for some Daikon/pickled radish as it sort of refreshes your palette.    Adding spinach makes the curry a lot thicker so if you would rather have a runnier curry that makes the ratio equal.. I would either recommend getting extra curry or omit the spinach.  As for appetizers, make sure to get the Takoyaki! It is a must-have every time I visit Curry Zen. Can never go wrong with it.

KuWcFzzZom7WJ7rxLUSRTw.text: Great curry! Loved that you can have Japanese curry in Vegas. Never thought I'd venture out of the strip but it is totally worth the annoying drive down the LV Boulevard to Chinatown for good eats. They do fried stuff right. My Tonkatsu curry was fried well and still not tough to eat. They offer different levels of spiciness (from 1 to 100). I've had the level 5 - thought it was spicy enough! My hubs had level 10 yet he didn't feel the heat.  Service was prompt & friendly. The kaki fry was yummy~ takoyaki is standard. So grab a cold draft and enjoy the fried goods and some tasty curry!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu curry

UX6tY0OahYMCXaY3N-Bbaw.text: 2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge 70/100  My Hawai'i friends were in town and this is their fave place for Japanese Curry in Vegas! It was my first time here, I'm not usually a fan of curry (had a bad experience) but when I tried Curry Zen it was onoliscious and I surprisingly, cleaned my plate!   I got the curry with spinach and scrambled eggs and brown rice. It comes with a few slices of tomato as well. The curry for this plate is a darker color than the usual brown that's served with the other curry plates. I'm keeping it healthy these days, so I'm glad I saw this vegetarian option on the menu! I enjoyed it and like I said I cleaned off all the curry on my plate. It was flavorful. The brown rice was cooked well too and went well with the spinach and curry.   I also appreciated the health benefits of spices in their curry, listed on their menu.  And they use a vegetable broth for their curry. I wish I had seen the mixed multi grain rice, I would've ordered that instead of the brown rice.   Had the fried gyoza as well, and it was just okay. I've had better, but nothing bad about this one.   5 star friendly service here. Kind, friendly and welcoming Japanese servers. Our server was awesome. It's a small restaurant, able to fit maybe 30 patrons at most, so there may be a wait. We went during lunch time and it was busy. They also serve Japanese beer, sake and wine, so you can get your drink on.   Next time I'm here, I'm looking forward to trying the curry pan, mixed grain rice, and other fried options.

AnLUCT7kzEelJbv13DThHg.text: one of my favorite places but unfortunately i have to give them 1 starz When i dont see the owner the restaurant become a mess, on my last visi we order tofu katsy and the tofu had bad taste like expired product, the rice was overcooked. When i ask server to chamge it she gave me attitude and loooked at my like im stupid and dont know anything about food. Trust me i was coming this place for last 5 years amd i know hot this dish have to taste. I hope the owner will see this review and do something.

KXkNwdVgkkpDRNWKgi7qrQ.text: Not sure spicy level 10 is worth it. It's not overly hot at all but it doesn't feel like a 10. Might as well just get a level 3.   Got spinach and eggs and meatloaf. Tasty dish. If you're thinking of trying it, try it. Like a healthyish Loco moco. $14.55 with spicy level 9

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and eggs and meatloaf. $14.55 the add ons add up. tasty dish though

b0fMJagBzMcnjCwnYqaHhA.text: Talk about surpassing expectations. While the dishes look quite plain, the flavor of the curry was simply amaZEN.  Takoyaki -- 6 deliciously crispy balls filled with firm octopus. The batter was perfectly crispy with just the right amount of tenkasu filling. There were tons of bonito shavings on top to give it that extra seafood flavor.  Pork Katsu -- Dark brown curry, mild in taste with just a hint of sweetness. They have custom spice levels 1-10 and to be safe per the waiter's suggestion, I stuck with level 5. Their pork cuts are thin and tender, with a satisfyingly thin layer of crust.   As one who grew up with Curry House, this place blows them out of the water. Their curry is much thicker with much more depth of flavor. If you're looking for warm comfort food, keep this place in mind!

1yMEOTELRjtY8Nim576tjg.text: Used to love coming here. Came late night once and ordered 2 plates of Pork katsu curry to go. We added Corn and cheese. Once we got home (South Henderson) opened up to a plate of rice, curry sauce, and the addons.  So we didn't end up eating anything that night.  Came back the next day to resolve the issue because it seems a little unfair that we didn't receive what we ordered. Apparently the server that night only charged us for curry sauce and the add ons. Doesn't really make any sense as to why we would order just that. & she even actually repeated the order to us, at the table..  So who ever was in charge the next day, didn't help either.   Kinda sucks bcuz this place was pretty cool.

I0VHEDhL4UQBWf5tRM1w1w.text: The best curry in town don't need to go nowhere else this is the spot I've tried them all and there is no better

m6hNuROeAeBURq9_THUTKg.text: The owner's son is a jerk. Told him that the rice was luke warm. Told the waitress we wanted the rice very hot. Didn't happen.   Told the son he's about to get a very bad yelp rating and just shrugged his shoulders.   This is a shame. Don't expert rude service. Got it. Get it!  Great place for lukewarm and not made to order fried items.   Bad attitude, poor service, lukewarm rice; leftover fried shrimps,  makes for a 2 star performance. I hope your father reads this.   Try visiting when the father is around. He actually is very customer oriented.

AkbGvU15T2HlvKts9J8cDw.text: We arrived on a Tuesday night about 8pm and there was no wait and probably about three tables available. Small, quint restaurant.   The menu is pretty simple. I chose the katsu chicken curry with spinach and it was super yummy! We also ordered the takoyaki appetizer which my friend and I both enjoyed.   I only deduct one star because we received our entrees before our appetizer that I actually almost forgot about until my friend mentioned something.

fByTtOaQbUNgCIy83ZwFQw.text: A must go place for me every time I'm in Vegas. Food is great in big portion and the service is excellent, never get disappointed at Curry Zen. I really like the fried oyster, also I would recommend the curry udon and the curry chicken katsu with cheese. Their curry is amazing at all time! Only compliant is the parking, it's in a small plaza with many other restaurants and boba places, it's a bit difficult to find parking here. So come early!!

DWORR_2Ku7bOTvJQ72T1LA.text: This little hidden spot gets passed over a lot since it's in the same shopping plaza with some off-strip heavy hitters like Monta Ramen, Raku, Raku Sweets, and Kung Fu Tea. I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally did. The Japanese curry is stick and creamy in texture but still getting that hint of spice (you can get it spicier if you want). I love the katsu toppings - I got chicken and a croquette. Both were crunchy and crispy on the outside but moist (and the chicken was tender) on the inside. I've never had spinach incorporated into my curry sauce but I really liked it (but I also really like spinach)! I don't think I can go back to just plane curry. Service was fast and friendly!

b-vXesr4G06QQw14BUG8kA.text: Very good! We love chicken katsu curry. The flavor of the curry was what we expected and can pick 1-10. We also ordered naan bread and cheese with the curry. Chicken was fresh and juicy. The rice was sticky and just made.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FlfzdvnhH62-01X5xN92Mg.text: I LOVE curry well to be more specific I love korean and Japanese curry. I've been here so many times and usually there's always a line but they seat you relatively quickly. I love that they have half-sizes here because it gives me a reason to order curry AND takoyaki. I always get the same thing (half size Japanese meatloaf and fried egg curry with red radish and takoyaki) and I've never left disappointed. The servers are also all really nice and most of the time always ask if everything is okay. I 100% recommend coming here if you've never been! Also, just gotta add the price PERFECT. Literally it's hard to eat out nowadays without being like RIP my wallet, but this place is reasonably priced!

7r2DjY0qApiStPBlxdHHlA.text: Creamy and packed with flavor...does that interests you?...Welcome to Japanese Curry Zen.  I was so surprised at my first bite of curry...SO GOOD!  Our family ordered Curry Pan and Fired Oysters to start things off. Curry Pan is like a giant fried dumpling with curry flavored vegetables inside. The oysters were crispy outside but still fresh ocean flavor with fresh oyster texture inside.   Next, we ordered the Curry Udon with side of a fried egg (spicy level 7), Vegetable Curry with Chicken Katsu and Brown Rice, and a side fried egg (spicy level 7), Chicken Katsu Curry with a side of Croquette on white rice (spicy level 1). They rate spicy level from 1 to 10, and they have curry powder and red pepper powder on every table to spice up yours if you like and they also have Sriracha Sauce available for the asking.   We shared all our dishes and loved every bite. Katsus was cooked crispy and tender inside and croquette was such a hit that we almost ordered another one but decided to save room for dessert.  Japanese Curry Zen has a very casual setting with prompt service...we were in and out in about 40 minutes.    I will go back in a heartbeat to Japanese Curry Zen with more excitement than I had for the first visit knowing how great their menus is.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Oysters
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Pan

sIGauSCr_lld57cBQu0Oxg.text: Been suffering from a cold the past few weeks. I ordered potato croquette curry via Postmates. Such delicious warming sauce! The spice was right and the flavor is memorable  would love to order again this time dine in! Thank you Curry Zen for listing all the spices you use on your website! I'm a fan!

13sGCtM6fzFOjyzXAg3KWA.text: This place is amazing. The food is so good and the portion size is great and I've been here a few different times and have be happy every time. I usually always do the create your own with the chicken katsu and mixed veggies with brown rice and spicy level at like a 5 or 6. Their chicken katsu is on point where it's the perfect amount of crispy in the outside and just plain yummy on the inside. The restaurant itself it a little on the small side but both times I went I didn't have to wait and would definitely recommend this place if you like curry!

QRXgHxMLwavNxYNQni4jWQ.text: I had chicken katsu curry and it tasted just like the curry in Japan. If I lived around here,  it would be one of my go to places!

GVXn958jfY6myF4ezo9D4w.text: I love curry! And this place doesn't look like much in presentation but nailed it on the head in flavor!  After reading the other reviews,  someone stated a 5 was as spicy as a 9, so I got the 5. Was it burning hot? No. But it was full of flavor. I think I'll try the 9 next time. Husby got a 1 and said after so many bites, the heat builds up and couldn't finish it. My 6 year old finished it for him.  So if you can't handle any bit of heat, stick with the mild flavor. My daughter ate the curry udon in the mild flavor. It came with onions, green onions and bits of chicken. She loved it but couldn't finish it since polishing off her dad's plate. The mild taste a bit sweet with ZERO spice and is very tasty.  The fried shumai also comes with a spicy mustard sauce, like the hot mustard from Chinese restaurants. I personally love shumai fried now.   We all enjoyed our meal.  Our service was polite even w/ the limited English our waiter spoke. I'll definitely be back when visiting LV again.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried shumai
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry udon

Z9SfLyklv7SB7M-3DvRc0g.text: My list of bests are quickly filling up...   Hands down, best curry ever! You can easily leave feeling satisfied and happy after spending less than $10. The curry is unlike anything I've ever had-- it's definitely thinner than other katsu curries I've tasted, but still packs in the flavor. I ordered the chicken katsu with a lower spice level (1-5), if you go beyond 6-10, it's a little extra. Ojiisan (grandpa), working his magic on every order.   Fast, delicious, friendly service. A MUST-VISIT if you've got that soft spot for katsu curry.

dNncgRywGlhbnTdNB5HfHQ.text: After visiting Okinawa, I developed an addiction to Coco Curry. This place is THE closest I've come to finding a CoCo's replacement. It still doesn't match up but you really can't get better in the states. The prices are reasonable and the service is good (not THE best, but good). 5 stars just because this is the best Japanese curry I've found out here so far.

LlvYSztgrluptEge45GPDA.text: So apparently this little strip mall called Seoul Plaza is the Asian Food mecca of Las Vegas...  There are no less than 5 outstanding restaurants in this mall according to Yelp - the already famous Raku; Kabuto which some claim is the best sushi in town; the unique-in-Vegas Trattoria Nakamura-Ya; Monta Ramen which had lines waiting to be seated; Big Wong's representing Asian street food culture, and the little gem that is Japanese Curry Zen.  I guess jury is still out on Chung Gi Wa, a Korean restaurant that translates to Blue Roof, since I can't find a Yelp review on it.  We were really looking for a donkatsu place (can anyone suggest a good one in Vegas?), and found this place around the corner from where we were.  Not exactly a katsu joint, but we like curry so decided to give it a try.  4.5 stars on 270+ reviews can't be wrong, right?  Well, the only thing I'm wondering at this point is - what happened to the other .5 star?  Because honestly this is the best curry I've ever had.  I am quickly realizing that Vegas has L.A. beat when it comes to Japanese food not named sushi.  Only if Udon West (NYC joint with the absolute greatest gyu don ever)  came to the West...  Anyway, upon walk-in you are greeted by practically everyone working there - including the older gentleman behind the counter who appears to be the owner-chef.  The all-male crew is super friendly, attentive, and speedy.  The decor is simple clean.  Domestic beer is $2.50.  Off to a good start.  We order a curry pan, a katsu curry and a shrimp curry.  Curry pan comes in literally 2 minutes, and it's piping hot (on a side note, I realized then that "pan" is Japanese for bread - which I should have guessed because "ppang" is Korean for bread...).  And this thing is AMAZING good.  Koreans call this croquette, but none that I've had in a Korean bakery comes anywhere close to this little piece of addiction.  I should have gotten 3 more of these and called it a day.  But then, I would have missed out on their equally amazing curry.  The curry dishes come 5 minutes later, and I'm initially a bit disappointed.  3 smallish pieces of fried shrimp with a lot of rice and curry sauce.  A smallish piece of donkatsu with a lot of rice and curry sauce.  No side dishes, veggies, nothing.  At $9.50 per, I was expecting Wako size I guess.  I force myself to recall that Curry House was $15, and this is not a bad deal.  A bite of the shrimp with rice on curry sauce and I'm convinced this is a good deal.  Perfectly fried shrimp and pork with perfectly cooked rice smothered in the BEST curry sauce ever.  And 20 minutes after I've completely forgotten how small the meats were, I am full and fully satisfied.  One word of warning:  they have spicy scale of 1-10, and they recommend a 3 for those who like spicy food.  I would heed those recommendations!  So after a beer, bottle of water, appetizer and two main dishes, we get a bill for under $27.  Okay, this is a great deal.  We're coming back here over and over.  But in between, we'll have to resist the temptation and also try Raku, Kabuto, Monta, Nakamura-Ya, and Big Wong's.  Maybe Chung Gi Wa too.  Table-for-1 Factor:  There is a bar with half-dozen or so seats, behind which is where the cooking happens.  I think it's perfect for eating solo.

I0mbs_U8QnaI4FxgIqa-lQ.text: This is as close as you will get to Japanese Curry in Las Vegas.  It's good tasting, and a good value, but it's nowhere near the taste or quality I experienced in Japan.  My son, whom was stationed in the Navy in Japan, did like it, and my other son, who accompanied me to Japan, said it was okay, but agreed with me that it was nowhere as good as what we ate in Japan.  Place is decent, help is very friendly, and as I said before, food is decent and certainly a very fair price.   My only complaint was; it's a busy center and parking is at a premium.   I might go back there for a light dinner, but I doubt I will get addicted to this place.

QQ8e3F39UgxHByJX2elhBw.text: Good meals for a good price. Service is good minus a couple errors I had. Atmosphere is small and can get loud easily. Seating is limited in a small area.  The curry is good, but I usually get a level 1 dish. The spicy levels seems like they differ. Sometimes a level 1 will feel like level 1, but sometimes feels like level 3 or 4. Portions are filling as well.  Service is good, minus a couple bad experiences. One time I asked for a croquette as a side like always (I never had japanese curry without a croquette. EVER.) And the waiter asked "croquette? Coke?" I replied "no, croquette" and pointed at the croquette on the menu we then extended the whole croquette/ coke thing for 30 seconds more and reached an agreement of croquette. He then came back with a coke. I sent it back and got my croquette. Another time some waiter was being extremely cool and hip with it. He got my order wrong a few times, but im sure he was just having an unlucky time with me since the other people there didnt have any problems it seemed.  Environment is puny and if its full, youre probably gonna have to wait outside until one is available. It also gets loud easily with such dense seating.  Pros: good place to grab curry, carry (or curry lmao im killin myself here) out is available, nice portions.  Cons: seating is limited, gets loud easily, and inconsistent spicy levels  Advice: if seating is limited, you can get carry out. Top this place off with Kung Fu Tea, its perfect. Get croquettes as a side.

YFJdrXY2llG6JCjk6BWpYw.text: Ordered tofu salad for appetizer - very few tofu in it Lol and it tastes just fine - 3 stars. Curry with spicy level seven - 5 stars. Almost took the salad away when I was still on it - 1 star. Refused to let me use the wifi - 1 star.

0sCZhb6mECFaTEAyNODLLQ.text: I licked my plate clean! WHY can't the east coast have delicious places like this?! I got the pork katsu curry, level 3 and it was perfectly spicy and absolutely delicious.  Who knew that Japanese curry could be so scrumptious and spicy.  My boyfriend jokes about how he tried a level 8 before and couldn't even touch the food, but a level 3 was perfect and for comparison, it would be about a level 7-8 on a regular scale of hotness.  Anyways, can't wait to come back to Vegas and indulge.  GO try this place if you're in town!

7FcJf8HyiLpd6PJtD7v_wQ.text: The curry is pretty okay and the portions are also acceptable. The price may stack up pretty high if you like toppings and things in your curry other than just curry sauce.   They have ramune

bSwlxfNCvWD6S8c09yBC1Q.text: Quick Review: Tasty, home cooked curry flavor. Very simple dish, complete and friendly. Very mom & pop and not good for big parties. Tasty!  Pros: Solid curry, tasty, mom & pop feel  Cons: Very small venue, seats 15 people total maybe  This is a quaint place, very small though so if you aren't lucky enough to get here when its empty, then you'll expect to wait a while. The menu is very simple, easy to decide among a few dishes. They do curry and just curry and it's done well. Not amazing but very tasty. If you get a level 5 spice, that's just above comfortable for some of us who love spicy. Just a warning.  But there are essentially two tables for groups of 8, and a long "curry bar" that will seat another 8. So keep this in mind.  If you want to eat off strip and want comfort food, this is a great place to be.

5JPzau55XbQ0EDesCL_L6g.text: Very good japanese curry although had to order extra tofu katsu and corn for party of 2. The Takoyaki is fine not as good as Jinya. Service was great and you get to served pretty fast which is a plus for Japanese restaurants.

8mep0jiNEn90EkkrNwwEgw.text: always come here.  Ppl r nice and good food. Curry wudong with fried shrimp is the most comment meal.

DuY1y9c4BQ1KQnUEe5ztmQ.text: It's not my place . I tried lots of appetizers but I wouldn't go back again .It was very strange food and Tastes that I don't really like . The service was very good .

6aFv-_RcS3a0ROb8OAt5Eg.text: Honestly, I didn't know what to expect coming here. So this review is more that the food type just wasn't for me. There was too much of this fish taste that I don't like in general. I think though that the type of food represented here is really good, just not my thing.

f1mdjiKitNgrLyV3sEIdUg.text: The place is very small but the food is amazing, the service is nice and the food comes out QUICK. The Japanese curry is the best. It's better than anything I've ever had. You can make it as spicy as you want or not at all. It's great!!!!

EfR22IwvK9oTp8M7RuTgcg.text: This place is great for a quick bite. Honestly this entire little market has great food and service! I ordered the beef curry -for under $10 mind you!- and it came out in about 5 minutes. The curry was thick and quite tasty.   Only downside is that it doesn't come with any vegetables at all. Not sure if you can order extra but it would be nice if you could get that without added cost.

IB4NvH7aTSEqVni-76xQrA.text: It's so hard to find a good curry place in Vegas.  I'm glad someone mentioned this place to us. Curry is similar to Curry House back home. Service was great. Food was ono. A place we will return to for curry.

kzppWw_WyaUXWl6EUgbB0w.text: Oh sweet curry zen, I fell for you the first time my taste buds...ok never mind. The curry here is amazing! I simply can't get tired of it! 3 times in one month! And the best thing about it is that you can customize it! The staff here is incredible! Service is prompt! Food is delicious!

fAPujfdIlo7GaBbXSZgjOg.text: Very solid. Condiments like raisins, nuts, etc are no charge. Not sure my palate is sensitive enough to differentiate between different japanese curry places so it's hard to really rate. Cute waitresses though :)

Ax-C_HYJVMz0o-G_-p7e0Q.text: CruZEN down the street in my 6 4....Nah, Just playin'......(Watchu know 'bout NWA???)  But for reals, we were cruZEN Spring Mountain because a bunch of us were hella joneZEN for some ramen action at Koraku since it had just recently opened. We were all anxious and excited, but that night, it just waZENt gonna happen....They were closed. NOOOOOOO!!!!! We had to think of a plan B yet again.  I was thinking..."This iZENt happening...again!?!? Where do we go??? Sora? Big Wong? Raku? Monta? Then it hit me.....how about ZEN???? Yeah! J-Curry sounded like a great  plan B!!!  We were all in agreement and met up there...Now its usually always packed inside with less then a few doZEN tables, but when we peeked inside, I thought I was loZEN my mind....Not a single person inside!?!?! Great for us! We were greeted by who I assume was Mr. ZENbayashi and immediately got seated towards the back. To make sure we didn't miss out on any items, I made sure to ask our waiter right off the bat if they had some Curry Udon off the menu, and he later confirmed that it waZENt available.   I kept it simple this time and went with the Chicken Katsu Curry and  added cheese and corn. Combined with the complimentary toppings on the table, this made for another amaZEN meal with great friends. If you're looking for a spot to bring your parents, siblings or couZENs and they're in the mood for some currylicious action, look no further than ZEN.....The PERFECT reaZEN!!!   ALOHA!!!
