That was certainly enough to fill me up. The curry flavor was so full of flavor. I didn't add extra spice to it, and thankfully the curry wasn't spicy in the mouth at all. However, you can very well taste the herbs and spice in it. The croquette is certainly a recommendation. It has potato with vegetables inside, and it's fried.  Super yum. It has that nice outter crunch on the outside and a nice soft potato inside. I got to talk to the chef for a bit who was really friendly and helpful. He also recommended that I try mixing raisins and almonds in my rice. Apparently it's good for the digestive system. It's pretty good! However, I recommend you mix it with white rice. It doesn't taste as good with brown rice. The chicken was also very tender.   I'll definitely be back soon when I need to tend on my curry fix again!

BITW2b-yq29e8uXen311IQ.text: The Japanese curry gods have answered. Finally, there's a decent Japanese curry joint in town! Their menu is pretty small and simple. You order either a regular or half-size of white or brown rice with curry. Then you add accompaniments like tonkatsu, chicken katsu, potato croquette, and kurobuta sausage. I usually love a nice tonkatsu, but theirs is a bit dry and tough so I suggest going with the chicken katsu instead. Skip the miniscule salad . It's not worth the $1.50 price.

dhpW6x5U7cXoYVOerjJ4WA.text: Haven't been here since they first opened.... They have expanded the menu since then and finally added croquettes!! My favorite!!! Plus they have added a spinach curry and some katsu tofu for the vegetarian crowd.... Interesting.... I'll have to try it out next time ;)

NZrgU4KTanPRis2re0iyrw.text: Absolutely love curry and what makes this better is its Japanese curry! Totally reminds me of my grandmas cooking and its such a compfort feeling. The staff here are super friendly and quick service. The venue is a little small but that is the only downside. parking lot can get kinda full but people are always coming and going so your bound to find a stall if your patient. If the restaurant itself is packed and your willing to wait you wont be disappointed on the quality, price or service of this place. So if you enjoy a good japanese curry and rice, get here!!!

L0le_HXke1F_ZQdhyefV_w.text: Good service, great flavour, affordable prices... These things definitely lead to a great combination. I think next time I'll have to bring the boys along with me, and not keep the tasty stuff all to myself.

z_Vnv-u3tIZeeJydwmExEA.text: While the space is tiny, it's full of character and attitude. (In a good way.) The food is simple, fresh and delicious while the service is friendly and polite. It's such a great (and inexpensive) alternative to the myriad of chain restaurants offering bland and unimaginative food on the Las Vegas Strip as well as suburbs.  WARNING: Japanese Curry Zen is by no means going to transport you back to Japan, it does not offer an upscale dining experience, nor does it feature a famous chef. It will, however, delight you with a wonderful burst of flavors and simple authenticity. I'll definitely be back.

WyDbibvywpEcILhkkSNitQ.text: I ate here a week ago and can't wait to go back.  It is Japanese comfort food to me.  The restuarant is simple and to the point.  Every dish is served with rice, curry and a protein.  Most of the proteins are fried.  My favorite was the shrimp but also had the sausage and the chicken and liked them all.  I added the vegatables to my plate because I was looking for a little nutrition.   I wouldn't get the vegatables again as they were of the most boring, bland (possibly frozen from a bag) variety that could be found.  Very friendly service.

V071ilvXvRReLaB6anle4A.text: Had the beef curry with white rice and it was delicious. There are various levels of spices on the table as well as sliced almonds and raisins you can add. Also decided to try a curry pan, again very good. The staff is friendly. The prices are reasonable. Just be aware that it is a very small restaurant, so you may have to wait.

q2sy9cyVm7aKIG66g9dE5g.text: Japanese curry is REALLY different than Indian, and a lot of Americans aren't really familiar with its unique blend of spices. I have spent quite a bit of time in Japan, and my wife is from Kyoto. we loved this place! the owner was friendly and attentive, the food was as authentic as any we have had in Japan. the place is immaculate. try and get there early, because this place is going to be a hit.

NFqwYFomwlTZPWSwdJCi1A.text: By the far the best curry so far, that I've had. Compared to Kaba, this place has better food.

EI8fKHsWlrKr1-vdVghACQ.text: Best Japanese Curry in Vegas, and possibly in the US.  I have tried a lot of Japanese curry across the country, and nothing taste quite like the home made curry sauce at Curry Zen.  My personal favorite is the Kurobuta (sausage) curry with a side of croquette.

Jw28JwQVOk2a6J8QKLaIVA.text: The first time I came here, it was a full house at this tiny restaurant. There were also many people waiting outside, so we left and decided to come back another time. Our second visit happened around noon on a Friday. While we were driving here, I thought for sure it would be packed again. To my surprise, there were several open seats. I guess it was a great idea to come here on iPad Mini launch day!  As I mentioned, this place is very tiny. There are 18 seats available (yes, I actually counted, lol). Two tables that seats 4, one table that seats 2, and 8 seats at the bar. The menu is tiny as well, with only 6 toppings to choose from. I appreciate that they have brown rice and don't charge extra for it. Ordered my usual - Chicken Cutlet Curry. The curry was full of flavor and not too watery or salty. Portion size of the chicken cutlet was perfect and not too small.   Service was a bit slow. The place filled up eventually and there was only one server. We had to wait a while for our bill after our plates were taken away.   Simple menu, tasty, filling, and inexpensive. I'll be back for sure, but maybe for take-out since it is always crowded here. Hopefully they will open a second, bigger location in the future.   FYI - minimum credit card charge is $8.00.

YPdMUiQ8ooe8ZJOCaKWjEQ.text: HUGE portions, but huge with mediocre curry. Much saltier and greasier than expected. I wish the curry had more depth to it. It really tasted like a bulk of store-bought curry blocks.

wMM7d8I_FPAW5vdzOdyGSA.text: Got a chance to finally check this place out a few weeks ago and I wasn't that impressed. Not really sure what all the hype is about. The curry here is decent, better than most places, but nothing to rave about.    Like most others diners, I ordered the curry katsu which runs about $10. Each add-on (corn, egg, carrots, etc) is an $1 extra so it can get pricey if you prefer toppings in the curry. The katsu which is perfectly golden and crispy is the main selling point here. The curry on the other hand is just basic. Its simply a water downed brown sauce which explains why they charge for the toppings on the side. They also charge extra if you want spice up the curry but I did notice that their level 3 is probably a level 7 or 8 at most other places. There isn't a whole lot that sets this place apart from the other Japanese curry spots in the area. Thankfully they do serve beer and wine which is always a plus.   The restaurant itself is a small eatery located across the from Sweets Raku in the heart of Chinatown. The plaza gets busy so finding parking can be a pain. Service wasn't an issue, though its pretty obvious that English isn't anyone's first language here. There is a limited menu beyond their curry options but katsu curry appears to be the best seller by far.

1aNGQw703ZV9_btDj5xAhQ.text: Amazing Curry. Excellent price.  I had the chicken Katsu and vegetable Curry. Superb!  Warning: these guys are not messing around on the spicy levels. They go from 1 to 10. A level 4 is already blistering spicy. I made the mistake of ordering a 5 the first time I came. Then I went to a 3 the 2nd time and it was just right. Watch out... These guys make hellish spicy curry.  Love this place. Will come back for sure.

qq0oI9LR4x4FBlK_UuvcaA.text: Definitely one of my favorite places to eat! Their pork katsu is incredible as well as their chicken. I go here all the time either on dates or with groups of friends. The place is pretty small but you never feel crammed and I've never had to wait more than a couple of minutes even when I've come with fairly large groups. I'm never not in the mood for their curry!  My one critique would be that the parking lot is always full and a bit difficult to navigate since it's really small. The food makes you forget about the headache of the parking lot though

Ja067X801L3Re4nQkXKDDA.text: The curry udon (spice level 5) was so delicious. It was perfectly seasoned and the noodles weren't overcook! Thank goodness! I'm sad I don't live in Vegas and can't get this all the time. Still craving and dreaming about this meal!

apRhK8wbfSy7j4BHddK5PA.text: I'm sorry. I like Zen for what it is and all, it is good, better than the other places I've tried in Vegas however it just seems too plain for me to be a fan of. Is it more that curry, rice, and fried stuff!?  The menu is simple you order what kind of curry you want (original, vegetable, or spinach), what level of spiciness (1-5 is free and 6-10 is $0.20 extra), what rice (plain or brown), and what fried stuff you want included (pork/chicken/tofu katsu, pork/chicken tender, shrimp, sausage, and a few others). I've always ordered the original curry with levels ranging from 5-10 depending on the mood, it is good, has the flavors I like but I can never get it too hot to my liking even with the additional spices on the table, sure I'll sweat but I want to breath fire. Maybe it's not suppose to be too hot!? And I'll get the plain rice. The plates are pretty much half rice and half curry. I like the kurobuta sausages but the fried stuff is standard. I could easily eat one plate and be still hungry but drink plenty of water if you're a big eater like me. Adding additional items is an option but it also means adding to the price, which could turn pricey.  The interior is nice and clean. It does get busy occasionally so you might have to wait for a seat or even maneuver around while walking through the establishment. I've never had a problem with service, food comes out in a reasonable amount of time and staff is usually friendly, refill drinks, and handles checks.   Ask for a smaller spoon or a fork cause the spoon they usually give you is huge.  Don't let this review turn you away from going here the food's not bad or anything and I'd probably go back as long as others wanna go but you wont hear me raving about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extras
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu, sausage, rice, and curry

dPAGy4C7nbxt8QyohpuWBw.text: Japanese curry holds a special place in my heart because my grandma used to make it for me as a kid. I would never imagine actually wanting to pay for a plate of curry and rice, but this place proved me wrong!  The food here is great! I usually get the chicken katsu curry or the vegetable curry. Both are delicious. I've tried the fried spam as well, and how can you go wrong with fried spam?   I think the thing that makes this place special is the service. All of the servers are so sweet and attentive. If it becomes slow, they are genuinely sorry. There was one time when one of my friends didn't get his food while the rest of us did. The server was kind and offered my friend a free beer.  Overall, this place reminds me of my childhood and the service is the cherry on top!

zF_XRnzl-pBoJCgI-gmo1A.text: I lived in Yokosuka Japan for a couple of years back in my Navy days. Eating at  Curry zen brought back so many beautiful memories.  The curry was great.  I want to visit Vegas again just for the curry. They don't have placed like Curry Zen in Chicago.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cutlet with beef links.

RaBRioY8Pv1b-3HEXR_r8g.text: This was my first time ever trying Japanese curry. The restaurant was clean and our servers were super friendly.. My main issue was the following: I ordered a beer and there was too much head ( someone doesn't know how to pour) my beer was half a glass by the time it settled which is a rip off. We also received our meals 5 mins apart which is super awkward. My friend got his plate... 5 mins later I got mine... 5 mins later my BF got his... So my bf had to wait ten minutes into us eating to join in.. I don't mind getting our meals one plate at a time but that's way too big of a gap.  I ordered a croquette level 7 curry and it was DELICIOUS! I had 0 problem with the food. I love spicy and level 7 was the perfect level for me.  I love the food and our waitress was nice but please work on whomever pours the beer to learn how to pour it correctly and have the food come out close to each other so it's not awkward. UPDATE*** Came back a second time and everything was awesome.  No complaints second time around. Went from 3 stars to 5 stars for me!!!

i8wDdQ0YDFWZtXXJzPXMtQ.text: It's a really small place in the same plaza as Monta Ramen. Very tiny but still nice. I'm actually not a curry person. I gave it a try and it was surprisingly good. I think I'll be a fan of curry now. I went tonight because I was randomly craving some of their curry when I was at work. I guess it's definitely pretty worthwhile if it gave me a random craving!  The curry mixture was tasty and pretty addicting, if I do say so myself. I've had both the chicken and the pork curry. Meat isn't the best or anything but the curry makes up for it.  I'm looking forward to trying their curry dog next time.  Staff is VERY nice and polite. Mucho friendly :). My friend says it's the closest you can get to Japanese curry! That's absolutely promising to hear!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry

9pUCmaWAd6HkTwoqzx29Yg.text: The portions don't look like much, the plate is very shallow but when you finished the curry dish, you are stuffed!  Very good Japanese curry, not much veggies but very rich and thick.  The plates start off around $6 or so, but add a dollar or so for an add-on.  Also ordered the fried oyster special 6 for $6.  The oysters were on the small side but very crispy and juicy on the inside.  A good choice to compliment your curry meal.  Another excellent option in the heart of Las Vegas Chinatown.

TKqGmcZmELTHB0dcAsuVfQ.text: I have never tried curry before but this place made me fall in love with it. Their food is amazing and the spiciness level of the curry is reasonable:) it's a small place so might have to wait a little to be seated but it worth the wait.

NeCjV3i4JmbrzXx5JHi-OQ.text: One of the best curries I've been too.  Then to top it off they let you customize the plates for cheap prices. Chicken cutlet side for $3? Impossible anyplace else but not here. Do yourself a favor and try this place out and judge it for yourself.   What I ordered: Curry udon with chicken cutlet side Deep fried shumai Gyoza

srWlA8CI_VJEJjHnFPkXxA.text: I'll make this short--- 16 grain rice. Spice levels from 0-100 (ok, maybe I'm exaggerating, but you've got choices). ***TAKOYAKI*** Request fukujinzuke to accompany your curry and you're all set.   Service is fast, friendly, efficient, and food is good! I will warn you, even their milder spice levels are spicier than other places, so err on the side of caution.

Cf6ZJdRru9I3T_3kzjDoLA.text: I've been here a few times with my kuya and every time, I walk away happy. I always get chicken katsu and takoyaki. The katsu is crispy and I dipped it into mild curry sauce! Service attentive and prices were reasonable. Can't wait to come back next time

j7rNxmrgxkD4VQv51InWKA.text: Simple, straight forward review:  THIS PLACE SERVES REALLY EXCELLENT CURRY WITH HUGE PORTIONS!  If I remember correctly, I got the pork katsu curry and shared some takoyaki with my fiance. We were both VERY HAPPY WITH FULL BELLIES after our meal.  I'll definitely return.

FZDV3k4ppo08q7Q8zGQVfA.text: AMAZE!!! The chicken katsu curry is life changing and this place knows what a 10 spice level is. If you like spicy food this is it. The curry is perfectly balanced in flavor and spice. The rice is also cooked to perfection. I always order the chicken katsu or tofu katsu with beef at a 7 spice level so I can devour the whole thing. Service is iffy but they keep a skeleton crew on the floor so it is understandable.

ci9pMhRsBFNfbSPwm5jzLQ.text: Awesome food. Simple but done so well. Curry udon 3x in 4 days. My friend from San Francisco says this is way better than Volcano Curry up there. Wait staff is inexperienced and spacey at times but once the food comes out, I'm pretty darn happy.   The curry spice range is 1-10. A 3 or 4 leaves an afterglow on your lips at the end of the meal. Much more than that and I don't think I'd taste the nuisances of the curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry udon with lotsa pickles.

hRBjm8-wgWl3Sh2XQyjfmA.text: Was welcomed well when entering and got to sit in the booths. The service was great and the food was wonderful. The curry udon was a great meal when taking a break from the strip. The food and service was overall 5/5!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sticks
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tako yaki

IEsl7oefPvcYXTPBFAJwsw.text: Favorite curry spot when I'm out in Vegas for SEMA!!! Delicious food, great prices, and reasonable wait time if they're busy. Definitely worth making the stop if you're wanting to get away from the strip.

9IYs8itYgBMJPuZrtfMx0Q.text: Craving Japanese curry?  Look no further.   Ive been coming here since the beginning.   I usually get Spam and Tofu or Spam and Korabuta.  Their Shumai is awesome as is their Fried Oysters and Tako Yaki!  I also sometimes get the Katsudon or the Curry Udon.  This place is addictive so use caution!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8SBQamF_xvW1t6w5JNtGCw.text: Fantastic Japanese curry. Just like some of the better places in Japan.   If you're like me, a typical American guy who got tired of all the healthy fish &  veggies in Japan, you've fallen in love with Japanese curry and the seemingly random assortment of available toppings. This place reminds me of the better curry shops in Japan, albeit without a ticket vending machine in front...   Although I really wanted to try the spam katsu curry, I stuck with my traditional pork katsu & cheese curry. And the shaved almonds as a crunchy topping were fantastic.   If you were right by my house, Japanese Curry Zen, I would need to move, because I'd probably eat there every day and gain 15 pounds the first month. Thank you,  though, for only being 15 minutes from home.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry with Cheese.

0VnnAi68nPwhckEZg2YL8Q.text: Running around Vegas gave us the late night munchies. We were so happy that this spot  was open late!    I drowsily shuffled myself into the brightly lit and chipper restaurant. I was hungry! The menu was very simple. It focuses on the homemade curry sauce and the katsu. For the small amount of food on the plate, the prices were kind of high. We ordered the pork katsu and curry and added a side of veggies to make the plate more substantial. Bummer that there isn't a veggie and meat combo curry because adding the veggie side really bumped up the price of our dish. I'm used to Chinatown prices where you can get a substantial meal for $12. This was more of a snack for that price.   My favorite part of the visit were the delicious bright pink, free pickles that sat on the table. The jar was full when our party of 3 arrived but when we left it was only 1/4 full. Noms.

LpYyQJEhN3ijcb5BBXJvJQ.text: I love the food , there's just never a parking spot , you aren't allowed to park on the street next to it or the parking lot across the street. I went to eat there circled the parking lot 5 times and left lol. One of my favorite food places for sure though.

0sMqTpy4SRhGhUTmWqucbA.text: +1 good curry +1 reasonably priced food and drinks. Basic curry starts at ~$6, add $3-5 for veggie and protein, and $0.2-0.5 for spicy.  Only 4 stars bc the husband says he can taste the sweetness/artificial ness and it's not the best curry he's had. But I loved it!  We wanted to get off the strip for some good Asian food and since husband was craving curry, we found this little gem. He got the Japanese meatball and I got pork katsu. I enjoyed it very much. Katsu was on point, curry was yummy. Spicyness was a bit too much but that's my fault for wanting 6/10. When our plates first came, the husband thought the quantity was not big BUT looks can be deceiving! The portion size is just right.

LvaDz5DFzgToZrTYAapj6w.text: It's small inside but we went at a good time cause seats were available but I can imagine easily feeling claustrophobic in there - like a bunch of sardines packed together.....  The curry was yummy - I had the pork tonkatsu curry with white rice, potato croquettes and topped with shredded cheese. The condiments provided to us were good. I loved the Rokkyo (pickled baby onion bulbs) and if you want your curry hot there were many condiments to do just that. There even were raisins and almonds -yucky to me but hey if it works for you.....  The Potato Croquette was near perfect - the texture,breading,the mashed potato - yeah it was all good.... the tonkatsu was fried well also. The curry sauce was good enough to me. I only enjoy Japanese and certain Thai curries so this place did hit the spot.  I did suggest to the waitress that other curry options should be offered like - curry cooked with veggies (carrots & potatoes), or curry with beef cooked in it (cause the beef becomes melt in your mouth soft) or even offer more add-ins like corn,green onions,ect.... Now, the waitress didn't really speak or understand english so I don't know if my suggestions made it to the cook.....  But, yeah I'll be back to get my Japanese Curry grub on!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Tonkatsu &amp; Potato croquette curry with white rice sprinkled with shredded cheese
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rakkyo - pickled baby onion bulbs - YUM! perfect with curry....
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. more condiments....

32j-yTLx6Ul6HivL3PxXKQ.text: Great food and friendly staff! My wife and I have been looking for a good Japanese curry restaurant since we left Japan a few years ago. Thankfully we found this spot, we'll definitely be frequenting Curry Zen.

6SVgtqTkywcgpjhNqBjdFA.text: First off, I just wanted to say that anyone who knows me knows that I love love love curry! Japanese and Thai Curry to be precise! Growing up, my mom's home made curry was always the best. I mean, who doesn't love 'mom's' cooking, right?  As unfortunate as it was, I moved to Vegas and the months grew to years; my taste bud fell short, unsatisfied by the curry palettes offered in Vegas. Almost everything was a hit or miss! It was either the curry sucked and the meat was perfect, or the other way around. Booo!  Any ways, long story short, I found this place off of yelp and it was a romantic story between my dish and I. Love at first sight. I couldn't keep myself away! Is it bad that I COULD EAT IT EVERYDAY!? NO PUN INTENDED. LOL.  Meat ever so tender, various side options to satisfy the texture cravings, and curry spices to what ever heat you wish! Simply amazing.  Aside from the food being tastey, service is and always has been delightful.   The End.

9-NzCvL93pNU5st6j09-Zg.text: Zen Curry! I had been curious since they placed the sign up and I was curious to try it out but I never seemed to have the time.  One day my best friend and I were headed over to Monta Ramen... starving and what not.. and realized maybe it wasn't the greatest idea with 10 parties ahead of us. PERFECT TIMING TO TRY THAT RESTAURANT!!!!  So we walked over and browsed the menu, checked Yelp! and went on in. We were lucky that it wasn't too busy. We were seated promptly by Jason Kim and were served our beverages immediately. The quaintness of the curry shop was GREAT. My friends and I are always looking for comfortable restaurants with welcoming atmospheres. The chef and owner came and greeted us personally which I felt was rare in most restaurants.   I ordered the pork cutlet curry with potato croquette, and Di had the chicken cutlet with potato croquette. The curry was delicious and they had everything you needed to customize to your preference! They had their own mild blend of spices, the medium, the spicy, raisins, and almonds. The service was very prompt and since the restaurant is small, it felt very personal. The prices are awesome too, I think we paid about $10 for each plate.  Since I had seen on Yelp! that someone else recommended trying their specials... I came back several days later to try the Spinach Curry. I LOVED that they were consistent with the flavor and texture of the curry. I also tried their Curry Pan.. which is a fried pastry with a bit of their curry. IT IS AWESOME! I'm on a diet but I bought two to-go so I could eat them at work the next day!   LOVE THIS PLACE :)

0gWX8vc0gmiZj0KfgwPw5A.text: Great place for Japanese curry in the area. I know this is a popular plaza with Monta and Raku (and even the Kung Fu Tea, which I like too), but I think this place is worth a visit too. It is most similar to Coco Ichibanya. I had the pork cutlet with a level 5 spice. The pork itself was great, with good texture and taste, and the curry was yummy too. The level 5 spice definitely had a kick to it. Only thing is I would add additional items if you are looking for more than fried pork, curry, and meat. For example, a friend added the vegetables and it looked pretty good. I also tried the katsu don (great option if you don't want curry). It wasn't too busy when we came in around 6 p.m. but definitely started filling up by the time we left.

cGtSuR3tCwfep3nI8fVMgA.text: This is my go to curry spot. I love the curry here and the pickled daikon (i think it's daikon). I always....always get the same thing. Chicken katsu, corn, and side croquette with iced green tea. Lol. It's good stuff.  The curry flavor is so good and nostalgic for me. There's a place in hawaii called Curry House and it's very similar. I used to make sure I hit up Curry House when I visit Hawaii but now I can get it all the time here in Vegas. Hooray for that!

Q0ZutBjIbYGp7ymA3U2EnQ.text: I have been waiting for another cheap, quick Japanese eatery to open up.  After a couple of ramen places and a soba place, I suppose the move to a curry house makes sense.  I do have to make it clear to some who may not be familiar with "Japanese Curry" that it is NOT like Indian or Thai curry, as much as Japanese "Ramen" is unlike Chinese noodle bowls and such from where it originated from.  Japanese culture has a tendency to import certain things, modify them and make them their own after much time.  Curry is very commonly cooked in Japanese households, and it is almost like hamburger is to the American diet.    The menu is simple and self explanatory on their website, so I'm not going in to details.    As for the curry, it was was good, somewhat safe, and not overly unique, but as the only curry house in Vegas (I guess I shouldn't say that now that Kaba is not just in a truck anymore?)  I think it's better to make it not too out of the ordinary.  As for spiciness, it was mild-moderate, definitely a LOT less spicy than that at Cafe de Japon, and I am not certain whether you can ask to make it spicier or not.    I would say that the portions are quite BIG.  Regular size with pork cutlet to make a katsu curry for example will get you quite full.  I think half size and katsu is almost enough to feed most people.  Even plain curry ($4.50, cheap!) is plenty large.    Unfortunately they sold of out desserts which included annin dofu and Coffee jello that looked really good.    The service was quick and friendly, and for an opening day (besides from running out of desserts), they seem to be moving quite efficiently.    All in all, I was quite pleased to have an authentic curry house in town which should give us additional options for quick inexpensive Japanese food besides from ramen and soba, and I'm looking forward to going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croquette Curry

mmxsPx1Sjepe64zjEizdMg.text: Addicting. Consistent every time. Delicious.  I have been to this place no less than thirty times. It's odd that curry-gravy could have such an effect on me, but this place stays on my mind.   It's so simple: choice of meat, white or brown rice, and curry sauce. And yet, it's so much more.   The breading on the Chicken Tender is crispy and perfect every time. I've had the Katsu and grilled chicken as well, also great. The rice is standard, though I am impressed that their brown rice is just as soft and easy to eat as the regular white rice. Not all restaurants have the capability or knowledge to do this, and its evident that brown rice is often the more "challenging" of the two. Not here.  The curry sauce is to die for. It's as mild or spicy as you choose, and I love that I can choose. It is more of a gravy consistency, which is very different from the thinner Indian or Thai curries. The taste isn't for everyone though. I happen to be half Middle Eastern and grew up on my grandmother's afterschool curry, so I welcome the heat and the spices. Also, I'm not a fan of dark-meat chicken, so the Chicken Tender option was made for me.  The toppings are fun too. There are little jars on the tables with things like pickled radish (red), pearl onions (white), sliced almonds, and raisins. I was a little hesitant to throw these on my curry at first, but the flavors are so mild and add a brightness and a fresh element to the rich curry. Still won't do the raisins, but everything else is a must for me.  The service is standard for a Japanese restaurant. Every employee greets you when you come in, and thanks you when you leave. My favorite server is Misaki, as she remembers me every time, always has a great attitude, and is the most personable of all.  I will be back in the foreseeable future, like probably twice this week.

WAmuAFv1ga5OO5VxOi2p0Q.text: This place is great!  I love Japanese style curry... chicken katsu curry! Simple flavorful dish. Service here is friendly and on point.  I had the chicken katsu curry. No spice level added. I also had gyozas and eddemame.  Everything was good. Prices are fair. If you only get rice and curry, I believe is $5. The chiken katsu is around $7/8. Portion is large.   This place is awesome, worth trying.  Yum!!! :-) :-) :-)

8NKHBMyw4zTMbhjjhrPEwA.text: So my friends and I went here on a Thursday night, the place is kinda packed but the time of waiting is okay too. I'm really a fan of chicken katsu and curry sauce so this is the awesome place to go to! And the Strawberry Nigori Sake is the bomb!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This sake is so awesome!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is bomb!

Acfagk-ou390Vnj91I7e_A.text: Zen was a disappointment. The dishes were uninspired. A katsu pork cutlet with rice and sauce. No side veggies or garnishes. Yawn.

4o2Drz5SW0fv5MtnuPKZFA.text: I like Thai and Malaysian curry, but I never before had the opportunity to try Japanese Curry. Without having anything else to compare it to, I found Curry Zen to offer a tasty lunch. I had the Pork Katsu Curry ($9.45) spicy #4. The pork cutlet was fried crisp leaving it tender and juicy. The curry was rich, thick and smooth. It was bursting with flavor from the various spices used. It had just the right amount of heat. The dish was even better with a healthy dose of fukujinzuke and rakkyo. I enjoyed the bite and crunch from the pickled radish and shallot. Service was warm and friendly. I was in & out in no time.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pork katsu curry

qMgM3kMImBUmVVX8HcBlUg.text: I've been here a couple times already so I guess it's time to write a review.   My first visit: I wasn't too impressed by their curry, in fact I thought it was a bit salty (but maybe that might have been the katsu). What I did like was that the curry already had some heat without needing to add any more spice. I enjoy piling my plate with tons of fukujinzuke and a little bit of rakkyo. The topping that I chose was chicken katsu and it was a big serving of the meat. I've experienced in places where they skimp on the size of katsu and the rest of the serving is just all curry. Overall, first visit was a 3 stars.  Second visit: Was a lot better, in my opinion. I ordered korokke with fried ebi as toppings this time. If I order the croquette all by itself it might not satisfy my hunger, but since I also added fried shrimp (which comes in three) it definitely satiated the monster living inside my belly. The curry this time tasted freakin' fantastic. Their curry is definitely for those who like 'em a little on the spicy side. Plus, you have the choice of adding more heat with the three different "powders" available on each table.   This place is reminiscent of curry restaurants I've been to as a child. Curry Zen is pretty basic though, since curry houses in Japan has tons load of different toppings available. But for what Vegas can offer, this place is pretty darn good.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croquette with fried shrimp curry

i9xUmBzbGs4wG_yjtvchGw.text: This is my favorite place to go for Japanese curry. The pricing and portion are just right. I also love how authentic the staff and food is. I've tried other curry places, but they never seem to compare to Curry Zen. This place is becoming one of my favorite places to eat at, in general. I go here at least once a week. I recommend getting the chicken katsu curry plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small chicken katsu curry.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki.

klT4Qn4IvDUiboI8vsGd8w.text: This place is authentic Japanese curry. All the spices they use are so delicious, & the variety in the toppings they offer are great. Their fried shumai & gyoza is also delicious. & they have Asahi on draft! The owner is the chef, & his hospitality is amazing, such a great person & a great establishment!

ACP3ihwhH3I2-u-UskCFIw.text: The concept of Zen is something I've never given much thought to or belief in.  It sounds nice and all (understatement of the year?), but frankly I'm too concerned with work, beating the next level of Candy Crush (427!), and watching every minute of every NFL game possible to give any time towards self-meditation.   Total enlightenment can wait, the Browns vs Jaguars is on the NFL Network.   Who would have known I would take the first step towards this total enlightenment in the form of an hour lunch break at a curry joint on Spring Mountain?  Holy Buddha is this curry legit!  The broth contains more spices than Snoop Lion's tour bus, and each has health benefits if you're to believe the back of the menu and table displays.   I believe! The first time I went with what Tetsuro P proclaimed to be the best item there which was the pork cutlet.  I also added spinach and requested brown rice.  Each and every piece of pork was perfectly cooked, juicy and flavorful.   The spinach sopped up lots of the broth and the combination of all the components on the plate was a revelation.  Even better, they provide several additional fixings at no cost including raisins, almonds, and some japanese pickled veggies.   I tried incorporating each and every one in different ways and I'm not exaggerating when I say every single bite was delicious.  You couldnt mess this broth up if you TRIED.  Next time I'm bringing some durian and gummy bears and dropping them in and seeing what happens.   Odds are it'll still be delicious.   On the 2nd visit I tried the Beef, and it was as good as I expected even if I preferred the pork cutlet overall.     As an added bonus the service is incredible.   Greeted warmly when I enter, making sure no drink or side is ever empty, and a gracious goodbye upon exiting.   It doesn't get any better  When I think back upon my two incredible experiences here, I now find myself sometimes staring blankly into my computer screen at work, mouth watering from the thought of this wonderful restaurant.  Mind and body united in want of curry drenched pork cutlet.   Total enlightenment achieved.

pgnDXkW8bIsxgB13k6wZ7A.text: Unfortunately I'm not a big fan of this place. The ambience and mood isn't as great as Kaba Curry. I had the chicken katsu with curry and the curry tasted water down.

j4xQG7VqQuydju-PBS1buQ.text: This restaurant is definitely a Japanese curry oasis in the desert. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken katsu and udon soup. Service was excellent! We would go back tomorrow if we didn't live in the Bay Area.

eqUe2uYsX921-PN3tJdM-w.text: Amazing Japanese Curry food. After 2 days of eating pizza, pasta and burritos, this was such a welcome change. Loved the spice level and crispness of the croquette. And their ambiance is so simple and welcoming. Definitely recommend that you try this place. It will be great if they open one on the strip itself :)

ofV-mRGtO2r0g1ijRwwltA.text: Great curry, fast service, and friendly staff  I love how they have the small portion of curry too so if you aren't a big eater, I recommend the smaller portion.

ivdZU5UlF3LyoFcY2VKd2w.text: Great curry house! I finally got around to trying this place out, and I'm glad I did. The curry is authentic and the spice level can be adjusted according to your preference. The first time I went here it was a Saturday night and was part of a large group (more than ten  people) and we were seated within 10 minutes. For me spicy level 4 was perfect. It creeps up on you though and lingers after, so beware! I like the spinach curry with chicken cutlet and sausage. There's some jars of pickled veggies on the table and they add a nice texture to the dishes. I like the ginger the best. Try this place out ... Great food, fast and friendly service, clean space - what's not to like?

84uvbycdKSfZ3y-0RyF6FA.text: This place makes me feel like I'm at home. The food is amazing and everything is made to perfection. I usually eat the shrimp tempura with a spicy #2 and that does the job for me!

65Ye1PHP20QOCzAuPIfA0w.text: Western, not authentic Japanese curry house. Spice level 1-10 waiter insisted I order 2 as this is medium. Curry house that doesn't want you to eat curry.

edm-6BAoS7trH6OPTxg_dQ.text: Don't bother to go if you depend on a service animal as you will be asked for your animal's "identification card" (which she is not required by law to have), and then be left without so much as a glass of water when you explain that credentials are not required.

V3ZVw6uAa5cdx423ReTs8A.text: Ok. So I've been wanting to come and try this place for the longest time.... I finally did for the first time last week. Sorry this is a late post/review. But let me tell you, I'm glad I came here. First of all, I LOVE curry. If only my husband would eat curry then I'll probably make it all the time. Anyway, about this curry place. I love it! The curry is how I've always known it to be. Just like when I was still living in Japan. The staff are ok. Maybe a little more friendliness won't hurt. But the food is really good. The server will ask you how hot/spicy you would like your curry to be. I chose 7. It was pretty spicy. Just the way I like it. I had the burger patty with rice and curry on it! Yum! I will definitely come back and try the Katsu curry next time.

n_g6Ho32hc3SzRpz209OWA.text: The best Japanese Curry in the world! I always get the tofu salad and Chicken curry. Very inexpensive and highest quality!!

Q7ypHxLgNVVy2dXXlrKr_g.text: My wife and I have been looking for a good Japanese Curry place every since we left Okinawa in 2003 (CoCo's was the place in Okinawa) and boy did we luck up on this place.  We have tried several places in California and here in Las Vegas...THIS PLACE IS IT!!  If I were to close my eyes and go purely on taste alone, I would think I was in Okinawa sitting at CoCo's.  The Chicken Katsu we breaded and had just the right "crisp" to it.  I opted for a level 2, which had just the right amount of heat for me, and my wife went with the mild. She also said it reminded her or Okinawa...and we took to-go plates as well.  If you have a craving for Japanese curry, try this place....if you haven't tried Japanese Curry and want to, try this place.

vGgVynlT6zSL03oARzrVOg.text: Delicious! give it a try! I got the croquette curry level 6 with can and cheese and it was fantastic. Highly recommend!

JHXo2Pctg_4F7OHvzKbhVg.text: This is such a little gem. The curry was perfect and I was so happy to see that we could add the spices ourselves. I wish there was fried egg on the add-on menu but the simplicity of it is what makes this Japanese Curry amazing.   Service was amazing and it was great to see one of the chefs interacting with us.   Will come back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry with corn :)

hissAwIIomQ66kcQ4g2ruw.text: This place is the best... Been here multiple times and have taken other people and they have all loved it!

0nAdIThlKqeSA0V8OxOegQ.text: Customer service was horrible! While sitting for a good 15mins waiting for our order to be taken we watched the waiter help everyone else except for us. I couldn't even get more water which is funny because our glasses were empty and He refilled every table around us except for us....As soon as we stood up to leave they wanted to help us lol So disappointed I was so looking forward to some curry...

brIeVDZ_xxHRWWJPGpTV5w.text: Amazing food. Good prices and quick service! The staff was really friendly and we had a bunch of different options to try. Definitely recommend if you are the food enthusiast type

6GsDKr3mrF5A8p1hEQ3jcw.text: Absolutely delicious. Best curry I have had in a long time, even living on Los Angeles. Easy to customize your order to your liking in all aspects. Also helps that service was great. They even let me sample the curry to find the right level of spicy. The meats and veggies I added made my dish perfect. Must try this restaurant.

KYraidG42cQu6MrhJyd9-g.text: Some of the best food I have ever had. The staff is always very welcoming and everything on the menu is delicious. Plus the renovations really made the place so much more open, which makes it a lot easier to get in!

Gh2A1D8LwZnXw4JcRU4SQQ.text: THIS PLACE IS THE REAL DEAL. COME HERE IF YOU WANT JAPANESE CURRY. I was born in Singapore and Japanese curry was everywhere and i have eaten this dish for so many years. BUT this place was the real deal. Tucked away in a small corner of chinatown, they serve real, authentic, spicy JAPANESE curry. In fact, the curry served here is better than most places back in my hometown and i am really proud to give this place 5 stars.

Q3X7ZlNENyaKD0N7mBhLIA.text: Da best Japanese style curry in las Vegas. We love the curry pan,tofu,chicken,shrimp,and etc it so crunchy and soft inside.Service was great .

P39IwzSBPIWnxbTVfBLObA.text: The place was smaller than I thought, but very cozy and clean! We ordered... -Croquette Curry  -Chicken Katsu Curry  Both of them were very good! Tasty! Chicken Katsu was not dry at all and you could tell that curry was made from scratch. The only reasons why I gave 4 stars were the fact that you can't pick how spicy you want the curry to be...  I understand that there are different kinds of spices on the side of the table so you can add your own spice to your own curry, but still... after all it is just powder you are adding to your curry, it's not the same... A lot of curry house in Japan, you can pick how spicy! Also, we ordered hot green tea and we got hot water with tea bag inside the mug cup... I was actually surprised... If I'm paying $1.25 for green tea, I rather get one without the teabag!

cyayn96cd83x0pYCQpsGgw.text: I got the Tonkatsu with added corn and cheese and my mom had the curry udon.  the curry udon was savory, had a good amount of beef slices and scallions, and the curry sauce was liquidy enough for noodle soup.  the cheese looks a bit weird on the curry, but it was so clutch. definitely recommend and I won't eat my curry any other way now.

2xFjK598eSygLJcx5Xg4xw.text: The absolute best curry of any kind that I've ever had. The service is nice and the prices are reasonable. There's a ton of diversity in the menu, and it's definitely vegetarian-friendly! The owner and staff are always amazingly friendly. It's just a joy to eat here!

Z9VieCNqVoikGX8QxUDunQ.text: Best tasting curry in town... I tried a lot of places. And this is the best by far. Nice and simple. Nothing to crazy

0V2K-LPn63gsMwdZ4AYqDw.text: Born and raised in Japan, this place has great curry. !!!!!   tonkatsu was little bit under fried in my opinion(Tonkatsu kiyoshi does better off course).   If you love the curry, this place is the best in vegas.

9NK7lo0ouanN1u0AVYxlaQ.text: This place is great. Every time I'm in Vegas I can't decide to go to Monta or this place (Monta usually wins). But one day I decided to go here since I already had my Monta fix that weekend. I was not disappointed. The curry is flavorful, best I've ever had. The spice level of the curry is actually spicier than other curry places I've been too. I always get spice level 10 at curry places and don't really feel a kick, but this place does have a decent kick for me at level 10. I had the Chicken Katsu w/ Kushi 5pc add on. Everything was still crispy till the end of the meal, Chicken was moist, and i loved the quail eggs. Service was excellent and food comes out pretty fast. This place would probably be one of places I must go while I'm in Vegas

xHhdKSkB0zla8keG3Y-D_w.text: It's about time they put a curry house in Las Vegas. I was very excited about trying out their curry. The menu is a little small compared to other curry restaurants I've been to. I ordered the pork cutlet curry rice and it was very good, especially with the pepper seasoning and Japanese pickles.   I paid $9.13 for the plate and I thought it was more worth $6 or $7. The restaurant is a little smaller than Monta, so you might have to wait outside. The owner was very nice; he said the curry recipe was a family recipe. All in all, I would have to say the curry is legit and I would come back.

ZpW_7FmKKQ-ENTU4FLGbXw.text: Japanese Curry Zen is a decent place to check out if you're looking for Japanese style curry rice.  The Food (3 out of 5):  Okay, I've been here a couple of times now, and both times I have had the Tonkatsu (pork) curry rice which is good and tasty. Now, curry rice is a staple in most Japanese households, and I am really used to not only having the white rice with pork cutlet & curry sauce over it, but also with other vegetables in the curry sauce as well (i.e. potatoes, carrots and sometimes celery). So, I was disappointed by the fact that you could not add any of these kinds of additional veggies. Also, they really should offer Tabasco sauce in the restaurant as well as another kind of ginger (their ginger is kind of sweet).   The Service (3 out of 5):  Service has been good here but not great. On the last time here we had to wait a little bit to get refills on our waters and to get more ginger. Yes, they were busy at the time, but then again, it's not like you can pack a lot of people in the restaurant. I didn't like the fact that our table for 2 was really close to the table for 4 next to us, it was kind of like we were there with that other party.   OVERALL: If you have a hankering for Japanese curry (or if you don't want to wait too long at Monta a few doors down), then this is a decent place to go. However, I do think that I can cook a much better curry rice myself though!

rZXD2oVJVDkcQYhcmG7h6A.text: Short and simple review. GO HERE. Katsu was awesome and the service was fast. Only gripe was the parking lot. But once you get in, wow.

ZY0CTLfM7g4-Mj_7PYIxKg.text: This place was fantastic. Some of the best Japanese curry I've ever had. Though, I would say that a 4 on their heat scale is maybe hotter than I would have thought a 4 would be ;) Get one of the croquettes: they're perfectly crisp on the outside and delightfully fluffy inside.

0CmM1peXfffuOCmFK7uGaA.text: Katsu Don...  Pork Cutlet, lightly breaded with caramelized onion and rice under. Absolutely delicious!  My friend had vegetable curry which was also excellent.

NL93850Uv_tq99jqFWMn1Q.text: Pricey, but completely worth it once in a while. What is pricey, you ask? $9 a plate that leaves me still hungry is pricey. If u want a 2-item plate, will be about $14. Like I said though, very worth it once in a while. I hate curry, but this place's curry is so good, that I will definitely come back again!

TgA7S4RDFuhk-A1JMQGuIA.text: Loved the curry! I'd definitely come back.  Seating is limited though...small place.  Taste is close enough to that good stuff in Japan, CoCo's!!

baU-wR3Wu8KPt7QZNnAoog.text: Items are so simple but they keep me coming back. Their curry is REALLY spicy even at level 0!

r5d4yk640deQ2cCSZk5woA.text: Curry Zen does their spice and katsu very well.  As others have said, level 5 is pretty good (for me) - the spicyness builds as you eat your meal.  The cool, sweet pickles make a real nice complement with every bite!  Value is okay - I would have expected a bit better value in Vegas Chinatown.  The self-serve pickles (and other curry "add-ins") are a nice touch.  Solid place that is definitely worth a visit and we will return.

ApocvZ9lwItdsA6TnamTbg.text: The curry there is really good, and the level of spicy is on point! Enjoyable! Also, great service!

xorP17g_0FteVOjbqRzJyw.text: Totally tasty! And its not to far of a drive. The building was small but stepping foot into it! The smells the friendly atmosphere so lovely. The small selection made it easy for me to choose what I wanted. I wasn't gawking at a menu for 3 years like with other restaurants. I knew exactly what I wanted and ordered the pork katsu curry. The pork was crispy the curry was spicy and delicious. I'm already craving another plate and can't wait to go back. The gentleman that served us was polite and kind. Was all around a happy experience. Thank you for it. Curry zen

88aDiA9O1vLNJunt2LmPpw.text: I'll keep it short, this is the best curry in Las Vegas,

EJUPWCoG-NtGRgEgaJXWxQ.text: Heard good things about this place, so I wanted to check it out for myself.  Enjoyed the Chicken Katsu Curry and added Kurobuta Sausage to it.  The curry had the right texture and flavor, while the portion was just right as well.  The Chicken Katsu was nice and crispy.  You can tell great care is taken in making the curry.  Service was good and everyone was friendly.  It's not a big place so get there early or take it to go.

Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry

f1IdIZ7RcwiezcFnYluvpw.text: Great hot curry! They have 10 levels of heat for the curry. Level 3 is just right for me. Friends brought us here because they loved it.    I will definitely come here again!

6mSwDiAIIy9ZuEloKWmM3A.text: The chicken katsu was tender and perfectly fried. The pork katsu was a little hard to chew however. Mild 4 was not even spicy at all but still good. They have options for brown rice but no veggies included on your meal. Takoyaki was bomb! Place is clean and modern. Service was fast as well. Dont mind coming back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki ftw
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu with Brown Rice

xvDhMzs1vyexKE23NyFlSg.text: i love this place! one of my favorite restaurants in vegas. The service and food are always great! i come at least 3 times a week. As good as curry in japan, only missing the nan! Definitely a must try!!

WscXl0MomoFxsL8rqE_NcA.text: The best curry around! I always eat here when I'm home. The service is great and the food is consistently delicious. I recommend the curry pan and pork katsu curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu curry

niJ7kcKfvmrQGw7YbqWlDg.text: This is a great place for curry. If you are from Hawaii, longing for Curry House, then this is your best bet. They offer an array of meat to accompany your curry, or you can opt for a simple curry sauce and rice. Zen is located in the same complex where Monta Ramen is. If you don't know about Monta...yelp.   There is a base price of 5.95 and price goes up depending what and how many items you add into your curry. The great thing about this place is that they do have vegeterian selections, and they also offer side dishes/appetizers such as takoyaki, deep fried oysters, shumai, edamame, and much more but my photographic memory failed me.  Today, we ordered 2 of the chicken katsu curry, deep fried shumai, and a spam curry. My son loves spam so of course he had to order it. The spam slices came out really thick, think he only had three slices of it, but again...they were pretty thick of a cut. I shared my katsu plate with my 6 year old so we ordered an extra scoop of rice. I love curry; I just don't enjoy the heavy feeling. Sharing with my son was the perfect portion for both of us. The chicken katsu itself was delightful. It was perfectly crisped, the meat didn't look "dead" inside (you know...that dry old chicken look),  and the fact that it isn't seasoned at all or heavily season is also a plus to me, because it'll be chillin on top of curry sauce anyway. As well all know...curry has enough depth, the extra sodium on a breaded chicken would be unnecessary. 1 thing I did wish is that my curry sauce came out a little bit more hot temperature wise. It was more like lukewarm. I'm just one of those people who love seeing steam come from my plate. It's confirmation to me my food is coming out fresh. Hell, it could've been microwaved for all I know if there were steam, but I wouldn't know--I just know I want it to look like it came fresh out the pot.  It was busy when we arrived, but we did not have to wait at all. We came in on a Tuesday afternoon, but twas Veteran's day so perhaps twas the reason for a full house? The facility was very clean. The waitresses were attentive. We did have to ask for our waters to get refilled at the end of our meal, but two refills prior to that they came without question. Tables kinda sit close to each other as the facility isn't big. So no nasty talk unless you want the people next to you joining in. Lol. I don't recommend bringing a stroller in there as well. I didn't have mine, but when I walked in I thought thank goodness I didn't bring it in. Kinda figured considering we are on Spring Mountain and such eateries along it don't offer plenty of stroller room anyway.   For my family of 6 our bill came out into a whopping 32bucks, that's with tax. Can't say the same for others because I still have kids that are in the sharing zone. Good deal to us. Anyway, before I get 'curried' away....pause....I will certainly be returning whenever we are feeling Zen like.

6txrW69Ej3iN5bnSZUCgQA.text: Delicious!  The curry is on point every time, especially their spice level.    Don't get too nervous about the fried foods, it's actually not greasy at all, very clean tasting.  Tip: get the curry udon, it's kinda amazing.

O1MNPNVwPKFayg13Xx7g9Q.text: I never get tired of this place....I go here all the time and the quality of my food is always THE BEST. It never comes out differently. One of my fave restaurants in Las Vegas honestly.

tLfGyQ4Pn00uOoBw47jPhg.text: The curry is great here and the service is efficient. But the food comes with curry is only acceptable. Especially, the meat is always dry out and taste is just ok.

1PAeG4RUbGHuAzRg3jZl1g.text: Good service. Very fast. Food was good for what it was. Very cheap meat. Don't expect anything out of the ordinary. Curry had a good spice and the rice was cooked very well! Thai tea was actually really good too.

AFH8BBkiFwcnGiTXFYqC6g.text: I was craving curry and wanted something comparable to Tani's Kitchen in Daly City or Hurry Curry in LA. This place definitely hit the spot. Very clean presentation and their kitchen looks pretty clean too. There aren't actually too many tables in here, but we were having a pretty late dinner so no one else was in here. My only gripe is that the vegetables I think were $2 extra and were not a substantial portion for the price, but I wanted to feel somewhat healthy that day and would probably continue to order it here - prices are pretty low to begin with already, so I guess it wasn't that bad. Our server was very attentive and I'd definitely come back next time the craving hits.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Condiments at the table
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cutlet with $2 veggies

dsRl-HPLQE6D9GBkpMa9VA.text: I've been looking for a good Japanese Curry House for over 10 years since I left my home town.  I just happened to see it when I was at Kung fu tea.  I had the Shrimp and Pork Katsu.  Flavor was  perfect but temperature of the curry was semi cold.  I want to eat steaming hot curry with medium spice.  I want the cheese to melt.  I will try this place again and I might give more stars but I'm not sure if I should request the curry extra hot temp or just chance it????!? I see the cooks working very hard in the back but I wondered why the curry was cold.  Maybe they didn't stir it up good before plating it and the curry sauce at the top got cold.  When I go to a buffet and there's soup, I always stir a few seconds wait to see the steam before I scoop and I get it hot and fresh.  I haven't given up on this place but they better notice that if the curry isn't hot then you can't finish the meal cause it's gross to eat when it's cold.

vT3CrzSzHlrbh1qbpOomJg.text: The food here is really good, the presentation needs a little improvement... I would come back for the food though...

IsiWJVPKiffCuvUlaiX6-A.text: My wife and I lived in Okinawa Japan from 2003-2006 while stationed at Kadena AB. We fell in love with a fast food Japanese Curry place known as CoCo's. Anyone who's been to Okinawa or even mainland Japan knows about this place! When we moved to Las Vegas, we were super happy to discover Japanese Curry Zen!! It's amazing curry. Such a great comfort food.   We eat here quite often and constantly recommend it to our friends and coworkers. If you like spicy foods and curry, you must try this place out! I normally go for the chicken cutlet level 2 spice. It's perfect and you can always turn up the heat with the extra spices they have on the tables if need be.  We've tried Kaba Curry in town as well, but prefer Curry Zen. The prices are reasonable also. They've recently expanded the restaurant which allows much more seating then before. I've had to wait outside before they added the extra seating, but now we get a table almost every time.   They also have great iced thai tea! Check em out!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tender curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yum
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fss0jaKX1T-jRYI7-7Cnzg.text: Nom nom nom!!!!   This place is absolutely delicious! Love the chicken katsu, pork katsu, shrimp and always curry spicy level 4!! Very friendly, very welcoming.  Nice little addition: cute seat cushions glued to the bench for your comfort and safety :D

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!! Pork tender with extra Spinach &amp; side of shrimp !!!

5QiX6YdOZVU_EXRSDXPAEA.text: At Curry Zen, I love getting the chicken katsu curry because their chicken katsu is on point and their curry is also on point! It is a nice place for a cheap and quick meal! Their service is also always on point, and I love how flavorful their curry is. I always recommend this place to my California friends whenever they visit. Definitely try this place out!

EhqnDbwFIP97vOHl1p3aTQ.text: Great little spot. Good curry, sake and customer service. Cold sake helps to combat the spice. Don't pass this place up

kxhTTxlxfvV3lBeeAGY6KA.text: So I love Curry, and I often go here to get my curry to go, but what I really like... Is the Katsu Curry with Cheese and Corn. I have to say though, they are so Stingy on that stuff that you can probably just have some at home and save yourself a $1.00 Also when you order (extra) anything make sure you double check with them as to how they Add Extra - because I got cheated one day on my rice.. Never again will that happen.  I advise though, there are only 3 tables in this place and 10 seats at the bar, way small place... So doing the take out thing is AWESOME!!!  Food is good tasting stuff though... Totally love Curry... so I like this! Yes ^__^ ..

J5xMEQ0kesrD8sgzPkb2BQ.text: It's all hype....  My friend and I decided to eat here because we heard it was the best Japanese curry in town....it's mediocre at best.   The service was good but we were really disappointed on the quality of the curry. The only thing that had it going was the chicken katsu.   Still on the look out for the "Best Japanese Curry in Las Vegas"

so7vGySwss9i3T_pMDygkA.text: There is a part of me that wishes I could live in japan and drive the insanely awesome vehicles that they produce, date all the hot woman that they have and specially eat all the awesome food that this country comes up with. Sadly I am not there..but places like curry zen makes me feel a little better I could spend days explaining the taste of this place, and it would not compare to the experience at all. This place is simply magnificent. The quality, the presentation and the flavor are out of this world and to top that the service , courtesy and warmth of the servers and chefs make this one of my new favorite spots. The spot is small but thankfully ive never had to spend time waiting. Maybe its because the damn hipsters haven't find this yet and I am cool with that !. The pork is so tender and the curry is thick with a decent amount of rice as well.Be sure to try the enderloin at least once.If it feels a little too expensive for you, stay with the chicken if you want..it still tastes epic. If you lke it hot they wont change it while cooking however you get the spices in the table. Not a biggie..I like getting the legit thing so not altering it actually works for me. Everytime I went my glass was NEVER empty and had the staff checking for satisfaction all the time. Seriously the service was better than most 5 star restaurants..and why? Because they were sincere!! You can see them wanting you to enjoy.. that my foodies; is priceless . Want to know what is the hardest thing for me to do? Go to that plaza..sit down in my car and look at monta...look at zen..look at monta again..zen one more time.. MY HEAD WILL EXPLODE one of these days. I need to figure a system out.. It is like going to a strip club and have "destiny" and "charity" (classic stripper names btw) offering you buy one get 2 free!! DON'T JUDGE ME. Do yourself a favor and try it. Get that JDM hotness in you and you wont be able to let go!

pmnbVsZrS7kj50gTI32Ijw.text: I love this place. This place serves the best authentic Japanese curry in Las Vegas. I recommend this place to locals and tourists. I usually order the vegetable curry with chicken katsu. Support local! (:

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z2k-kmxMtHV16-z9j8J09w.text: If I ever need my fix for J-curry, this is where I'll go from now on.  Apparently that's also the case for many Japanese in town including the owner of Cafe de Japon who we bumped into and had the pleasure of dining with.  He got natto with his curry.  I didn't know that was something Japanese did?  I think natto is super gross but I guess drowning it in rich curry sauce would be the most acceptable way for me to scarf it down.    Most of the meat options are breaded and fried with the exception of the kurobuta sausage.  I got the pork katsu with cheese and my wife went with chicken katsu and cheese.  Both were excellent and terrific portions.  I also liked how they offered almonds, raisins, sweet onions and pickles on the side.  I'd never put almonds on my curry before but it made for great texture.  I ate a ton of onions since that went really well with the crunch and juiciness of the pork.      I would like to see a few more options for curry including a straight up beef option and maybe an unfried chicken too but that's not a big thing.  Friendly service, Japaneezy atmosphere and great curry is what will ensure my return.  Free wifi is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu with cheese

yKNQh1eiuiWRoa3gumdwpA.text: I love things all curry so when my boyfriend was too lazy to cook it, we opted to eat out at Curry Zen. We decided to do take-out to stray away from the lunch rush hour and ate at home instead. I ordered the chicken katsu curry that they separated for our take-out order. Now while the amount of curry they provide is actually a decent amount, I can't say that they give you enough chicken katsu to eat WITH the curry. By the time we were done with the chicken, we had way too much leftover curry. While I do feel as if they skimped us on the chicken katsu, the curry makes up for it - I could've dumped the curry over some white rice and called it a day. I do suggest that they should really re-evaluate their food portions for a more "even" meal.

Crpm2YZU9NxY7YSvdmt9kg.text: Located in a plaza with some of the best collection of Asian food in the country lies Japanese Curry Zen. Parking may be hard to find, but it's definitely worth it. The menu is very simple, choose type of curry, choose meat, choose spice level, enjoy.   I was able to indulge in the Pork Katsu Original Curry with extra Kurubota Sausage with spice level 4 and the Curry-Don which was a relatively new item on the menu. The meat in the Curry-Don was thin sliced pork and seemed to have a pretty good kick at spice level 3.   We came a little later for lunch so didn't have to wait too long for our larger group, but service was excellent. Expect to pay $10-11 for some top-notch curry. I have to admit that this review may be a little biased because I had been craving Japanese curry for months. But I'd give this a solid 4.5 and bump it up to 5 for what was an amazing meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu with Kurobota sausage
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry-don

M3NtPhT3HK_dfpDNvuaP_w.text: I've only ever tasted Japanese curry in Los Angeles which is pretty hard to compete with. Japanese Curry Zen has exceeded all my expectations! So yummy! Came into a quaint and traditional Japanese style restaurant and was immediately greeted with a warm smile. Luigi was my waiter and was exceptional in every way. I'm personally in the service industry and I can say with confidence that the flow of my service was spectacular. He met ever demand with ease and has a very genuine/kind way about him. THE CURRY! So delicious! I got vegetable curry, spice level 7, with a chicken katsu. The chicken Katsu in itself was something to praise. All white meat with a good amount of chicken in between the outer crust. It was perfectly golden! Everything about this place was amazing! My friend's and I will definitely be spending a fair amount of time here in the future.

DblnDBua9ueic6KJ1OHUMw.text: I tried many Japanese curry in many cities. This is the best I think. Even my 6-year boy loves it so much! Although he needs to keeping drink ice water when he was eating the curry.

Pyrm3bPfMxeJEsHE0wI9xA.text: I originally ordered two original curries from Postmates, but when the order arrived there was only one curry. This didn't upset me, I know people make mistakes and it probably could've been the Postmates driver's fault. So I call Curry Zen, explain my dilemma and ask if I can go pick up my second order, they agree and so I head over. I walk in and as I'm waiting I make eye contact with two waitresses yet I'm not greeted, I wait a bit longer and two couples enter behind me. One of the waitresses goes up to the couples and seats them completely ignoring me.  At this point I'm furious for having to drive across town to just be ignored. After seating them, they continue to ignore me until I finally go up to one of them and ask to speak to a manager. This waitress completely disregards my question and simply says "How can I help you?"  I tell her I called earlier about my order being incomplete and she walks away to get my order. Finally the server comes back with my meal but I ask her that I think it would be fair if they give me a sort of credit for all the trouble they had put me through, she struggles to understand what I'm saying (there may have been a language barrier) and says no. She then calls another server to help (I'm assuming the manager). The next server is quite nice and provides me with an extra order for all the trouble, I then thank her and leave. I finally get home and when eating my curry I come to find out that it is extremely spicy though I had ordered no spice (level 3). So I end up having to throw my meal away because I tend to get sick from eating food that is too spicy. I feel as if they purposely did this for asking for some sort of compensation, which I think is ridiculous after everything they put me through. I wasted an hour and a half of my time and money that I'll never get back. I'm hoping this was just a fluke, but I hope they read this and not let some other poor soul go through what I had to.

0fykI9anQI83w7EoE3SwPA.text: Thank you again, Yelp! I would have never found this little place on my own. After a long day of walking the strip this just hit the spot. This place is nestled away in a little Asian shopping center and that it's a good sign that the food is authentic. I heard this type of curry is called "Navy curry" because the Navy brought this delicious Indian spice to Japan. Thank goodness they did!  As you can see, every dish looks the same and pretty much tastes the same. You can have chicken with curry, shrimp with curry, pork with curry, tofu with curry or beef with curry. :-D If you want Japanese curry it's the place to go, if you want more variety you probably want to find another place. I highly recommend binging on the pickled onions and radishes on the table.

81NCXXRghYGfUFkFpdVnEw.text: It's one of our family's favorite spot to eat when we crave Japanese Curry! I wish the restaurant would be bigger, but it's worth the wait!

hxjUWDciDmh7gIbf3pECBQ.text: Curry special restaurant and very reasonable prices. Curry lovers must go. Also curry udon is my best recommendation, oh I love it so much. Gotta eat at least once a week.

AsaBHh_99_D3oV1_vGwsHQ.text: 3 1/2 stars. Located in the same strip center as Raku and Monta Ramen I arrived for lunch and was surprised how small but cute the place is. There was only one other patron besides myself.   My order the pork cutlet curry. My dish arrived promptly and the curry sauce was flavorful but I added medium spicy seasoning for additional spiciness. I thought the pork was on the tough side and was a little difficult to even cut.   I thought Japanese Curry Zen was pretty average and prefer Coco Ichiban due to they have a larger variety and offer combinations.  Don't get me wrong, if I'm craving Japanese Curry in LV I would return to Japanese Curry Zen.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Cutler curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5VKqBYS5pX4a4stgHWNBvg.text: This place has a pretty simple menu, but I like the fact that it is customizable. I went with the spinach curry at a level 6 with 5 pieces of kushi. The plates here are huge but I had no problem eating it at all. The five pieces of kushi includes katsu, quail eggs, zucchini and mushrooms. It was super bomb! There is something very comforting about Japanese curry. I will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Level 6 spinach curry with 5 pieces of kushi yumm!

bavrStLhPcxld-b3QL6fYw.text: THE FOOD HERE IS A1 ! Basically it is my go to spot whenever I'm hungry and the staff is always kind and welcoming. They have a variety of food you can pick out, also can pick what spicy level you want, and pick your toppings to put the curry. As for the vegetarians, they have a delicious selection for that as well. The curry is always so flavorful and fresh. I usually get the Chicken Katsu curry with an appetizer of Takoyaki which is 5 pieces for $4.50. YOU HAVE TO TRY THEIR TAKOYAKI ! It is a must. Overall, it's very cheap and will make your tummy happy :3   10/10 for this place and I highly recommend everyone to go here !

meMk-odEvfPQJNJAjUXqbQ.text: Went there for the first time. I've been knowing this restaurant since we started to live here. They always seem to come up on yelp whenever I search for restaurant. They have good rating. And I understood why today. Curry was smooth yet spicy, creamy, tangy. Rice was cooked perfectly, not all smushy and stickly, had enough bite yet soft.  I had Kurobuta Sausage curry, "blaZEN" level 4. I love spicy food and it was just the right heat for me. Not too hot like I had to take a break, but made my nose run (best sinus reliever!). Kitchen was sparkly clean, and the entire restaurant was neatly kept. Waiters are attentive. Very cozy atmosphere. I cannot wait to go back and try their new "curry Udon (oh yeah!) !!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Udon. Thick, rich, hot and spicy goodness!!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kurobuta Sausage, blaZEN: 4

9axFVwSIQhdlvi9_QFFsrw.text: I don't really have a lot to say about Curry Zen. It's just an average place all around in my opinion.  The curry is decent in flavor but the price seems a bit much. The menu is set up so that you pick your curry base and then from there you add on whatever you want to dip in your curry. So far I've gotten the chicken katsu and kushi options. The food is good. It's why I've come here a few times, but in all honesty it just feels average. Nothing really stands out to me. It doesn't leave me wanting more. It's just average.  They do earn some brownie points for having a rating system on the spiciness of their curry that is actually accurate and wonderful presentation on the plate.  Other than that, I really have to be craving curry specifically if i'm going to go out of my way to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m1ZNkGL3oxtcGVarHeXOIw.text: The food here is really basic- figure out what level of heat you want and pick your protein. Curry is rich and delicious. Great option when you are tired, hungry and don't want too many choices. Maybe you've had a few drinks earlier and just want to get in, out and get to sleep- whatever your story.   Service is lightning fast and food comes out almost right away.   On a late Saturday night they were packed with not one open table, but they turn fast, so stick around and a table will likely open up quickly. We only waited about a minute before a couple that was done with their meal got up so we could grab a seat.   They do have a few very reasonably priced draft selections, if you are drinking.   All in all, not a special trip place, but quick, satisfying and effortless.

seG7ZguB3i3GRDgmgVEVkA.text: Fantastic, deep flavor on the curry that you might be taken aback by, katsu was on point, spinach curry so good.

Kx47mkwZyS_K9b6NNosHtw.text: PLEASE EAT HERE!  Ok so I rarely give 5 stars and especially rarely give it for a Japanese restaurant in the US.... That's mainly because my wife is Japanese (from japan) and I of course lived there for 7 yrs... We've actually only been back in the US for about 2 weeks ... So Japanese food (real) is still fresh on our pallets.  So those of you that know me, know that CoCoIchibanya is my absolute #1-2-3-4-5 favorite restaurant of allllllll time.  So when we found this spot on Yelp, Sakino recommend we try it as she knows I'm missing curry, specifically CoCos.. When in Hawaii, I drag her there. When in LA, I drag her there. When at our home in Okinawa... Well that's home so I can't drag her anywhere lol, but she lets me go like once a week!  So of course I'm feeling a little standoffish about this place... Most of our American Japanese dining experiences thus far have been ehhhh.... So in we go. Right off the bat, they have that CoCoIchi yellowish colored menu...  Ok. Then I notice something, everyone in this place (staff) is actually Japanese, and speaking Japanese! This please my wife and I a lot... Sounds silly I know but it's kinda rare to have actual Japanese people that speak Japanese in a Japanese restaurant in America. And they were legit, when my wife conversed with them they didn't skip a beat or look lost. Plus 1 pt for these guys! !so then I order.. Old faithful. Chicken katsu curry with cheese level 2. Exactly as I would a CoCos... Sakino ordered the same only level 3.  So, what I will tell you is this: if you know and love CoCos, this place WILL DO JUST FINE! Is it better? No. Is it pretty much equal? Ehhhh yea sure. Point is for Vegas, this place is basically CoCos, which earns it a 5 star for me... The food is great, the service is great and authentic... Point in case, we come in and Sakino (my wife) sees a young Japanese waitress... She keeps staring and telling me hey hey doesn't she look so familiar? I'm like yea I guess. Sakino was like you know when I was an exchange student at University of Hawaii, I swear that waitress was also a student there on exchange from mainland Japan! I'm like sure I guess but I don't remember babe... So my wife is like ok, after we eat I'll ask her... Well before that even happens, the young girl walks over and is like omg hey remember me from Hawaii etc etc... Turns out it IS Misakichan and she is HERE going to school now... And not only that, today was her first day at this job! What a crazy coincidence that a girl from Okinawa, a girl from mainland Japan, both exchange student to Hawaii, 2yrs later bump into each other at a curry house in Las Vegas? Wtf?! Point is, the people here are great. They are authentic as it gets, and the food is ON POINT! Large for me small for her, 2 drinks, plus tip.. $25 total...
