Which by the way, is exactly what I'd pay at CoCoIchi.... These guys here at Zen Curry in Vegas are onto something... If the local Air Force guys here that have been stationed at Kadena AFB ever find out.. This place will be packed!  Please please please ... Check this place out! So worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front side
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu without cheese
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu with cheese

9iLGremtyqUqqtWQhqbZqA.text: Omg I love this little curry house. The prices are reasonable, the options are plenty and the taste is very homey to me.  Taste like my mother's homemade curry...WELL made curry!   A must- always order a beer and a Tako yaki!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tako Yaki was full of flavor!

tfG9cmaG-bf0W_1iQqXcjg.text: The Curry Udon is absolutely amazing.  The item is listed on the menu board as a "must try" and they are not joking.  I also got the Chicken kushi Teri, also delicious.  I am so glad they have the liquor license because draft beer is a must when I'm having delicious curry.   The place packed up fast too so be prepared to wait for a table.

JN5d6Ce37puFDFSnyQipjw.text: Amazing katsu chicken and veggie curry. Folks when they say blazing hot for 9 out of 10... they mean it . So make sure you can handle it... I would say people who can handle very very spicy venture to 8 or 9. Very flavorful and fresh.

WsJT2Pnwnocj23fsrw9H8Q.text: Its alright. Nothing special. Just the sauce and meat.

Y5JOCTL7HVFNqBm8xhhWqw.text: Small for sure and easily overlooked.  I have dined at Monta numerous times right next door and never really noticed this place.  My boyfriend wanted to try it so off we went.  There was a big party taking up the only tables in the place and we ended up at the counter.  A little claustrophobic maybe at the counter.  The menu is small.  There basically is one curry that can have a few options of meat and everything comes with rice.  But the curry is good and flavorful and makes me happy.  It has something like 13 different spices in it which all contribute to your health somehow.  None the less we gobbled up everything on our plates, didn't pay very much and we left with a warm belly of curry.

uT2yRPDDJmyQ8STXo4s2Rg.text: Very nice staff. Cute place. Very small and tight. Delicious food. Found hair in one of my meals. Asked staff about it, they apologized and made me a new dish and added tempura shrimp as compliments.

HTKIL4pGpWhSCYbxYUF5DA.text: The service was excellent, the pork katsu was perfect, and the curry was the best I have ever had. Be careful with the spice level! I love spicy food, so I ordered a 7 and was amazed by the heat level. It was still delicious and I was able to finish with no problem, but it was pretty damn hot. Love this place.

9a5OwEgW5PdBFjjDX4f4DQ.text: I went there with my family one day to try out their curry... and it wasnt a HIT for me. This place ONLY SERVES curry... and your choice of pork chop, shrimp, croquette.. etc etc. My dad got the pork chop curry ( shared that with my mom) and i shared a shrimp and croquette curry with my sister, and we also ordered a curry puff on the side. The curry puff came and it was COLD... like it was just taken out of the fridge and served to us. IT WAS NOTHING SPECIAL. The curry wasnt BAD but it wasnt good. i've had better and i probably wont be going back to this joint...

08HWAMbHI_mSvHeCuIBBuQ.text: Great rice bowls...."A"grade.....Jap-Hawaiian fusion. Coffee gello and Don katsu with red ginger and nori was good! I gotta try spam cutlet and mild curry my next stop. Great service by Natia!

JtO8if8xAU1-8GBURHsUQQ.text: I like their curry. But the restaurant is quite small. I always liked Curry House in California. I think this place, Curry Zen is now my curry spot in Las Vegas. I'm happy i don't have to go to California to taste decent Japanese Curry.

y66AWn3AVIj0Z1UduFGjYQ.text: Fresh and good for this style of curry. Everyone super nice. Number 3 is like a 5 for spicy and my mouth was still on fire.

xvpJ_CwOa6hcwiTiDFdJxA.text: Very welcoming atmosphere. The waitress was nice, informative, and kept checking on us with the willingness to talk even though the place was packed. The curry always makes me happy no matter what mood I may have previously been in. There's just something special about it, perhaps made with chef's love for cooking :)? We didn't enjoy the Croquette, but maybe it's just because we aren't fans of the specific fillings in it? It's nice to try new things and I'm thankful I was able to find it here!

AzxkqRrdQmGTlqkUai34Fg.text: I have never had this kind of food before eating here. I just love it. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is not afraid to try new things. I loved it so much that I went back six times in one month.

wq-cLUi9WHSMoGVaKg5-8Q.text: curry with cheese just perfect match!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu ,shrimp whith cheese curry.

nkAAihooJaJH3_QFSg-ylA.text: absolutely amazing. i would definitely come back here again. i got the chicken cutlet curry. it was such an amazing time. also done forget to try the edamame.

7bo7M2xM0ncLw0qvfmBfcQ.text: Great place to go for Japanese curry.  Also, ya can't beat the price and service.  I will come back to this place....

J927aH_P4fQ8c5tAOGrkSQ.text: Was recommended to this place by a friend and have found myself going very often . The food and service is great. Now that I moved out of state, I am going to miss this place.

UJtlgTD5pTXozBvi8sMYrA.text: Simple but good Japanese curry and katsu. Unfortunately they charge for increase in spice levels. The spicier the more expensive. Very friendly waiters and good experience overall

hVTP_HM0kGrlSBvsttCvAA.text: I had tonkatsu curry few days ago. They serve me a rock hard tonkatsu that I have couldn't chew on!

GfYmBrAI7nfDyBcERkSPfw.text: the curry here is sooooo Yummy! just the same as CoCo Ichibanya back home (hawaii). just missing a few things like: the vegetables minus broccoli, the squid rings which they DONT carry and the delicious salad dressing that doesnt compare to anyone else except for Pietros.

KxbC9RIsOEmSDJ-2gWtOnQ.text: Amazing Japanese curry! I could have it everyday.  Clean & courteus service. Affordable and delicious!

pF8UAwMVRNMcHoRqRXvARQ.text: This place is addicting and oh so good!  I come once a week.  I don't know why it's so addicting because the dishes are so simple, but it truly is.  Last time I sat in the bar directly in front of the kitchen and I was pleased to see that the kitchen was spotless and the cooks were handling the good properly.  My only complaints are that the benches are uncomfortable (needs better cushions) and some do the servers can't communicate in English that well.  But it's not a big deal.

lMUw6u3VHYzNT_xSciRB9Q.text: I had the Tofu salad very good loved the dressing & the Katsu-Don.  I would go back very friendly & good service.

ts3QQ4_JYXA7Ex2ELTy-VQ.text: Over-rated, but solid curry. The prices are ok, not great, and the selection is lacking. But they make a good signature dish, the fried chicken curry.

DGjEMiS8EMSR4ZhPeOpf3A.text: A great new option for Japanese Curry in one of the most up and coming and/or already there china town food malls!  Read a fellow yelpers review and bookmarked it immediately.  There is a line but if its good then a line is worth the wait.  We were lucky and sat at the bar immediately.  The decor is modern, warm and clean the service was extremely polite and fast and the chef was behind the counter to be watched while plating his food.    This is a bit like a fast food but comfort food but way better, let me explain why.  They have a 15 spice blend with a guide on the back of the menu explaining the benefits of adding these spices to your food.  I have been to a couple of curry places in town and basically I could have bought the same mixture from a box and added water and had the same thing.  This place is different you can tell it is freshly made daily.  The flavors  of the curry is a strong but very mild flavor at the same time (I know that doesn't make sense but if you eat it you will understand).  You have quite a few options for the meat portion of the meal from chicken, fried pork chop  and a few more.  The rice is plentiful and good you also have a brown rice option for a healthier carb addition to your meal.  THIS is the curry I had in Japan this is the curry I have been looking for since my trip to Japan.  I am extremely happy and will be back for sure.

U5GUT23M4KLbPtxCNc5l_Q.text: Japanese Curry Zen is one of my favorite places to go after a hard work out, the food is fresh and hot. I've tried many places that had curry all around Vegas and this is by far my second favorite. I've only ate here at least three times and I'm really looking forward to going back!!! Although it might not look presentable, it's very tasty. If this is your first time at Japanese Curry Zen, I recommend the Chicken Cutlet.

EpzGLv7f9PLo6o8cf4EKoA.text: Service was so-so and food was okay. Portion size acceptable. It wasn't bad, but I wasn't impressed either. Had to spice it up a bit to my liking.

UIxdAf-o2XoSlyxks7AtYg.text: I started this account just to write this review.  I love Curry and have eaten many curry dishes even lived in Honolulu, Hawaii where CoCos was on top of my list, but compare to the service and taste.  I got a new favorite Curry House. Also I can't stopped thinking about this curry, considering it was my first time trying Japanese Curry Zen, 3 days ago. yes 3 days of thinking about it every time eat my home cooked meals(and I love what i make at home)  So I went with my roommate Elizabeth L. (check out her review 5/13/13) to eat @ Monta Ramen(which was close by and is also pretty good) and after that we went to Japanese Curry Zen to order "To Go" for dinner because we were working that night and had no time to cook but once we got home we wanted to have a little nibble just to try and ended up eating it all. even though we were full from Monta Ramen. The staff and cooks are so nice and smiley.   I guess you can say this isn't really a review but a praise and declaration that i will be going back there for more. =)  Tried the Curry with pork cutlets and Curry Pan and Croquettes, I love my curry spicy and the sweet Miss who gave us our order packed lots of chili powder for me togo when I asked.

UM9DyYMEAVVr1YxDZoyi1Q.text: Although the menu is very basic, I think this newly opened Japanese curry place will do quite well.  There are only 3 tables in this restaurant, but they also have bar seating, where you sit facing the cooks while they are preparing the food.  I counted a total of 18 seats in this restaurant.  But for such a small restaurant, they had quite a few people working there.  I believe there were a total of 8 people including the owner.  Luckily this place wasn't very busy when I arrived for lunch, so I was able to sit at a table.  The service was very good, which is typical of Japanese restaurants.  I ordered their pork cutlet curry on rice and a side order of chicken katsu. Their curry sauce is quite good, but I would have preferred a little bit more curry sauce.  I also tried their curry pan and it was delicious.  This deep fried panko bun with curry inside would have been perfect had it been a little bit warmer.  It was very tasty and the texture of the bun was excellent.   For a quick Japanese curry fix, give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. saku saku!!

0DI4W_HbWn3heIV_gCk6xg.text: Awesome curry plates. Be careful when choosing the spice level; I got a 6, and I was sweating like crazy. Service was really good.

vFWrJ0uDTMLKHByZx0J4Eg.text: Good stuff. It's a simple little curry place so I'm gonna keep my review nice and simple with just good stuff. If yer like me and you tend to do two plates plus an appetizer it will run you around $30 for two chicken curry plates and gyoza just a heads up on how much you should have if yer eating for two but like I said good stuff.

GZa-4lxuz4M3ATidMkWJvQ.text: Japanese Curry Zen offers a traditional environment with friendly service and awesome food. I love authentic Japanese food. I usually order the Chicken Katsu with curry. The spice levels are customizable, but Japanese curry tends to be very spicy. There are also plenty of sides you can add such as corn and tofu. Overall, it is always a pleasant time here~

DJhbR_BKGo06XRDcYubFUg.text: The curry here is great! It tastes like a True Japanese style curry. The price is decent, their menu is limited but that's because they're just a curry shop.  This is a very tiny restaurant; seats about 15-20 people. So if you go with a big group you will have to wait.   I ate here twice before and ordered the same thing; pork katsu curry. It's not too spicy and not too sweet so it's the perfect combo! If you want to make it more spicy, you can always add the spices that they have on the side of the table. The size of the curry is big & so is the katsu.  If I'm ever craving curry, I'll definitely come back here!

OaY6AjpQrnQXBoaSnx64JQ.text: Meh. The menu is short and simple which is fine. My beef is this:  Overpriced rice & curry dish = Rice+ Protein +Curry*Full or Half-order.   For $6-$9 this does not have anything worth going out of your way for. The curry itself did have a character of its own. But at the end of the meal, it wasn't worth the curry burps I inflicted on my girlfriend, coworkers, and anyone in a throwing stars reach.   Not to mention the small butt parade stomping through my intestines by the end of the night. Christ! I love curry from all regions of Asia, but I haven't heard my stomach make these sounds since I was forced to watch 5 minutes of Twilight. At least then I passed out and it was over.  In spite of my sarcasm, the service was decent and orders came out quickly. I wouldn't make an out of the way trip for this place, but if someone is determined to go, you happen to be with them, and drinking, sleeping, taking an SAT/GMAT, or a 24hr Roberto's is still not an option because it's closed...go check it out. But there are several other places in that shopping center that are worth more of your time.

Smav0PSXUBVl-Kqzd-OrRg.text: theres always a surprise in small joints like this!   super GOOD curry + friendly staff + hungry me= HAPPY TUMMY!!! its the BOMBDIGGITY! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy tummy, happy curry plate!!!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cutler with cheese and croquette! Bombdiggity in my tummy!

UtmY0gvXJGfPhNnbXLjiZQ.text: really good curry! if i'm ever craving curry, this is the place I go to! their levels of spicy are a lot spicier than you would think, so I like to stick to non-spicy haha  I could only give 4 stars because the food is great and all but the service is just ok. they're not rude or anything, but they're not engaging either.   but you go for the food, not the service and the food is GOOD

copBTWmRE6_HFeyov2q-NA.text: To be fair, I'm not a big fan of Japanese curry but I've tried a few different places and I have to say the curry here is just okay. I thought the serving size was a bit too small for the price as well (or the price a bit too high for what you're getting). My sister loves this place though.

dCG7HIgUCWfrgFdD1mH-NA.text: Zen Curry hands down has some of the best customer service compared to a lot of other Asian restaurants in Vegas. While the size of the store makes it feel a bit cramped at times when it's busy, I can let it slide since whenever I eat there I always end up feeling a bit better than when I left.  But let's get to the nitty gritty -- the food. I love curry and I'm not a stickler from where it comes from. Amongst all the places I've tried curry from (Thai Noodle House, Surangs Thai Kitchen, Mt Everest, Shuseki, and various Korean restaurants) I think Zen Curry's is my favorite. The curry itself has a nice density to it and the flavor always stands out. Combined with large portion sizes at a decent price, eating here won't break the bank.  The menu itself is pretty simple (katsu, pork, steak) but they have a large board that has some specials in terms of what meat or addons you can get for your curry.

njoNXjt_3dhNyQESL0bC8A.text: These guys are excellent! The service is quick and the food is absolutely excellent! And the prices? More than fair! Small dining area, you may need to have to wait a little but it's worth it. Definitely give this place a try.

x5QHceO2qjjGfjtKC-M_Bg.text: Truly hits the spot! The Chicken Cutlet Curry, Rice, Corn & Cheese combo is my go-to order. Portions are adequate although they could be a tad bit more generous, I think. I finish my meal in 10 minutes. It's that delicious! The meal is simple, served with a spoon. So convenient since I grew up using a spoon and a fork. Haha!  The place is super small so big parties may be a bit hard to get in. I think 3 tables and a counter so plan ahead!

gnINhe0VDtXzkx8IXDbGCw.text: I absolutely love traditional Japanese curry houses. I was extremely excited when they opened because back home where I'm from (Hawaii) they have a curry house called cocoichibanya. This reminds me so much of home.

cLu0Aj5fumXrLZdS8bTyPQ.text: This was my first time trying Japanese curry so I have nothing to base it off of, but I love this place! I love the flavor of the curry. The chicken katsu is delicious!!!! I love the vegetable curry too. Perfect combo is chicken katsu and vegetables and of course with rice. I highly recommend this place. Great customer service as well. Staff is always helpful and amazing.

Q_vCDoKWcnCzRfw9aoGwAg.text: Other than Brandon's curry, I really enjoy the deep fried protein and smooth curry texture. It gets better when you add in the sliced almonds and red pickled radishes. These are hidden little gems that you can ask for (almond or radishes - trust).   I highly recommend the kushi 5 piece curry. It comes in a variety pack of flavors of meat and veggies on a deep fried kabob Japanese style. Best part of it all, they were deep fried. I also recommend deep fried spam and their 5 piece deep fried oyster. Just sprinkle a lil bit of lemon over them for zest~

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 Grain rice, kushi curry, and extra chicken katsu
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kushi curry, almond sprinkled on to with raddish
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 Grain Rice, deep fried shrimp, kurobuta sausage, cheese, almond, and raddish

JY9KCK6ytYbv4LR4EHYw2Q.text: I know what you are thinking. Curry? Japanese?  Well they really do pull it off. Japanese style curry is delicious. You must try this place! Everything is good. Great service as well.

KKr0ADNdKftYNIPKRDDKeQ.text: I love it! Thanks for awesome customer service Ichigo!    I got my food in a reasonable time! Tasted amazing! Thank you again!

YgLwZTFPjK7qVKJek0TOUw.text: After living in Japan for 4 yrs, I have ABSOLUTELY fell in love with Japanese Curry. This is BY FAR the best place in Las Vegas to get some. Zen is my comfort food!

j3rGh6orxKBMjBK7iW4bcw.text: UPDATED REVIEW: I've been coming to Zen Curry ever since it opened and i'm still so impressed every single time i go. The only changed i've noticed is that they serve a bit less food than before but rather than that i still give this place 10/10! I never go to any other places for Japanese curry, ONLY here! It's such comforting soul food and i'm OBSESSED!! I'm constantly craving zen curry and i could eat here for a week straight which i did before lol. This is located down spring mountain in a really jammed packed location because of other popular restaurants and desert cafes so parking is a butt, but it's so worth it when you taste the curry!! You get a big plate and basically you build your own curry! What so love about this place is that they have healthy options if you're a vegetarian or watching what you eat! What I love to get here is the Chicken Katsu (so delicious and juicy) with level 3 spice and the 5 piece Kushi (quail eggs, chicken, mushroom, shrimp, and zucchini?) or i get it with cheese and corn with just the chicken katsu & curry! Remember to get the red radish as well (i can't eat it w.o this). These dishes here has so many different kind things you can add on, the spam and croquette is delicious as well. My mouth is watering just typing this and I can't wait to be back.   The service here is AMAZING ALL THE TIME! Their staffs are super knowledgeable about their menu and are so kind. There's this one employee guy that's so so sweet (i didn't catch his name) but we left him a $20 tip and he literally went out of the restaurant to look for us and kept bowing his head saying he can't accept such a big tip and we said he deserved it, like this made me so teary and melt my heart because he's so genuine and kind. Thank you zen curry for excellent services and staffs!  Overall, I don't have any complaints but the fact that it's super tiny and the wait time is long sometimes but i mean that's what you get for having such an amazing restaurant and good quality food!!

NqN7CPfRGjHjctmKMPHd6A.text: Where do I start? Fujinsuke. Awesomely red and tasty. It goes with curry like...well like...did I already use the word Awesomely? So that.    Katsu was perfectly cooked and the curry tasted great. To top it all off was some extremely tasty Takoyaki.  Great taste. Good amount of octopus and reasonably priced. I will gladly detour here anytime I can.  Great way to close an evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fujinsuke.

g0iTOY_r1zP7usaw6HgzIA.text: Been eating here once a week or so for the last few years and it's always excellent. Prices are reasonable and the curry is fantastic. Hard to find parking in this small plaza at dinner time sometimes but you can always park on the side street.

N1lCJYww5ulCHS67UpN4Mw.text: Oishii! Authentic! Real Japanese curry-- like Japan! Make sure you put all the condiments on top- the red little pickles, white picked onions, raisins, sliced almonds...   Got the chicken katsu- white rice baby. Added cheese and corn (50 cents each). Level 3 spice. Delish! The crunchy, moist chicken katsu, with the warm, sticky rice. The sweetness of raisins and the crunch of almonds, combined with the sour umami of the pickled red condiments. So good!   Pretty lame I don't remember the real name of the red stuff. Cut some slack, 3 rd generation Japanese American :).   Hubs lived in Japan, and said it's as authentic as it gets, except in Japan, you can add a raw egg.   Hubs also added a potato croquet to his and loved it.   Small place, but no problem seating our group of 9 on a Sat night. Busy little strip mall, with a convenient bobba tea place nearby.   Edamame was a large serving for $3.50.   Highly recommend this hidden gem!!

Wt9FQzFQIiyDUYtkFn_d6A.text: Hm... Ya sure, over 900 reviews with average of 4.5 stars... But why?  Food quality- 3 stars. Nothing really to write about, fried stuff is crispy, curry is hot.....  Food taste- 2 stars. The curry here taste different than the one you buy from Japanese store for $4.99/box.... But that's pretty much it. Nothing really "hits" your tongue and scream "I am worth 4.5 stars on Yelp!"  Service- 0 stars. If brings the menu, utensil and water to your table is call service, than I guess this place worth one more star....

P9DfrsQkEedLm40iKY0ecQ.text: The food here is super simple, yet super tasty.  The menu is pretty short and sweet - different variations of Japanese curry with either rice, udon, or ramen.  I love places with limited menus because that means that the restaurant must be very good at what they do.  My theory held True for Japanese Curry Zen.  I got the chicken katsu curry with rice and it was absolutely delicious.  The katsu was so crispy and juicy.  The curry was amazing and had just the right amount of heat (you can specify how spicy you want it!).  The portion size was pretty decent, probably good for a person with a regular sized appetite.  However, I was still hungry after my meal - I don't know if it's because it wasn't  big enough for me or it was just so good that I wanted to eat more of it!    The service is good too.  I was seated quickly and my food came out pretty fast.  I  would definitely recommend this place.  Delicious simple food and great service.  However, this parking lot is pretty annoying.  I came here on a Friday night and was extremely annoyed by the large number of people who appear to not know how to operate a vehicle.  Just watch out because it could get congested and people seem to now have horrible parking skills.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dtalGOx5p8WXDTiy_KTHyw.text: One of my favorite japanese curry places in town. The service is nice and the food is excellent.

kY4iCZ-WEpocWdrXrMAUjg.text: The flavor of the curry was great, although The sauce was slightly too thick.. I know japanese curry is supposed to be thick, but that consistency was way too thick like a garlic spread. And the rice portion was small. It didnt fill me up at all. Also, they serve food with cheaply made plastic plates and cups. I felt like I was eating fast food. My plate kept spinning as I was eating. They should use better quality ones since it is a restaurant. I would go to Cocoichibanya instead.

R-SlGyfYZtixDo3_yWddlw.text: Absolutely love this place! I have been here so many times and every time I leave satisfied.   I have had Japanese curry in a few places around town but this place is the best! I always get the 3 piece (quail egg, zucchini, and chicken) or 5 piece Kushi (with mushroom and shrimp)  (when I'm super duper hungry!) - add corn and spicy level 3! Of course I ask for their pickles too!! This is the perfect meal!  I usually also order their Takoyaki and sometimes gyoza! I have also tried their tofu salad which is also really good! The dressing is very light!   The place is pretty small and can get very busy during lunch time, sometimes there is a little wait but the wait is worth it! The service is also really good compared to other places in Chinatown.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki - very good!!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 piece Kushi with corn

kWvMxB60ucWWFu8dsayPNg.text: YES! this place is legitimate. If your a curry fan and in LV then this is a must stop and eat place.

AfoyPu1bHDoQxsaTCUeKkA.text: This place is always busy because their food is great. I've picked up food to go and eaten there a couple of times. Today however, I called ahead to order food to go. I get there and there's two parties ahead of me in the line. Cool, they get acknowledged and seated. I'm standing there by myself waiting. Another guy walks in, he stands waiting. They come ask him how many, they sit him. I'm thinking okay? Maybe they just sit him and they'll attend me after. Nope. Another 10 minutes go by and they go take his order, the waitresses are just ignoring me at this point. Waited for about 30 minutes and had to leave because they never noticed lol. 0/10 service. The only visible difference between myself and the guy who came after me is that I'm not Asian... gg.

KNmknXOJt-CWtwWWoadBZg.text: This place was OK. Ordered it for delivery, and I enjoyed the curry but... they were out of stock on Curry Pan which is literally the only reason why I chose them over another curry place for delivery.  Oh well, next time. I'm still craving Curry Pan.

nbPCrBs537yVZ8yhzR_Z0g.text: Its kind of crazy how popular this place is when all it serves is curry. Especially in a strip mall that has a handful of other really well known Japanese restaurants. But the curry is insanely good and if you're craving curry, this is the place to go.   My boyfriend and I went in for a late lunch and although it wasn't very busy at first, it filled up completely as we ate. We both had the $3 Kirin draft (can you even eat Japanese food without draft beer?) and an order of fried shumai to start. I usually like all dumpling foods to be steamed and not fried but these ended up being pretty good. They're small, but filled with meat and delicious with Chinese mustard. My boyfriend ordered the chicken katsu curry with corn and cheese and I had the beef curry spicy level 10. I'm pretty traditional with my curry... I haven't quite mastered all these add ons and it seems weird to put cheese on curry especially. Cheese isn't really a staple in Asian food. But of course cheese makes everything better. I had a bite of the chicken katsu curry and the corn and cheese did add some more texture to the dish. My boyfriend said it reminded him of the KFC Famous Bowl which is hilarious. The beef curry was awesome all by itself though. I did have to ask for some pickled radish and onion and I stirred those in, not sure why those don't come with the dish already. I was surprised at how spicy it really was since I've read they can actually get even higher than the level 10. There were about six chunks of beef in the dish, but I shredded them up and they went further. My only complaint about both dishes was that the temperature of the curry itself could have been a bit warmer. I noticed this especially with the cheese in the katsu curry, I think it would help it melt more. Anyways, great meal at Curry Zen and it's always enough food to bring home so I'll be eating it later as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry with corn and cheese
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef curry (farthest), tonkatsu curry, and takoyaki

GXMbEdfrgd24ZdQm9uK41A.text: The curry is so creamy and amazing! Definitely the best Japanese curry I've ever had in the US. I would definitely become a regular if I live in Vegas. This place is just off the strip, and very easy to get to. I am going to come here every time I visit Vegas now :)

NOTcWle2EV6tTKc_pz6e0A.text: I really like the smell of curry when you walk into this place. Came here in the afternoon and wasn't that busy. The interior design was pretty neat and the table size had enough room for me to eat comfortably.  I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry spice level 4. The spice level ranges from 1-10 with the lowest number being less spicy. Level 4 was still really spicy so if you're not a big fan of spicy I would recommend 1 or 2. My brother is a big fan of spicy but he can't really handle the level 7.  The dish was a nice size for the price. The chicken katsu was perfectly cooked and gave a decent portion of white rice.   Service was very fast and friendly. She refilled my water when I needed it and the food was brought to our table in a very reasonable time.  Thank you to the staff of Zen Curry!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The beautiful delicious mouth watering chicken katsu curry with white rice

ddnAOv1o-gPzEEe5QCvW2w.text: Inexpensive ($8.95 for the chicken Katsu curry). Great and attentive service. Also tried the fried tofu curry, which was battered really well. Options for spicy add-on to your curry. I usually like it medium, but even getting the 3 (out of 10) was plenty spicy for me. Cheap beer (eg. 20 oz Kirin bottle for $5). Only negative is that I would have liked something else to cut the heat of the curry a bit (the tofu curry came with corn for example).

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry (original) and tofu curry.

QBGgozyTcoy6NwXBory0zg.text: I've been looking for a place that actually serves good katsudon for a while now, and decided to try this place for takeout on my way home. As a result, I guess I can say that my review might be different from others because I didn't eat in, and I didn't eat the staple meal they sell here (the curries). But as katsudon also includes breaded pork like the curries on the menu, I figured I would talk about it anyway.  I love Japanese pork cutlets when they're made well. They're crisp, but not dry or hard, and the meat inside is usually soft and moist. It just melds together and tastes great. The cutlet in the katsudon, meanwhile, tasted awful. Traditionally, it is a pork cutlet with rice an egg cooked on top of it, and the egg yolk and white are supposed to complement the taste of the meat.   This one had the egg on top and the whole thing looked (deceptively) visually appealing, but the whole thing was so over seasoned to the point that eating the cutlet was really difficult because it tasted SO SALTY. I couldn't taste the egg over the taste of what felt like pork dunked in soy sauce. On top of that, the cutlet was very, very dry and it felt like chewing into a rock. I knew the pork was there but I couldn't really taste it over the sodium and the hardness of the outer shell.   It goes without saying that the sauce leaked down all the way to the bottom of the bowl, and even as I started to eat mix and bring some of the rice to the top, I noticed the white rice was pretty much soggy and brown with the sauce. The rice also tasted way too strong at this point, and I just couldn't enjoy it. Maybe the curries are better, but I wouldn't recommend the katsudon here at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsudon takeout

OpxYplgI2RWEr1JaYf56Jg.text: Waiting is sooooo long while the place is half empty.  Our expectations was high due to the high reviews. But it just taste normal to bad. Not worth the wait at all. Won't be back again.  Karage: very very dry, chewy, tasteless  Oyakodon: they used white meat on top of the rice to steam. As a result, the meat tasted so so hard and no taste as all. Soup is good though Curry: taste just okay

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Order

rV35UaJEfuhoQrJ4utpj4A.text: Craving some Japanese Style Curry??? Hit up Curry Zen! It's located in the same plaza as Hwaro & Raku on Spring Mountain.  Just a reminder about parking, It gets packed in there.  There is some parking on the street and in the empty lot across the street.    I came here at noon on a Monday and It was busy but we were able to score a seat.  We arrived at the perfect time because a line at the door started to form.  It is a small restaurant.  The menu is quite simple.  They offer different curry plates featuring the typical chicken katsu, Pork katsu, cheese and spinach, and so on.  They also have a diy version where everything is a la carte.  They also have spicy levels from 1-10.    I ordered the pork katsu curry, level 2 spiciness and added cheese and corn.  From the appetizer menu, my friend and I tried the takoyaki.  The takoyaki surprised me a bit.  I actually enjoyed It! I didn't think that It would be as good as It was because the main dish was curry.  I'm now craving the takoyaki! Lol.  The curry dish I had was alright.  I did have to chase down a server for some of the pickled ginger.  It is the main reason why I eat curry!  I wish that they gave a bigger portion of ginger or even have It available at the table because the servers are really hard to chase down.  Other than that, It was good.  I do miss Curry House back home in Hawaii but this restaurant will do.    I ended up paying about $20 for my meal with add ons and tip.  The service is a bit lacking and wish that could be better the next time I go.  The servers don't really refill the waters and It did take a while for our bill to come back...

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tFpiVKWHU5X0Cd5DLgGQIA.text: Zen is achieved when you've devoured a warm bowl of curry and it's sitting happily at the base of your gut. Zen is also achieved when you don't have to cook curry and clean up the mess because it stains like crazy!   What we ordered:  - Japanese meatloaf with sweet corn, spicy level 4. The loaf was soft and not dry at all. It tasted lovely with and without the curry. Spicy 4 was somewhere above a mild but nowhere near medium.  - Pork Katsu. A house favorite but I felt the katsu was a bit dry and a bit too lean.  Overall: - Ordering + menu options were simple. - Eating here is great for solo diners. - The serving size was perfect.   Con: - The additional fee for spicy curry!  Note: We came at 11:27am and a line was already forming. By 12pm, the restaurant was full but turnover seemed fairly quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japaese meat loaf + corn (.75)
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu

XsOGAEqQv4e4SIIcuwTpMg.text: Japanese Curry Zen is located in Chinatown, just a few miles from the strip. Located in the same plaza as Raku, Kung Fu Tea (very close by actually) and Hwaro.  My husband and I decided to grab a late diner here this past Sunday night, around 9:25 pm. As soon as I came in here, I wrote my name on the sign up list. We waited a little less than 15 minute and we seated (even though there were 2 groups of 4 people ahead of us, we were able to get a table before them since a small table of 2 opened up).   After looking over the menu, we ended up ordering:  Pork Katsu Curry, $10.45 prior to tax + $0.20 extra for spice level 5- My husband opted for this entree and at the level 5 spice level. Please note that you do pay extra for some of the spicy levels (level 5 and up). My husband thought this spice level was good for him and probably wouldn't go a level higher so that he could still enjoy his curry. Because I am not a spicy eater, I didn't have any of his curry but I did had one piece of his pork katsu. The pork was good and wasn't too oily. Had a nice tender piece. This entree came with a good portion of steamed white rice to soak up all of that curry, which is also a large, generous portion.  Chicken Katsu Curry, $9.95 prior to tax- There most popular item, I asked for this to me mild. The chicken katsu itself is rather bland but of course with the curry, splendid. The curry itself was nice and savory but not too salty. I was pretty full after eating all of this. You do get a pretty good portion of chicken so that this is a filling meal.   Peach Sake, $4.50 prior to tax- I opted for this sparkling sake. Our server described this as a soda and that you can't taste the alcohol. I agree, I couldn't really taste the alcohol in it and I liked this drink. But my husband didn't like it at all. I liked this drink and probably will look for it at the Japanese market near me.  ---------------------------- (Total= $27.17 after tax, prior to tip)  Wait time for our food was just about 10 minutes. I wasn't expecting our food to come out so quick but guess they have a lot of curry already made and ready to add additional ingredients to make it to a particular spicy level per patron and just add on the different protein and toppings the customer orders.   Our server was nice but he was forgetful of bringing me this curry to sample. He had told me that they do a sweet curry and said he could bring me a sample. But being that they were busy I just decided not to ask about it again.   Seating inside is rather small so you can see how a wait for table can soon accumulate rather quickly, especially during peak hours. But this is a place people do not necessarily linger and chat. They just eat and leave. So I don't think you will be waiting too long for a table. And if there is a long wait, consider ordering to go or eating at one of the other delicious restaurants in this plaza.   The ladies restroom was clean upon this visit and adequately stocked with the essentials (please note that this is a single toilet restroom).   Pretty good food, I would definitely come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Damage
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry, $10.45 prior to tax (please note that photo was taken after a hungry husband ate some prior to photo)
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry, $10.45 prior to tax (please note that photo was taken after a hungry husband ate some prior to photo)

yfX9nHH8egoVUP9LyFibbg.text: Wow. I've had Japanese curry at ramen or sushi restaurants that dominate the Japanese food landscape in the United States and was never impressed with what I had been served. Now I know why. I should be going to shops that specialise in curry or just go home. Unfortunately, home only has one curry shop and its vegetarian selection seems to be limited.  The beer here is cheap ranging from $5.00-6.50 for a 22oz bottle. They have several options that are vegetarian or at least I hope so given I didn't know what the base was for the sauce. I had a spinach and scrambled egg curry, and it was so sick. The spice was healthy at the Level 6 that I ordered. It partially cleared out my stuffed sinuses. All of my other friends enjoyed their dishes including an interesting looking curry udon. The place opens late I look forward to returning here in my visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach curry with fried egg and tomatoes on top.

SPBvo8-RqZNVvVPNkEo_2g.text: Located in the Seoul Plaza right off Spring Mountain and Decatur, the parking space at this area is tight and very limited. I was entering from the west side and almost missed my turn but thanks to a fellow yelper, I saw Kung Fu Tea as a landmark and turn immediately to the correct plaza. Parking can be a drag when you have to wait for someone to leave. Fortunately when I made that turn, I saw a car coming out and that was a lucky find for a vacant spot.   When you enter the restaurant, there is a reminder sign that says wait to be seated. Kenta was my server, hopefully I heard and spelled his name right, if not then sorry! Seating took within seconds. He immediately brought a glass of water and gave me a couple minutes to look over the menu. I started with Oolong Tea ($1.25), opt for the Tofu Salad ($3.50) ordered Chicken Katsu-Don ($8.95) and request to add corn ($0.75). The Tofu salad has fresh tofu, grape tomatoes, corn, carrot, and thin slice of radish serve over crispy romaine lettuce. It comes with a sesame dressing and it makes the salad taste so delicious!   The Chicken Katsu-Don arrived within 10 minutes, very prompt service. It's chicken cutlet with scrambled egg, pickled turnip, corn, caramelized onion, topped with nori and serve over white rice. The chicken katsu is tender, it has a little sweetness to it but everything in this bowl taste savory and amazingly good! It's even better with that sesame dressing and I just had to ask for another. My hot tea was refilled and the server checked to see if there is anything else I need.   I'm really glad I came here for dinner. Service is quick and efficient. The server is nice to help bag the leftovers. This is a friendly, welcoming, and casual restaurant to dine. They have a bar area but I like sitting at the table. Nice background music and the people are lively. Prices are reasonable and the food is flavorful. I didn't feel rush to finish my hot tea. The food here is worth the visit and I would come back to try the Japanese curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu-Don with Egg, Pickled Turnip, Corn, Caramelized Onion, and Nori Topping
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu is fresh and the sesame dressing is very good!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu Salad and Sesame Dressing

LAmYFjr2MXj1YE8Lq4Vb6Q.text: I read a review written by Julianne T. ( Las Vegas) and decided to check this restaurant out. She's correct the parking lot is extremely small for the amount of businesses located in this U- shaped mall. Once you find a parking space you'll forget about the parking situation. We did wait a while to get seated, the restaurant was very busy when we showed up. It was worth the wait. We ordered Shrimp Curry , Pork Katsu Curry and Green Tea Cheesecake. Honestly, the cheese cake tasted like cheese cake I could not taste the green tea. It was good cake. The curry dishes were excellent. If you like Japanese style curry this place is a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GreenTea Cheesecake
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Curry

cTDYekPoTGmGU1X6E82GOQ.text: My friends and I just wanted somewhere cheap, tasty and fast while on the go. Japanese Curry Zen did just that. Seating was immediate, staff was efficient and the food came out quick. It's basically the Vegas equivalent to Hawaii's Curry House. You pick what types of curry you want, the spice level and your choice of toppings. I'm not a big fan of curry in general, but I find the curry here to be tasty and reasonable for what you pay. TONKATSU/PORK KATSU ($10.45, added 16-grains rice for $1.50): bit.ly/2OZber4 The pork was lean, yet tender and juicy. The panko crust had a nice almost buttery finish. I went with a spice level 7 for the curry, which was tolerable for me since I love all things spicy. The curry although tasty, was missing the bits of meat that I'm used to having when it comes to Japanese curry. The curry flavoring also wasn't as pronounced as I would've liked. FRIED OYSTERS ($3.60 for 3pc, $6 for 5pc): bit.ly/2yIa0WN I've had pretty gnarly-tasting fried oysters in the past, so we decided to just try the smaller 3pc portion. So.Damn.Good! Same buttery panko crust as the tonkatsu and the briny oysters were tasty and not at all fishy. CHICKEN KARAAGE ($4.50): bit.ly/2yIa0WN Seasoned well and juicy. The batter was crunchy and non-oily, as it should be when it comes to good karaage. Portions are small, so order two! They have a good selection of Japanese beers and sake, all reasonably priced. I tanked a bottle of 22oz Saporo for $3.75, hell ya! Hours: 11:30am-11pm Parking: Located within a shopping plaza. My friends and I had no problems finding two open stalls for our cars right away.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TONKATSU/PORK KATSU ($10.45, added 16-grains rice for $1.50): The pork was lean, yet tender and juicy. Panko crust had a nice buttery finish
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FRIED OYSTERS ($3.60 for 3pc, $6 for 5pc) and CHICKEN KARAAGE ($4.50).

5V8G3iEIa435z6v5Dnm6ZA.text: Absolutely baited again!   Surely a place with almost a thousand reviews, teetering at 4.5 stars would be good, right? Especially since it's the top of the list when you search Japanese Curry for Las Vegas?  Nah, unfortunately not.   We got the: 1)Tofu Katsu Curry (spicy level 5): -Despite being spicy level 5, the curry itself was super bland. -The tofu katsu was literally just breaded tofu with no seasoning. Maybe I've been spoiled by Curry House, which minces the tofu and seasons it before breading and frying, but this was a real drag to eat.   2) Chicken Katsu Curry (spicy level 4 and 7): -The spicy level 7 had a little bit of heat to it, but nothing much to write home about. -The level 4 was even blander than the level 5.   The only pro's to this place was the fact that it's much cheaper than other Japanese curry establishments (at least the one's I've been to) and the service was good.   Whenever I'm in Vegas again, I'll try other places first before giving this place a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Damage for 3 meals.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s literally just a slab of tofu that&#39;s breaded.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu Katsu Curry spicy level 5.

b3s2D9x1HYato6IPPPzxKA.text: The Japanese Curry is mouth wateringly delicious! I prioritize a stop here any time I cruise through Vegas.  Food: 5.0 of 5.0 Service: 4.0 of 5.0 Environment: 4.0 of 5.0  I'm not all that familiar with Japanese Curry. The simplicity of the dish but the subtlety of the flavors is shocking! Great spice combination with a decent variety of cutlet or tender (pieces) options as your protein.   I'd stay away from the tofu and order the veggies if meat isn't your thing. The tofu is a bit bland and uninspired :/ Other than this small downside you can't really go wrong. Order an egg and some cheese for added yumminess!

QAAcutvne4aqBASFMaKtlw.text: Came to the plaza for Kung fu tea and Sweets Raku and discovered this gem here. Affordable curry katsu! You can customize what you want and I ended up getting a chicken katsu curry with corn and cheese. The curry is slightly sweet and the chicken katsu is pounded thin with a panko crust.   You can also add in spice from level 1-10 (10 being the spiciest). I chose 2 and it had a slight spice - spicy enough but not as spicy where you're sweating and turning red. The server told us that level 2-3 is considered medium spice but I feel that's subjective. I can't imagine how spicy level 10 is!  Service was okay but understandable. It seemed like they were understaffed with only two servers in the front of the house but only one was actually competent.   As a side note, they offered a flavored sake jello drink which was super interesting. You could pick different flavors but I ended up choosing peach. It was something I've never had and loved - soft jello with a sparkling peach sake. You have to try this drink!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach sparkling jello &#34;shot&#34;
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry with cheese and corn

a_lIxC4zFwbEalvAXidgVg.text: Cheap and delicious? A rare and happy find for me!  The curry was tasty and spicy as advertised. If you like spicy food you can definitely eat in the 8-10 range. I found the 8 to be at the perfect spice for me personally. The pork katsu was perfectly crispy and the pork itself was great. I added cheese and corn and I highly reccomend it. I like the taste and added texture to the dish. I added an egg as well but it's not necessary.   Overall a great meal especially at the price. If you're tired of the food on the strip I highly reccomend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu - Egg, cheese, corn

uzsEsMdS8t3miVfeZE6oZw.text: We like coming to Monta Ramen which is located near this restaurant. So, we decided to give it a try for dinner. It's reasonably priced and a lot of young kids liked coming here.  The amount of curry sauce you get with each dish is outrageous.  It's like a cup of thick soup.  Hubby had the pork katsu curry with spinach which was mixed into the curry,$13.  I tried the fried oysters, 3 for $3.60. They were delicious and I wish they offered it as an option with the curry meals and not just an appetizer. My chicken katsu curry,spicy 2 was really spicy. Next time I'll get level 1.  The panko batter was crispy and crunchy, $10.20.  Another option for us when we visit Vegas again

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu with spinach curry

q7ZDK3nfp5DIytneZricag.text: The curry is pretty solid, and you can add additional items a la cart as well to make it an extra yummy dish.  They're fast and efficient of getting people in and out, but wished the service was a little better.  Not once did our server check on us if we were ok or needed anything else.   The check was given without asking if we wanted dessert... the mango cheesecake sounded good, but sadly we didn't get the chance.     Advice:  don't forget to add the Fukujin red pickles since they don't come with the curry.  And the Takoyaki is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_lt78ATtM1eCiZNhNON83A.text: Curry Fact: His full name is Wardell Stephen Curry II.  Oh wait, wrong "Curry."  Oh well.  Here at Curry Zen, their recipe is comprised of over ten different spices. Each of the spices has their own unique holistic qualities such as warming of the bode, aiding in cell turnover, improving appetite, alleviating fatigue, and acting as an anti-oxidant. Very cool!  This place reminds me of California's Curry House. All they need is some corn pottage soup and they would be set! I had the Croquette Curry and added Kurobata Sausage. I also got to try the Japanese Meatloaf Curry with the addition of Spam. Both were at Level Two spice and both were extremely satisfying. It was the perfect way to start our trip in Vegas and I would not hesitate coming back. I love making Japanese curry at home but Curry Zen is so much more convenient. If only they had a location in Arizona! I also had the peach sparkling sake jelly drink. It was interesting but I wouldn't get it again.  It's a small cozy eatery that fills up fast. The staff here work efficiently with no extra fuss. I like it! I want to come back and try my curry with cheese!  Note: Pass on the takoyaki.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki and the peach sparkling sake jelly drink.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese meatloaf curry with Spam.

Qb7OhrU12xiRhsuu9qMiYw.text: I really don't like giving "okay" reviews, however I really like the employees that work here and the taste of their curry. I've been there quite a few times and every time I order the same thing..chicken katsu curry. Every time I have been there their chicken is dry. It's my favorite thing to eat with curry and I wish their chicken was more moist. Other than that the price is great and so is the customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry. Nom Nom!

P0dWqITwW02McaT5FLIm2Q.text: I'm a huge fan of Japanese Curry! It was a must that we stopped by here when we were in Vegas this past weekend. We came on a Thursday during lunch time and it was packed. Luckily, we were seated right away! The staff here were very welcoming and provided excellent service.   The wife and I shared the classic Chicken Katsu Curry ($9.95) with a spice level of 5 (scale of 1 to 10). We had just eaten at Monta Ramen and walked over here to try it out. The food came out scorching hot, so we knew it was freshly made. The curry here is thick, flavorful, and has a slight hint of sweetness to it. I don't really care for the sweetness, but that's just me. The presentation is a little boring since it doesn't come with any toppings. But it's a simple dish that will easily fill you up. Give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qGh1EkjpTeXrOxGOASwKvg.text: 4.5 stars  My friend saw this place when we all went to get a foot massage a few days prior and wanted to try them out. There were people waiting outside to dine there so that was what struck his interest. I love curry so I was down to give them a shot. Usually busy restaurants have good food and in this case, it was True.   When we arrived, the place was busy with their lunch rush. Something we accounted for before coming because my friend had to go straight to the airport to catch his flight after lunch. It didn't take long to get seated. We had a chance to look at the menu while waiting so we knew what to order.   I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry with Cheese and Spinach Level 10. Portions were good but the curry wasn't spicy at all. I really enjoyed my meal even though the spice was disappointing. We washed down our meals with a couple of beers. What an awesome meal to send him off on. Great spot and I'll be back next time I'm craving curry in Vegas.

cVWzsCTJGd5pGOJsNs2qSg.text: I've only had Japanese curry once in downtown Los Angeles but Zen beat that meal by a mile.  I like that they have you pick the spiciness you want.  When I ordered the chicken cutlet curry, I asked for a spice level of 7.  My server was a bit hesitant and suggested perhaps 4 and asked if I liked spicy food.  I stayed with the 7.  Next time I'll get 8.    The servers enter your order on a tablet so the order is sent to the kitchen from your table.  I was brought a glass of water which was refilled once.  It took about 5 minutes and the curry was brought to the table.  Besides the basic curry, chicken, and rice, I added the topping of cheese and a fried egg.  Mixing the curry, cheese, and egg into the meat and the rice was my first step in enjoying this meal.  Once that was done, I took my spoon and started to enjoy the dish.  The spice level was OK.  It had a nice tang to it but it could have been spicier.  The chicken is breaded with just the right amount and cooked so that no knife is needed.  The spoon broke the chicken pieces quite nicely.  A couple of things:  this is a small restaurant so you may have a wait.  There is a sign in sheet at the door when you enter.  This plaza is filled with Asian restaurants and parking can be a pain.  Luckily, I found an empty spot.  I'll be back.  It's close to Las Vegas Little Theatre where I often go and I'll stop here for dinner again!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cutlet curry with cheese and fried egg.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking toward the kitchen.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front.  The entrance is to the right of this photo.

yiJKVwSAG2P4OFpNxYMybw.text: Great food, I always go for the veggie curry. It's delicious. Great service every time we go, we're always seated and served quickly with a smile and the food is always fresh and hot. Definitely go here if you want great food at a great price!!

MYWScJciyvJB4iRfGSyVVg.text: I do like the fact meet can have some fat in it but it's still good. I love the curry souce.  If you love meet with fat then you won't like here then you should get vegii curry. Great services!! Nice people!!

nuCrVUWVWGh1cSjFdQENbQ.text: The pork katsu was very juicy and my veggies in the curry had the right springy done-ness. And, yes the curry does have a nice depth of flavor. That is where all the good stuff tapers off. Yelp has this place listed as one $ but with 2 people, sharing 1 drink, our bill was $48. If you get the basic chicken katsu its one $, the rest, and I mean THE REST is all EXTRA. I ordered spicy level 5 and my friend ordered 8.  Our spicy levels were extra charges and it gets more expensive the spicier you get! I think  spice level 8 is 35 cents extra. Which reminds me, they switched our spice levels and I was almost crying trying to eat my curry while his had almost no spice...we were in no mood to voice our concern as we were just hungry. The takoyaki felt a bit under done, the 'meatloaf' is more like a soft burger patty and cheese and corn cost 75 cents extra, each.... not worth the extra price (the corn was COLD). Over all I would love it if I could just get the curry sauce to go and fend for myself. Oh and the 16 grain rice was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G if you like rice similar to the purple Korean rice. *TIPS - Don't go when it's busy (we went when it was slow and still felt a bit rushed) AND tell your mom you love her.

tlPdg5NlOl9w0rC_bRYmyw.text: Decent.  But I do like Tonkotsu Kiyoshi better.  I got the pork katsu curry and my husband got the chicken katsu curry.  Both our protein was dry.  The curry was good, but the rice was a tad dry for me.  Again, I compared this pork katsu durry to Tonkotsu's and both times, I prefer Tonkotsu Kiyoshi.  Service was great, but not enough for me to return if I can get to Tonkotsu.  Also, there are toppings that one can add to the curry.  My husband tried the raisins and almonds.  He liked neither, but it's cool that they offer it.

OwcYAZ445uvKcv3C97DwfQ.text: First off, I LOVE Japanese Curry & usually go to the one on Rainbow but coming to this location was the one of the worst decisions I've made. I came with a party of 9, and everything seemed to go smoothly. Most of us ordered then those who came about 10 minutes later ordered after. Cool, we're waiting and plates begin to come slowly. But my sister and I noticed that the two curry udons that we ordered weren't coming out, but we waited patiently. EVERYONE else got their plates and the waiter & waitress mentioned nothing about the udon. So I asked them about it and they just said "oh," so the two udon bowls come out and they're watery? Apparently my sister likes that but everytime I've gone to the other location, it was nice THICK curry. In addition, I ordered a spicy level 6 and it was not spicy AT ALL. Maybe they forgot about it and rushed it? Who knows.. But whatever, we were just hungry and wanted to eat then go home. So we ask for the bill, and mind you, we previously mentioned that we were going to pay separately.. We wait about 10 minutes for her to bring the check, then she tells us to write numbers so that we can tell her how we split it. So I did and I handed it back. We wait 20 more minutes for the bill to come out and she separated it by entree saying that she has no time to split it the way I wrote it and said to just combine the paper checks and she'll ring it up like that. So she brings back the cards about 5 minutes later and my card is no where to be found then mentions that there is a $8 minimum AFTER the fact that most of our party paid. Luckily my sister, whose bill was only around $12, was able to combine their checks because there was a complication. So I bring their check back to the register area because the waiter & waitress didn't bother to check on us. I ask for my card and our server, Yuki, told us that she didn't know where my card was. So whatever, it stacked at the bottom of the trays. She told me to sit at my table because she didn't have time to ring me up right there. We waited longer. So she brought my check back along with my sister's.. My bill was fine but as for my sister's, she was charged for more than what she was supposed to pay for. Her bill was only supposed to be around $18, but they charged her almost double that amount. Wtf? I was fed up with this place. Yuki told me that I was supposed to say we were splitting it, which I did, and that they're too busy so she couldn't take care of us and we must wait. So another person comes in later on, named Yuta, and he clarifies and resolves the issue. But apparently we still had unpaid entrees on our check so what did she change the other people? We put the exact checks with our form on payment in separate trays so she couldn't get mixed up? The other waiter didn't even bother to help us. Should've eaten at Hwaro or Monta Ramen instead.  All in all, WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. Would not recommend this location. Go to the one of Rainbow if you want to be charged the right amount and want good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watery curry udon. Ordered Spicy level 6, wasn&#39;t spicy at all.

AVOz0qdk72bwFxKvvkbISg.text: I am OBSESSED with this place. In my eyes, this place can do no wrong. They make the chicken katsu #4 hotness the same every time I come in. If I don't know where to eat, I KNOW I will have a good experience here. Please never leave me, Japanese Curry Zen. I want a world where my future children can enjoy you :)

Z2qViDaMtRhiSkreVp1ImA.text: The biggest thing I miss about living in Japan is access to really good curry rice, and Zen's is by far the best I've found this side of the Pacific. The other things on the menu are okay, but the reason to come here is a big plate of curry rice.  Some tips if you're new to Japanese curry rice: - Don't use chopsticks. In Japan it's always eaten with a spoon. Plus it's impossible to get enough of the delicious rich curry sauce with chopsticks. - Get a topping. Tonkatsu (pork cutlet) is traditional, but I love the chicken katsu. Try to get a bit of rice, curry sauce, and topping in every spoonful. - Add a spicy level. The base sauce is complex and tasty, but even a level 1-2 spicy (out of ten) adds more depth without much heat. (If it helps to calibrate, it takes a level 5 spicy to get my nose running.)   It's super busy right at the lunch and dinner hour, but has immediate seating the rest of the time. (If you have to wait, stop by Kung Fu Tea next door.) With all the businesses in a little square, parking is tight most of the time, but well worth it.

gmN9SjxE6yBdJG6IP2ANng.text: Delicious curry! Watch out for the spice level! I get a number 3 and it's super spicy already! I'm gonna try number 2 next time and see how that goes. A guy next to us got a number 10 and wasn't phased, I don't know how he was eating it lol. Definitely try the takoyaki here too! It's delicious. For the curry, I usually get the chicken katsu with additional beef but I recently tried the 5 piece kushi and it was great! It was skewers of fried mushrooms, quail eggs, shrimp, zucchini, and chicken katsu. It's nice if you want a good variety! Don't forget to ask for the pickled ginger. It helps balance out all that spiciness! I have to remember to save room next time for their green tea cheesecake which looked amazing! Their service has been consistently great and fast whenever we've come. Give it a try if the line at monta is too long! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried shumai
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki!!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu with cheese and corn

9WzMlsQKvwWGXV1HmdDugw.text: This place is great. Went for Udon next door but wait was to long. So thought what the heck lets try this place. Use to curry all the time when I was stationed in Japan. But as years pass you forget how good it is. This place was fast, easy to order, and quick as we were on lunch break. Bring the kids back on my time they'll love it as I do.

NeywcGI7D8fTXMqubxepRg.text: This is the best homemade Japanese curry we've ever had. Everything comes together perfectly: the fry cook does their job admirably (GBD without overcooking the contents), the homemade curry is a perfect melding of flavors, and the service is prompt. Surprisingly, even the hot tea from an oolong tea bag was pretty good.  There aren't a ton of seats so you might end up waiting a few minutes, but be patient, it's worth the wait.  PS: I'm not sure what it is about this little strip mall, but it's densely packed with a ton of 4+ star Yelp reviews. There's Monta Ramen, an Asian fusion restaurant called Big Wong, a snow-ice place, a boba tea place amusingly called Kung Fu Tea, and the one-and-only Raku.  This may be one of the densest Yelp stars per square foot I've ever seen.

nQYUw8dKJ2fUUwHrgWCA3w.text: Nom, nom, nom!!!  The curry is out of this world, add some cheese and they definitely aren't shy about it! The tonkatsu is juicy and tender and their other offerings are just as perfect.. I usually switch it up every time I go.   I officially crave this on the regular.

fhcDuVBQb711gDDYB6GkZQ.text: Partied too hard?  You know, dinner, ultra lounge, casino gaming for pre-gaming, a club, an after hours club.  Mobile filled with numbers of people called "the hot one", "the hot hot one", "the hottest one".  Enter Japanese Curry Zen; cure for a hangover and tragically lighter money clip.  The dish is simple.  Rice with plain curry topped with mostly deep fried goodies.  Ordering: 1.  Choose the size:  small $3.75, regular $5.95, or extra rice plus $1.00. 2.  Choose the heat level (this is Japanese not Thai.  J-Level 10 = T-Level 4 AND the taste is altered). 3.  Select toppings (braised beef, chicken, pork or tofu katsu, deep fried shrimp, potato croquette, or vegetables); $2.00 - $6.50. 4.  Done.  Typical Japanese curry (viscous, vegetable base with a complex, aromatic blend of Indian spices and a gentle heat).  No coconut milk, no painful chilies in the mix.  Everyday quality short grain white or brown rice.  The braised beef, tender, fall apart goodness.  The fried items, crunchy on the outside, correctly cooked on the inside.  The veg, cooked to death, very soft and lending their flavor to the mix.  A single order of any topping is enough to fill most up.  Typical offering of pickled veg and raisins at the table.  Multiple visits, very consistent.  A simple meal, done right.

2WjQGe0HvRJxz3NH4g-muQ.text: LOVE this place. The curry is super spicy and burns your mouth in a pleasurable way ;).  But foreal, the rice here is always fluffy.  The Panko breading on what I've tried so far is crispy, golden, and hot.  The curry itself-- so deep and flavorful; one of the most authentic places I've been to. The service is great and food comes out fast! Just be warned: I love eating spicy stuff but I mean a 3-5 is like "burn your face off" to me. Still, one of my favorites Japanese restaurants in Vegas!

_XcdrdWw73FbMM73ew2xBQ.text: Craving Japanese Curry? Stuck on the strip? Get in a cab over to this place, stat.  This place is relatively cheap, depending on what you order...  - Chicken Curry Katsu: Sizable piece of chicken katsu, nicely breaded, loads of rice, flavorful curry. ~$9  - Pork Tender: If you're going to get pork, get the pork tender. It is MUCH greater than the regular pork katsu, and only a few dollars more. ~$12.50  - Spinach Curry: Yep, this is the real deal. It has a nice kick to it and is a fantastic option if you're not looking for any meat. ~$8  Waitstaff was attentive. The wait doesn't seem to be terribly long. Adding this to the complex probably makes this the best complex in vegas (Sweets Raku, Raku, and Monta Ramen)

f7qq9bzHJz-HVEwWPT_iag.text: My first and second time coming here this past week - cannot stress enough how much I've come to LOVE this place.. I am not a huge fan of curry. But wow, I absolutely love the curry here!!!!!! IT WAS SO GOOD THE FIRST TIME I COULD NOT STOP THINKING ABOUT IT AND HAD TO HAVE IT BEFORE I LEFT TOWN. I had the chicken katsu, a must have ! And I had tofu too. Curry is exceptional. Service is great here too. There's one server in particular who is soft spoken but he is so very nice!! They are really on top of things... Please do yourself a favor and go here!!

m3OaWneXv8am-pESVwcobA.text: To say this place was AWESOME is an understatement.... It was THE best curry I have ever had. Glad I read the other posts about the level of spice-- my hubby and I both ordered a level 3 and was perfect.   We've been searching for a place similar to the CURRY HOUSE in Hawaii and I'm happy to day we have found it. Love love love this place!

jNrkyFGKd8kvl3tte_NChQ.text: Yummmmmmy! So many options to customize your curry, however 9 times out of 10 I will order spam katsu as my topping. Love it!

Xmy0YcKrrIEJukw4BmWUHw.text: We ordered the Katsu Curry, Oyakodon, Tofu Salad, fried Shumai, and Kushi Teri. The tofu salad was drenched in sesame dressing so I'd definitely ask for it on the side. The fried shumai was so fried it barely had any life left but our son loved it. Of course. We all liked the Kushi Teri - was the favorite out of everything we ordered. The oyakodon was pretty average and had no complaints. The Katsu curry was lacking something in flavor but couldn't put my finger on it. Katsu itself was yummy and crunchy but I feel like I can make better curry at home... and my curry isn't even that great. This isn't to say it tasted bad, I think I was just expecting something better than what we got. Probably won't be back even though the service was pretty attentive and friendly.

Epu2bHsxxUL2wrAtnvzjXg.text: DEElicious chicken katsu with spinach curry!! The rakkyo and radish are must have accompaniments!! This place rivals Hurry Curry on Sawtelle!! In fact, they surprise them because they are able to titrate the spice factor 1-10!! I got 3/10 and this was the perfection a that I would beg for at Hurry Curry. Can't imagine what 5-10 would be like!! Also another plus, plus, plus is that they have Asahi on tap!! This place was sooooo good that it's still on my mind!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most AMAZING chicken katsu with spinach curry!!

sKHbihLvFo1X6ivZwwoTgQ.text: Saw a friend bookmarking this place so I sent him a message through Yelp; one day later, I am here at Japanese Curry Zen with my sis and friends. The moment I sat down, I noticed right away how clean the table was. It was so clean and shiny, it glistened under the fluorescent lighting.   They have a very limited menu consisting of several fried meat/protein options to go with your rice curry. I got to taste the vegetable curry, chicken and quail curry as well as my dish, the tofu curry. I think my favorite is the vegetable curry since it was the most flavorful out of the three. I also tried the coffee jelly and loved it! All of the items we ordered were very very delicious and well deserved the high ratings from everyone.   Come here if you're in the mood for some comfort food. Don't forget to try the yellow (medium spicy) spice mix on the table. It smelled so darn good I wish I could take the whole bottle home.

wfG_ESQk_UYOhk1spHSE2g.text: Wanted something with rice and this hit the spot. Got curry with chicken and vegetables. I would come again if I had the time.

3ojnLRzjGuFwfHwfWNPJDQ.text: Great food, simple traditional dishes with super fast great service. Love love love this place. Everyone should check it out!

F8hy1KLowIWxkrFXZtDnZQ.text: Really good curry and they know how to make it spicy. I usually get level 8 spicy and I'm sitting there crying because it is spicy lol. If you can handle the heat try to spice level I eat. I order the Katsu and add beef to my curry and it is filling. When you look at the amount doesn't look too big but afterwards you are full and satisfied.

dtKFqlGOOFj07hscbvQVeQ.text: I went last wed after I got off of work.  The place was very quiet and clean.  The server was extremely nice and the cooks were super awesome.  I took my food to go.  They were very fast and they have a great selection of toppings and the curry has a great flavor which is absolutely perfect.  This is the curry place that I will go for my curry fix.  By far the best curry place in vegas.

mB31CMKzO0FERWQ3Ih7DYw.text: Since I was a young kid I have always always always loved japanese curry. The only place I knew that had this type of curry was in California ans it was called curry house. I LOVE THIS PLACE I dont know how else to say it lol

Ek3Yz8YY8dKP7ffDq-cW8g.text: Excellent service great food cant go wrong will definitely be coming back the beef curry and pork katsu was delish

VJKxubw4FAhVBLTiOpd9UQ.text: I love this place even better now that I can get my curry spicy, instead of just adding the spices they have on the tables

mQhSWAZuLthj-xtQql4WDQ.text: Simply the best! I always get chicken Katsu curry with veggies spicy level 5. So goood. Service is great and you're greeted arriving and leaving which is nice. I wish I lived closer so I could eat here more often!

BMrNuilkxqs0_K6ewamATw.text: I have been looking for good Japanese Curry for quite a few years. Curry Zen is exactly as I remember it. First the curry is delicious, and you can order traditional curry alone, or throw in some chicken, fried tofu, or even quail egg skewers on the dish. You can choose white, brown, or a multi-grain rice options along with the curry. They even have curry pan, which I look forward to giving a try next time I stop in. The restaurant was just recently remodeled, which has given it some more moving space, as the seating was a bit tight before. The folks who run it are very nice, and the service is good. This place fills my Japanese Curry urges hands down!

GcQ27qSH7IsWhO7pm1yw2Q.text: The best Japanese curry in town.   Always great service and delicious food.  The 16 grain rice is awesome as is just about everything else.   Not spicy unless you like it that way,  choose spicy level 1 ti 10.  I usually go with a #4 or 5, gives it just the right amount of kick. Give this place a try, you won't be sorry.

NqhotRlrW4FPH4kN2YUTOg.text: This place is awesome! Great food and service! It's a little far away from me but it's worth the drive.

zQafyvRhKkXSN9bEexqTAg.text: This place is the closest to CoCos :) They renovated and has much more seating room than before.

y0Ygb_6X-s4B69tp6sx9BQ.text: The wife and I rolled up into this place as we were in the mood for some curry.  It was overcast and a little cold in Las Vegas so this sort of homey cuisine was desired.  The menu here is quite simple with lots of options.  We both ordered curry, but chose different add-ons.  The spice levels range from 1-10.  I ordered a 3 and it was slightly too hot for me, but the food was so good that I could not stop eating.  It was nice that they had extra napkins for me to take care of my perspiration.  This is a great place to check out if you are in Sin City!!!

vn3_K1-5TQvlQL8qVmfykw.text: Excellent curry! Came here for lunch, service was fast and very friendly! I had chicken curry, it was so moist inside and crunchy outside! Will definitely come back and will recommend this place to everyone!!!

glHSFumtVmmXuxagLwc5YA.text: Japanese curry is different from your typical Thai curry. Don't expect it to be spicy, but expect your curry to be hot and fresh from this tiny restaurant. I always order the chicken cutlet. I like it because the chicken always has a clean feeling to it compared to pork. They use white meat too! The sauce is thick and flavorful, and it's a great cure for a hangover. This restaurant is reasonably priced because the food has good quality. The rice is not cheap and mushy. I love it. Their staff here is always friendly and humble. They seem to enjoy what they do. I love seeing happy workers. I have big hopes for this restaurant, and so far they've been really consistent. I am a regular. Lastly they have free wifi.

LreioCqfy57_6c5NtgdWkw.text: Food is very good! Curry reminds me of Jamaican style curry. The chicken katsu was perfect and the portion for price is terrific. Highly recommend.

v6AJQRs4TRtHf4h2Dqut7w.text: I was literally dragged here for lunch by Curry Zen addicts, and I now know why it is so addictive. I have always been ambivalent towards curry, but the Japanese curry served here transcends traditional american food palates, and the 1 to 10 heat scale curry options makes it safe for even the most delicate of  tasters. So delicious. One of our party was allergic to peanuts, and as they use peanut oil, was unable to eat.
