Our waitress was OUTSTANDING and I thought she would literally cry that she couldn't serve her, but accommodated our friend in every possible way. Service was far and above anything I would expect and the food was excellent.

jITxiilqdOg41tCUE4Rp6w.text: At first my friend told me that it's not that good and it's expensive to eat here and today I went to there and tried it by myself! They have really really good customer service!! They alway smile : ) it really make me feel good to eat here! I definitely will come to here again!

EsHRhACuR628G1bQyKOG-A.text: I don't understand why it's 4 and a half stars. This place does not taste like real Japanese curry. I could have made a better one at home with a pre-made curry base. Even my mother in law from Japan stated that it tasted like they used pre-made powder to make the curry. The dish was not presentable either. The dish looked really plain. They didn't serve any side salad like Curry House, which they serve a small side salad and corn soup along with the curry. The service was not great either. When we arrived, we waited for over 30 minutes for a table of 3 even though there was a table of 2 open, which I didn't think we would be seated there anywase because it would not fit all three of us. When a table opened up, they split the table to serve the 3 of us and a group of 4 people that came much later. They seated us on a table that was originally for only 2 people while the group behind us sat at a bigger table that seated for 4. My husband mentioned that they could have just seated us at the other small table of 2 that was open the whole time we waited the 30 minutes rather than wait 30 minutes to be seated at a different small table of 2. We asked why we couldn't have the bigger table for 4 even though we had 3 people and they responded that they wanted to seat the bigger group at the same time as us. We waited over 30 minutes for our seats while this other group that literally came through the door waited no more than 5 minutes. I also didn't like how the waiters had to squeeze past my seat to get to the other tables because I was seated on the side of the small tiny table that was really only for table of 2. I had to squeeze myself as close to the table as possible for the waiters to have some space to pass me. I really tried my best even though I was pregnant. We had a difficult time eating at this small table with our big plates. I'm pretty clumsy so I'm glad that I didn't drop my dish or water. I will never come back to this place and I recommend that you do the same!

JSLc6VL6I0RRAIw9zzMozQ.text: All I need to say is that I finished the entire plate. This place is simply AMAZING and they make to feel welcomed the second you walk in. They greet you, seat you, and serve the best japanese curry!

HqCpJPcIhOhlhljy7BTe6w.text: Went there the second week they opened and thought it was "ok." I'm used to the Curry House in Little Tokyo in LA. The place is tiny and cramped. Portions are a little small for the money and no veggies to go along with the meal. We ordered the sausage (tiny hot dogs) with brown rice and chicken katsu with brown rice. About an hour later, we were hungry again and had to satiate our hunger with a nice order of Carne Asada Nachos from Faustos. I wish they would offer options for veggies, pasta, and a hamburger patty.  One the plus side, the staff here is SUPER nice.

IWuquYi8HLdO_qNvxf8gEg.text: Amazing little place to eat. Great people who give great service. I've become a regular and they truly care and get to know their customers. I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cZQtwlR4b6HIVrqeaY1tCw.text: First off, I need to say I am not exactly a fan of Japanese curry. I prefer Thai curry over Japanese curry. With that said, I'll try and write this review as best I can based on the Japanese curry that I've had.  Japanese Curry Zen is actually a really nice/cozy place. It's small, so I suggest you go there during 'off' hours to avoid potential waits. The ordering process was fairly easy. A simple menu and a selection of additional meats to add on without putting a hole in your wallet =] The wait time for the food was normal, and the portions were decent. My friend ordered the pork cutlet and I ordered the chicken cutlet with a side of sausages. The sausages and the chicken cutlet was REALLY yummy. My friend's pork was slightly overcooked, and therefore was a bit harder to chew. The curry itself blended in really well, and I believe it was one of the best tasting Japanese curry I've tried =]  On each of the tables were two types of seasoning, some pickled ginger (i think it was ginger), and some PICKLED GARLIC... I haven't seen a place that served pickled garlic on the side in AGES!  I would definitely come back again, for a quick yet filling meal =]

lEg6AkLcSKYNdwkcJXt9Hg.text: Finally a good curry place where I feed my katsu addiction! There's just something about breaded and fried pork thats smother in a warm aromatic curry sauce that is so comforting.  They have all the ingredients to have a successful delicious curry joint. Fried meats, a pretty tasty curry recipe, and limited seating (the longer the wait, the more delicious the food). The restaurant itself is very small, so it might not be the best place for large groups.

u-2ocYw2eGUcGyHHoc9f6w.text: Straight up Best Curry in Vegas!! The flavor of their curry is phenomenal. I usually get chicken katsu, shrimp katsu, kurobuta sausage and/or corn. I LOVE their pickled condiments!! I feel so bad sometimes because I can and I have ate the whole jar before! I'm not sure what the red one is but based on flavor I think it is red daikon- japanese radish. The other one is pickled pearl onions. Oh and I love spicy anything and my first time here I ordered spicy level 6 (1-10) and omg it was really SPICY! I still ate it because it was sooo good but I had to have water and pickled daikon after each bite hence why I ate the whole jar once lol. Now I order level 3...which is STILL PRETTY SPICY but just the right amount for me.

mtWYBplrk4N_WDFC8_Xqkw.text: The Beef Curry & Spam Cutlet was tasty. I'll be back for some more.

VwS97DXgLKe2dCoCNVPoZA.text: Located in the Seoul Shopping Center, which should be called a Japanese Shopping Center by the way since there are way more Japanese restaurants (Raku, Monta, Trattoria Nakamura-Ya and Kuboto) there than Korean.   I tried the chicken cutlet curry and it was good. The curry sauce was really flavorful and not too spicy. The cutlet had a crispy batter and it was tender on the inside. The side pickled onion was my favorite. Sweet and a little sour, no lingering raw onions smell or taste.   My bf had the shrimp curry and it was also good. It was a good size shrimp and was not over cooked.   As what the other Yelpers mentioned on their reviews, I hope they add vegetable options in their menu. Veggie goes well with curry!  Decent price for this kind of food, amount of serving and location.

5CTlbRaSVKapCgE0StL2Bg.text: This place is seriously amazing! Super fresh and authentic Japanese curry. I love the beef curry with chicken katsu... but the curry udon is also made to perfection. Everything is delicious and priced reasonably as well. Overall... if u like curry... u will love it here!!

pGNiq3dKD9pt5Yvc7dX-Mw.text: Yummy! I am an islander, so we cook with curry also but I have to say....Japanese curry has stolen my heart. It's so creamy and delicious. I can't wait to go back and have more. The service is also great! They are very attentive! This place has made me into a huge fan! Yay!

DjoGt23fHR4E1S-IhC1dYA.text: The curry here is delicious.  No wonder the place is full.  But honestly, all the restaurants in Chinatown are full of patrons! It is possible that all trillion of them deserve a try.  The menu is pretty focused here.  For appetizer we ordered the tako yaki, which are fried balls of mixed squid pieces, tempura bitsies and vegetables.  There is a mayo-like sauce on top.  I was not a big fan, but my husband liked it very much.  It is a very traditional Japanese street food.   Then I ordered the spinach curry, my husband ordered the vegetable curry, and we split tofu katsu, which are panko crusted blocks of tofu.  Everything was extremely extremely delicious.  We only waited a few minutes for the table.  Other people with bigger parties were waiting longer.  There was no one really hosting guests, and there is no space inside to wait, so we all stood around for a while, until finally we started writing our names on the pad and waiting outside.  You can request the spice level you want from 1 to 10.  I ordered a 2, and it was medium spicy.  I told the waiter a 6, and he said, "6 is not medium.  2 is medium."  And he was right. The entrees were about $10 apiece.

uK6So9e4HmXCX5iMfbxeeQ.text: I absolutely love Japanese style curry and this place has to be the best! My best friend's father is an amazing Japanese chef and his curry was the my favorite. He moved back to Japan and I just wasn't able to find curry as good as his until I tried this place out back when it first opened. I've been hooked ever since! I've been using yelp for 2 years now but realized that I never signed up and left reviews for places! I'd rave about them on my FB though! hahahaa! This place is super affordable and highly recommended.

qkUhW8Yqnac6dcGSIedwXg.text: The service and good here was very good.    The place is kind of  small but it gives me  the impression of how I would imagine a curry house in Japan to be.  I ordered the chicken cutlet curry dish.  The curry sauce and the chicken cutlet went very well together.  The curry sauce had lots of flavor and a hint of spicy.  The chicken cutlet was cooked perfect.   It very juicy, crispy, and flavorful.   The service was great.  The server was very attentive and checked on us a few times.  Even the chef asked us how everything was.  Definitely my favorite local Japanese curry place to eat yet!  Check it out!

M4CFI6EqgHiTT7Sa_l8hMw.text: went here with my boyfriend a while back, and he loves it! he's from the Bay Area and we plan on going here at least once every time he visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken katsu 3 (top), and 1 (bottom).  favorite katsu curry place.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken katsu. my boyfriend prefers chicken over the pork too.

mD4fp4hlV_-wK4OoajRV2w.text: I've been having the ugliest craving for Curry House CoCo Ichibanya, but because the closest one is 263 miles away, I thought I'd save up on gas and try this place out. At Japanese Curry Zen, I experienced great service, just as many other reviewers have, but the chicken cutlet I ordered was dry and bland, and the curry wasn't anything extraordinary. I understand that CoCo's is a franchise and it wouldn't be fair to compare this local dine-in to it, but I've also had better curry at other local Japanese/Island restaurants for half the price.  They DO serve a mini bowl, so if you just want to try it, go ahead and order that instead.

tRax0tQBe_CPuc6bA80OsQ.text: Finally!  A Japanese Curry place in Las Vegas.  I really liked the curry.  It had a nice mix of spices.  My only complaint would be that I think the curry and the chicken/pork katsu I ordered with it could use more salt.  If you want to under salt them for peoples' tastes that's fine, I guess, but put salt shakers on the table. I was a little surprised you don't get the veggies in the curry that I'm used to.  Also, didn't see an option for some sort of veggie in the curry.  Guess you have to order a salad. Still...this is just quibbling.  This place is delicious.  If you like Japanese Curry, and you'd be crazy not to, this place will be on your regular spots of places to eat.

7664aP0BTVJk7OB7bCycEA.text: Incredible! Level 6 spicy was perfect. The curry was so thick and flavorful. I will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

1QBQDQsNlWOJlOv8oj2ahw.text: My cousin took me here for dinner last night and I am hooked! The best curry I've ever tried. The portions are generous and the curry itself is very smooth. I got the pork tenderloin with a side of tofu katsu. Everythibg was delicious. The tofu salad was bomb too.

X5HFPkhzIjQ3TKaLonzezw.text: Upon entry I am always immediately seated. The restaurant does get busy but the service and attentiveness of the staff is always on point.   I was sad that they ran out of takoyaki and gyoza and hopefully they will be available in the near future. I always get the pork katsu curry and add corn and sometimes cheese. Delicious.

xlb_4z75mmRbvZsPtEJnxw.text: What a GEM! i love to eat here for many reasons. they owners and employees are genuine, thoughtful and sweet. the curry is delicious. the new menu has spice levels you can add to make hotter. I love the list of all of their spices. it explains many health benefits of curry spice. I even came here with a group of friends for my birthday back in May.  try the coffee jello, i like it with extra milk! i feel major inner joy when i think about zen curry.  this place is great even down to how they serve water--clean tasting water with perfect-ish square cubes.   Please eat here, its for your health!

SFqu2oNbipaLd8A1EmBQpg.text: Best katsu chicken katsu curry! Good service and great food. Will definitely be returning.

XPnsvsxeW6ekv7oRK07IRQ.text: One of the best curry place i have ever eaten, my family came here pretty much every week, sometimes twice a week, the side dish like tofu salad and tako yaki are bomb, toping with corn and chesse make the curry taste more ever better. The only thing I am dislike is that they took off one of the dish call curry puff cake, i believe, and it was so good but some how they took it off the menu. Their customer service is great every-time we visit. We will be back for sure again this week.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tako Yaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable and fried tofu curry.

_7freDCAvh3O4O5KH2vO_w.text: A girlfriend and I decided to stop here before the flight back home. We weren't hungry when we first walked in, in fact we didn't even plan on eating.  But the nostalgic scent of curry in the air...oh man...it sat us right now.  She ordered some katsu curry and I ordered a vegetable curry. Again, I wasn't hungry. Once I had a bite of that curry-drizzled rice, I couldn't stahp!!  The food was delicious! I licked my plate clean and best of all...their water was fresh. (You know some restaurants just serve you tap water, this place was refreshing).  I can't wait to go back! Seriously, great food in Las Vegas is often found off the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry!

Q4G9yM6tVl4nP0K52yY-LQ.text: 3 was spicy ass shyt  It wAs more like 10 lol  I suggest no spice but it was good  Home cooked type food

eGnEQ1oWSQPE-CC31Wf_zA.text: Great curry if you want authentic Japanese version.  Reminds me of Coco curry in Tokyo

dx3eY2-7Zi78eBsYnjAUvA.text: 5 STARS! Quality for a great price! At around $10 a plate, if you love curry you should try this place out for such a good price! Highly recommend the chicken katsu curry, I tried it at spice level 3 and it's perfect. If you ever find yourself at a long wait at Monta Ramen next door, you can always try curry zen if you're to eager to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry, Spice Level 3

k0YxP2EBK4ATTRXSujKn_A.text: Since I grew up in San Francisco I was used to having my Japanese curry taste a certain way. I have tried many curry places around town and they have all let me down. Until I came here, I have not looked back.   Their curry flavor is almost like the curry places from back home. It is filling and hearty. The food is delicious and they have different items to chose from. It is also affordable. The servers are always friendly and quick to say hi. Since the restaurant is small, they sometimes get busy. The wait can be a long time. Overall this place is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dg_3rpkKjkqDIoUwb8MeGA.text: Great prices for the amount of food they bring you on a plate. Customer service is on point! You can order to whatever spice level you can handle. 7 is pretty mild for me, 9 was just right. My son absolutely loves this place! It's the only Asian in him that he gets from me. Definitely a favorite!

wtt-GvBGYGHercstz55yhA.text: The Curry magic....was I hungry or this food is just bomb dot com. Deliciousness - perfect combination of spices to bring out authentic flavors. The ZEN momemt. Definitely the best curry in town.   Thank you ZEN s team for cooking this delicious food.

xbdE-wXU9zA6x_tY77_OeQ.text: Service is 100% 10/10 amazing and SO FAST. If you're hungry, this place is affordable, filling, and speedy!. I went here about 3 times this week alone so that should definitely speak for itself! (Currently writing this as I'm craving it at 12:30am :-) I love this place so much. Favorite place for consistent amazing fast kind service and YUMMY FOOD ALWAYS!!!  Oh btw, THEIR THAI TEA IS THE BEST!!!!

8-T0HlEeq7yyYAyfaAP6kg.text: good curry. I like it. I will keep coming back. Last time, I ordered chicken tender. I really want to try the beef.

jcksAL6CfWfk_ivHELKWcw.text: This place introduced Japanese curry to me, and I've loved it ever since! I used to come here often but stopped, and I stopped by last night and remembered why I loved coming here! This place gets packed, especially at night.  The curry is full of flavor! My personal favorite is the tofu katsu! Honestly, if you told me this was chicken katsu, I'd believe it. I also love getting the veggie curry. Nice add-ons include spinach or cheese (Additional charge)! You can also adjust the spicy level, which ranges from 1-10 (Additional charge). I would prefer getting a MINI plate. It's just enough to fill you up, and it is cheaper. And if you're not a fan of curry, the Katsu-Don would be my go-to!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Chicken Katsu curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MINI Tofu Katsu with spinach and cheese! More than enough to fill you up :)

JQfye7WvAEowYCEtBdRImQ.text: Chicken katsu curry and spinach with brown rice- healthy but the chicken was plain, so good thing for the curry. Level 6 was mild and not spicy so I went with that. After eating the same thing in the plate, it kind of gets boring. I suggest adding toppings. I added croquette which like mash potatoes in panko crust.  I like that their fried items in a curry is on the lighter side, hence the name panko crumbs.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PyNLL3QJDWyGPbHi0_psHw.text: OMG  this best Japanese curry I've had in Vegas. Do not even hesitate heading over to this little mom and pop joint on Spring Mountain. They have various spice levels to suit your liking and different meat selections to add to your curry!

wgH0tmNLYsA0KzeXcNujQA.text: Went to this place for the first time tonight and it was amazing. Polite, timely service, atmosphere doesn't feel claustrophobic, food is SO yummy and filling! We will definitely eat here again and again

1tVOw9Uwap4KY2Mk913fRw.text: I'm not really into Curry that much but when I'm in the mood, Zen Curry is the place to go! One of the best locations to get curry and rice in my opinion. My all time fav is the chicken katsu with rice and curry. Recently one of my friends recommended adding cheese with my order and I was a bit skeptical at first but after one bite, I was in love. Gotta try it with cheese man   Afterwords if you're in the mood for boba, guess what's around the corner? Kung Fu Tea. Oh my G!

vj6SLTLSCFKw3D16RvXbGw.text: So damn good I can't stop thinking about it ... seriously. Can't wait to come back again

40cQ7g5wxRqe8kJ5UU3WRw.text: It is Japanese style curry restaurant. I ordered curry and fried fried oysters and Dakoyaki.  The curry tasted just ok and the others were delicious.

OAsF6OOv_DY29HFrDgjSdg.text: I really love this place because they're accommodating to my food allergies!! Right off the bat, the menu says if you have any allergens (especially peanut allergies) to let your waiter know. I avoid the curry because it is made with peanut oil, but from what my friends say, it's pretty great.   What I always get is the Katsu-Don, with the egg cooked well done. Usually, the egg in the dish is served undercooked or runny. Because of food allergies, I'm only able to eat cooked egg so I really appreciate the staff being able to make the egg adjustment for me so I can eat here with my friends. In the past, I've ordered the Chicken Katsu with rice, no curry, and that was good as well. However, I prefer the Katsu-Don better, probably because it's a bit different than what I'd normally order when eating out.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alyza with her Chicken Katsu Curry (spice level 1) and my Katsu-Don, egg well done.

YNhhWkFhZ60SPi3fCIJcVQ.text: I absolutely love this place! It's delicious, but a little bit pricey for what you get (hence one star off).  They offer spice levels from 1-10, and from 10-100 if you're brave. I'm stupid brave.   I've eaten here many times. I've had a 5. Nothing.  9? No challenge.  15. Waiters are asking me if I'm sure. Still, nothing for me.   25. I guess there's a kick? Come at me again.   Tired of asking for more and more spice, I ask for 50. The waiter looks at me, trying to talk me out of it. I swear, at one point he ran over to ask if everything was okay. I'll be honest, 50 gave me sweats.... wiping my brow and running nose. Finally spicy enough for me!  Unfortunately, it tasted like garbage. Instead of a deliciously smooth and flavorful curry, it tasted like chalk. Moral of the story, even if you can handle a 50, don't get it! There's more powder than curry. It would probably be really tasty if they used a spicier pepper instead of more and more of their standard spice.   That's not their fault though, Zen is delicious if you're sane and order a regular level of spice ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ioyQAQbL5Mqm3MMYX85WDg.text: Beat Japanese curry restaurant in Vegas. Sometimes they don't give you enough curry but overall very good food

yr5Ea22sJcSqndrud-G70A.text: I will constantly give this place 5 stars because they never fail to meeet my needs for Japanese curry!   Wasn't feeling too hungry tonight since it was a little late but I did get a half order of Katsu curry with corn (my staple) I always ask for extra pickled radishes and they always give me a bowl full, which is the PERFECT amount.   The best part about this place is the half sizes. The half size orders are basically the same with a little less sauce and rice, still fills you up. curry zen, please don't take these away!!!!  I'll be back, as per usual

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry

_T1C24AnhDx4mrNNITKBXg.text: TLDR: curry and non-curry options, alcohol and some desserts available, seating fills up quickly  I've been coming to the first of three locations for a while now and I have enjoyed the options available for both meat-eaters and vegetarians alike. Their rich curry sauce is good alone or with a protein and they even offer brown rice as an option. When I don't feel like curry , I opt for a tofu katsudon which is always full of flavor and prepared well. Tip: ask for extra pickled onion on the side!   While I've never had any additional spice (partially because part of me doesn't want to pay an extra 20-cents), I see that everyone else in the review enjoys the spice added. I do enjoy a frosty mug of asahi once in a while and it is priced fairly. Otherwise, you can try the cheesecake.   I tend to come early to not have to wait in line, but if you're seated right away, you can take your lunch break here.

Epat14ZmydLcmXoRgpcFZQ.text: Been eating at Zen Curry for many years now and I've never been disappointed. Zen Curry is always a great fall back for when the wait at the near by KBBQ and/or Ramen restaurants are too long. Portion sizes are great for the price you pay and the service is always quick. A couple of the side dishes are pretty bland but there's enough yummy alternatives that I'm willing to fill my belly with.  My go-to order is the chicken curry with cheese spicy level 4 (out of 10) with a side of shumai. I'm also slightly obsessed with their water. The water is always extremely crisp and refreshing. Either they have a really good water filter or I just live in desert so I'm always thirsty. Stay hydrated folks!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My happy place.

3dLJ48Ea1dqF0pKM-RuRvA.text: My husband and I have tried this years ago and loved it. Last time we got 3/10 chicken curry Katsu and thought it was pretty spicy. Years later we really wanted to see how spicy 10/10 was. We were pretty disappointed. There was a kick but not as much as we anticipated for 10/10. This was almost as equivalent to a hot level at a Thai restaurant. We still would come back to this place regardless with the spice level disappointment because it still taste Amazing and is good quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VjwOsjw-ZaDxHGAstm-E8w.text: We alway eat here once every trip. True a Japanese curry. So ono.   I got the curry with pork katsu and Kurobuta sausage. The pork katsu was dry. This is not the norm. Previously, I used to get the chicken katsu but I had a bad experience either dry or tasteless chicken so I started having the pork katsu. Now the the pork katsu let me down, next time I'll try the croquette and Kurobuta sausage.   Wife was not hungry so she ordered half order curry and rice with fried oysters. This is her regular order and was very happy with her meal.   We will be back on our next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bill for our meal
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order curry and rice with fried oysters
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry with pork katsu and Kurobuta sausage

rzIsJCZxwaU1VRLSD7F3wg.text: While I've never been to Okinawa, my dad and my husband both rave about Coco's Japanese curry during their assignments overseas.   My Dad watched a YouTuber review this place, and we had to make it one of our destinations while visiting family in Las Vegas.   We were seated very quickly and our order came out even faster.   For those who love spicy, I highly recommend a level 10 (highest level). I initially got the level 7, and it was too mild for me. We got a level 10 to go and it was so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry with a side of vegetables   level 7

D7zBzoSAsIqi1Hkh7w4XpQ.text: If you love Go Go Curry, this place is comparable. If you've never had Japanese curry before, I highly recommend eating here. For the price and portion size, it was well worth it. You can choose your level of spicy between levels of 1-10, and I chose 2 (pansy, I know), and it still had quite a kick to it! It was absolutely delicious.   I ordered the pork katsu and tried my fiance's chicken katsu and both were equally cooked to perfection. I had the chicken karaage as an appetizer, which was delightful as well (if you like fried, crispy chicken).   Parking can get tight if you come during peak times, but the restaurant has plenty of seating. I read they're even increasing their open hours and adding a second location in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry with a side of corn
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Karaage

JFXERRmJDhTFpy1DfAXl5Q.text: My go to place for japanese curry in Vegas! The portions are priced nicely and the curry tastes pretty good. Their most popular entree is the pork katsu and most popular add on's are cheese and corn. I'm pleased to find out that they serve have sizes for less than $4! For someone who can't usually finish their food, it's a good portion size and additional $3-4 for meat. It's not the best curry I've had but it does fulfill my craving for it.

PeL_CUamwZh3KSqZ9KOqbg.text: Cute, cheery, and clean. Describes the interior design of my favorite restaurant on Spring Street. Known for their degree of spicy curries, the husband had chicken curry and rice. I had oyako don. We shared a plate of takoyaki. The husband cleaned his plate while I was still working on my big bowl of white seasoned chicken chunks and scrambled egg and sauteed onion atop the generous bowl of rice. Perfectly seasoned !  The pile of dried bonito flakes atop the five takoyaki balls were still writhing on its platter. Love the food selection, quality, fresh ingredients, friendly and prompt service, and the clean friendly atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry #3 spice, takoyaki, katsudon

IfUqn2voQPLTj3Ic95H_JA.text: Food is very tasty! I got level #6 curry and it was the perfect spiciness flavor. The service is quick and friendly! It's a flavorful little hole in the wall where its always packed and the clientele is satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork tenderloin
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PW19XgW8r5POXhmjSCbTMQ.text: I'm probably going to come here every opportunity I get because it's so tasty. The only thing I wish is that my shrimp plate came with more shrimp and leas rice. Pro tip: get your curry with spinach!! It's so tasty. The restaurant was clean, the bathrooms were clean, the servers were always quick to refill my water or take the trash off the table. I'm dreaming of the day I can come back here again. I will definitely recommend this restaurant to my colleagues

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp spinach curry

evGA8Sigyss2TfrrieodnQ.text: Simple yet delicious. On the menu, it says you can get spiciness level from 0-10 but apparently you can order down to (-2) as an FYI. You can a variety of different toppings for your curry and rice ala carte.   We had level 6 with pork katsu, which was delicious and I think I could have gone another level up. We also had the curry udon which had bits of pork in it and had a nice consistency to the broth. We shared some takoyaki balls too which were crisp on the outside with creamy center and a bit of chew from the octopus.   They recently changed their hours as of May 4th to open at 11:00am instead of 11:30am.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Udon
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry

o1J0GZJz2DyIfdzZ2wzNrQ.text: This is one yummy curry place located in China Town. So many options here including the scale of heat of your curry. The selections of add ons are very good including cheese, sausage, katsu and a lot more.  My friend and I came in to have lunch and ordered different styles of curry. I ordered the Spinach Curry with Kushi at a level 6, which is above the average. It was so good! My friend ordered the Spinach Curry too but with cheese and the Kurobuta Sausage, it looked really good. I might try that next time.   The nice thing about this place is you can create your own curry plates from the type of rice, the spice level of curry and your toppings. The servings are big and very filling. I thing this place is great and the prices are on point for the amount of food you are served. Yum... I cannot wait to try out the other locations and curry combinations!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry with kushi

OClCV--JGjsGSOgHZXvdyQ.text: So goood! Such authentic flavors. You can truly taste all the spices so vividly. I need to go back. I got the chicken Katsu and curry. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu curry!

3Ya5gw6t_qaRohURyijHOA.text: I have been coming for so many years and I have so many good things to say about Curry Zen. For sure, the best curry option in Las Vegas. In a city oversaturated with bad Japanese food, Curry Zen is a breath of fresh air. It may not be the traditional preparation of curry (more vegetables and meat), but the options they give you are delicious. Getting the level 5 curry with croquette and kurobuta sausage is absolutely divine. Additionally, the curry pan is super good. The filling is fantastic with a blend of vegetables inside and is fried to a crunchy perfection. I would recommend everyone to come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V_Dx26Q6zX3TTdq19sDSGg.text: Our go-to curry place! Beware though as parking can be a bit** in this area.   I like the fact that there was never a time when we had to wait for a table. Staff are always friendly and very accommodating.   My favorite is always the chicken katsu and one can definitely choose your spice level. For appetizer, our staple order is the naan.   I give this place props for a super clean restroom.   I look forward to coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-kf2bzVdsz7nOYfeKzmPMw.text: This review is long overdue. Awesome Japanese Curry place. If you are nearby this plaza, and is looking for a quick in-n-out place that has tasty food, then this is the place for you. The chefs and the servers are all japanese people and their curry tastes just like you would have in Japan.  Their Chicken Katsu tastes so good, when combined with their Medium Spicy Curry. It is tender, crispy, and full of flavor.  For less than $10, you do get a lot of food. It's pretty filling. Their curry is amazingly good, great portion size for a good price.  I am glad other places were full. If not, I wouldn't have had the chance to come and try this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iwBQtcR9pNzI83kM4ygMVA.text: OMG! This place is amazing! Was not a fan of curry until I came to Japanese Curry Zen. Came here because the other places were full.  Their curry is amazingly good, great portion size for a good price. My second time trying it, we came on a Friday during lunch time, and we were sat right away and got our food in like 10 minutes or so. You can also call and pick up. It looks like they're opening a new location in North Las Vegas, which is a little bit closer to us :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry

6d5mDHQ4fbRRb_XtwzlNwg.text: I'm only giving this place three stars because of my loyalty to the food since 2013!  The food here is blessed. I ALWAYS go for a chicken katsu curry, spice level 4 with corn and cheese! To top it all off, the pickled ginger on the side. I started getting the spinach curry and let me tell you.. LIT  If the curry is too overwhelming, you can ask for it on the side and they'll give it in a separate bowl. There's a lot of things to add on like extra cutlet of katsu, spam, fried egg. You can experiment each time you go here until you find your dream curry.   The downside to this place is, they're always short on staff & this place gets so busy!! I wish they kept the pickled ginger and a pitcher of water at the tables because it's so hard to chase down a worker since they're always busy. Also, the average time on waiting on your check is like 6-10mins. The last time I was here, the waitress dropped a couple plates and some curry splashed on my friend's pants and shoes. She didn't acknowledge it, no apology, which was disappointing.

Wba5Xq8b7mim-N6YP59HoA.text: Cute little spot. My husband tried the Chicken Katsu curry and I tried the chicken and egg over rice, both were really good.  The restaurant was very busy but the team worked really hard to make the service run fast and smoothly.  We waited 30 min for the table, the food arrived less than 5 minutes after we ordered. Hot and yummy.  Many customers were Japanese also which is a good sign about the food quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyakodon

xEKqcwRfhoh2FEH_Xqh-9w.text: First time having "real" Japanese curry and can't match it better than with tonkatsu. Big plate of rice, crisp juicy pork katsu and spicy curry. Be forewarned the spice level is pretty serious business. I got a level 3 and it pushed me to my limits which really surprised me. Taste is superb though.  Unlimited pickled veggies on the table if that's your kind of thing too.

2vHFTiMuRUcolWQUjvgUXw.text: My first time eating Japanese Curry!  I have to say, if one were to compare them to Thai, Indian, or other curries I've had in the past, Japanese curry seemed more bland and thick, almost like a gravy.  They had plenty of seasoning shakers on the table though, so a few sprinkles of extra hot woke up the dish, and it was very enjoyable!  We tried a little bit of everything here, with Cathy ordering the Pork cutlet, Chicken Cutlet, Kurobuta Sausage and Croquette for us to try. It was cooked well, with lots of juicy meat and great flavor in the breading.   This place is super tiny, so not for the claustrophobic...but a great place to get some good eats for not much money!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cutlet with White Rice, and Kurobuta Sausage. Chicken and Sausage were good, still juicy and full of flavor!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Cutlet with Brown rRce, Corn and Croquette.  Everything was good!

mZ-zjW6PRN3LjTkpyYNBXg.text: Been going here for the past 7 years!! Love the curry! Very authentic Japanese curry!!

q2yn8aBMNOrZjN6wg91mhQ.text: The curry here is amazing.  I've gone to many different places for Japanese curry and this is at the top of the mountain.  The curry is always flavorful and not watery.  The katsu is always fresh and crisp.  They take pride in what they serve.  My friends from LA always want to go here.  Definite, two thumbs up!

mtRqgGCHP_rgRKEg8PvHCQ.text: So so good. Their curry really is the bomb. I love mine with katsu and croquette. Their fried oysters also amazingly yummy! Very recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry with cheese and croquette. SO #YUMMY. :)

8TqK1brXWzKUQYedFZxvLg.text: I love this place so much. The serving size is perfect to get me filled up. I always get the chicken Katsu curry with cheese.   The food is phenomenal, it definitely is homemade. Also the owner is always working and is the main reason your food is amazing! Great guy with an authentic restaurant that makes you feel happy when you arrive and when you leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jGqphDpe0U2Y1ek5k_KNkw.text: The portion that they serve are so little that you are kind of forced to order side dishes to fill yourself up.  Definitely not the best curry I've tried but it's not bad I guess since there aren't much other options for curry in Vegas.

WEpdDhaLRZwMvA2FUetf4w.text: Great place . Popular destination during peak hours so go earlier. Great for families.

Q3H517vu-XyDmtiNF-jXbA.text: My go to spot for curry! Everything is so delicious and the service is awesome! Recommend the katsu, ton katsu, kurobuta, or meatloaf. Also the gyoza or shumai! I usually order a 0 spice level because there's still a small kick to the curry. Personally I like to taste all the flavors of my food without having my mouth burning.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese meatloaf

a7topyUeA_xpdukPoLXQ6g.text: Been here countless of times. Food and service are consistently great! Whenever me and my boyfriend can't decide on where to eat (which is often), this place is our go-to.

-Agq0NLZGEqaQq9G9wwE1Q.text: The chicken cutlets were cooked perfectly crisp, and the curry had the right amount of texture.  I love their ginger and japanese red pickles.  It's a lot of rice for my taste but +1 for serving brown rice!    All this for under $10 bucks.   I am a big meat eater, so I ordered an additional side of sausage and I was satisfied.  I might try to replace the rice with veggies next time.   The service was very quick and the server was very nice and attentive.

f4M0guwiHqHEV98LUfrdpA.text: Came here for a late night dinner with friends and we were seated right away. Service was quick and staff was friendly. However, I wouldn't go out of my way to go here to be honest. It's a little out of my way. The place is rather small so I'm assuming there's a wait when they're busy.   Food was great but then again my friends and I were starving before we arrived. We ordered chicken katsu with spice level of 2 and there was already a kick to it (just a heads up for peeps who are sensitive to heat), tokiyaki, fried shumai, and katsu-don. All were very flavorful and the portion sizes were perfect for us.   PS - Did anyone notice why they fill their iced water only like 75% full? I constantly had to ask them for a refill.. Lol.

l7x1C-XxqWNEw5Lme24jXQ.text: Super good and cheap! Very traditional Japanese flavor reminds me the curry I had in Osaka! The green tea cheese cake is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DN--8wjBxxdwUKtRmej0Rg.text: Arrived around 8pm and got seated immediately. The hostess was friendly and welcoming. The food was really good and we didn't have to wait so long to be served. I'll definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu plates

LWxVeAzqP5uu_fQaQnPm9g.text: I love this curry I love this curry it's yummy yummy in my tummy!  This place has expanded! It users to be a little place but glad it is growing popularity.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zOun_-08_5e2VWql1lD9hw.text: They need to expand, the place is so small. other than that staff is always nice, they're decently priced and menu is also great!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep friend shumai

1SoRZl7ylH8AbJ7UFzkkog.text: I love their curry here. The price is perfect. I would suggest adding cheese to your curry. It gives it a little kick. Overall, the food is scrumptious and the place is very cute & petite!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam cutlet &amp; deep fried shrimp curry w/ cheese! Worth the 12 bucks.

qJKlJxSeOidVFbzarOeTRQ.text: I've eaten here at least 50 times so far and I love it. Consistently great quality and great low price! Even the drinks are are super cheap! I don't usually order soda at restaurants since it's usually over priced but it's like 1.50 here. The chicken Katsu curry is out of this world. I get spicy 10 every time and it's perfect. The gyazo is solid too. Staff is super friendly to boot!

s7veHBP7Zsx3IXS_Zj6GiA.text: OK.   In this trip to Vegas, we've seen Penn&Teller,  Michael Jackson One Cirque du Soleil, and even the Australian BeeGees. The food we've had in this out if the way little mall has been right up there for highlights!  Curry here is authentic and rich. Not loaded with MSG. Real good curry made by a real Nihonjin, not Mr. Lee or Pedro ( no offense meant, but this place is legit!)  There are a variety of delicious things to go with your curry and rice.  I did the tonkatsu, which is my standard go to. Crispy, moist, not greasy.  Wife had the Japanese meatloaf, which was moist and flavorful.   Young guys at table next to us did 3 things with their curry. If I had the metabolism of years past, I would have done that too!  I did level 8 out of 10 for hotness. Just right. Made my nose run, but my eyes stayed dry.   This small place, which can seat maybe 35, is a must do for curry lovers. And if you're on the fence about curry due to the MSG laden, S&B block instant curry you've tried, give this place a try. You will be glad you did!

WCxg3MsOe0Tl97FNlmE7Lg.text: I love all kinds of curry, so much so a few recipes I've burned out on we eat it so much. I needed to try something new into our curry rotation.   The BF and I split our meat toppings of a pork katsu and a tofu cutlet. Pork katsu was crisp and still juicy (which a lot of pork katsus are not). Tofu cutlet was crisp, but still light and was of the silky/soft tofu variety which I much prefer over firm kinds. Curry itself was pretty decent though standard. It's solid for here, but not the best I've had though. I like all the garnishes they set on your table which some curry houses do not do...At least for me, I've never noticed raisins and almonds at other places. Not their fault, but I wish they had my favorite curry topping : an egg. It would really make me a fan. Something about curry rice and egg is perfect.   We had the coffee jello which was nice, and refreshing to the palette after curry. Halfway eating the waitress asked if we would like more cream for the jello which was a small, but very considerate touch. Really, she was kind and attentive throughout.   I'm a fan of this place for the humble service you come to expect from Japanese and feel It's a solid and quick lunch plate option.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu Curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu Cutlet Curry

FBDKJtQH9ZWC441xEFpg5g.text: Best Japanese curry in las vegas. Very authentic and pork cutlets cooked perfectly. Only place to go if you're in the mood for Japanese style curry.

nMcbPcruyEe_t_Ok0s_XOA.text: I have passed this place multiple times... and my family loves curry so they're particular where to eat. We finally gave it a try and I must say we loved it! It's a small restaurant, neat, clean, good service, and good food! We had a great time! No complaint. But It would of been nice to see or have someone at the front greeting us to wait to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach Sparkling Jello Sake ... So good!!!!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef curry; her favorite!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. She loves just plain curry sauce and rice!

I2LL7SUrt2T25uRQ2rOQwg.text: They have really good curry! I got the regular katsu curry. My friends all got 2 or higher and they said it was pretty spicy! If you like spicy, they have a scale that goes all the way up to 10 and apparently it's really spicy! Their place is small, cute, and clean. Their staff is really nice and I would recommend this place if you want to eat curry! I don't eat curry on the daily but they're pretty much the place everyone tells me to go to! So try it out if you want to try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular chicken katsu with curry!

PvCxgqJnXie7DvATNDXtUA.text: Atmosphere: Very clean, modern, and bright inside.  Food: I love how simple their menu is and there's no fluff. I've tried both chicken and pork katsu curries but I prefer the chicken curry (don't get me wrong both are great). I only wish they had katsu fish (only because fish is my ultimate protein source)!   Specials: Although it cost $0.20 extra for spicy levels 6-10, it's definitely worth getting some fire on the curry. I've tried spicy levels 7 and 8, and 8 is definitely hotter (my lips were burning and my stomach a little bit churning). Level 7 spicy is perfect for me with just enough heat! Almonds! Add thinly sliced almonds inside the curry for crunchy texture and because the almonds are so thinly sliced they do not contribute or detract from the curry flavor.  Service: The service is excellent. I believe all the house staff are native Japanese but we didn't really have a language barrier and ordering was really easy. They are quick on their feet and make sure our waters are always refilled and they check in on you often. The food comes out quickly so I definitely recommend this spot for quick eats.  Final Impression: I have to admit, this is my favorite katsu + curry house ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the almonds, gives the curry some nice texture.

x_N3JfWUWUhV7MNEvtMP5w.text: My favorite curry place in Vegas. Their food is always on point and service is great most of the time. They do get crowded around lunch and dinner times but it is so worth the wait. The only downside i can think of is that their spiciness varies from day to day. I usually get the level 1 or 2 but sometimes the level 1 would be really spicy and other times not spicy at all. Parking is also hard to find but that's more because of the location and other businesses around it. I love coming to this place though and will always pickup some late night dinner for co-workers when working overnights

RDhRpsrocoQ5i5RXTMXjyA.text: this is a good place to eat whenever you want something quick, filling, decently good price. they charge extra for spice in the curry, which goes higher as the spice increases. my favorite is deep fried shrimp and no spice since i don't like hot/spicy sauces. my boyfriend likes to get the original chicken katsu ($8.95) which is cheaper than the deep fried shrimp ($10.45). they have a good variety of food on their menu.  the restaurant is somewhat small but the most i've ever waited to be seated is 15 minutes. i always come here whenever i want something good but cheap!

lDqsgNhxpttshZLK4HsFfQ.text: Love the curry at this place. The service is fast and attentive. Chicken katsu is super delicious. Cheap beer also.

D2Jfe0qwYIATB1P2e5TNeA.text: I love their curry. I just love everything about their chicken katsu and how spicy you want your curry to be.   Also, I love that they have different options for curry and not just with chicken. They have healthy options as well.   It's so cheap and delicious. I could eat here everyday.   I brought my friends to this place for the first time and they now want to go back almost every week!

uGVehJ0ATzdUYHSyKKgdoQ.text: Great place! Service is always friendly and as attentive as possible. It is a small restaurant and very busy, especially weekends, so a wait is always a possibility. I love the pork katsu curry! It's the best when you add the side of almonds, raisins and shallots and radish.

_vYwdoekrqMWmYM3ju1BPQ.text: The tofu curry is just insane...the consistency of the flavor and cleanness and pureness of the batter is so amazing every time!!! This is one of our MUST GO PLACES every time we travel to Vegas!! This is even better than any curry places we have gone to in LA at Little Tokyo...its seriously that good!! You know some places have batter which tastes oily or gets worse throughout the day, there is zero salty or stale oil flavor here...actually there is zero oil flavor...the batter is so light and crisp day or night!! I also highly recommend their tofu salad, its so refreshing to your palate before you eat the Japanese curry...the pork is also super tender as well...there is really no going wrong but someone MUST get the tofu curry just so everyone can have a bite!!

0QULZ6qyvGLrTRvVQNJY2g.text: If you love Japanese curry, I recommend this place. Ordered the beef & pork Katsu curry as well as a Katsu Don. For appetizer, we ordered he Shumai, didn't really expect it to be so small for the price you pay for it, but nonetheless, it was good. We went about 2 hours closer to closing time, on a Sunday and didn't have to wait for a long time. The service was ok, took longer than expected to order but it was probably because we were sitting in the corner. The ambience was cute and quaint, definitely felt like you were in a Japanese restaurant from Japan. This place is located in a very popular little center, so parking can be a little tight but there is street parking available.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Curry, Beef Curry, Katsu Don, Shumai

snEljr8g0GQrSujhFtZ5Bg.text: Really love the curry here! They get creative with their menu and I had the one with five different "fried skewers" on my curry. I ordered it with 4 hotness but if I go back will definitely try it at 10 lol. I had the curry as it was for half of it and then just dumped a bunch of chili flakes at the end because I like my curry hot. Good stuff though will be back!

kMipKaPVxvCvGHix_L4kvg.text: Welcome to man vs. food:  Japanese curry edition. That's the first thing that came to mind regarding portion sizes. I always have leftovers, and the leftovers reheat very well. You can get chicken katsu curry with veggies... SPICY!  They have a spicy rating system like you'd expect from a Thai place except this is obviously Japanese.  Their spam, beef, veggies, it's all good.  You can order no wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R_0RPbEwmmyzitRqllC_mA.text: Love this place so much! I come here so often and most times with my cousin. Never lets us down!   First the food! I always get the tofu katsu curry which is amazing! The gyoza is always perfectly cooked and the croquette, which I just recently tried, is flavorful! Their tofu salad and the dressing are addictinggg!! Definitely a must try! As for dessert, the green tea cheesecake is heavenly. The slice is small but trust me, it's perfect and satisfying.  Now, the service is also great. There's a few servers that already recognize us every time we come in and they always greet us with a smile. They're very helpful and kind! Ill definitely continue my semi weekly visits :D

_W25DMvdYKkkXDZ386cS_Q.text: Me and my kids love love this authentic place for curry! We order katsu don with curry on the side! Sooo deliciouss! Chef uses 15 spices or more and cook with alot of passion & heart for people! Owner zenbayashi san is very nice sensei! I highly recommend to eat here if you love japanese style authentic curry with white rice or brown rice. You can try takoyaki & curry bread too! Enjoy!!!

Es6EKfeYwFodI7JDwX9IWg.text: Everything we ordered was spot on. The Takoyaki was like, actually significantly better than other places enough for me to notice!

g5-EBL10cLK-g3BYAvs0hw.text: After.school my daughter was hungry. She told me about this spot so we went there.. very good food and it came out fast and hot.. the servers were very nice and professional. . definitely coming back...

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YmbI-FD3jN-fSx87f1ODEQ.text: First time I went was fantastic but the batter wasn't as good the second round. Ill definitely be back, the curry itself is very authentic. Also try their oysters!

g8S2usRe8I2ul-UZymLGyA.text: Located in the same plaza as Raku, Kabuto, and Monta, Japanese Curry Zen rounds out this wonderful menagerie of awesome eateries on Spring Mountain and Decatur.   This place is a bit small so if you if plan on coming with a group of 3+ there might be a bit of a wait during rush hour times. The bar is better suited to single eaters or 2-people groups. Still a fun, casual dining experience.  If you're doing curry, this place is a delicious choice! I ordered the base curry pork katsu ($9.45), with sausage ($2.50), corn ($0.50), and a spicyness level ($0.20). The pork katsu was perfectly crisp without being dry meat on the inside. Sausage was flavorful. Curry itself had depth and didn't taste like it came out of a box. Along with curry bread ($2), we couldn't get enough! Curry bread tastes like crack, but with curry and whatever magic is in there to make me salivate. Think pastry without the sugar and all savory goodness.  Prices are okay. You can see how it runs up pretty quickly per person. They charge quite a bit for toppings. $2.50 for three tiny sausages? Base curry is just rice with sauce and a little bit of meat all for $8-$10ish and you're still expected to get toppings? It'd be a pretty plain curry otherwise. Not as cheap as pho, but it's still pretty savory and a nice change of pace. After all the add-ons between my boyfriend and I, the bill came out to be $35ish.  Not exactly cheap for what you get, but hits the spot! Good place for a casual date night or hang-out with friends! We both left feeling pleasantly satisfied. You know food is wonderful and delectable when it stays with you on the ride home. (Well, obviously, because you just ate it.) But for instance, it just makes you feel happy like a cat on a lazy sunday.  Would come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu curry with corn and sausage! I&#39;m in heaven.

J3-9xjVGhA84A0kn6A64MQ.text: Really simple typical Japanese curry joint... Nothing fancy.   Their menu is simple, you pick the spiciness of the curry and the toppings.  My favorites are the kushiage and scrambled eggs.   Takoyaki here is a must try. It's agetako (deep fried) style. Really crunchy on the outside and slimy inside, just like agetako should be. So delicious.   I'm sure I'll be back when I'm in Vegas next time.

ZY-ddIqXxgvMl9LvK1MDww.text: I came here on a Tuesday afternoon and ordered  1. Original Curry, 5.95 - Pork Cutlet: 3.50  2. Original Curry, 5.95 - Chicken Cutlet: 3.00  for 22.89  - Came during lunch, around 1pm, a little packed. We were seated on a small table for 2.  - Takaya was our server. fine service.  - No extra charge for dicon, scallions, almonds - Crispy cutlet.  - Little portion. I counted the slices on my plate. Sigh.... - Original curry was good! But Kaba Curry had corn and vegetables without paying extra.  - Presentation was nice.  - Stomach left unsatisfied. Definitely need to pay more to get a better experience. Lame.  - Expensive for 2. I'd rather just go to Tonkatsu Kiyoshi. Kaba has better value.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu

k9ejyNkuq7PJXBhouwgAPw.text: I've been here several times and I decided to finally write a review. Japanese curry here is the best! Some places serve a chalky curry but this place is well done. I usually get the chicken katsu curry with cheese and sausage. Soo yummy and filling.   I've also done curry out. Phone order is simple and estimated pick up times is on point. Food is well packaged, they separate the curry in it's own container so it doesn't make the katsu soggy. Portions are huge.

ZC9kNVWV2_FGd43D2K8t9w.text: I went on a hike at red rock canyon. Afterwards I was starving for some spicy food. I wanted to try something new and I was in Chinatown area. I've never had Japanese style fried chicken with curry sauce. It looked interesting, so I decided to stop by.  I started out by ordering Ashi ($2.95/small glass). I ordered Toko-yaki (~$4) and fried shu-mai ($3.75). Toko-yaki was batter was good, but the octopus was bit too chewy. Fried shu-mai are really small, but they have good flavor and frying anything makes it great.   My main course meal was the chicken katsu with level 10 spicy curry. This might be the first restaurant to charge money to make things spicy (like I won't be paying a price next morning). When I the plate the curry sauce looked red hot (not sure if you can see it in the pic), but upon eating it I was bit disappointed with the spice level. However, I became a fan of this meal. I think this is the best way to eat a fried chicken. The chicken was tender and the batter was just the right amount. Rice and curry also complimented very well with juicy chicken. The price is also perfect $9 for the whole meal.   I will definitely be back for more. The only negatives I can say is that the TVs are tiny, and I wish the bathrooms didn't smell like someone had a curry explosion. The service is good and the servers take their time to explain the menu item if you are new.   Check out this place, it really is a gem, but stay away from their bathroom and bring a pair of binoculars if you want to watch a football game on their TV.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry (level 10 spicy)
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Shu-mai
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki with Octopus

5SrjgLax8CzJVRvV0Ehf0Q.text: We have random curry cravings (yeah, that's a thing) so Curry Zen is our definite go-to! Service is fast and the staff is super friendly. If you're dining on a budget, no worries here. The spice scale is on a 1-10 basis. Anything over a 4 is pretty hot (I'm a wimp)! I recommend the shrimp and fried tofu curry with cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and tofu curry with cheese. Delicious!

MCL_MZ_tZhMwMl3Ape2sgA.text: Simply put, Zen Curry is a great place for Japanese style curry. I feel like its becoming as mainstream as Thai or Indian curry is (despite the lack of Indian places around).   Zen Curry also offers a delicious Katsu-Don (Donburi/Bowl), I wish they offered other types though, not just katsu. The toppings for your curry are endless and there are many different sides you can get with your meal. I recommend getting the tofu salad and the takoyaki to accompany your meal.  This location is definitely in a poor plaza. There are too many places packed around this two row parking lot. Don't let this scare you. Zen Curry js a must try, and there's many other delicious places surrounding it as well.

RIgkc89VUjOHAgmqCBTA_Q.text: I had this place bookmarked to visit so I stopped by on a Weds evening around 9pm because I'm on this whole ramen mission. I'm no expert on noodles, so when I ordered Curry Udon, I had no idea the noodles would be so thick. I didn't like it at all... but that's no fault of the restaurant, I just didn't do my research. The flavor of the curry was rich and satisfying. It's a very good dish, just not my style of noodles. So a good thing came out of my visit, I learned that I am not a udon fan. The fried shumai was wonderful. I'd go back for them alone. The waiter was extremely friendly and attentive, exactly what I'd expect at a Japanese restaurant. He was very pleased and put on a big smile when I tried my best at saying "Gochisousama deshita" at the end of my meal...This is a 5 star place.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried shumai was wonderful -- Curry Udon was packed with rich flavor and a spicy kick (spice level 4/10)
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Udon was packed with rich flavor and a spicy kick (spice level 4/10).

M3dll64MEm7k88M-rpBP2g.text: Wow, I didn't write a review for Curry Zen? Weird. I'm quite a regular here.  Simply put, the best Japanese-style curry house in Vegas. Period.  There's Kaba Curry nearby, which is also good, but Zen is better on all fronts.  Zen also offers Curry Pan! It is a Japanese comfort food, crispy fried bread with curry inside. You cannot imagine what it is like until you actually eat it, but believe me, it's a popular food category in Japan.  My favorite is veggie curry with pork sausages. The pork sausage is a beloved "schau-essen," if you know what I mean.  And yes, they offer brown rice too! Now you won't get sleepy even when you have a full belly.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Curry with Kurobuta Sausage, on Brown Rice
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Pan, dissected
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Pan

dT9SG5e23claVwBY-6m8hw.text: This place was good.  Very small, casual, and intimate.  I ordered the kushi, which was a sample of shrimp, quail eggs, zucchini, shiitake mushrooms and chicken.  All were good, but the zucchini was my favorite.  The curry sauce had a good flavor and a good heat ratio.  I ordered a 6 on the hear scale, but probably could do the 7 or 8 and still enjoy.   Glad I came.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 piece Kushi

nuHyoWTZmLP_I3_UmohRDA.text: Japanese Curry is on Point! Just the right amount of curry on your plate! This is the place to go when your in the mood for good curry! Simple menu. Add toppings! Sausage is my favorite add on with the Chicken Katsu curry. Decent restaurant size. Always steady flow. Staff are friendly and also on point with water refills. Check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My absolute favorite combo! Chicken Katsu Curry with additional topping - Kurobuta Sausage! No filter needed!

0cTTtESWF7joRSZIPXjATA.text: Japanese Curry Zen is one of my favorite comfort food spots. I used to come here often when I worked on the strip, but now that our office has moved further east, it is now even that much more of an effort to get to Chinatown area and all of its great food. I guess you could say that it is not really that much of a drive from Henderson, but I digress...  I typically get the pork katsu curry with shrimp. Which doesn't seem like much, but that rice is really filling and pairs oh so well with the curry. Sometimes I don't get how something like plain rice can be so good when eaten with other foods. It just tastes like home.  On the spice level - I typically get level 1 which is perfect for me because I really don't do well with even slightly spicy things.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tako yaki.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sides.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pork katsu and shrimp curry.

LIGksMLMXQPd2TzHHSZc5w.text: This place was really good. The service was good. The people were friendly. The food came out quick. The place was clean. The chicken Katsu curry was really good. At first I was like, "Why didn't they bring me a knife?" and then realized it was so tender you can cut it with the fork. I like that they have brown rice and other toppings. The Thai tea was so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry with brown rice. Really good.

oz28T2cu6pPG-ign8UjvSQ.text: Small place located north west of Spring Mountain and Decatur intersection, in the same plaza as the popular Monta Ramen, Raku Japanese Grill, or the elegant Kabuto sushi.   Over the years, I haven't been much of a japanese curry lover but I will still eat it periodically. This place is small but is managed by a very friendly, welcoming staff.   Very small, defined menu highlighting their main focus, curry. Plain curry, chicken katsu curry, or pork katsu curry. Of course there are other things on the menu or add ons but in this review, i will not get into it. On the back of their menu, they list every, or almost every spice they use in the curry, as well as a brief description of each of what it does to help you (health wise)   On the table, there are 7 different bottles. Of course the normal salt and pepper, but they have 3 others. The normal 15 spice blend they use in the curry that gives a mild spiciness. As well as a medium and a hot blend of spices. The final 2 bottles are the usual red pickled ginger you see normally in japanese restaurants and i believe was pickled baby onions? not sure. What i had found out which was a nice touch was that they do NOT put the ginger on the side of the curry, where most restaurants do. I thought it was a nice touch because i am not much of a fan of ginger, overall.   This first, and only visit I have made (so far), i had ordered chicken katsu curry. Presented in a normal fashion. Round plate. 1/2 white rice. 1/2 katsu covered in the curry sauce.   Of course, first thing i would taste is the curry sauce. Nice brown color. Very smooth upon taste. Very flavorful. Can taste a lot of the spices but with a small kick from i believe either paprika or cayenne (i dont remember the list of spices they had listed). This place makes their curry sauce well.   Besides the curry sauce, of course they had the katsu. Wasn't too amazed by this though. It was cooked thoroughly, but maybe a little too long. Meat was dry and the thickness varied greatly on the piece of katsu. The breading was a bit stuff, and not "loose". Not sure how to describe it. What i believe to be a perfectly made katsu is an even thickness cut of meat either cut or pounded thin, breaded with panko bread crumbs and fried to a golden brown, long enough to be cooked but fast enough to still be juicy, as well as have a flaky crust.   Price pretty reasonable. $4.95 for the plain curry. Then additional $3 for chicken katsu, $3.50 for a pork katsu, and they had other things.   But aside from the katsu, maybe they are still correcting themselves on the timing, ill give them another chance in the future, the curry is great. probably the closest to genuine japanese curry you will find in Vegas for now. Good place to visit but remember, space is limited, to maybe.. 20ish seats total.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry

sIyU9F2EMbW6IajbdlVxTg.text: Zen on Spring Mountain has excellent Japanese style curry and many simple options for everyone.   This is a great place to also try curry if you've never had curry before. I suggest the chicken katsu if you're a first timer to curry.   Zen also offers great specials off the menu, such as the curry udon.   The staff is friendly and service is fast!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu-Don... So good!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry

3Ec6tdVqsOS6wQtZB8_c8w.text: Came here last night for the first time with hubby & sister. Since it is my first time to try Japanese curry, I have nothing to compare it to.  However, here are the key points that I feel worth mentioning:  1) Ambiance:  The place is quiet when we got there and only has 2 other tables occupied. The place is clean and quite cozy.  2) Service:  It was great and food came fast.  3) Price:  I think it is quite pricey after putting the toppings that you want unless you only want the combinations they have on the menu. That's where the deduction of star came from.  4) Food:  Overall, the food was great! We ordered the following items:  *  Chicken Katsu + Sausage - Hubby ordered it and loved it. He got it at Level 2 spiciness and felt that's all he could go for as the spiciness lingers in your mouth according to him.  * Pork Katsu w/ Egg (Lvl 2 spiciness) - My sister ordered it and she felt that it was quite good and conparable to Curry House in Cali that she and her husband's family frequently go to get their Jap curry fix.  * Original Curry + Spam + Fried Oyster w/ corn - I ordered this with level 1 spiciness (can't handle too much heat).  I found my food very delicious specially the fried oysters. The burst of flavor when I had my first bite of the oyster with the curry sauce & rice. The best description on my food that I can come up with at that moment was "It was orgasmic!" Lol! I love to cook and have pretty good palate and the flavor of this was amazing. Even spam with the curry sauce was pretty good. I had leftover food that I brought home to my 16 y/o son and he enjoyed it as much as I did. He did agree that the fried oyster with the curry sauce was to die for.  We will definitely be back for sure.  I look forward to trying the spinach curry with fried tofu. Just writing this review makes me drool. Yum! Absolutely worth trying!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry with egg on the side
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Curry with Fried Oysters, Spam &amp; Corn on the side. Yumminess!

hSGnaFoeA-tyLiml4E6jtg.text: We hadn't had GOOD pork Katsu curry in a long time and so we decided to try Japanese Curry Zen while visiting Vegas. The wait staff and one of the cooks (we couldn't really see the whole open kitchen so we weren't sure how many cooks there were) were Japanese so we took that as a promising sign of things to come. They serve Asahi draft beer which made us happy and also Sapporo beer. We decided to order the pork tender curry with cheese topping and white rice at spicy level 3. We usually go with spicy level 8 in Japan but the waiter warned us that anything more than 5 would be extremely hot. So to be safe, we opted for level 3. We were glad that we got level 3 because that already had a kick and anything beyond that would just make the curry overpoweringly spicy and ruin the taste for us. The curry was excellent. The pork was tender and delicious. The cheese topping sealed the deal for us. We came out of Japanese Curry Zen "tummy-happy" that we found a slice of Japanese curry heaven in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (Lean) Pork curry with cheese topping - a winner!

GAoo-NQRxobUKBuYJQBm9g.text: The best curry spot in Las Vegas. I always come here every time I visit. Absolutely delicious and filling food. My usual is the pork katsu because of the pork being tender and juicy. The chicken is good too but pork wins. I love it here!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu

OuiiuHWLctz88dDy1RQijw.text: Curry is excellent!!!! It is Japanese. DonKatsu was crispy meaty enough to harmonized with spicy curry. Toko Yaki was delicious!!!! Service was quick and pleasant. I would recommend to friends who will visit Las Vegas.

7oTyaY243QAeU6eoHpyevg.text: I'm a Japanese curry snob and this is the best in Vegas. The flavor of this curry is really exceptional. My favorite part is when I order veggies I actually get big chunks of veggies that appear to be fresh. Other places it is the mixed frozen vegetables which are tiny and that's why it's obvious they were the frozen ones. The rice is cooked nicely, the red and white ginger are nice additions and I like that I can help myself and don't need to ask for it. A 2 or 3 is very hot, a 10 is I don't know, I never got it. I did see someone order it once though, wow. I like really spicy and a 3 is really spicy. I like seeing the list of health benefits listed for eating curry. The food comes fast to the table and has always been consistent. Menu is simple but nice.   I also like that the chef (assuming the owner, but maybe not) always thanks us for coming (at least that's what I think he is doing since he speaks in Japanese). :) If I had a wish, it was that a small salad came with the meal. I also wish for non fried items, since beef chunks is the only protein on the menu that is not fried.

Kmb-sf6bSqXKRC4qwtcshQ.text: Best Japanese style curry here in Vegas. It is similar to Coco Curry House. It's a family run business which Is nice. Dishes I've tried and liked...Veggie Curry, Chicken Katsu Curry, Takoyaki and the side salad. For the spiciness level I usually get a level 3 and add hot pepper powder as needed. The establishment is clean, the staff is helpful & friendly  (especially the owners son), speedy service and the food is delicious  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Curry

HrA06U89PBqZnKPsnXz8aQ.text: There's nothing like Japanese curry on a cold day to warm the stomach.  When I'm craving comfort, this is my spot for j-curry.  Came here on weekday night for dinner with my best friend.  Restaurant was packed, but we were seated promptly.  I like how we can customize the spicyness and what is included with our meals.  The meat is fried golden brown and is crunchy in comparison to the rich spicy curry.  The steamed rice helps to balance all the flavors and all together make up a symphony of good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry combo
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu and veggie curry

NonjFAVtrlVfRQWOdQRUVg.text: Busy restaurant but does not lack service at all. Very affordable Japanese curry option near casinos and glad we went there for quick bite!

bEAuphCI40vgzeyyUVaUjg.text: We come here every once in awhile when we need our curry fix. Spice level IS spicy so fair warning. The parking isn't the best, but it's sure worth it. We're from Hawaii so the spam katsu is yuummm! Fried oysters is a must try as well!

fE6HFwJANhGYIWxxk4YRqw.text: Onolious food! Came here for my birthday busy but quick. Love eating here, service and food always consistent.

K17z6Df0ch1gNwEANjvVZQ.text: I come to this place everytime I'm Vegas, and they never disappoint. The curry is as authentic as authentic can be! If you been to Japan and been to cocos curry, this is 98% similar! They renovated the place since I last been here, it is much nicer.

GdmeOSxFVQjCkuj9ugtwqg.text: This is the first time I've tried curry of any sort. My bf & I ordered the pork curry (5 spicy), chicken katsu curry (3 spicy), spam on the side & takoyaki. The fried spam & the curry sauce were my favorite. I ordered the takoyaki on a whim cuz it looked good & didn't really ask what it was. Personally I thought it was gross, it's not for everybody lol.

Ghpttv5woFKb-KWsZFZCpw.text: We are regular customers there, they do the best curry sauce , the draft beers very cheap and the people are there very friendly, any time if we've been there , we got the food fast.

OZIYMuTcseEzrY3sK2FOWg.text: There is a big sign on the front window "...something, something.. **HOMEMADE CURRY**" ...Seriously... No lie!    The restaurant is not big at all and can maybe sit 15 people at a time.. but after hearing about how good this "hole in the wall" joint was through co-workers, I had to try it for myself. I was greeted immediately and traditionally (well.. it sounded pretty Japanese to me) and seated at the bar. I noticed the menu was a "build your own" style and decided on the chicken and vegetable katsu level 6 spice.  I was served a perfect sized portion of food that was unbelievably delicious!!! ..All I can say is.. Very clean curry.. perfectly fried katsu.. Authentic homemade flavor!   Highly recommended for all you curry lovers!   ..S.C.A.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
