amfKEOKCKcem13GLyWkdNg.text: Family recommended that we try this place out cause we just might like it.  Went to their location on Spring Mountain Rd., and this restaurant was tiny with seats for about 18 people.  Fortunately, we were there at an odd time so there was no waiting for a table.  The food was terrific, and it was presented very nicely on the plate.  Curry sauce is the best that I have ever had.  The mixture of all their various spices creates an explosion of yummy flavor!  Their was an insert at our table, and I enjoyed reading all the health benefits that the different spices offer.  Very educational.  Also liked that you choose how spicy you want your curry to be.  The scale ranges from 1 (not spicy) to 10 (their spiciest choice).  I chose the #3 level, and it had a good kick for my taste buds.    I am happy that we were referred to Japanese Curry Zen.  If I lived in Las Vegas, they would be part of my dining out rotation.  Very very nice option!

EVhzs0LPCSwqqnX3Vo5ziw.text: Just like CoCo Curry in Japan!  Only smaller!    Service is always fast and good.   Japanese style curry that be beat!    We are here at least once a week.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef curry with vegetable.

6EuP6cTWPRR8DsTZyb5B3w.text: This is a small Japanese restaurant on Spring Mountain Rd. They specialize in Japanese curry, that is hand stirred and smooth. If you've never had Japanese curry, you need to try this joint.  My friend and I were looking for a place to dine and to chat a little and we decided to go here. As we've never had curry before, it was interesting to us. The area is small and they have about 20 seats, it doesn't have a patio, so it's not comfy for large groups, but for two or three people it is perfect. The service is pretty good, it took about 15 min. to get our order. The prices are reasonable.  I went for the pork cutlet curry and my friend went for the chicken. Both were very well prepared with a nice gold crust. Very yummy:) Now I can say that this is an excellent cooked home style food and after trying this food we became curry fans)))

xmxaX6dIvCg2Y78XyZzpfw.text: Curry zen has never cease to fail me whenever I go especially whenever I get back home from college breaks because they don't have it down in San Diego. I hope everyone in Vegas decides to come here at least once and experience what s great place this is to eat at from great service to great food.

SoU9ML3WTLJQYmOo7Dmwfg.text: Flavors are clean and precise! Get the curry pan amazing! Thai tea is very tasty also.

zlsskr_O206_kFarJIJrDQ.text: Super friendly staff! Would love to return agin to spice up my levels with curry. Food is very consistent and the small drink selection lists is also pretty accommodating to the restaurant's type.

6pcRkWfQH2l1aTg9hxUJ7g.text: I lovvvee Japanese curry, and this comes close to one of my fave places in Hawaii. They've expanded since I've started going here, and they're customer service is still on point  My go-to meal is the chicken Katsu curry with cheese topped with a lot of fukujinzuke.   And yes they're menu is limited...serving just a variety of curry and meats. It's a typical Japanese curry house.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu curry with cheese

LlJMjxRApZgIxwUoCAYOEA.text: If you love curry this place is a must try !! I would like to say this is the best curry town. Go Now !

5uQwmsRMyvVoUdlR-reumw.text: Can't go wrong with this place. The curry satisfies my curry cravings. My go to is the Japanese meatloaf with spinach and chicken katsu for extra protein.   Other than this location, I do go to the other location on rainbow and robindale. The app for that location makes ordering easier and it's always ready for pickup.

RNj1_oFrJRblt1_esT9yjA.text: I like everything about Zen. My co-workers go at least once a week. Stand-outs include the Curry Pan, 16 grain rice, and the TOFU!  Las Vegas Locals know what's up.

Yl8wh0Mi8K7q0OVQ4Wn1vg.text: I LOVE this place!! I could eat here everyday if i want to and not get bored of it!! The usual that i always get is the egg and spinach with chicken katsu and fried tofu on the side with spicy level 8! Yummy!!!! And i would have to also say they have the best takoyaki here in las vegas:)

vM33khOYIDvFwt4nT1mwew.text: Tasty Curry! I like this place a lot especially because you can chose the level of spice you want. I generally like spicy, and so level 2 wasn't so bad. There was kick to it but I'm sure I could have gotten a higher level of spiciness. I do wish the portion was a little bigger though, but I still would come back regardless! Two thumbs up!

KaIyIT-nv0Bh5RPH0Xtjuw.text: Good variety of menu items also offers lighter versions. My favorite is the spinach curry with the katsu and the croquette. The only reason I docked one star is because of the spicy levels. Its never consistent and they charge u for extra spice levels 5 to 10.

Le0ygAvmWjNFQhrKEcngtw.text: This is our favorite place for Japanese curry. It's always busy and crowded so we always do take out. Food always comes out hot and fresh. Food is always delicious and cooked right.

0YGhOXaHcTXApVwJ5bAimw.text: I've been coming to Curry Zen for YEARS! It's my absolute favorite curry spot. The curry is always the same and they never disappoint! The staff is always so nice and the menu offers such a wide selection of toppings. Anything you get in the menu is guaranteed to be delicious. My usual go to is a Chicken Katsu Curry spicy level 5 with a Croquette. I highly recommend and will continue going to Curry Zen until my dying day lol

7Af1d3spAtm4gu3Z3I6lxQ.text: I had a craving for curry and this place more than satisfied it. Coming back again for dinner!

ECpCKwTB4kTUCTiETHdILA.text: I brought my friend here for the first time because I absolutely LOVE Zen. It always gives me a comforting vibe. Mostly because all of the waitresses and waiters are so attentive and bright. Despite how busy it gets they always bring their A game. Special thanks to Sharon for giving my friend a great humorous experience. She was always on her feet and catering to our needs.

OcpXaSDxtzH-FAWspRkylg.text: So good! This is basically a build your own curry eatery and has easily become a favorite spot for my son and I. It's usually pretty busy, that alone speaks volumes on what a gem this place is. We have never had to wait for table. The staff is friendly and the food comes out super fast. I recommend adding the cheese and corn as toppings to your curry.

fdedzKPI2Yf_HVJyS2G8ow.text: 3.5 stars:  Good: - Curry flavor as on point - Employees were friendly and attentive - Portions were good for the price  Bad: - Chicken was really dry and overcooked - Parking can be an issue because of how popular the other shops are in the plaza  Go during off-peak times. Otherwise there could be a wait.

OfHE9GL62-QKdqtjFmVDuA.text: Well, very polite staff and delicious food.. overall, I am satisfied and would go back there anytime.  They were about to close but still made exception to cook for me veggie and beef curry with rice..   One critic I would have was, portions are small, I was able to eat two orders myself. Each order being 12 dollars average, making the portions bigger would bump this place 5 stars in my book.

Jr7Jr3_rnQveSsceKwXEtA.text: If you're looking for a delicious tasty curry Zen curry is the spot. Been here multiple times, and there's never a dull moment eating here. This time I bought to go and it was ready in a short time. I always add cheese and corn to my chicken cutlet curry. Their curry sauce has a tangy flavor with a hint of sweetness when you bite into it.  The chicken is crispy and tender served in a big portion. This place does get very busy, being in the Chinatown area of spring mountain. Would always come back as this place is my number spot for curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry cutlet to go !

xMrLRvnHKDMaLtCCFiRUDg.text: Place never disappoints. Curry master chef is amazing. He's so friendly too. Just the right about of everything you can think of when you're craving a rice curry dish. Love coming here every time I'm in town. I wish I could take it home and eat it for lunch the next day. Too bad it's way too far and I'm too paranoid that it'll spoil by the time I make it home

EfuAbkVrHQEWsNj8EfV9tA.text: Came here when I was in Vegas before we were going out for EDC. The food was very satisfying and filling for the day. We had to wait for a while though before being seated because it was a small restaurant and we had 8 people. Once we got it, the service was very attentive and the curry was good.   Don't get too spicy because it really does get spicy. Very flavorful and I would recommend getting the other side items too. Fried oysters were great addition.

R5DPrJoTZF2kNwG0KOOcpg.text: Worst Service ever! First off do not move a party mid order for a party of people that have not all arrived yet secondly after we were moved our table was by the door constant people entering and exiting making the food cold at this point we tried to finish our plate but could not when we are about to leave after being moved and waiting 12 minutes for our two curries the last three members of the party that they made us move for arrives this is terrible Service I will not be coming back if they had a 0 star option that is what I would chose!

DVDZ_GvQiNK0jkJ8Vjt76A.text: I like Curry Zen but there's a few things about it that concerns me. First off there are too many dishes on their menu that should be improved or at least evaluated. The sausage curry should not belong on the menu. I'm sorry but it doesn't look like something that should be served at a 4-5 star restaurant. It's literally pieces of cut sausage covered in their curry sauce. Usually less is more, and this is a prime example!  Next, the katsudon is advertised as their prime dish, even stating it as the house dish on their menu if I remember correctly. For something that is their house dish, it was nothing special. In fact, I recommend their standard chicken curry instead. I feel like newcomers to the restaurant or even newbies to curry-eaters in general may not enjoy the katsudon. It's a little soggy and on the bland side.  I like their chicken curry especially with the cheese and corn toppings. The curry, rice and chicken were all on point. I have to say the curry is very flavorful, go to a 7 or 8 if you're around that number with thai food.  Service is friendly and prompt, food is great but I only stick with the curry chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki (kind of hard to see)
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry with cheese and corn

dqpc9Kh9ldklJlWjheSLpg.text: They're doing something right if they have so much popularity for a plate of rice and sauce. It's the most delicious curry sauce I've ever tried. I'm not even a fan of rice, but can eat heaps of rice with Zen's curry sauce and some pickled radish. I usually get the chicken katsu, but after trying the croquette, I will be getting that from now on. Had the perfect amount of crunch on the outside and inside was moist and flavorful. You can ask for extra toppings of meats for extra, and get pickled onions, radish, almonds, and raisins for free. Takoyaki appetizer is worth a try.  Their portions are quite large, but they do have a "small plate" option of just the curry and rice for $3.75, which is a perfect size for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry udon
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry udon
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini curry w/ sausage &amp; croquette and lots of radish :-)

-Wg1tv0fldrRcsuDHb2vuQ.text: I love going here but the service here (from what i have witnessed) has seriously plunged. The asian girl with the blue hair was incredibly rude to our table, didnt even refill waters or checked up on us once, and even cut my friend off in the middle of asking for something (she literally walked away from her mid sentence lmao). The past few times i've visited the employee-customer interaction was incredibly low and we constantly had to flag down the employees for simple items that i've already asked for previously or they just drop the food off and never come back again.

NNqQ2yR0TKqGf2xoCeEcmw.text: You can only eat so much strip food.  Eventually you need "real" food.  This became our "real food" place of the trip.   It's not high end but, it's filling and reasonably priced.  That counts! The katsu was delicious and juicy.   If I could ask for anything, it'd be a bigger space! Our wait was long. Definitely worth it though for a simple tasty break in all the madness!

Pe0SVdMNcEHIySi7fYsS4g.text: This Japanese curry place was recommended to us by our brother and fellow elite yelper. We are so glad we tried it. It was easy to find. It's a few minutes from the strip. When we walked in, it smelled like curry heaven. The host/waiter greeted us right away with a Japanese greeting and seated us. The restaurant was about half full. They had a booster highchair for our toddler.   The menu isn't too complex which was nice. I ordered the vegetable curry with no mushrooms and my husband got the chicken katsu curry. We both got 3 for the spicy level. It was $0.20 per meal to add a level 3 spice. The spicier you add, the more it costs but the max spicy level was still under $1. The waiter mentioned that the 3 would probably be too spicy for our toddler, and I told him he'd probably just eat the rice anyway. I thought that was very considerate of him to mention that.   The food came out in an expected amount of time. We both took one bite of our meals and were so pleased with how our curry tasted. It was pretty spicy at first but then not too bad. My mouth was burning though. I'd probably get a 2 next time. Good thing we had ice water nearby (which was a little slow to be refilled but that's ok - my husband said that's how it is in Japan haha).   I tried my husband's meal and LOVED the crunchy, breaded outside and tender, moist inside of the chicken. I wish they would do a chicken and vegetable curry dish. That would be perfect. The meal portions were huge! We were very full afterwards and I couldn't finish mine.   Overall, it was $25 including the tip. We hope to be back down this way soon so we can eat here again. Someone needs to open one of these in Utah county!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry, no mushrooms. So delicious and HUGE portion sizes.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry. Wow it was good. The chicken had a perfectly crispy outside, and a moist inside.

EfT-0U6vZF0NQhhkzP4naQ.text: Basically in love with going to this place! curry Zen gives me that warm feeling (no pun intended) that I can't get at many other places. My friends and I have been frequenting this place for almost a year now and I couldn't be happier that I was introduced to this location since. I'm not the pickiest eater but I love a good presentation and a good selection. This place however, is GREAT. They have adjusted their menu/style since I first started coming here and prior that I didn't believe the place could get any better.  Their wait staff has changed over the course of time and I'm honestly happier about that. Their staff from the past couple of months are noticeably more attentive, friendlier, and I always get the vibe that they're happy to be here. As busy as it gets, I'm appreciative that the service never seems weary and gives the place such an amazing atmosphere.  About the food: AWESOME. I always get the tofu katsu curry, with or without extras. This time I got 4pcs extra and I was super happy about this. Lately I've been ordering their jelly vodka.. And they're usually out of the berry option but the wonderful waitress suggested the Yuzu option. Tasted great! It's hard to find a place that knows how to pair their drinks with their food so well. Usually it's random and doesn't seem to fit. But I have the best time with their selection. Final thoughts are that I can't wait to go back! I highly recommend Japanese Curry Zen to anyone who is looking for a great dinner or lunch!

DKeepYsUnyTedCS2G_nIoA.text: A lot of service workers tend to enjoy their job (or at least they pretend to) especially in front of their customers. That was not the case this evening. We were with friends from out of town and said, with pride, that there is a great curry place to check out. The other staff was great, the food was great, but the quality of service was the lowest by far.  The male server greeted us by saying, "Just so you know, we can only split the check in four ways." I thought that was an odd version of "Welcome to Japanese Zen Curry. What can I get you?" He was very short with our friends when they were trying to decide what to order, did not offer suggestions, and spoke very monotone and had the facial expression like he was contemplating throwing himself out of the window of a moving vehicle. While I was ordering, I was looking over the side dishes to add to my curry plate. As I often do, I speak while I think and the server mistook it as me ordering and said, "Can you speak up? I can't hear you." I told him I wasn't telling my order and he exhaled like he was in hurry.  We received our food (only reason for the 2-star rating) and it was great as usual. Another server offered to print out individual receipts so we can group the payment in three instead of four per request of Mr. Sunshine to help clarify the order. Before we knew it, he comes to our table scolding us saying, "I TOLD YOU WE CAN ONLY SPLIT IN FOUR." I had enough at this point and responded, "You have three cards in your hands. We only want it three ways." When I offered to tell him that we can group it for him, his response was, "I don't know what you ordered!" I can see the awkward looks on our friends' faces so I stood up and had to spell out for him how to charge us.  After signing our bills, he comes over and asks, "Do you need anything else?" I laughed. And i said, "Nope." And he walks away. I don't know if he was forced to work or a family member died, but he does not belong there. I hope the owner or the friendlier staff members speak about his rudeness. Get some sleep, guy.

BP5tErdH3XbmWKy14vSphQ.text: I loved this place! The food was delicious, servers were very friendly and to top it all off.... they had takoyaki balls!!! Which were absolutely off the chain! It's very hard to find these delightful little treats around town that actually taste so good but this is the place that has them! The prices are great and it's a very quaint little joint. You won't be disappointed.

gdqWlMb1JwG33JqzdngIYQ.text: Curry use to be the one thing I didn't want, but this place changed my mind. The curry here has a lot of flavor but isn't too overpowering like many other places. I'm def not a curry expert but I like the food here.  Food -katsu curry- yum, the curry goes great with katsu and rice. I like how the katsu isn't breaded too thickly. The only drawback is they don't give you that much katsu, and there are no vegetables.  -katsu don- good flavor with a decent amount of food. Meat was a little dry though  -tako yaki- yum  Service- service is usually good, friendly waiters who do their best to accommodate you. I like how they split the bill for you.   Environment- nice and clean, fair amount of tables. Parking lot is small and crowded though.   Overall, this place gave me a new perspective on curry. They offer good food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu plate curry w extra chicken katsu

-3uQ6TWSv9-lkKGvst_5Hg.text: Definitely try the curry udon! I literally should be a vip here since I eat it so often I LOVE THIS PLACE!

rOQEpFd8jU7llLjkc8PvyQ.text: The best curry I've ever had! The place is small but this is a great thing cause the staff is so friendly that you feel like your eating at their dinner table. I had the chicken katsu and it was breaded just right not to mention it was super moist! I loved being able to spice up my meal with all the condiments options... not that it needed it but the option was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu with the oh so magical curry sauce! Yum!

cKcAYXlOV2gjuStfjogYhA.text: Got the Chicken Tender curry level 2 hot, it was on point, I recommend it, it's located in a small shopping center so I recommend parking on the outside. You'll enjoy the Asahi on draft.

nZQNat9XJcghuX_rb58bkw.text: Curry plain and simple! I've gotten the Curry Udon and the classic Chicken Katsu. The Shumai with spicy mustard kicks your ass in a good way. Also Cheap beer and great service.

HSwdGYPJcGfpFzBhXc-mUw.text: Best Japanese Curry I've had since living in Japan and/or Hawaii. The flavors are on point and the presentation is always appetizing. I lived in Vegas for 8yrs before finding this place a few months ago. The spice levels are there for a reason, so choose wisely! Coco House flashbacks with every bite

FrmJEYPWzzvOHNn4dffzwg.text: Curry comes in so many flavors and that's why I'm not the biggest fan.  However, after visiting Zen Curry I can definitely give curry an endorsement.  After my wife had recently visited Japan she had a craving for curry.  Zen was busy but the wait wasn't too long.  I ordered the Tonkatsu  (breaded pork) curry and an order of Tacoyaki.  The Tonkatsu looked very simple.  The breaded pork was side by side with white rice and the curry gravy was liberally spilled over both.  The pork was delicious and crispy and the curry had a nice spice and all in all it was so awesome!  Takoyaki is a Japanese snack that is in the form of a ball.  In the middle of the deep fried dough ball is a small piece of octopus.  If you come to Zen don't miss out on the Takoyaki, it was so good!  Over all, I loved this place.  My wife even said that Zen Curry was very close to the curry shops she ate at in Japan.  This is a must go in Las Vegas!

RU1h2EbBnnlOatA836AgJA.text: Absolutely love it here! Small and cozy environment. I always get the chicken curry katsu and it never disappoints me. Also the staff is very friendly!!

QL9pqdi0BR-ipqsqdVnUtg.text: The curry here is awesome and I'm not much of a curry lover. Love the vegetable curry with chicken tenderloin or pork katsu. Also love that they offer brown rice!

EMSD09pq4zsDi70am0TeKQ.text: Yum - had a craving for Chicken Katsu Curry and this satisfied it! Was staying on the strip and used Postmates to get dinner delivered!  Cheaper than a roundtrip Uber.  Curry was tasty and the katsu was crunchy and moist. Never seen spice level options before, I got a 1 which was just fine for me. And my hubby got a 4, which he said was pretty spicy - and he likes spice.  All in all, would order again if in Vegas.

C4jGi4Bj6Ja54sXv-diu9Q.text: While we haven't tried the other japanese curry place Zen Curry is the bomb! My family and I fell in love with this place from day 1. It's affordable and oh so yummy! Must not be high in sodium cause it doesn't raise my grandmas blood pressure like the ones you make at home from the box. It may be quick and easy, but packed with sodium! We always leave Zen Curry wanting more despite being full :D

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry with brown rice

L3L35ZV-BEhuEmcYRs3ynA.text: If tasty, fast and simple is what you are after, look no further. This hidden gem offers a flavorful twist to the curry most of us are used to and couples it with tasty protein choices. The service is excellent and the prices are very economical. You must check this place out!

s006KuK6fLjS4Mv-cVkXaA.text: Their curry is SO delicious. I love the spinach curry with tofu katsu. Great place for both meat eaters and vegetarians/vegans. The staff is super friendly and are always energetic and fun whenever I go in there (which is usually once a week). One of my favorite places in town

3RVAAHB378X1wiG1FfCOqA.text: It's a great curry house, not to be confused with a katsu house.  Always end up being super stuffed since everything is so delicious and we over order.  Make sure you order the curry bread soon as you get your server.  NYE we went and were told a lady who just came in ordered the last 12.  Night before, we were told the table who came in after us ordered the last two orders.  Fried oysters are done right, fried shumai delish!  Gyoza spot on as well as the takoyaki.  One thing I would probably pass on is the clam chowder, it was good, but not my style of chowder.  Chicken katsu curry with corn, spice level 7 with a side of spam.  Throw in some of the red pickled veggies and almonds, and you are golden!

zIVQfKDDRw0okW5whJmLKg.text: Excellent curry, great service.  My go to is typically chicken curry with spinach.  I enjoy a little bit of spice, so I usually go with spice level 1 or 2.  The boyfriend LOVES spicy, and enjoys level 6.  It's a slow burn, so the first few bites of 6 were ok for me, but was too overwhelming after about 6 or 7 bites.

Mjb6eE1ObJ7dhesCG342Mg.text: Authentic Japanese curry is a rarity in this city, so I'm ecstatic we now have one!   As another reviewer stated, this place is as similar to Japan's CoCo Ichiban as you can get in mainland America. I've missed this food since I left Japan, so I had the chicken cutlet curry with an extra pork cutlet, and it was exceptional in every way.  The great thing about this place is that your meal can can be as gargantuan as you'd like if you add extra toppings, though the typical serving of rice, curry, and one meat is enough.  The service was very attentive as well, which I'm sure will continue as people discover this gem.   I'm expecting this place to become the Monta of curry, so enjoy the lull while it lasts. The word WILL get out, and this place definitely deserves more business.

sXk4VOvSEz7P171CyJOo1w.text: There's not a lot of places in Vegas that serve japanese curry compared to LA so I was super happy that I found this place. The place is small but the food makes up for it. The servers are nice and friendly. The food is nicely proportioned but I do wish they would add more meat. My fave japanese curry place in vegas!

Y0Zk8e6gUlqWKrpXpKcxXg.text: The curry is really good, it's flavorful and has a reasonable portion. Service was quick since we arrived right when it opened. The spice numbering system is a little unclear since it goes up to 10 but from our experience 1, 2, 3 is like mild medium and hot while 10 is like depths of hell or something. My friends couldn't handle their spiciness "3" and the waitress took it back and remade their food less spicy. The chef came out to make sure it was okay and he was really friendly about it and a fantastic sport. As someone that generally can't handle spicy, a 2 was perfect for me. So go ahead and test your spiciness, and if you can't handle it, you can trade it out for no extra cost!

kcMwc1OoCKOig9EFLWlODg.text: If you want traditional japanese curry, this is the place to go. Forget your gluten free carb free diet nonsense - get some good homestyle, delicious japanese curry with all the fixings or toppings you could want.

Xm7hk-lO_uC-NfD2vW_lbQ.text: What a great little concept. The curry was good, real good. My favorite was the Spam add-on. I can't wait to come back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My curry with kushi (3 kinds), kura sausage, spam, and corn. Thank you for such a great experience :)

ZK2Q80YlpIyDSmnhmBLNlQ.text: A little hole in to the wall.  It's small so expect a wait if u come on a weekend.  Nothing bad about it...the service is good for an Asian spot.  Portions are small.  But prices are good.  Great place to go with family so u can order a whole bunch of stuff and share.

_zOzul9iXXv0Mv9b6hogjg.text: Ok this is a 3.5 star review. I really wanna go with 4 but then I feel I'm not being True to the other places I gave a 4 star too because they were exceptional. But this place is a very good place for curry. Given the selection in Vegas it's probably one of the best. I've been here more than a few times if that tells you anything. The curry is pretty good and consistent in flavor each time. I really like the curry udon but my girlfriend thinks it's only ok. But hey when do couples ever agree. It's a pretty good place and it will definitely take care of your curry craving.

j9UsynWV_XrCz8146oOdTw.text: Best curry in Vegas. Hands down. Tastes just like CoCo's Curry in Japan, with a hint of spice thats just enough to give it flavor, but not so much that you're dying. Definitely my new curry spot!

7yd3Ez6Dm60td4i44ETKtQ.text: My hunny 's family had taken my son and I here before and all the food was on point to the point we crave their curry dishes often. Each time we have gone we have amazing service everyone is kind and welcoming and the food is very reasonably priced and everything is delicious.  My son's favorite is sausage curry, and gyoza as the appetizer.  We will always keep coming back :)

ACNjhppGG1X7aTUXpfRaaA.text: Right when you walk in you are warmly greeted. The waitress is super sweet and attentive.  I ordered the Curry with Pork Cutlets, Croquette, and Curry Pan.  I have never tried a curry pan but it looked good in the picture so I ordered it. My order was to go and usually other places put your freshly fried food in the to go box and by the time you get home it is all soggy.  The merry chef at Japanese Curry Zen was so thoughtful and makes sure he let's the fried pieces set and crisp before he packs it  so when you get home they are still absolutely delicious and chrisp. The order was meant to be my dinner but when I got home I just wanted a little spoon full of curry to try it out. I ended up eating my whole order right then and there! It was so good I had to finish eating everything! Man the chef knows how to cook. Curry master!!

hQ732Juj1mVX07vWi_KrOQ.text: I have been a customer of Zen since it opened. My friends and I would often come here because we wanted to support the restaurant, so I'm really glad that it is as successful as I would have imagined it to be.  There aren't many specialty restaurants in Vegas that have Japanese curry as their selling point and that's why I think Curry Zen is good for Vegas. It is unique and it is different from what we already have here. If you've never tried Japanese curry before, I say go here for your first time. The curry sauce is creamy and very tasteful and the way they cook their meat is perfection. This is definitely authentic Japanese curry. I've been to Japan a few times before and when I eat curry there, it reminds me of Curry Zen and makes me miss the restaurant. They have a bigger selection of Japanese curry now (as compared to when they started when they only have about 10-15 dishes) so you'll definitely find something that you like. The customer service here is as good as it gets as well. Sure, it gets busy from time to time and they forget to refill your water but you can see genuine smiles from the server that never seem to disappear. The owners also walk around to see how you are doing, which I think makes it such a personal and inviting restaurant.   They have a nice selection of desserts and non-curry food as well, so if you're not into Japanese curry, you can always try other selections that they have.  All in all, Curry Zen is definitely worth a shot. If you've never been here before, try it. I'm sure you'll be a regular like me before you know it.

imUp71FjXlA5Lu8VfKH1rQ.text: Just the way I remember the curry houses in Japan.  An intimate setting with name your spice level.  Even with the expanded dinning room the chef is no further away than a dinner party at home.  If curry is not your thing you won't find alternatives. The menu is just straight to the point.  Having said the 8 year old in our dinning party was quite content with the chicken cutlet and rice, hold the sauce.  Go figure.  My pork cutlet level 4, met my curry craving with high marks. Now to work my way up the ladder of heat. 1-9.  A 4 got my nose running lol.  2-3 level should be fine for medium fans.  The staff said the difference between 4 and 5 is more than the other steps.  I'll bring some tissue and take them up on that on the next visit.

SsGAF9GxIdPg65AQxrP5DA.text: Ordered Kushi Katsu, the pork curry, and one of their appetizers on special. Everything was great, but just about everything on their menu was fried, which was a bit off-putting. Bottom line, delicious fried food, but not a big selection. On the plus side, they do serve alcohol!

IpCH7zNbeqQyhdVxEMCg5Q.text: I really like this place. I need to go more often. For some reason it's nvr too crowded but that's a good thing. Wish they had beer as well.

-oO2u9Nt3rXHwK4SnICqNA.text: You can find me here at least five times a week and two days are to go orders! Got the whole family addicted and make family try it when they out in vegas. For a tiny girl who doesn't eat much I finish the plate! That's how amazing it is! The staff is great and fast. Clean restaurant which makes it a better place. We always challenge how spicy we can eat which makes it fun. Chicken, pork, and shrimp curry are all tasty! And the cold beer just hit the spot!

Sz-xIqkvO5SpUmjaEQoWMQ.text: Great food as always. Had pork katsu and sausage with level 3. Great portion and amazing curry. Thanks for a great lunch!

1T3kOmsZOM3B6PzPCN9lHw.text: Delicious! Really excellent curries,  with a good number of selections. I'd suggest keeping your spice level below a 7. I normally like spicy food,  and the 7 was just at the edge of my tolerance!

ZrC2iaoZS9TipogsZyupPw.text: One can get their fill of spicy Japanese curry here. A wide selection of toppings to choose from, but simple enough to order quickly. On a spicy scale from 1-5, I recommend 3 or under to satisfy your craving for spicy goodness. Get 4 or higher if you brought your own napkins for your nose. Satisfying they are. I'll be back when I'm in this area again.

Eqylcpkyt5HL45nc-GnsAQ.text: I came here wanting CoCo's curry.  This wasn't CoCo's but it's a good sub.  I had the chicken katsu level 8 (not spicy to me).  It was AWESOME!

UzA0eBsPMszDpHRhn8MtGQ.text: Curry Zen is the jam!!  Best curry in the valley, by far.  Reminds me of the curry from home (Hawaii) and it definitely hits the spot when I'm jonesin'.  The place itself is a little small so it can get crowded in there.  However, sitting at the bar, I still have enough shoulder space to feel comfortable so that's usually my sitting spot.  I also love the pickled onion garnish and make sure to capitalize when I'm there.  The brown rice option is also a nice touch.  Definitely a good spot to get some quick curry grub and leave happy.  Next time, I'm going for the Curry Udon!!

NklsTPi1m7fTwYrOUF-a-g.text: Katsu breading is perfectly made. Not burnt or undercooked like other places make Katsu. Pretty big portions and filled me up good. Had vegetable curry with tofu katsu. Curry was delicious and well prepared. Everyone that I've brought to this place has enjoyed it as much if not more than I have.

o6BPD6OvbbRihGp5QvCKnA.text: One of my wife's favorites. I am a fan of the curry with basically anything. Japanese curry very different then other curries. Still amazing though.

mnrKbOVnhChQdOkQBxdXcw.text: Amazing curry, done Japanese style. Staff is very attentive, and all of the food cooked fresh to order. They do give you options on your spiciness level desired, I'm a wimp and do 1. My husband does a 7, and he loves the bracing kick it has. All of the fried foods are perfectly done, juicy when appropriate. The sauce is the best part of the meal, hearty and ultra flavorful. My fave place to eat in Vegas!

Dom4ErzjzhCg3xz_snypqw.text: We popped in here on a whim and it was such an unique and cute little place! The food tastes amazing and the prices are reasonable. Although the menu seems simplified, it helps customers narrow down the choices with the addition of pictures for the dishes!   The Edamame was fresh and scrumptious. The chicken Katsu curry was the perfect blend of spicy and traditional. The dish filled our stomachs and we're happy customers. We will definitely come back again in the future! A+ food & service.

qB3giSP_Mq_2QCqHDZpo0g.text: Came here for late snack. I end up finishing a plate of curry. I just couldn't resist the smell of curry. The curry was as awesome as it smells. I totally recommend this place. It's really affordable too.

UXQIkuQMHsvKBwtLfuCcEA.text: I had the 5-piece kushi curry (the skewers were shrimp, shiitake, quail egg, zucchini, and chicken) from the menu and fried oysters from the specials board.  I love their sauce--it is definitely their own fragrant blend. I didn't specify hotness, but that worked out well. At first I thought it was going to be too mild, but by the end of the meal my nose was running and my mouth was pleasantly hot.  It was very busy at lunch--the place seats something like 35 and the one waitress was just about overwhelmed--but they kept the dishes coming out at a steady pace.  While I prefer curry with ingredients cooked into the sauce, I would definitely order the kushi curry again.  The oysters were also very good.

raW2MXtCoiNdy_0kH2fndQ.text: I have an addiction to this curry place, such that i had my husband doing a take-out for me and drove from vegas to LA. But it is still soooo good. The pork katsu curry was yummy, especially with spice level 7, thats some serious kick. The best part about this katsu curry is after the long 5 hours drive, the katsu still taste good.  I am a bit disappointed that this place ran out of curry pan by 3pm in the afternoon. Why why ?

H_-VHBWAncgmOQFGUsMq4g.text: The chicken katsu curry has the right crispiness! You can choose the level of curry spiciness to suit your taste. Fast service too.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ur6s6bsNOXM5DhM8BNsYpA.text: Best Japanese curry place in town. I always get the chicken katsu curry with cheese and croquette. Servers are always nice. Food comes out pretty quick and is always on point. Nice crispy katsu, with awesome curry. This place never disappoints.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry with cheese and croquette

S3_1uIBm84Z6HS--G_LwhA.text: I went with a group of 10 so I called the restaurant to make reservations. When I called Zen answered and said his restaurant only holds 18 people at a time. My answer? 8 more than we needed :)  At first menu glance all we see is deep fried. Unfortunate.  Low and behold we see a beef and sausage dish and after speaking to the server found out they made a grilled chicken too. Recommended.   Funny note. Picture of beef showed 4 pieces. We asked the server if the picture was accurate and he said there was actually 6 pieces. We were server 5.  Um ya. The server came back later with two more pieces.    The chicken katsu was good. Lots of rice with each dish. Don't order a side of corn as its about 2 tablespoons at most really? Give me the whole damn can! Lol   My favorite was the spinach. Go figure. Perfectly cooked. Right tenderness and not soggy. The mix it right in the curry.   The confusing part was the spice level. Regular was 1-5. Then they had a blazing option at 6-10.  I was told medium was between 1-5 so I ordered a 2.5 to be funny but the server wasn't amused. But smiled  :). Other friends had a 5 and I could barely tell the difference. We didn't order any 'blazing's so I could compare.   The owner came out again to greet us all after we finished and was very sweet. Tried to explain the difference in spice levels but I was already in a rice/ food coma.   The extra star to make it a 4 was their spice mix they leave on the table. I sprinkled it on my wrist prior to ordering and was in love. I added this to all my 'shared' plates.  They also had two hot spices one which looked like crushed red peppers and the other cayenne.

fAMaOBwb67yJT1zmB2AkPA.text: If you were ever in the military and stationed in Japan and went to Coco's Curry, this place is right up there with it. Great selection of sides (shrimp, spinach, katsu, corn). Also the spice levels are really well balanced. This place is a very authentic Japanese curry house. The feel is very close to being back in Japan. The only thing is don't come around dinner time. I was here are 7 on Tuesday and the parking lot was packed. I highly recommend this place.

IW5fEzaGdngiXh3lCIkg_g.text: Love it best curry place I've tried in years,I been to several other places but none compare   Try the pork tender curry

GoRAyLXQYdgNSjXldwa-mA.text: This Is The Best Japanese Curry In Las Vegas! I Come Here Every Other Week! They Always Give Me Fresh , Tasty and Perfectly Served Food. I Usually Get The Chicken Katsu w potato Croquet. 100% recommend if you love curry!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

66rj-ozEtNlSH3BTeEaNxw.text: By far my favorite curry place in town! The curry here is so flavorful and satisfying. The staff are friendly, quick, and courteous and the food always comes out quick. Definitely worth trying if you've never had Japanese curry!

3cat_0dlzEYL55ypYF4k1g.text: Delicious food. Friendly faces :) if you don't eat too much rice and curry you could get the smaller bowl for $2/3 less. It's still plenty. Think if it like a panda bowl. Lol :) enjoy!

yrZyEJa6BnvULEZP3F4QZw.text: The food tasted amazing, and the service was exemplary--What a bargain. So good, that we came back 3 days later and brought friends. This place is legit.

DAJmG0XydjHfO6qxBqkmwg.text: Be sure to try the Tako Yaki balls.. Delish!!

wg146TokD-teiwuPQ8-Hlw.text: Hands down one of the best places for Japanese curry. My boyfriend and I are regular customers here and they never disappoint. The waiters/waitresses are always very nice. Good, quick service too. The croquette curry and curry udon are so delicious! Definitely try here, you'll be addicted.

Ue2aey5khAFcS-JWdhzHIA.text: The curry is very tasty. Very savory, perhaps slightly too salty for my taste, but I can't deny the fact that salt can be so yummy.  I've been here twice now. I got mild spicy and I would rate that as a 4 out of 10. So for people that aren't into spicy, make sure to order extra mild. Spice is so tough to calibrate though, sometimes I order a 4/10 at a thai place and it comes out 6/10 and some other places when I order medium the spicy level is 3/10. Oh well, spicy is dependent on each cook too. So, just order what you think you can handle that day.  I had the veggie curry then added meat to it. I enjoyed that veggies in the curry a lot. I highly recommend that.

RNmIyD0QqtomtoU1ZMpwqQ.text: Terrible service, don't go at lunch time not even order to go, they will put you on hook off the phone for 9 mins and told you they are busy, and usual just don't care, and try to buy you off with free food, people are not bagger, people need service not pity. Terrible way to do business, Never Never need this around. If I can put Zero they are below zero.

qdAHcqTGaKfR0DKScIZw_w.text: We come here all the time and it's always so freaking delicious! Even though it's over 100* outside we still make a point to have a hot meal here. The food never disappoints! Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can&#39;t come in with out getting a curry pan!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry with veggies and cheese

YeZiLRxfYnJ9wrimPg43wA.text: I really liked this place.  I've never eaten Japanese curry before so I have no frame of reference.  But I really liked the taste.    This was as "comforty" as any comfort food I can get back home in the land of the Norwegians and Germans.  Spicier, but still great comfort food.  I'd stack this up against cheese buttons or klub any day!  You probably don't know what cheese buttons or klub even is.  Trust me...anything that stacks up to cheese buttons and klub is pretty freaking good.  The waitress and cook talked me down from a spice level 5 to a spice level 3.  I think they were concerned for my safety or something.  :)  Wish I would've stuck to my guns, oh well.  I shall return.

ba-XQZMmGWqYq_j8QU_h3A.text: I really like this place! Ordered ck katsu and tokiyaki, love it. Also, the service was excellent :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu and takoyaki

0PcMjP5XVvTipFfsOqkwnw.text: Real Japanese curry made by real Japanese people!  I always do a happy dance inside when I encounter this..  Just like in Japan, most restaurants the menu's are small and specialize in one type of dish; in this case curry.   Food Breakdown: I ordered tonkatsu curry.  The curry sauce itself is legit Japanese curry and was mild in spice and flavor.  They did offer pepper and other spices if you wanted to give it more oomph. This was different from the typical Nihon Curry-ya where they would ask you your spice (pain) tolerance level and add oomph accordingly. Boo on that :(  The curry had no sustenance; just sauce. A little carrots, onions or meat in the sauce would've gone a long way in my book.   I don't mind paying good money for good food however at a pricepoint of $9 for katsu curry it fell short and I left hungry.   I am glad to find a legit nihon curry-ya in Vegas so I'm sure I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu curry

izcCkx0cla98udfCrW1A4w.text: Been to curry spots all over Japan as well as the US. This place was the closest I've found to the good ones in Japan. The curry tasted homemade and the varieties of Katsu's were both tasty and crispy. Appetizers were tasty as well. Had the curry pan and it was so good I had to order another! Definitely glad I found this place and will be coming back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Tenderloin Curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Pan

DlLVh6Mp1qL9qK6xF-yLwA.text: A great find in LV for authentic Japanese curry! Lots of options for customizing your curry meal! Enjoy!

lY0-F_mpusnEV6keS37rOQ.text: The chicken Katsu with curry (level 5 spice) was solid esp for the price and I actually enjoy the seemingly plain presentation because the curry was very tasty , low key would come again bc it's p good.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry level 5 spice

GoILoy3nra5Ixcraq7RCAQ.text: One of my absolute favorite places in Las Vegas for Japanese curry. I always get either the chicken or pork katsu curry. You can also choose your spice level for the curry sauce. It goes from 1-10, but be warned.. their spice is no joke! I usually go for level 2 or level 3. 2 is good enough for me, but 3 is when I want that feel that kick in there. Service is always great and fast. The servers really know how to move the customers along and they will quintuple seat tables at a time. I don't know how they keep up! Overall, this place is a must if you like Japanese curry. They even have vegetarian options such as spinach and egg, fried tofu, vegetable, and there's one more but I can't remember it. This is a place for all kinds of crowds. I must say though... Their portion size has decreased over the years. Oh! And go over to Kung Fu Tea afterwards for a dessert drink.

6cE1WKzSE4OrIFTI1JFJjg.text: yummy. delicious meal. katsu chicken curry is tender n juicy. the curry is perfect. i like spicy so 12 out of 10 ($1.00 additional to the bill) cheap fulfilling meal. I'll eat this any days with rice n lots of spicy of course. services are good. next time I'll get spicy level of 15 cause 10 & 12 is still not spicy enough. but what can i say. i just love spicy foods. there right amount of rice curry n meat. give it a try. parking can be a pain but it is in the small plaza. i like to go over to kung fu tea after. Bobas. pretty decent milkteas. definitely will come back again. even tho this place opens at 11:30 am. they were ready n open at 11:20 am. the foods clean. n non greasy curry with crisp chicken. just love it w the spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken katsu curry. i added green onions to my curry.

PFAIRkKc11KALY4fdDVbvA.text: Got the Katsu-Don, very good! Will remember this place and try to come back again one day!

NTbKalCA4oUmwssABUUMwQ.text: They don't mess around with their spice levels.  If you're a spicy food lover, you'll appreciate this place.  Level 4 spice is too spicy.  I'd go with level 1 next time.  I loved how the curry sauce was very flavorful though.      Unfortunately, I thought Coco Ichibanya's meats were better since their beef is softer and their chicken is crispier/juicier than Curry Zen's.   Tip: Get the small portion of curry to save a few bucks.  The regular portion just has more rice and is served on a bigger plate.

PcZe1ttwgQ_fyfFRjvuB9g.text: I was spoiled with amazing curry when I went to Japan over the summer. After a few friends and I agreed to try this restaurant out, I was really excited!  I got there a little early compared to the rest of my group, however, because the restaurant itself is pretty small, the whole group needs to be present in order to get seated...so make sure to scold the friends that are always late to be on time! Lol The interior smelled amazing and the decor was simple, reminiscent of the restaurants I visited in Japan.   I ordered the vegetable curry, spice level 7, and added chicken katsu. As a big fan of spice, I'll vouch that you'll get the level you asked for! It has always annoyed me when you're expecting a certain spice level and it's either either too spicy or not spicy enough. If you want to stay on the cautious side and order low, you can always add some extra chili flakes they have on the table. The curry itself was delicious and very flavorful. The veggies were cooked tender enough to cut with just your spoon. Although the chicken katsu was small, it was yummy and all white meat! I also ordered the takoyaki and I was happily surprised. The outside was crispy and the inside still tender but not undercooked, with large pieces of octopus.   The waitress came by frequently to refill our waters and was nice enough to ask if we needed our checks split. I was very happy with my experience at this place and I will definitely be bringing my boyfriend here to check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki!
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry with chicken katsu

ax7OLrYszVIoSLJsWZuDCw.text: Food quality was good, love the chicken katsu and the curry with spice  Only thing I would say is the portioning is a little small for the price but I guess the taste makes up for the portion  I would recommend to anyone hasn't tried it

ZvXfH4OpakI532QKHqtsPw.text: For curry, portion was great, taste was good. I liked it! I chose spicy level 1, hoping not spicy at all. It was spicy! I would say level 4. I like spicy but I chose level 1, hoping I could feed it to my baby girl who cannot take any spicy at all. This did not work at all. We ordered "oysters" not knowing it was flied. On the menu it didn't say it is flied...Well, it was not my favorite. I wish they had a Natto & egg for toppings. Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple curry with Fukushinzuke
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach curry with tonkatsu
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flied oysters

Rz0jrFhxUsrQTngajggSfA.text: The curry here is excellent, although it actually has a spicy kick to it (if you order it at a spicy level beyond 3).  The portions are small, but that is not necessarily a bad thing; keeps one from overeating.  So just be warned, if you're looking for massive portions, I don't think this is your spot.  If you like Japanese curry, but you want it so that your mouth can breathe fiery dragon-fire, then check this place out; it's great!

mgFmDCwBhhinQOGU_UYkxQ.text: The chicken katsu curry is to die for!!! My boyfriend said he would have likes veggies or something in the curry, but I thought it was perfect as a plain sauce. Prices are decent, and the food is just too good. The croquettes are super duper yummy too. The only downside is the parking lot-- it's set up really poorly.  Will definitely come back!

LNZ3YRWzPmUjK4XCbV5_CQ.text: I was pretty excited to try this place since I love curry, but I think it was just okay. I actual prefer the curry that you can buy in boxes at the supermarket and make at home way more.  I ordered a vegetable curry with low spicy level. They were pretty generous with the veggies, which was nice. The curry sauce was pretty thick, which I think is what it's supposed to be. Unfortunately I didn't like it being so thick and heavy.  It's not bad, but I think there are better food options around. My friends seemed to enjoy it so if you really like curry then stop by.

RHHGKM95x2bZYMLl8VkNEw.text: Best Curry in town! I grew up in Japanese/Hawaiian curry and this brings me comfort!!! Portions are huge. Selections are not too much but has enough to satisfy the appetite! Rice here is good, not half cooked or grainy or over cooked. The deep fried oysters, korroke, kabuta are really fabulous with the curry!

TTZruvsxLuTMFVt-FMOKHw.text: Very heavy but tasty.  If you're into heavy curry and fried foods, then this place is for you.  Not the healthiest and you will feel it afterwards.  Not much vegetable to this meal.  I had the pork katsu with spicy 10 curry with spinach and corn additions.  The corn was like 20 kernels and the spinach was devoured in the curry so not much green to it.  It had a little kick but nothing crazy.  The pork was your basic breaded meat.  I enjoyed the meal but it definitely hits you later in the day and gives you the bloated feeling.    I paid $13.95 total for my meal so it's definitely not that cheap either.  I'd rather eat at many of the other options in China Town or the shopping plaza alone.  But if you're into katsu then it's a good rendition.

tOrox7J-3T6WJr_Yzwc3gw.text: Curry Curry action! I decided too try another curry spot one that on radar just never hit yet. Really good! Not only was the Japanese Curry stayed True too japanese style curry but just from the whole decor inside and moment you step in. Me growing up in Hawaii japanese curry is common place in the islands. The first things that brought me back was soon as you walk in they great you in japanese like anything other japanese restaurant. The counter style action and the size or lack of size (four tables in the entire restaurant) so timing is everything here Japanese Curry Zen. I went odd time so missed the lunch crowd. Small business feel the owner busting out all the curry action and really appreciate your business. The little spices that can add too curry on the tables or counter. Curry done right!  I ended up going with grew up with some chicken katsu curry with add on corn. The chicken katsu was perfect. It was nice golden crispy brown on the outside, moist cooked on the inside, and combine with japanese curry it was divine! Just wished they had some kim chee action on the menu. Still it was the perfect plate lunch action without the mac salad. Lol! They do have other choices for protein and other sides. Really menu not that big just simple, delicious, and all about the curry action. I know lot of options comes too curry but if want some authentic curry Japanese Curry Zen great spot. Small menu not much dessert just walk next door for some Snowflake action!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry! Add corn

udoCMsgs8QsPribh60nOOQ.text: I walk in Monday right after the place opened and it was already busy. I was immediately greeted and seated though, and was asked for my order not soon after. The menu isn't huge but it's a specialized curry place...so that's what the menu is mostly made of. I got the tofu Katsu with veggies and spinach. I have to say it was pretty good. I'd eat here again, but I'd make my order a bit more on the spicy side.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese curry---tofu Katsu with vegetables.

pRyqO07g13gENSzOlm5mUA.text: Oh my gosh! I have never had curry before, but a friend suggested this place. It is small inside, and it was packed when we got there on a Saturday night but the service was amazing. The waitress was very knowledgeable and friendly and answered all of my questions. The food was amazing. We ordered curry udon, fried gyoza, and pork katsu. It was all amazing.

Hj11HkmZe8AfxMcxb3M59g.text: Me and friend went here last night 2/23 Friday night, the food was really good. The place was busy.

eXeQBqStXmu6BIcSGCp0Jg.text: I came back here because I was craving some curry. It was a pleasant surprise to see that they had expanded the restaurant. It used to be a small hole in the wall, now it's a big hole in the wall! The layout was a bit awkward, but the whole restaurant looked nice and clean with a couple of television screens.  Now for the important part... the food. The food continues to improve each time that I come back here. The menu also keeps expanding. In this particular visit I ordered their kushi katsu 5 piece (chicken, quail egg, zucchini, shrimp, shiitake mushroom) curry plate. It was on the chalkboard where they listed their specials. It was good and I definitely will be making a return visit sooner rather the later most likely the next time I'm in the Las Vegas area.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kushi Katsu 5 piece curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specials chalkboard
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Expanded dining area

6SBd-jxYtnNrDunUsuDe1A.text: Whenever I crave Japanese curry, I come to this place! It's also a nice location, just in case you want dessert after or to get something to drink at Kung fu tea!   Their portion is quite large, so I usually have to take half of it home. I usually get Chicken Katsu curry, spicy level 5. Sometimes my sister & I mix and share an 8 and a 5.   Their takoyaki is also quite good!

u9PEb8oR7Tv4IXhzLRFE6Q.text: The best curry in the city, hands down. I drive across town just to come here and it's worth the drive every time.  Friendly servers, great food -- this is a restaurant you have to visit.

HWIXFSG0jVnLZGD5U7ItYw.text: Best Japanese curry I have ever eaten. Simplistic at its best. The dining was a bit small, however the amount of rice and curry given will last you until dinner time and possibly the whole day. They have tasty varieties of food on their menu which makes it difficult to choose from because they are all good. Most of all they have different levels of spice to no spice, mild, or really spicy all depending on your preferences. Customer service is at best courteous and respectful and always making sure you are satisfied. Will definitely return.

Ddt6Y39g2eKqtTC2iBenrQ.text: The food is great! Love the option to increase spicy levels. Only complaint is horrible parking and verry, very small interior room. But food is on point.

9kTZkTJL_AH7X7wAaFF_WQ.text: Love the curry here, I always get the curry with spinach and a level 2. I tried level 3 and that was already burning in my mouth. I love that they make the curry fresh. And the owner, Mr. Zen, is an amazing, sweet man. He takes pride in his food and makes sure it's always right.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd time getting Spicy level 10
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brown rice with spinach curry and spam katsu

x3kNqCdQs9ECXMy1oPuizw.text: Just came back from lunch here. It was totemo oishii desu yo! I had the pork katsu and croquette. The waitress told me the portions weren't that big and I was really hungry so I got the croquette too, but now I am very full and happy.  I paid $15.08 with tax for the pork katsu, croquette ($2.00), and thai iced tea ($2.50). The food came out pretty quickly. The service was prompt and the owner came out and checked on us to make sure everything was good.   The pork katsu was crispy fried on the outside but still tender on the inside. The curry tasted as if it were home made and I suspect it is, unlike other places in town which openly state that they use a curry base that I could easily buy at the store and make myself (i.e. the curry place in the food court adjacent to Clark County community college). There was a lot of curry sauce which I like to sop up with my rice. You can get different levels of heat 1-10, everything about a 5 though there is a surcharge for. I asked for level 5 and it was a little hotter than I would have preferred but that's what i get for asking for a 5. I assumed that as Japanese food is generally not known for heat a level 5 would be about a level 2 in a thai food place but I was wrong. It was still really good and whew... my sinuses are cleared at the moment. I also liked that they give you condiments, I love condiments, they provided pickled radish which was not too heavy on the vinegar and had a really good flavor, onions that had a little beat of heat, almonds, and raisins. Also, tonkatsu sauce and extra hot chili powder. Taking another yelpers suggestion I tried the almonds which added a nice crunchiness and texture to the dish.   That is what I like to see a restaurant that has a relatively simple menu but does it well. If anyone has seen Jiro Dreams of Sushi, then they would understand you do one thing and you do it well and you always strive to do better - and if you haven't seen it definitely a must see.   The dining room was small but modern and clean. Upbeat vibe. I would recommend for anyone who is up for some curry. In fact with so many great places to choose in the shopping center where Japanese Curry Zen is located there is no way to go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu and croquette.

9n8UwjClt_xrFxSEggcBxQ.text: It's a very small place but the curry was very good. I'm normally a level 3 gal at most curry restaurants but this level 3 tasted like what I'd expect a level 8 to taste like. It was very very spicy.   For my 16 month old, I got the curry pan and it was very very good. He ate all of it and nearly licked the plate clean.   We ordered croquettes as a side order and they were great as well. We will definitely be returning.

X5OIl3b1OGLzO-nVHqQaQw.text: Beware of their Spicy Scale... it's not rated for whiteys.   I was craving some Japanese Curry and thought I've give this place a try. The joint is super small, but it's as authentic Japanese Curry house as you can get. The place does get busy, so plan your meals accordingly. I went with their Chicken Katsu curry and added vegetables ($2.00) and corn ($0.50). Not that I like vegetables, but it'd give my curry an appetizing color and consistency. The super nice Japanese server asked me how spicy I wanted it and I went for the hottest, free, spicy level (anything above level 5 spicy costs extra.) Unlike other Japanese curry houses I've been to, their spicy, is effin' spicy. I could barely eat 2 bites without downing a glass of water. I ended up eating 1/3 of my curry, since I drank 3 gallons of water. My whitey counterpart co-workers struggled with level 2 spicy. Overall the food was fantastic, service was great, and the timing couldn't have been any quicker. I would definitely come back here for my Japanese curry fix.   My street creds: I first got into cooking & food when I was in college. After being rejected by numerous girls and getting zero action, I decided it was time for a change. I needed a new makeover to boost my geeky image. I applied for a cooking position at a Mediterranean-Italian Restaurant near my home and learned to cook all sorts of dishes. I never became a professional chef, but I continue to enjoy & love food. 9 years later and 55 lbs heavier, I have a new passion for traveling and trying different foods around the world.

H1AJnDmtw7FihpmpDYT8gQ.text: This place is pretty good, if it was in a small town I would be very happy with it, but it's in las vegas surrounded by some of the best cheap asian food around. I got the chicken katsu curry which tasted great, but their curry tastes almost exactly like the popular 'golden curry' everyone makes at home so nothing special. My girlfriend got the katsu-don, a rice bowl with katsu and egg. It was good, and again if this was in my hometown it would be 5/5, but you can get a way more impressive katus-don down the street for the same price. One nice thing about this place is they sell a 22 oz beer for $5. Just not sure it's worth dealing with the parking lot and waiting in line to eat here

KRj9eUFviE6SlBuU1wsg4g.text: Absolutely hands down the best Katsu Curry I've ever eaten!  And the tofu salad was so delicious !!!  You must eat here if u love Japanese curry ... This place is the best in Vegas and ridiculously affordable !

XlMuO2rVB_s3t37yRVujTg.text: Came in for my friend's birthday, was surprised by their large menu, friendly staff, and cheap beer. The dish I got, chicken katsudon, was absolutely delicious and I was given a more than generous serving. They have japanese soda too! Great cheap dinner in a nice atmosphere. Will be coming back soon!

1R75fPRBAwYNL9sX9--_YA.text: Authentic Japanese curry house...had the pork cutlet (1-2 spicy level since there's red powder you can add if you wanna up the level), on point and wasn't greasy at all. Also ordered the curry udon, not really a fan of it but hubby liked it. Servers were very nice and polite.  Definitely we would like to come back again!

0br7Glm-fa_6qKsuwYggCw.text: Basic Japanese curry place. Place was clean and the food was pretty good. I had their beef curry it had like 6 cubes of beef. Felt like the curry needed a little more texture. I'm used to Korean and Thai curry with lots of stuff inside it, but overall it was good!

qjeK2vkVczAxLAmXmO64sg.text: This place was great, quick, good service and delicious.   My son had tried Japanese Curry on a recent trip to Chicago and wanted it again.  This was my 1st time I'm so glad we went I will be back!  If you like it spicy get it #5.

vWfyQyXSPRNgbS1qI06XMg.text: Went last night after a show and wanted something filling and comforting, and it was just what I needed.  Best Japanese curry I've had so far, and he also agreed it was the best and he's from Hawaii where this more commonly found! super flavorful, fried without being to greasy or burnt.  My boyfriend had the chicken katsu curry, and I had the chicken tenders.  My portion was way bigger than his, but I think his was oddly even more tender.  I am waking up craving more right now, I can't wait to o back.

oK4FGqd0pKd4b2_D_glkag.text: It's Japanese style diner food.  I ordered the Chicken katsu curry. The cutlets are thin and dry, there's no vegetables in the curry. You get your rice, katsu, and curry sauce. Basic.  Prices are little above medium, but rent is not cheap in Chinatown.

N_Q9U-uZAdPBwYymIueQJg.text: Tasty as can be!!! addicted ? maybe just a little. Small place but clean and busy all the time . Thumbs up! My Favorite is  Chicken Katsu Curry. Spicy level number 1... just the right amount of kick. Staff is great and service is fast. Each visit leaves me wanting more.

4Nm968GqsiP2w7NUYDIKoQ.text: Love this place, parking can be a pain in the ass, but I just park at the church across the street and walk in. Service is great, food is awesome. Would be 5 stars but they are a little weak on sides when you take food to go.

9rYUJzYKWJVqWilAWFNjUQ.text: Hubby and I have been coming to Zen Curry before their expansion.  I have always enjoyed the Croquette curry with Spam culet. Hubby loves their Chicken Katsu curry.  We both love that they give us sides of Fukujinzuke,Rakkyo, Almonds and Raisins to add to our curry.  They recently added Takoyaki and Gyoza on their menu...YUM  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croquette curry with spam cutlet

ESn7MCJgP5z7VvLpwxNBUA.text: Curry was decent i got the katsu chicken curry. Nothing beats the curry from L.A but since i live here in vegas this spot will fix urge. Portions are on the smaller side so i have to order 2 plates to feel satisfied... Don't judge me.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry

Ts_o69gr3yEqDzHNJEZ2jQ.text: I am a sucker for curry and Japanese Curry Zen does it really well. The breading is nice and crunchy and is not oily or greasy. I went for the level 4 in spiciness. It was a decent burn. I enjoy spicy food (much to my stomach's dismay) and this lived up to the spicy level. It left a warm feeling for a good hour after consumption. My boyfriend enjoys extremely spicy food so he got level 10. I tried a bite of it and it surprisingly still have good flavor not just heat.  I wish this was closer to my house and/or work so I could eat it more often!

Ch5k8qHUgp82_PE6-0TuAA.text: Food is good.. I ordered chicken katsu curry and fried siomai..i like it.. Service is great staff is really  friendly .. 5 star for them! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu

B-99PKIlPm1tOlBDkkDujA.text: This is my favorite Japanese curry place in town. It's a little small so it can get full quickly but once you're in the food is delicious. Huge fan of the Pork Katsu and Chicken Katsu. They also have takeout so you can drop by and get your food to go. On top of all of this the food is really cheap! They also have all kinds of toppings for you to add if toppings are something you like. Definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s the menu I got when I got takeout

vtLY7-SCOMBp2SVMWpDqQA.text: Delicious. I ordered tofu katau curry and fried oysters for takeout Saturday afternoon. The place was busy and the servers were running around. They were very polite and the food was hot and fresh. I ordered a 10 (the most spicy) and I wish it was more spicy. I would definitely go here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried oysters

c3pYSKDN26GoO8s4dp_ABQ.text: While their curry may lead you to enlightenment the proteins at Japanese Curry Zen aren't worthy of your focused attention.  JCZ has some of the tastiest Japanese curry around!!!...but their proteins are regularly dry and overcooked.    They are doing a lot of things right here.  I'm a big fan of the deep, developed flavors of their curry.  They have brown and multi-grain rice options.  I can easily get down with the fried quail eggs in the Kushi Curry.  If you're into a little heat JCZ offers 10 blaZEN levels.  I highly recommend turning up the heat to about 80% of what you can handle...the heat adds a delightful dimension!  In fact, they are so good in these areas that it's a little frustrating every time you take a bite of sub-par Pork Katsu or Chicken Tenders.  The Vegetable Curry has some potential as well.  It is a mixed veggie combo of potatoes, broccoli, potatoes, carrots, potatoes, squash, and a little more potatoes.    I haven't written JCZ off completely....they're the old friend that doesn't' show a lot of gratitude but still wants to come over to eat every time you have people over.  And truth-be-told, I will probably be back sooner rather than later in search of their perfect dish for me.  I want to check out the Curry Pan, but they make a limited amount of these and you need to come early to secure one.  Another bright spot is JCZ's menu--created to easily explore and add-on different items.  These options make it effortless to sample several items and leave with a belly expanded greater than otherwise anticipated.

AgwE9nlpnoRe6u4z28cGlw.text: I found this restaurant by chance when I was trying to find a decent local spot off the strip. I'm glad I found this place! If you need a curry fix this is your spot! They have 10 levels of hot...I chose level 8 and it was perfect and satisfying. If you are looking for a good Japanese curry spot this is the place to go.

6h9x8Tqkvqw-17C7Mnnczg.text: I had my doubts when I saw the pictures of dishes, they look plain and lacking, but I'm glad I came.  I ordered the Katsu Chicken at heat level 5. It's amazing. The sauce with the rice is just enough flavor.  Service, the 2 servers were extremely friendly and seemed to always smile.  Would definitely return.

x03y5L3J3II_3TupoC4AjQ.text: Delicious food I been coming here for over a year and finally had the time to leave a review. The food is delicious they have more than 10 levels of spicy (secret menu) and the customer service is fantastic. It gets really busy in the weekends but the wait is definitely worth it! Try the Thai iced tea.

PXjzCFC_XzAdVXPyvkkKOA.text: ordered a level 7 spiciness beef curry (which was the type of spiciness that builds up with each bite and might possibly give you heartburn) with chicken katsu and it was one of the best curry houses i've eaten at. This tastes like nothing I would make from a box at home. It's ~6.95 with just curry and rice. ~9.95 for beef curry with rice and you can add a chicken katsu for an additional $3.  the takoyaki is ~$4.95 and still one of my favorite things to eat. I wish they had okonomiyaki but no..   They don't serve ginger with your food but if you would like ginger, let them know.   The peach jello sake was also delicious.

ucOKsd7oPfLJ8uOzzlWOfA.text: Got the pork katsu curry, spice level 3, for takeout. Friendly service, though I was in there for a limited time. Appreciated how the curry sauce was packed separately from the rice and protein. Ample portions of all- had leftover rice and a large remaining puddle of sauce. Good value- per person total is around $11 without add-ons.  Side note about the spice: should have been a warning to see that spice levels 1-5 is "free". I thought a 3 would be safe, but the spice nearly made me sick towards the end. Good warm burn, but perhaps scale back to a two if you don't love spicy food. Solid place to get Japanese curry, love the straightforward menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takeout, pork Katsu, spice level 3

LEO2g2V45tUOoXXtiYh_9Q.text: Pretty legit Japanese curry.  I wouldn't say it's comparable to good curry houses in Japan, but it's one of the closest I've come to in the U.S.  I had the beef curry and the beef was cubed a little too large and wasn't really tender enough to easily cut in two.  - The takoyaki is awesome.  Tangy, gooey, just enough octopus, and sauced to perfection - The fried shumai is ok - The gyoza is average  - Service is great!  - Value is off the charts

Np01yeM5-ZUQvsaywbtChA.text: Finally made visit #2 after months and months. Regretted waiting so long.  When I popped into Japanese Curry Zen tonight, I almost didn't recognize where I was. They've definitely expanded their dining room at some point in the last several months. This is a great thing for what I'm sure is still a popular dining destination.  For a change of pace, I decided to order the kurobuta sausage curry ($8.45). Kurobuta is synonymous with Berkshire, which apparently is a tasty and pricey type of pork. Google it or something. The sausage is really tasty and tender, somewhat sweet, and definitely on the small side (that's what she said). However, the flavor is more than enough to enjoy rice, curry, and kurobuta evenly for the whole meal.  Other than the choice of meat, the curry is the same for everyone. Good white rice (whoops, forgot that I had good brown rice last time) plus a savory, high temperature curry with their special blend of spices. I tried both the sweet pickled radish and the onion thingamabobs that they bring out to accompany the curry, and I went mostly with the sweet stuff to augment the flavor profile.  A note on the spice level: think a hot Thai place, or possibly worse. I went with a "3" again and ate fairly slowly, recalling how I rushed it last time and was punished for not waiting for it to cool. My advice: order conservatively and be aware that there are additional spice condiments available if you need them.  This is a must-try restaurant for anybody who eats any sort of food, and it makes the plaza that it inhabits even more special.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Proof of... oysterness? Oysterage? Oysterdom?
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry with the &#34;new item&#34; deep-fried oyster ($3.60 for 3 pc.)
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Condiments. I mainly scoop from the jars, but it&#39;s nice to have spice. However, I&#39;ve never seen the almond before.

XejccdbY6W7PyyWZpM1oFg.text: Love that you can make it your own with all the possible combinations of add ons. I spent part of my childhood in Japan and this is the place reminds me of that childhood. One of my family's favorite places. Got my friends all addicted to it.  Note. As amazing as it is the cost does add up. My brother is guilty of adding lots of toppings.  My usual is a chicken or tofu Katsu with veggies and spicy four. Then one or two curry pan to go.

rSm1dO3uYySFQ0uBy6vXPA.text: Walked in with zero expectation because I just wanted something to eat, and this place is AWESOME! Very clean, quick, and all the workers are super nice. I ordered curry udon, which I've never ever had, and wow it was so good!! My friend got chicken Katsu curry and it was amazing as well. Crunchy, yet soft... Mmm. Everything was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry udon with extra green onions
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UpkHXFneCu_pbwCinStofQ.text: Whenever I go out to eat, I make sure that the food that I chose to get is something unique and something that I could not be able to make at home myself. Upon arriving I came in with a group of seven, we were placed right in the middle of the restaurant. We waited for about ten to fifteen minutes before ordering and I ordered the Chicken Katsu with an addition of sausage. I did not get any spicy level because it being my first time I wanted to taste the curry itself. We waited for another fifteen minutes until our food came and we still didn't have our napkins/ eating utensils. So when we asked for that and the pickled ginger we didn't touch our food probably until eight minutes after it came out. Service was a bit slow in the beginning but our server was very nice.   The food is a 3/5. Like I have mentioned before, I go out to eat especially to new places to determine if their food is worthy of being unique, meaning I wouldn't be able to replicate back at home.
