However, this curry was something that I knew I or my family could make at home. Of course it was good but there wasn't anything that stood out to me. Their chicken katsu was the same as well as their sausages. I paid about $3 extra for three pieces of sausages. Towards the end I didn't finish eating my curry because the rice/ curry ratio was completely off. There were more curry and meat itself than rice so that was frustrating. I pushed the curry to the side to see where the rice line ended and it didn't cover at least half the plate, it was about 1/4 of it. The food was overall okay, I just wished my rice ratio and sausage portion was bigger and the curry stood out opposed to thinking about "I could make this at home" type of thought. Calculating my bill without tip it came out to about $16. The plate is big but with the actually quality in the curry plates it does not break even to the amount you pay vs. what you get. Waiting for our checks and paying alone took longer than us eating, which we were confused about. We seen other people go got their checks after a leave the store before us.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu + sausage

edmEsxMXmYmpheuuZN_6Tw.text: The menu has a variety of choices for the toppings. Toppings included; chicken katsu, sausage, vegetables, spam, corn, cheese, meatloaf, spinach, and others. You can add as much toppings on your curry dish for additional charges. I got the original curry with sausage and vegetables. Spice level I chose was 0 although I believe I could have done level 2-3. My friend got the level 5 spice and she said it wasn't that spicy. The sausage on the dish was like mini wieners hot dog. The vegetables were carrots, broccoli, mushroom, potatoes. The curry had a little kick of spice in it but it was fine to me. I didn't care much for the sausage. The vegetables curry was good. Next time I will try the chicken Katsu with corn and cheese for toppings. The people next to us ordered it with a beer they obviously knew what to eat here. We also ordered the chicken skewers for appetizer. It looked like fried tofu but it was chicken. The chicken was tender and I liked the soy sauce served with it. I would come back here to try other dishes but overall I thought it was an okay place to eat. I'm not a big fan of curry in general.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The yummy chicken skewers
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My sausage with vegetables curry. Sausage was tiny and tasteless
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O7tWUKLR8UcLJtZ_vq4UkQ.text: Raku was over 1 hr wait and didn't want to drive anywhere else so walked over and there was only a 5 mins wait around 9pm. About $9 for a cutlet curry but it was one of the best curry I've had.   The rice was perfect and although I wish I had ordered spicy level 4, the 5 had a good kick.   Def will be coming back

67LOoc00fCKJJMyNFTxZnw.text: I discovered this place because it's adjacent to Monta Ramen and Kung Fu Tea (which are both great places btw).  Plus Curry Zen is one of my bro's favorite Japanese Curry places to go.    It always feels like the parking lot is packed, but that's just all of Chinatown.  You'll always find parking here.   There's plenty of seating, and you have plenty of choices for toppings in curry.  I decided to get curry with spinach, cheese, and katsu.  I wish I shared because my plate was HUGE.....for me at least.  I ended up taking it to go.  I think what made if filling was the spinach.    I've gone to one other curry place, and I have to say the portions here are very generous.  Next time, I'll have to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry with spinach, cheese, and katsu

SoR8GQvAf0qIxQKy3da3tw.text: We always seem to end up here on every trip to Vegas. I might because one of my buddies thanks is the best place in the entire world. It's pretty good we always just get the Chicken and Curry.   I always get a 2 or 3 hotness.    Be careful not to go to high...    :)   Good food, we will be back.

OHF5NJVTBy9L25_QA0wrZA.text: This place was packed. No where to park but people still waited outside in line ready to eat. Curry was delicious. I was amazed by how many people love curry. Friendly staff and quick service.

CQQJGGa5GFnm577CBBRTvA.text: Let's just say I deeply regretted agreeing to share this plate of curry with one of my friends. When the plate came out and I took my first bite, I wanted the whole thing to myself. I haven't tried many curry places, but this has got to be the best curry place I've tried to date.  Located in China Town in the same plaza as Monta Ramen, Kung Fu Tea, and Snowflake Shavery. There's plenty of parking. The restaurant has a very homey and traditional Japanese feel to it. We came around lunch time on a Saturday with a group of 10 people and they seated us immediately. Our server was friendly and quick on her feet. The prices for the curry is reasonable and it's a huge portion so it's worth it.  My friend and I decided to go with original chicken katsu curry with a croquette on the side. We got The curry was absolutely delicious; it was thick, flavorful, and you can really taste the spices. The chicken katsu was light and fried to perfection. It was my first time trying a croquette and I enjoyed it a lot. It's a deep fried mashed potato? It wasn't as heavy as I thought it would be but it was light as well.   This is such a cute, quaint restaurant with amazing prices but better than that, equally amazing food.

kVkM23fWRV6JKSrPz_MNsg.text: Came here because I wanted Monta's kimchee fried rice to go haha. I also had a good craving of places like Coco ichibanya which I can't get anymore at home unless I drive a good while so Japanese Curry Zen really hit the spot in every way.  Although the service wasn't exactly the smartest cause we were trying to share some appetizers but waiter dropped it off w/ no plates and one utensil. -_-   With that said, I thought the  curry was great. I got level 5 and I thought it was great. It was spicier than I thought it would be but I also tried a lvl 9 and it tasted the same for odd reason so I say just get the lvl 5...save the extra cents. The pork katsu was really good. I usually get scared when they put a lot of fat into my pork(where they basically rip you off cause it's so much fat) but that didn't happen. Croquette was okay too. Really, the spotlight was the curry + pork katsu cause it really tasted great.  The one thing I did mind was the amount of rice curry ratio. So little rice(the curry amount was fine) but I didn't want my rice to be all drenched up because of how little rice they give me.   I do recommend it if you're a local.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G3YlINVURpiVrj9yH_aY-Q.text: What we ordered: Pork Katsu Curry with cheese (9.95 + .75) | Takoyaki ($4.95)  Taste: Curry was good but spice level wasn't spicy enough. Takoyaki was pretty good as well.  They have a parking lot. Portion was good that I was able to split one plate with a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Curry with cheese

EhDC3d39yz7IWfX9W_6FvA.text: Almost like being home.  I spent seven years in Okinawa, and anyplace that has Orion beer (Okinawan) has my attention.  I love all curries: Japanese, Thai, or Indian; it doesn't matter.  But Japanese curry holds a dear place in my heart.  Short: this place is as good or better than what I had in Okinawa.  We had the Curry Udon, Beef Curry, takoyaki (octopus balls), and the mixed fry.  Both curries at heat level 10 and both were exquisite.  The takoyaki reminded me of the street vendors in Urasoe and outside Gate 1 at Kadena.  Now, all I need is a place that serves Okinawan Soba and I'll be culinarily set for life.

QB4kDyZgin2GgkB3tJmvzQ.text: Great curry house! Servings were huge and filling. I had the Portuguese sausage with the Chicken Katsu, and my date had the fried tofu with pork katsu. I stole some of the fried tofu because it was just really, really good and highly recommended. The spicy level does go a little too strong. I love spicy food, and I got a level three and i thought was a good balance already. My date had a spicy level seven and he was sweating bullets, but he loved it a lot. He grabbed an ice cold Sapporo and it just tied everything really well. I also highly recommend the takoyaki, a good appetizer to the plate. The place is pretty small, but it was great that we didnt wait long a table at all. The place was packed but we were seated in under 5 minutes. Definitely worth a trip back.

16x3KiiqKjx7fPYUQ95Amw.text: I would totally recommend this place for some good curry! Aside from their curries, I would say try their takoyaki and their katsudon! Both are super delicious!

U3lQXvjMwv0tdPgyqvae4w.text: Decided to go here for lunch because it has been a while since I've had Japanese curry and I was really craving for some!   I ordered the chicken katsu curry and the curry pan. The chicken katsu was crispy and they used the white meat portion which was pretty good. I didn't have to worry about the meat being too dry since I had the curry for moisture. The curry itself was just okay. There wasn't much of a strong flavor to it compared to places like Curry House and Coco Ichibanya. It was pretty hard to taste the spices in there, but at least it didn't look watery lol. The curry pan has a nice crispy shell and the inside was a thick curry paste which more flavor than the curry from my other dish. The only critique was that it was given to me lukewarm and not warm and toasty which makes me think if they just reheated it or used a microwave or something. I didn't request for them to reheat it because it was still edible and I generally don't like to cause problems for the staff unless it was something major.   Either way if you are in the area feel free to check this place out. It isn't the greatest, especially if you've been to other curry dishes from other restaurants, but it does fulfill the curry cravings. Be sure to ask for the red pickles because they sometimes forget to give it to you along with your dishes. They also give you onions here which is pretty neat. They aren't strongly flavored so you don't have to worry about it overpowering your dish. Parking in this small plaza can be a hassle during lunch or dinner so take that into consideration!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cylge_j02OGVSuCCP1IFtw.text: Food and flavor was great! It's like cocoichibanya. The presentation can use work. The curry came on a plastic dish which looked and felt really cheap. You can actually spin the plate around. I feel like the curry would of tasted twice as good if it was served in a ceramic plate. Also, as a Japanese person, I felt that the fukujinzuke (pickles) should have come with the curry, but I needed to ask for it. Japanese curry isn't curry without it. I was disappointed in that. Plus they charge 50 cents for extra fukujinzuke, which I thought was ridiculous. Should be complimentary.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TaGzdjfPEgHbtYtAsT5x5A.text: I've been here twice and both times it was good, but not fantastic. I never think "wow I'm craving Curry Zen". I like a little spicy so the first time I got spice 4, way too spicy. This time I got spice 3, still spicy! I needed a sip of water every couple bites ha!  I've tried chicken tenders and chicken Katsu, I think I need to try the pork or veggies next time.

FpzcW_n6e5tXz5Lc511A4Q.text: I don't like most curry BUT this place is amazing. My first time trying Japanese curry and I'm now a FAN! My friends and I have been here a few times now and they never disappoint. It's a small cozy restaurant. They serve food fast and service is always on point.   Potstickers 4/5  Full of flavor, crispy, and the dipping sauce is yummy!   Chicken katshu with sausage 5/5  Chicken is tender and crispy the curry is slightly spicy (spicy #3)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ALL GONE!  Chicken katshu with sausage 5/5  Chicken is tender and crispy the curry is slightly spicy (spicy #3)

clGacEiiTc6yvlqJEvs1fw.text: Simple and delicious!  They only have curry and appetizers and everything is really good!  Although the lowest level spicy current was a little hot for my son.

78iAv8ehU_OozhkXECw2ow.text: First time come here to try Curry Zen. Food very delicious  and good service. You can order curry spicy from regular 0 up to 200 (crazy spicy if you dare to try). However, level 10 is already super spicy. Fried oyster is from Japan so is very juicy. Takoyaki is my favor. Crispy outside and soft and hot inside!! Chicken Katsu won't too dry so its prefect match with curry. Tofu salad taste very good and fresh. Owner is super nice and you can see many return customers come back to his store. I'm for sure will come back again.

VZxT1Mw_V0gcTjcJuRhQzg.text: Visited on 5/31/16 Went with a party of 3 during the evening.  Atmosphere: Busy and lively Despite the busy atmosphere, the sound and commotion actually adds to the atmosphere, bringing a live, and active feeling to the dining experience.  Service: Excellent Despite the large amount of people present at the time of my visit, we were still well-attended by the servers. The table was clean and our food was served in a timely manner.  Food: Super good! We ordered a tonkotsu bowl, a meatloaf curry, and chicken katsu curry. The spiciness levels we ordered were up to par with what we expected and the flavor of the curry met our expectations. Flavorful and colorful, it's a curry you'll truly enjoy.  Summary: Visit this place! Worth a visit! If it get super packed, you know you have to be a good place to each.

CDYmYDH4uqV4aXmWC7rClQ.text: This place has the best curry and has a great range of spice.  I got no spice and was still really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0h-HQiKlfk9GP3PvIdORuA.text: Great curry! Beat I've ever had. I had the level 8 pork katsu with cheese. Very very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smells good in here

CPSrqEgLSJlK6gBs54jpIA.text: The Japanese curry here is very flavorful. I can see why they're popular. I can't help but compare Japanese Curry Zen to Coco Ichibanya in California.  I tried the chicken katsu and the pork cutlet curry here before I left Vegas. The presentation of the curry dishes here is mediocre at best. The rice looks like it was just slapped on there. The the amount of curry was not as generous as I'm used to. I love to cover both the rice and the meat in sauce for every bite. A recommendation is to add more Curry as well as sprinkle some kind of green on the dish. I also got to try their Takoyaki. They were 5/5. Some of the best I've had.

Wh1Ts0D-IW6iLqjF79sGEA.text: Totally worth the drive away from the strip. We ended up there by mistake after the place we were planning to go to was closed that night. I haven't had such great curry since I was last in Japan. The tacoyaki were also pretty darn good. I ordered the ton katsu, my friends got the veggie curry and the curry noodles.  However, they need to fix their spiciness scale. On  a 1-10, I ordered a lvl.2 spicy thinking it would add just a bit of extra flavor, and boy was I wrong. It was borderline inedible. It tasted more like a 5 or 6. My friend ordered lvl.1 and even hers was pretty spicy.   So, the food is delicious, but be warned,  if you are sensitive to spicy food, even if you like a little bit of spicy, stay on the safe side and order lvl.0. That's what I plan to do next time.

ZHA0wkwCwWiVi3VdHbi_kA.text: This place is as close to authentic as it gets! I've had curry in Korea, Japan, and Okinawa and this place is the best I've had in the states!

q1jC4Y5qCd4dyKH09Gd77w.text: I'm back in Vegas again and got the Japanese meatloaf curry again. OMG it is every bit as good as I remember! Sooooooo yummy. Heads up the parking lot can get super busy, and there were a ton of people waiting outside for seating. Popular! If you like curry, go. If you don't like curry, go and it will change your mind. I'm about to go pick up one last delicious curry meal before I head to the airport. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese meatloaf curry w corn. It smelled too delicious and I took a bite before I remembered to snap a pic; oops!

UFffW8ADQw907qA2kwxqXg.text: Good food, good price. Definitely, will visit again, but small parking lot.  Food: Good Price: Good Service: Good Parking: Avg

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sU9YYXzC4TjYTwEFxmVBZw.text: Finally back in the bay. This place is one of the highlight in Vegas due to the kind people who works here. Authentic Japanese place. Which means, they are from Japan and some of y'all think all Asian are from Japan or China.   Came here after a horrible massage next door. I ordered Katsu-Don and Katsu-Curry. I must admit, Katsu-Don has always been a favorite of mine since at a young age in Japan. It tasted just like how I remember it. Not too sweet and just perfect. The Curry, it was a bit too salty for me. But it was good.   The Katsu was fried to perfection. Wasn't greasy or soggy. In fact it was crunchy even after the Curry was on top and Katsu Don Sauce was over it.   I will be back next time I'm in the area. A go to spot for authentic Japanese good outside of Americanized Sushi spots.   #SOLitFood

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MFnQiMiG6vAurd3SSG-GPA.text: I came her on a whim for a quick dinner with a friend, and it was one of the best decisions ever.   This is a quick, casual restaurant. Their menu isn't too extensive, but it offers different meats and sides for the curry. My friend had the chicken katsu curry with spinach, while I had the chicken Katsura curry with mixed veggies. The curry is thick and rich and very flavorful, while the chicken is cooked perfectly. The chicken is moist and tender, while keeping a crispy outer surface. I definitely recommend getting the curry with veggies or spinach because this adds an extra texture and flavor to the curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken Katsu with white rice and vegetable curry, 4/5
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken Katsu with brown rice and spinach curry, 4/5

XMa0mtsytbALCF4Okxwoow.text: Japanese Curry Zen is the place that introduced me to Japanese curry, and also the place where I fell in love with the dish. I no longer live in Vegas but whenever I come home, I make sure to stop by here to eat and get a few orders to go to take back to AZ with me.   I usually get the Chicken Katsu Curry (no spice) + gyoza. The serving size is generous and the prices are very reasonable. The chicken is always cooked to perfection, and the curry sauce has always been on point. Call me crazy, but I never get tired of the curry here, ever.  Zen is located in a tiny, super busy area of Chinatown with lots of traffic because of next door businesses. The dining area is a bit small, but the wait is usually bearable and the food makes it worth it. Because it's a busy area, parking can get craaazy, so just a heads up. Overall, if you like Japanese curry or would like to try, this is a good place to start.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hJAzC3ttf085VJdYnnpdMg.text: Solid curry house with really good katsu. Didn't blow me away though.  Came around lunch time and it was full but we got seated right away. Waters dropped off and orders taken quickly. The service here is really efficient. Both of us ordered the chicken katsu with level 3 spicy.  The chicken katsu is made really well. When you cut or bite into it, the breading doesn't just fall apart. That separates great katsu from badly breaded chicken. The curry was good, came out piping hot and had a slow creeping heat to it. I'm glad we asked what "medium" was and he said 2-3 on the spice level (out of 10!). I can handle my own with spice but I don't even want to imagine how spicy 10 is. I would recommend 3 for some heat without being too hot.  Overall, I would definitely come again, but wouldn't go out of my way for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry

b7SpD01BjG42GQWNNuEtjw.text: Yaaaasssss! HAPPINESS IN MY TUMMY!! Talk about a great place with amazing selections. Their curry is delicious.. I really mean it! They cook their curry in a vegetable broth so it is definitely vegetarian friendly here. I wouldn't say vegan because they might fry their Katsu chicken in the same oil as the tofu style katsu.   You can customize your level of spice here. I normally just get level 3 for my curry because it has a perfect mild kick. The Chicken Katsu is delicious but my favorite is the tofu style. Great flavor!! Amazing crunch!! You can add veggies, cheese and all these other toppings on your dish. They also serve 16 grain rice there which if you are a brown rice lover, its such a great option to have! Very healthy and delicious.   The servers are soooooo nice here! They quick and come around often to refill your drinks and to check on you. They train them well! I recommend this place if you love Japanese curry. You'll be really happy!! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RgobM-muY1dnBDYpSd4WlQ.text: Really awesome curry! Get the chicken katsu...you won't be disappointed! Quick service. Place is small so if you have large party, be sure to get there in advance.

NvdKDC6LP9DdJCvgHHvBSw.text: Very clean,  music and TV with well cooked food. Ordered Curry level 4 wasn't too hot could have went up to 5. Great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Katsu Brown Rice Curry

2wYMMMUXbg9qD__WHzwt3Q.text: You can never go wrong with this place! I love the consistency in their curry and how flavorful it is. I usually get a chicken katsu with a low level of spice. I love that you have the options for a variety of toppings for an extra charge or get a half version when a full is too much to handle on your own. One of my favorite places to go eat at on Spring Mountain in Las Vegas!

qR9WcLISbp0qW4zEZyMazw.text: Let me start with this: I love zen curry. I'm a True fan. Been coming here since they opened. Tonight though, I am leaving disappointed. What the heck happened to the portions?!?! Listen- if you haven't been- go. Eat. Enjoy. You won't be disappointed. If you have been coming- be prepared to be shorted.

4dwCMrH9vKo6J8iHdbbtig.text: This is my favorite Japanese curry place in Las Vegas. I eat here probably once a week or once every two weeks.   However, I sadly have to say that this place has been lacking consistency. I've played around with the different spicy levels by trying everything from 1-5, but now I always order a spicy level 3 and it always differs. Some days the spice is tolerable and tastes more like a 2. Other days, the spice is almost overbearing and tastes it like it should be a level 5. They also lack consistency with their proportions.  On the contrary, their curry is absolutely savory, sweet and spicy (depending on your spice level). It is made up of a soupy broth and over 10 different spices, which gives it such a distinctive flavor. My favorite dish to order is a Tofu Katsu Curry with a spicy level of 3. Some of my favorite toppings are corn, cheese, and kurobuta sausage. I recommend eating any of the curry dishes with the red radishes and the white scallions. Also, for appetizers, I recommend their takoyaki. It is probably one of the best takoyaki dishes I've had in Las Vegas thus far.

8FcHyKk5JClJloHoEstKKw.text: Definitely a go to. Reasonable prices and a meal that actually fills u up. I got the chicken curry with added spicyness.

SIogp7ozTKFBOox-O0nBhw.text: I don't like reducing stars when service is so great but the price increase and portion shrinking is a terrible idea for customers. The food and service are on point for quality - except the last few visits I had to send back the chicken Katsu for being rubbery but was corrected to perfection. My disappointment comes from a recent menu and price change. While I understand a reasonable price increase, they increased menu prices about 30% -50% along with decreasing portion sizes 30-50%.   This is a 60-100% price increase. I no longer come here when I used to be a regular.

rbjIXhYp65rtVX7DkEJUMg.text: This small restaurant has a great selection. It is very affordable and their portions a a good size. I orders the half size curry and a house salad for under $10. Delish and filling

AkaP4ZysFoC2pqWkc7JPyg.text: My favorite food in Las Vegas. How can curry making so good. Always good service and food quality.

3ZPtZoliZT6U91ZPDJh5UQ.text: Hands down the best Japanese curry restaurant in Las Vegas. We stopped in after a movie and the place was busy. They pushed two tables together for us since we were a party of three. Very nice of them.   We started with waters and a calipico drink. For our meals the girls ordered fried tofu with curry, and chicken katsu with corn topping spicy curry #5 for myself.  The food came out quickly and we enjoyed every last bite. Check out the pics if you don't believe how good it is here.  We saw some menu items we might have to try on our next visit to Chinatown. They had chicken karage, curry udon (sounds interesting), shumai and tako taki. All sounded good but too full to sample them this trip.  Arigato Zen Japanese curry!

Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried tofu curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 6

9J_7rTXepNbkKQlmM5tI6A.text: I'm a chef, a fan and have traveled from East, to West USA. Zen has food that is severely on point. Sharp, savory, distinct flavors...... sake pairing and spicy ness consultation. The service is fantastic.  It's literally a few tables and a few hundred square feet, but it's a destination.

UZ179JVnz8N6piirGun4wQ.text: Location: Centrally located in the heart of Chinatown (Spring Mtn. Rd). The place is small but they combined tables for large parties. If you have large party, it is better to call and RSVP rather than just drop off. Parking might be a challenge since it is in the same plaza with Monta and they get busy during lunch hour. Some people park on the side road when it's full.   Decor: Nothing special in their decor. They kept it clean which is important.   Menu: Obvioualy, curry is their specialty. Please note this is a Japanese curry which has a different ingredients and taste from Indian curry. They have ingredients list what goes to their curry. All of them sounds healthy. The spicy level can be adjusted from 1-10. I ordered spinach curry with a side of 5 pcs Kushi (variety of deep fried tempura items: chicken breast, quail eggs, vegetables, mushroom and shrimp). For me spicy level 5 is perfect!  They have beer and wine as well. Of course, I had to go with Calpico since it's my lunch hour.   Service is quick and efficient. They usually have two server around and they provide an excellent service.   Overall, this is a perfect lunch place to go. It is quick, price is reasonable. Food is prepared carefully and taste good. Oh, on the side note....They also have good selections of vegetarian menu. Will come back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach curry and kushi

txNYYyYzIC3bLer805bhWQ.text: It's so hard to find a good Japanese Curry around here, I'm used to one with more veggies in it, but this one was dee-lish.   The staff was friendly, helpful, and there was a lot more on the menu that I wanted to try, but as a solo Diner I didn't have the stamina or strength to try everything... So I will definitely be back.  I just had the basic chicken katsu curry and it was amazing, satisfying, everything you would need on a rainy day craving some oh so good Japanese comfort food!

B7xOUaARmgKU9s8I9P5vCw.text: If you want Japanese curry this is the place to be. So much variety. I've been here twice ordered original curry half size with steamed tofu and a fried egg. Absolutely loved it!  Next tried out the curry udon noodles. It was a bit salty but not too bad. The pork was a little dry but the curry fish broth made up for it. I'd probably still order it minus the meat. Great price on beer. 22oz Kirin for $22. Definitely will be a regular here.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed tofu half curry with a fried egg. Delicious and good value

1eh4H-863o01wXbP8JN5lg.text: Whenever I'm in the mood for some curry, the first thing that pops into my mind is Curry Zen. Located on Spring Mountain and Decatur is a plaza filled with a bunch of popular food places. My review for this place has been long overdue as I have been coming here for years, back when the place was tiny and seated about 20 people. You can choose just plain curry and rice, or you can choose to add meat like chicken katsu, Pork katsu, chicken tenders, croquette, and much more. The portions are huge and the price is very inexpensive. However, once they expanded the place and made it bigger, Curry Zen wasn't like it was before. Previously each table had two different spices that you can sprinkle on as much as you'd like and there was ginger and pickled radish at each table. You can still get ginger and the pickled radish still, but you have to ask for it now. As for the spices, I am not sure if they carry those anymore as every time I went here I never saw anyone with those spices on their table. Food is just as good and I highly recommend the Takoyaki, Croquette, and chicken Karaage. As much as I would love to give this place 5 stars, each visit, especially with take-out there is something wrong with my order, whether it's overcharging me, missing an item, or giving me someone else's order, but I always check my take out orders before leaving so make sure if you get take out you double check your order! Service needs to be improved on as the original servers have either left or are not working when I go. The current servers never really check up on you and can be frustrating not getting your water refilled. Overall, the food here is still great, but not as good as before. I'd say this place is more of a 3.5 stars, but decided to give 4 stars because the food is still delicious and the portion sizes are big and the price is cheap. Overall, if the servers become more consistent and if the restaurant would bring back the spices and pickled radish and ginger to the tables this place would be a solid 5 stars

FLTKU6gNfw1p_T3vbcWywg.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. Everytime I am in town I always have to make a stop here. Atmosphere is great, it's a small place but they flip tables really quick so typically you aren't waiting too too long. *TIP* their spice does not play, so be cautious when added heat to your curry. And for the little add one go crazy and test what you like. I found that adding cheese kinda makes your curry a little thicker but also very delicious. I can't wait to come back to Vegas to get more curry!!!

lZ7ElwmYSUYDA2zkbX4-5A.text: The curry so... tasty ! The services are great  Very friendly and nice !! Because of size, therefore sometimes we have to wait. But, its worth the wait !!

24H_jnLtqAX8Z7IgOs0uxw.text: Every time I never know what to eat, I always end up going to Curry Zen. I like how the price for this place is cheap and the portions are really big. The service is amazing - all of the servers are nice and quick! I always get the chicken katsu curry with cheese and beef, and it's so good!!! Water is good too lol, I know a lot of places' water is gross

IlyPGu1Ek8_5TaYpicN_HQ.text: I went to Japanese Curry Zen a couple of weeks ago with my son and brother in law. Actually didn't intend to go there as we went out to try Monta Ramen. Line was too long at Monta and there was no wait at Zen.   I was very impressed. The curry dishes were spot on. But before I get there, because it was late and we were hungry, we ordered some appetizers. Ordered Gyozas and deep fried Siu Mai dumplings. I've never had a fried Siu Mai before. Both were good but not spectacular. They were on the smaller side (if you've been to a Chinese restaurant with good dim sum then you know good Siu Mai and Gyozas (potstickers) are pretty good sized where six to eight can make for a hearty portion). The skins were of course fried and crispy. The pork filling was good but not all that flavorful. The fact that we were hungry probably made them taste better than they were.   Now on to the entrees. I got the pork katsu cutlet and added curry with beef to my entree. The katsu was perfectly cooked. Tender, not too much salt, and crispy breading without a large presence of grease. The beef-based curry was rich, spicy (you can pick your spiciness poison) and flavorful. It had a medium thickness so that it was slightly runny but blended  well with the rice and cutlets. The beef cubes in the curry sauce were tender and flavorful as well. I threw on some of the pickled radishes that are semi sweet and salty and it was down home comfort food awesomeness. And I'm not even from Japan. I have always liked Japanese curry and it is hard finding places that do it outside of large coast cities like LA and the Bay Area (never looked for it on the east coast). This really hit the spot.   My son got the pork katsu donburi (rice bowl). It was excellent as well. Tender pork katsu cutlet covered with steamed egg and cooked and caramelized onions over rice with a light but flavorful teriyaki sauce. My son ate it all and I was happy to help him out with a few bites. I added some radish as a condiment.   My bro in law got the pork katsu with a side of sausage (never seen that before) with curry. Because this place lets you customize with add one, he added corn and shredded cheese (never seen that one either). I tried some and have to say although it was not something I would have ordered it was pretty darn good. The sausage was almost like a small smoked kielbasa with a crisp snap when you bite into it.   All in all, this place is worth a visit if you are in the Vegas Chinatown area and looking for something good and filling (not a light meal by any means).

IMFMicShO6V4J87B29__xA.text: This place is super delicious! Customer service is great, and the food is awesome. Simple, and delicious.   I've tried basically everything on the menu, super yum. Pork tenderloins my fave! Level is usually 5, and its not bad at all.   They even got specials and side items around the restaurant. Look out what they are and try em too!

8EcVPHp5gLvJmtuMDeYwNQ.text: Popular restaurant as it seems to be full at all hours. Friendly staff, alcohol and a custom level of heat level you can pick for your curry. Of course, its the Japanese style curry, smooth and rich. Reasonable prices and quick   service. Simple decor. Choices of rice, too. Deep fried specialties are special. Parking is easy, too.

-hTtSzQL5qqgg7h0U3jmEg.text: Most of the time I am a tourist and eat on the strip when I come to the Ninth Island (Vegas).  However, on this trip I had my car and I wanted to eat where the locals eat.  Japanese Curry Zen is on Spring Mountain Rd, in the Seoul Plaza strip mall West of the 15.  They specialize in authentic Japanese curry here, that is hand stirred and silky smooth.  Curry and rice is $5.95 and you can add chicken or pork cutlet ($3.50), kushi (chicken; quail eggs (3); & zucchni - $3.50), and a variety of other toppings for an additonal charge.  We ordered the tempura oyster app ($3.60 for 3), tonkatsu ($9.45), and the foregoing w/ kushi ($12.95 - not pictured).  A can of soda was $1.  The oysters were excellent.  The tempura was cooked very well, and the oysters were fresh.  I have had overcooked, not so fresh oysters and they disintegrate when you bite into them.  These were nothing like the foregoing:  5 Stars.  Likewise, the curry was excellent.  You could see and hear the chef constantly stirring the curry sauce to perfection.  Secondarily, the color was perfect.  In addition, the pork cutlet was cooked properly.  It was not dry like other places I have experienced.  Lastly, the portion was a bargain for the price.  BTW, I ordered 3 out of 10 for spiciness, and I was SMAO:  5 Stars.  The service from our waitress was also excellent.  She was super nice, described how the menu worked, and really attentive:  5 Stars.  The ambiance is very basic, but it works for this small place.  Although the place is small, there were separate, clean restrooms:  4 Stars.  If you have a car, forget the overpriced, Americanized Azn food on the strip, and head to Spring Mountain Rd (I would compare to Garden Grove Blvd in OC).  In addition to Japanese, there is Vietnamese, Chinese and Korean.  The food is way better, and less expensive especially at this gem, Japanese Curry Zen.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura oysters app - $3.60
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu - $9.45

ZYHDoup3aax5jIxjyztC9w.text: This is my go to place. It reminds me of the curry we ate in Japan. The service is always great. It can be a wait sometimes but worth it.

rh3JwXE4wxZ0qF4oON_1Yg.text: First time I'm leaving a review but I can't count the number of times I've come here either by myself or with friends. A friend introduced me to this place a year and half or so ago and it's one of these best places to eat in Vegas without a doubt!   They've got an easy to read menu, easy to customize your food and all the food is so tasty that you couldn't go wrong with trying something new. As for me, I started out with Beef curry, went to Curry Udon, and now I've ended on Tofu Katsu curry. And every single thing I've ordered in between was DELISH.  If you grew up with this kind of food, rice and a side, you're gonna love this food. If you haven't tried something like this before, it's a welcome change and I promise you'd love it.   Cute atmosphere, extremely friendly and welcoming staff, and above all top notch food! Stop by Curry Zen and you'll keep coming back.

jHF3jq9_SvEMChfEssqd4g.text: Zen was okay. It was the very best experience I've had but decent. The server just brought us water and asked if we ready to order. She didn't greet us nor ask if we would like anything else other than water. I had to get attention of another waiter to take my order as I got done looking through the menu. He didn't give any suggestions or ask if we have been zen before. The appetizers came out fast and were the best dishes of the entire meal. The shumai was nice and hot. The tokoyaki was very delicious and hot. The curry on the other hand very bad. The rice was cold and it seemed like they just warmed the curry up in the microwave because I think we were the last customers of the night. Also curry was way too sweet for my taste.

i9GhPzjB860tww0YSTo-ug.text: Our go to japanese curry spot! We will drive from noth LV to china town if we ever are craving curry. It never dissapoints us and the flavorful curry and portions hit the spot.  Not to mention its location is in a plaza that has so many other great spots to enjoy as well. We have been to other locations and it just isn't the same. I aways get the chicken katsu curry with sausage and its always delicious! I used to live in japan as a military brat and it brings me back. You will not be disappointed.

AmMc_WhxJPbu64hiInfIXA.text: By Odin's beard, this place has curry like you wouldn't believe. It is insane how amazing it is. And it's not just the curry, the rice is awesome, too! It could just be that my tastebuds are weird but it seems that the rice is slightly sweet which provides a perfect contrast to the spice-heavy beauty that is curry. The cool, soothing rice alongside the lively and warm ocean of flavor creates a dish of emotion. One can feel the love put into these edible works of art. I ordered a vegetable curry and rice with an addition of fried tofu. A surprisingly short time later, the friendly servers brought it. Holy seacow. Instead of only a couple small pieces of fried tofu, they placed four huge ones right on the dish! Whoo-hoo! The mushrooms in the veggies deepened the curry's flavor even more. Mmmmmm! The rice provided a sense of serenity. The curry was so incredible that I'm definitely coming back again.

Hau3ZrC7G6SniDnAM28Vlw.text: FOOD:  overall is tasty and well-proportioned.  However, one time the chicken cats came out very hard and rubbery.  I sent it back and the replacement was fine.  Make sure to request the Japanese pickles to add flavor to your meal!  SERVICE:  is generally friendly and attentive.  You are greeted upon arrival and everyone is quite polite.  AMBIANCE:  is basic, but clean.  It is medium-sized with a number of tables and a counter.  VALUE:  quite good for what you get.  You'll pay about $10 per person without drink.

2zGXgOWs2V2MUwVPv0llvw.text: My most favorite japanese curry spot! Great service, reasonable prices and amazing food quality. Tip: You can also sub white rice for brown rice for free.   Been coming here regularly for a couple years now. Still one of my top places to go to. Keep up the good work guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu curry with brown rice.

1NA9XYoRyeCrT9XBOM6DWg.text: Chicken katsu + curry + with potato croquette = Omgsoyum!   This place definitely delighted my taste buds! Their curry was traditional, very rich and thick, with a hint of sweetness. Compared to the popular chain, Curry House in California, I would say it's a neck to neck competition. Although, my biggest gripe at Zen was that they were light handed when plating the curry - they could of gave us more. We ended up buying an extra side of curry sauce for $1.50. However, the chicken katsu and the pork tonkatsu were both breaded very lightly and expertly fried to a crispy golden brown. They were extremely addicting.  We also tried their new menu item, Takoyaki $4.50. It had 5 plump balls and dressed generously with mayo, takoyaki sauce, and bonito flakes. They came out piping hot and about 2 pieces of tender octopus inside of each ball. The dough was more on the soggy end and also a tad bit bland. Maybe they could of been cooked a little longer.   I would pass on the curry pan next time. Even though the bread was lightly crispy on the outside, I felt that the overall dough was very dense and lacked curry filling. It was mostly air once I took a bite. (Curry House in CA will continue to hold the crown in curry pan).   We added:  - Potato croquette - My favorite! It was lightly sweet and breaded perfectly.  - Corn - simple canned sweet corn. I still loved it with the curry meal! - Kushi Katsu (5 skewers of kushiage): lightly breaded and fried and quail egg, zucchini, shiitaki mushroom, chicken tender - Everything was fried perfectly and the chicken tender was very moist and juicy, but I would pass on ordering these next time. They were too boring for me.   They have many different toppings to add to your curry: kurobuta sausage, potato croquette, corn, kushi katsu (3 or 5 sticks), vegetable, spam, tofu, tofu katsu, spinach, cheese, chicken tender.  Also their spice levels are no joke!  - Spicy 1-5 is free. - Spicy 6-10 is 20 cents extra.  We tried spicy #6 which had nice heat. Trust me, they don't mess around. It's not at all unbearable since we're avid spice lovers, but we could of actually went up a couple more notches as well, and loved it! I'm sure spicy 10 would be crazy spicy!   My favorite part had to be their unique table condiments! I loved adjusting the texture, sweetness, and spiciness of my curry dish at my own discretion. All of these go perfect with curry! - Fukujnzuke - Japanese sweet pickled radish - Rakkyo - Japanese style pickled pearl onions.  - Sliced Almonds - adds great crunchy texture to curry - Raisins - adds a nice sweetness to the curry and rice  - Curry powder - adds another level and dimension of curry flavor  - Spicy chili powder - adds spiciness

N7h0UKGOGhUKeh_i-7xCfg.text: this place is extremely average. don't come here expecting bomb af curry. it kinda tastes like the curry packs that you can make at home, but they have many levels of spice here that you can choose. not bad but not great

jwyoqzscPQNLPX7zG7IFcA.text: This place is awesome.  Amazing, flavorful Japanese curry.  Spice levels from 1-10, packing some serious heat in the higher levels.  Make the 5 minute drive and get away from the nasty overpriced strip food and try this one out.  We were disappointed with multiple strip meals and decided to try something out here.  A couple minutes later we had narrowed our choice down to Japanese Curry Zen, pulled in the parking lot, and were quickly seated.  The menu is decent sized, full of chicken, pork, beef, sausage, shrimp, and all sorts of other curry.  I went with the pork katsu, my girlfriend did the chicken.  We had some fried gyoza to snack on before the meal as well.  The fried gyoza was great.  Crispy, tasty, and a good price.  The curry came out pretty quickly as well and we were in heaven.  Tasty curry, good meat, and great rice.  For under $10 this was way better than anything we had on the strip for $25+ a plate.    Service was good, drinks were always topped off and everything was prompt.  We were in and out in under 45 minutes, paid around $30 with tip, and were on our way.  I won't eat on the strip again.  Every meal we had there was disappointing and overpriced.  5 minutes off the strip we had excellent meals, with this being one of them.  Seriously do yourself a favor and come out here if you're visiting!

2r3Wp6yF6gA_l7Yxf9Fhrw.text: It was my first time coming to Zen and the place is small. I viewed all the reviews prior to coming here and knew exactly what to order. I ordered the chicken cutlet and rice adding shrimp with the corn and cheese and absolutely agree that the sauce is awesome! I just personally don't think that corn and cheese goes with the curry. The sauce is very tasty, spices were well balanced as well as the heat of the curry. I like the fact that you have an option to choose white rice from brown rice. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to those who love curry. This place is very inexpensive. The only con to the place is that they had there thermostat set to 80 degrees and it was pretty warm in there....

jjyd6C6boV4cy-vODGSX2Q.text: Food was amazing. I have tried most of the menu and I've never had anything I didn't like. The curry has perfect flavor, and you can spice it up too if you'd like.
