0NHSjb87Ri5IdJjnbpw7xw.text: One of my favorite places to eat Japanese curry. I get the chicken katsu curry with a level 2 on their spicy level. The dish is simple but very good

DQQIs5SZ9CBS6LWoX5MFzw.text: Amazing Japanese Curry place in Las Vegas. I was in Japan the past couple years so I know a little about Curry, Ramen, Sushi, etc. The curry here is very similar to what I would get for lunch down the street from where I lived. I ate at their new location today on S Rainbow Blvd. It was very empty but the food was just as good. I almost prefer it because it was new, the sitting area is more open, and the fact that it was quiet atleast for now.. since I do like my quiet. Lol. Also, they were very friendly :)  It might be worth noting that I always get the Chicken Katsu Curry and Thai Iced Tea which is just over $12.

rbipPwY-Jjc6a-8rwLsv8g.text: Fantastic service. Some of the best Katsu curry I've ever had. Appetizers are reasonably priced and the restaurant kind of reminds me of of a fun/modern approach to a Japanese curry house. Would definitely come back again on my next visit here to Vegas.

w7bLgHjHHqqJhoHKuKcVLA.text: Since starting at UNLV almost three years ago, I have come here probably 30 times. I love their curry, especially the curry udon. I also love their katsu-don! Definitely would recommend it to anyone who loves Japanese-style curry or just Japanese food in general.

M1gfycBy1te1dh-onaMw_A.text: WOW- this place is yummy!  Great curry!  Great fried food.  Even the sausages are super tasty.  You really can't go wrong with anything you order here.

Tl653moAF9hjVEMV9mxk1g.text: I did not know Japanese Curry existed. Here's what happened: about 150 years ago the British started bringing Indian spices into Japan, Japan liked his they tasted and local families started making their own recipes. So what happens at Zen is that you get a family recipe. It's a unique blend of healthy spices (listed on a small menu - together with their benefits).  Ok so here's how it works: what you see on the illustrated menu is exactly what you get.- with the added value of taste buds awesomeness. No frills, no fancy decoration. Rice is white, curry is brown. Flavor is insane.  I tried a handful of "hotness" options and have to say that the hottest is totally bearable. They use different varieties of chili to obtain heat throughout the scale and a nice amount of Habanero in their hottest sauces (hence the redder coloration). Perfect blend and amount. Never too much - always enough to feel it and love it.  Now - I'm not the type who goes out for dinner seeking an ambience, I don't care. I want my joints to be clean and mainly I want them to provide a fantastic food experience. Zen is pretty straight forward: don't pick this place if you're trying to impress a date with fancy stuff, maybe try Chinese at the Bellagio's Jasmine.   Lights are bright at Zen, bill is super reasonable, staff is awesome, chef is great and food tastes better than a wish.  Since mouthful #1 I would have kept going, going, going....  Loved it! X  .

wPXvdOzRhXdZy4eMNM73eg.text: Superb authentic curry straight from Nippon!!! It was very spicy. I got level 5 and I was breaking a sweat. It was like I just did a workout. I got the chicken katsu dish. The other meats looked good though. The atmosphere was very chill and relaxing. The staff was very helpful and kind. This is my new favorite restaurant in LV!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu  Curry level 5 spicy

qVcqv4YYVxbOWwuxI40xjw.text: Had Indian,  Chinese,  korean, Taiwanese, Malaysian,  Japanese curry before and this place is where you come when you're homesick with mom or dad's curry. Nothing really special but special in some ways, such as adding extra toppings like cheese, corn, extra meat, veggies for extra cost and being able to choose how spicy you want your curry. 1~4 is low and 5~10 is high. Croquettes are really good though. Be sure to order your plate with at least 2 extra toppings, plate looks boring without it. Price for what you get seems little on top.

X1XJFsPubtrzrzNIii2nRA.text: Excellent..Curry is very flavorable.  Spice levels are 1 to 10.  Level 3 quite spicy for me.  Definitely  try the tofu salad.  The dressing is delicious.  I had the tofu Katsu  and husband had the chicken, both were good.

I5-JkJ-vB7MjphFI_R9l0A.text: I do not usually give 5 stars, I really have to be absolutely in love to give 5 stars and LOVE is an understatement for how I feel towards this place.   1. Authentic Japanese curry flavor and restaurant feel but with many Americanized menu options  2. Gigantic portions for a very reasonable price  3. Fastest service I have ever had at a restaurant. Every time we've come here we literally got our plates within 7-8 minutes of ordering.  Brought me back to when I lived in Kochi Japan when I was little, and the quality of the food was mind blowing.  If you are a vegetarian, this place is perfect for you. The Tofu Katsu is like eating chicken. The fried food is not greasy at all and taste amazing. The chefs clearly know what they are doing, I have not one complaint about anything.  This place has become a weekly thing for me now, and I live 30 minutes away.   I would seriously have to go through a grieving process if this place shut down.

ORzQU1wufoKRELu-GJzC4Q.text: this is the most authentic Japanese curry i could find state side, from CA to LV. the flavor, tenderness of the chicken katsu, spicy levels, and only being offered a spoon to eat your curry is identical to the Coco Ichibanya in Tokyo Japan. the Coco's in LA doesn't even come close to what the Coco's tastes like, and like i said, this is the most authentic i've found thus far.  My favorite order: Chicken Katsu Curry, spicy level 3, with one order of quail egg kushi, and one extra scoop of rice.  The food is spot on and delicious! Not only is the food good, the customer service is awesome. The cooks, servers, etc are all very polite and sincere, and all of them being able to greet and farewell in the Japanese tongue adds just that bit more of authenticity. Only problem I can see anyone bumping into is the language barrier. Their English isn't horrible, but some of them do have strong accents.  5 out 5 because this place rocks, the people rock, the food rocks, the atmosphere rocks.

uViAjNGWYZoDeFo18lkUjA.text: When I eat here, it's spoon to mouth time, and talking is not apart of the equation.   If I have a plate of Zen's curry and rice in front of me, you would have better luck having a conversation with Stephen Hawkins without his computer.   Yeah, it's that kind of place for me because it's that good at Japanese Curry Zen.  The first time, I walked into Japanese Curry Zen was a few months ago, and they won me over on the first spoonful of their Tonkatsu curry and rice.    It was a orchestra of flavors, and the unique herbal blend created Beethoven 5th symphony on my taste buds; it was bold, smooth, and complex.   It wasn't too spicy, but Japanese curry Zen has a  number of condiments on every table to satisfied the more picky eaters.   I'm proud to say, I didn't need any extra raisins or extra spices, because the flavors stood on it's own.     One advice to the owners, Please make a sumo sized plate for those overeating Hawaiians :) because I could go off like the Yellow Gorenger from Himitsu Sentai Gorenger series in this place.   If you never seen that series, the renger headquarters was located below a Japanese Curry cafe like Zen, and that Renger would be pounding out 5 to 6 curry plates each episode.       Zen doesn't have a large dining area, but I don't need a lot of time to eat here because I will clean out a plate within five to ten minutes.  The owners and majority of the staff are very genuine Japanese, and have that entire business spic and span clean.    Ouch!  Sorry Monta on that comment.   Everyone raves about Monta, which is located a stone throwaway from Zen, but I believe Zen is leaps and bounds better of the two Japanese restaurant in this shopping complex.   Heck, this might be my favorite Japanese hole in the wall that I ever been too.....and Yes, I am Japanese.

Lf8XglT0FJeMjo9IphJLmg.text: OMG, It was delicious. The curry was savory and not too spicy. I love the random toppings they put on the table to go with it for a little bit of crunch. Definitely great comfort food!  Goes to show, that great things come in small packages!

6AQsfjE2Zn2ZN4Q__4aAUw.text: I imagine this is about as good as pork katzu and curry can get so in that regard it could be five stars.  My favorite part of the meal was seeing you could get food from 1-10 spicy level but 6-10 cost extra.  I assumed 5 couldn't be that spicy but the waiter warned me against it.  3 ended up being about perfect.    I'll have to trick a friend into getting an 8 or 9 some time.  In the name of science, of course.

O5_sAy5Z2nJanOY4PthFXQ.text: So glad that we found this place! Amazing curry, with genuine hospitality to go with it. Staff are extremely nice, and always available. The best thing is their scale system for spice levels. I personally get a 10 every time I go, but it's nice to bring friends that don't like spice so they can also enjoy.

eA2TG3WaYYkpcTLCHVLUtw.text: A really good Japanese curry restaurant. After being seated and ordering, we had to ask to get our waters. Also, the ratio of rice to curry was a little bit off for me (more rice than curry) but besides that, the currys are pretty good. I probably will be coming back, just not anytime soon

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croquette curry (closer one) &amp; 3 piece kushi curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu curry (closer one) &amp; 3 piece kushi curry.
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My kushi katsu curry (chicken, quail eggs, and zucchini), and my friend&#39;s pork cutlet curry (further one).

F_YU-kvYUyCbomoq_tZYWA.text: Not a bad pit stop if you're craving some curry and don't have a ton of cash on you.   It's a nice quiet tiny restaurant that you imagine in Japan and the host / watier was really friendly and polite. The menu is pretty limited with specials written on the board.  The nice thing about this place is that they serve both white and brown rice and also can do half orders on rice for those who are cutting down on carbs.   What I had to eat was the Pork Tenderloin Cutlet with Curry and Brown Rice + an additional Chicken Cutlet and Croquette. All of it was pretty good and the cutlets weren't dry at all. That with the combination of curry and rice makes the best comfort food after a long day!

upB3hu-XZBXQA-g2LH1uow.text: I actually lived in Japan for almost 3 years when I was stationed there for the US Navy. So I know a thing or two about Japanese Curry, as this is one of their most popular dishes besides Sushi. This place is authentic as it gets! It's run by a small Japanese family and gets real Japanese customers. (A great sign of authenticity with ethnic food)  The inside of the restaurant is fairly small (reminds me of the small restaurants that are common in rural parts of Japan) The decor isn't fancy like other curry houses and not as nice. It's just a simple place to enjoy great food. The staff especially the guy who takes our order are especially nice all the time and makes sure to check up on all the customers often.  The condiments are on the house, and I always load on the the pickled baby onions and curry powders. The flavor of the curry itself is perfect. I usually order the pork cutlet (chicken cutlet is a healthier option, and tastes just as good) with white rice, corn, sausage, and steamed veggies. They give you a very generous portion for the price, and I always leave this place fully stuffed and satisfied.

swOe19SKLExIC80UkM7F-Q.text: This is my favorite Japanese curry in town. It's super clean, super friendly staff, and QUICK! The food here is amazing. Try the chicken katsu curry (spicy level 7)!! It's superb.

G4YrZM4dS5JFzk3v8wiaZQ.text: The original location of Curry Zen has stolen my heart. I've come as a regular before their 2nd location and before their expansion of the building. Every time, their sauce has been hearty, savory, with that bit of sweetness that makes Japanese curry different from the rest.   There's just one thing that gripes me about this place and it's most likely due to their recent wild success. When I used to come back in the day in their tiny little hole-in-the-wall type of restaurant, my chicken always came consistently. However these days, it seems as though my chicken comes somewhat dry. It's not largely noticeable, nor is it huge enough to complain loudly about, but coming from one of my favorite curry houses ever, it's something I wish would always stay the same.   My favorite curry house of all-time will always be CoCo ICHIBANYA, a popular curry house from Japan that landed its way to some parts in the states. I particularly like their sauce just a bit more and I love that they have naan bread to dip in the sauce.   I request that Curry Zen brings in the naan bread and I will come running every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These big pieces of bonito flakes do not work well with the takoyaki
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6s9kFjNzT1Kpk6PO_-9Apw.text: Best curry place in town. The staff is so polite and attentive. I could go on and on about their food, it's delicious. This curry is magic, I swear. I always start with a tofu salad (the dressing is sooo good) then get a spicy level 10 vegetable curry, I eat slow so it lasts me longer lol. This place never ever disappoints. Their food is impeccable, the service is great. You can't go wrong. I love Zen Curry!!! :)

5VtsAEhrS1bhP0rmJ_NpVQ.text: First time going to Curry Zen, got the tonkatsu curry and kuraage. Food was good, service was good. Will probably go again sometime in the future.

Azf9j8KqBsxCGzouiVxWvA.text: really great place for good Japanese curry.  This place has some really good service and value, you definitely will walk away feeling like you snagged yourself some sort of deal when you get your meal haha. The curry is actually pretty spicy, for someone who is good with spice, so I definitely do recommend a kind of lower spice level. It's kind of sad we don't have a curry house like this back at home that I can compare this to, but it's definitely authentic.  Katsu was of course, good.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken katsu curry :)
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. gyoza

V6pw2VPoyfFpeqiNbrtGHA.text: True to Japanese Curry!! They should really open up more locations in town. I would be there several times a week if they were only closer. Price point to good too!

jD8NfrrHjXPOntwrOoE1GQ.text: Very enjoyable food. I had a lunch, with the spinach curry with egg and three skewers; the chicken and zucchini were my favorite of the two. Filling and tasty. Service is friendly, not the fastest, but friendly. I'd definitely recommend it for a taste of a different type of Japanese food than many people in the US are used to having.

j-FZ6QNAP0em5I9FTCkVwA.text: This place is legit. Japanese chef. Japanese patrons. Great prices. I love how you can customize your basic Japanese curry plate and fix it up to your specific liking. 1, Proteins (chicken/beef/shrimp/kurobata sausage/etc) or some awesome combination using everything. (That's what I would do if I came back - have a Japanese curry plate sampler!) 2. Spice level (1-10) 3. Free tableside condiments (red pickles, raisins, pickled onions, ginger, curry and spice powders) Customize to your liking. I ordered the PORK KATSU CURRY LEVEL 5 ($9.5) and the flavor was on point. CRAVE WORTHY. Rich and complex with out being too soupy or sweet. Perfect spice level for me. (Kaba curry is more on the sweeter side). The katsu was flavorful and crisp. They just cooked it a minute longer which made it a little dry. Same with the chicken katsu, but still very good. Good sized portion too. (yelp.com/biz_photos/japa...) Notes -The place is small with like 4 tables (of 4) and a counter top so I could imagine this place easily getting busy. Not really good for groups larger than 4. -Came on a Saturday for lunch right when they opened at 11:30am and we were the 3rd group there. -Have your curry topped with cheese. So good. Would definitely have this on rotation if I lived closer. (yelp.com/biz_photos/japa...)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double chicken katsu curry with cheese
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork katsu curry.  5 level spice.   Soo good.

TggDgJGUP4dOaLWF_g21Dw.text: This place is relaxed, subtle, and doesn't try too hard...because the food does all the talkin!  I find myself coming here whenever I can't decide where to eat. It's because it's quick (the parking is another story), convenient, and their menu is right to the point.  I've been coming here since the beginning, when they only had a couple of items on their menu, and it was perfect. Since then, they have expanded their menu but for the better! There are now more options for vegetarians - fried tofu or veggie curry are usually what I order.  Tips:  -The spicy levels on their curry do run a bit hotter than most places so if you want a mild, a 2-3 is perfect. Anything past 4 is like death to my papillae.  - The parking is also insane! If you want a guaranteed spot, try parking on the side streets next to the center. Many people do it and so far it hasn't caused me any trouble.

ehGwlxPdP2tY4TA50QCLtA.text: Had a taste for Chicken Katsu. The chicken was very plain with zero seasoning however the panko breading is yummy. I added Curried Veggies these were the best ever. Seasoned well, had a light crisp, and the curry gravy was delicious  . So next time I would get extra gravy to pour over the chicken katsu and white rice. Staff was very pleasant and patient. Small cute restaurant. Nice place to have a conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu With White Rice and Curried Veggies

0zINpVeFLJ-nAQXjBxuaPQ.text: My favorite curry place. Decent price and original curry.  Feels like home and they have good customer service. I actually left the place full and no need to go anywhere.

w6F3BdnmmjwVvUDUC8-RjQ.text: II am 99.9 % :)sure this is the best curry in town.   I always seem to order the potato croquet  and a side of corn and cheese, but I have also sampled the katsu and have to say that was delicious too.  Definitely take a look at their board for their daily specials. The curry is very tasty and reading the long list of its spices and health properties makes you feel good eating the curry too. They also have a condiment tray  with raisins, pickled onions, and radish which adds great taste and texture.   The restaurant is really small with maybe 5 tables as well as a counter with stools therefore you may encounter a bit of a wait at times, but it is so worth the wait.   The coziness of this place is especially welcomed during the winter months.   I have always experienced great service and a nice touch is also the greeting received from the owner.

XVyqERvAxX94cGKNcVPWoA.text: Every time I come to Las Vegas I make sure to visit this location at least twice during my stay. I never eat curry at home or given any other opportunity to but I make sure to get the Curry Udon with chicken Katsu on the side every time I can here in Vegas. I get it with level 12 heat and it only tingles the lips but it's edible. Not that crazy amount of heat where you literally die. Last meal material. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Udon with Chicken Katsu on the side. (So it doesn&#39;t get soggy)

GR_QnBKrKsuRSXZ3ri5IIg.text: So yummy! A friend recommended this spot to me and I was pleasantly surprised. Here you will find the obvious choice of chicken katsu paired with curry, but there are other choices as well even for vegetarians. Choose your spice level, and enjoy!

M5OVPWm8t-9qlwbWZPfbZw.text: Atmosphere is dope, and the food is too. It has a simple presentation but the flavor isnt simple at all. Is amazing dawg. Damn son, c'mon son damn son.

Yv1EsXX2zqBHT3EngHtU2w.text: First time here, stumble across this place because manta was too busy next door.  Every dish we had was delicious especially the chicken katsu with spinach and scrambled eggs was balanced with spices and consistent throughout. The service is great and very knowledgeable.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu with Spinach and Scrambled Eggs.

qBr5xlv6s2eo6cUn_XWszA.text: We did have to wait in line, for about 15-20 mins, but their Japanese curry tasted delicious and authentic. Get a main dish, and then an extra side/topping. I suggest chicken katsu and then veggies added. Also, get their croquette as topping! It's a good element to balance the heat.  Something that might help people deciding on spicy level: I am okay with spicy, and realized that 5 was my hot spice level. 5 already got my face sweating, but it didn't bother me. I guess the highest I could go is a 6. My friend got an 8. I tried and thought even someone like me who loves spicy food, I no longer can stand the 8 as I love to enjoy the food more, than alloting that time for eating to just wiping my face and running nose. My friend who still finished his plate says 8 is tolerable for him (he ALWAYS ADDS chili, red peppers, and/or jalapenos in his Asian and Mexican dishes) but will next time just go with a 7 or 6, he says.

i8xnMJ33BD4BFgeXWlLAvw.text: If you're in Vegas, you have to go off the strip to this little curry place. There is a bit of a wait, but I promise you that it is worth it. We always drop by when we're in Vegas. The curry is phenomenol with just the right starch taste and spices. It also helps that the servings are on the larger end. I always get the chicken katsu curry with a spice level of 4 and leave satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry

E8lr0lpU5YtlgFDJcYRj3g.text: I cannot express how much I love to eat at Curry Zen. The food is very well priced  and delicious. I have tried most everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Curry Zen provides a variety of options for curry lovers as well as amazing appetizers. Not only that but they offer a smaller sized portion that is perfect for me.  My favorite is the tofu katsu with a side of radish and onion. Every time I come, it is made fresh and amazing. The curry is perfectly flavored and the tofu is scrumptious.  Not only is the food amazing, the staff is very friendly. They are efficient and kind. I couldn't ask for nicer service. The establishment is always perfectly clean.  I come to Curry Zen at least once a week and recommended it to everyone. I have never seen anyone not like the food here.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Normal sized curry with tofu and sausage. Onion, radish, and sauces were added.

MchoJ6gvfu5Z3QUJLlZt7A.text: Ever since I moved back to Vegas, I've been on a search for some good Japanese curry. This place is definitely a winner and will now be my go to place.   I got a small chicken katsu curry and added a croquet. In all honesty, the small was plenty enough. I do recommend adding some other stuff since a small is about 3.50, it's forsure worth it.   My friend added some cheese, which was also pretty good.  I thought it was kind of weird that you have to pay extra to make it spicier.  The place in general is pretty small, so definitely avoid the lunch rush hours. Another plus? It's right next to snowflake shavery so don't stuff yourself too much and grab dessert after.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu curry with a croquet

95XGFdWEUsNVipE_uRSp4A.text: A friend brought me to this place after raving about it. I was dragged along one day to try it and it blew my mind! If you like spicy food, they've got you covered AND can probably get you outside the comfort zone if that's what you're looking for! A 2-3 on their spice chart is considered "medium."  The staff is great, and you'll see familiar faces if you go with any regularity. The menu obviously focuses on curry but there are a few other great options and appetizers as well.  Japanese Curry Zen has become a pretty common default option when I go out to eat. If you like curry, it won't disappoint you!

oS8-PfzvHgoSobRVjWcglg.text: Got takeout of veggie curry and curry udon. Didn't get to eat until like 30 mins later but everything was still super warm and perfect. So good and hit the spot. Lots of veggies, good amount, great taste. Want to go back tmrw!

eY8DKu1OMqvAS21Ifre_0w.text: me and my bf were trying to get a quick bite after a 5-hour driving from Grand Canyon and before heading to the show. The curry is spicy and surprisingly good

RW1AVxOi1AsQJ2VOyuRGiw.text: This place was fantastic. I have been her multiple times and each take has be great. From the service to the food and drinks. Every thing was price fairly and the portions are great. would bring all my friends here. however it does get packed so be there early or be ready to wait 5-15 min.

8foSuQ5z08KtzTygKKWR4g.text: BEST Japanese Curry in town. I always bring clients here and we love the curry. Great stop for a quick and inexpensive lunch.

V_4IQnmzc_T-wq7V99gp0Q.text: I wanted to try this because of hearsay from others, and my new found love of Japanese curry. Interior-wise it was simple, and sleek. Upon arrival, I was greeted quickly from one of the servers. The menu had selection, and options to add-on. I was pleased to see they had brown rice as an option, because although I'm Asian, I'm not a white rice type of gal. Lol :-) Since it was my first time, I just went with a basic katsu curry plate, with 3 fried shrimp. Portion size is okay, they give you curry and rice, but the katsu is a little on the smaller side. Taste wise, curry was good, their katsu was so-so. Pricing was cheap! Me and my husband's bill was a little over $20 included drinks. I'm not sure if I'll be back, I thought it was alright.

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brown rice curry shrimp katsu plate

MLxnfEbWi3avbZGFIMgWmg.text: "WOW... WOW...WOW" is the word I will use to describe how good they are ... while I am eating.  We ordered the Pork tender  and Chicken tender, they are excellent from outside having the crispy crust and super juicy inside.  For the curry, they are JP authentic style.  I also enjoy their oyster as side order.  They even have regular JP steamed rice and brown rice for you to choose from, and the level of spicy can be requested too.  MUST GO !!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!!!

Np1ECphHZle1kEuPCPJYdw.text: Food came quick. Service was great. Food though was just ok. Felt like I was eating Asian Texan food. Like almost like a country fried steak, eggs, potatoes with a spicy twist. Got the 3 for the spicy level which as a regular eater of cayenne peppers was pretty mild but because it is mixed with the gravy errr curry it sticks with you for awhile after you eat it.

Px7Z7I3RUwAlTLLs_-HonQ.text: This is the go-to curry spot for my friends and I when we visit Las Vegas. I usually order chicken Katsu curry with a spice level of 5 or 6, depending on my mood. When I am very hungy, I add an extra piece of pork cutlet so that I have more meat. The cutlet and katsu are never over breaded, which is great. The curry is filled with so much flavor, while maintaining a good spice level.

8EnnCnjRPIy-aAX932pgeg.text: Wow...definitely one of the best curry I've ever had!  We stumbled upon this place while trying to find some food before getting some Kung Fu tea, and we're glad we did!  The staff is super friendly and quick with our drinks and food order.  We had the tonkatsu curry, and the curry sauce was absolutely delicious.  I had craving for curry after returning to LA, but have yet to find a place that taste nearly as good.  I can't wait to go again next time I'm in Vegas!

hrT7NLFpodN_5GJV7mPTWA.text: Bomb curry. I had the chicken katsu and slam curry with added cheese and corn. My bf had the meatloaf and slam curry and we couldn't be happier. Happy tummy and happier camper :). Friends had regular pork curry and beef with sausage. Very delicious! Will be back in a few days! :) :) :)

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf and spam curry
Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu and spam with added cheese and corn. Bombski!!

3bL6LEcFyqM6rnK8s9OfbA.text: I had ordered the croquette and pork katsu and was an excited little boy ready to womp on the hot curry on a cold night.  When all my friends' orders came out, mine came out wrong as they gave me some sausage with katsu.  When I told them i had ordered the croquette, instead of hurrying and whipping out another dish, OR just leave the one they messed up on for me, they took about 20 min talking amongst themselves trying to figure out what in the world they did wrong.  Finally after all my friends had finished and 20 minutes later, it finally came out with brief apologies.  The curry was good but i was so mad and full from eating everyone else's food I couldn't even enjoy it.  Sorry Zen, the food was decent but the poor service brings you down a notch.

gjOp8BMQ5tY0AFN4qNIgXA.text: It was good, the menu is very simple and very straight forward. The service was excellent and quick, but everything is fried on their menu. While this place does not beat my favorite curry at Sushi Hiro, it is good for a quick fix.

TIhJ4unHshIVk0-GGM7DNw.text: I have a new favorite curry place and this is it!  The Curry House restaurants in Orange County and Torrance had been my previous favorites, but this place just kicks it up a notch. While getting a foot massage next door I looked on yelp to find something good for dinner, and the reviews convinced me to try it.   After going back and forth about what to try, I saw the food delivered to the table next to me and just had to ask for exactly the same thing. The gentleman said it was double chicken katsu curry with sausage and corn, and I'll be damned if it wasn't every bit as awesome as he said, but more on that later. To get started we had the edamame which was perfectly steamed and topped with the large sea salt crystals that were a great flavor addition without being too salty. We also had the gyoza which were good, but not particularly remarkable in any way. In hind sight I should not have ordered the appetizers because I would soon be stuffed beyond capacity and feeling like an overfilled water balloon!   When the meal came the chicken was super moist and tender, with super flakey and crispy breading that blew away my expectations. The rice was perfectly done and sticky like it should be, mixing nicely with the curry. The corn was served beside the rice in a little pile, just begging to be mixed in, and the sausage looked like hotdogs but certainly didn't taste that way- more like a Polska Kielbasa with great flavor. The guy next to me sliced everything up and mixed it together, so when in Rome...well you know. Anyway, to make a long review even longer, I will add that the curry had excellent flavor and really brought the whole thing together nicely.  It was so good I think the only thing that could have made it better was getting it for free- actually, I am in town on business so I guess that means it was free after-all!  Guess I should go buy a lottery ticket now, cause I feel like I hit the jackpot with Curry House Zen tonight!

photos.caption: Photo of Japanese Curry Zen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View inside the restaurant

tZkzxOnl6iVANamHzA3D8A.text: 2 years later I returned to visit my grandma.  This place is just as good as it was before but it has expanded!  This food is so great - the chicken and pork cutlets are so perfect (perfect amount of fat in the meat, perfect panko breading and fried perfectly).  The curry is so good and the price so reasonable.  I'm glad they expanded to allow for more people to eat this delicious food.  I'll return here every time I come to Vegas.

0y_7ODx4-h5sZiyoe14viw.text: I am by no means an afficionado on Japanese style curry. For the most part I don't even like Japanese curry. I do however like Curry Zen very much. I like that they put out all of the condiments for their curries on the table. Their radish dish is usually decimated between the group. The raisins and almonds give the meal a textural change.   The portions are more than reasonable and often filling. The flavor is the main reason why I keep coming back. For someone who boldly states his dislike for any dish, I will continue to try it until someone proves me wrong. Maybe I just had bad versions in the past. That is not the case here. I had to wait and sit on this review for some time just to make sure that the experience was consistent.  What I find most appealing about this place is the level of service. The food comes out quickly. The presentation is neat. The staff is friendly. The chef is so humble and comes out to thank his diners at the end of the meal. It is a warm atmosphere. With the new addition, it can easily seat more. It is just another great establishment for a jammed pack powerhouse of a plaza.

kCtM5z3nA54A_9-PjbUJmg.text: Very yummy speciality restaurant in the busiest food mall in town!  you get to select your meat and veggies and it comes smothered on a plate in delicious curry sauce!  I had hamburger and kushi skewers, and it was really good.

oHNWr8JVRCQaCMvNZunX4A.text: Our favorite japanese curry place closed in Los Angeles like 10 years ago and we've been trying to find something comparable since.  Most places are poser curry makers.  We can tell that curry zen put their own secret sauce so it doesnt taste generic.    So far we've tried the chicken katsu curry as well as the vegetable curry.  Both are very good and tastes like a kick ass home-made meal.  The chicken is all white meat which I love!  You can also adjust the spiciness according to your risk tolerance.  I love spicy foods and I find they tend to make it more spicy than not...so definitely be cautious with selecting spiciness.  Parking can be a headache sometimes but its well worth it.  I think they recently renovated the restaurant so its way more spacious than before!

cxNgFXIlVzey2BqZk0FDQg.text: The curry house I have been hunting for.  After living in Japan for a number of years, I developed a slight addiction to CoCo curry. For years, I have been searching to find something here in the States that could satiate my CoCo craving, and Zen nailed it.  The service is outstanding, always pleasant and willing to meet my special requests, food is spot-on every time I go.  I love this place.

rCU8_ERTlrMK_dTMbWeyAA.text: Love the chicken curry with cheese and veggies! Make sure you get a mini - the regular one is good for 2.
